VB-177767

Acceptance Test failure: AM tool broken (on some objects)

Open the attached file. Go tot he saved views.

The title of the saved view will tell you what texture part to test on the object.

This may be only walls, not sure. The 2D objects work OK. The sphere and cylinder in the later views also seems to work. This "may" be wall only, not sure.

The tool just doesn't work on the objects. It doesn't even show the correct AMTool mode.

This was working last round of tests. 		Christopher Graye
VB-176933

Question : There are cases when “Export FBX(3D only)” is not executed on the number of 3D objects in the file.

Open the 0208sample.vwx file in Vectorworks and try “Export FBX(3D only)” command.
If failing to export FBX for the first time after starting Vectorworks, check if the same error as the FBXerror.png file is displayed.
This error is displayed when closed Vectorworks or opened Vectorworks again.
Therefore, execute “Export FBX(3D only)”, and if the file is not created, exit Vectorworks once.
In addition, once this error is displayed, no error may be displayed from the second time.
In that case, try restarting Vw or the machine.


Also, if the sample file can be exported correct, copy and paste the objects in the file, increase the number of objects, and then execute the export to see if the problem can be reproduced.

-When I verified the export several times in my machine, the number of objects that could be exported sometimes varied.
(Example: In some cases, the number of 3D objects in a file is about 60,000 and cannot be exported, or in some cases it can be exported up to nearly 100,000 the next day.)

-At this time, the conditions under which export FBX cannot be executed are not clearly known.

Is this by designed? Or is it a bug?

Hayato Wada
A&A 		Justin Hutchison
VB-177772

2022 Reshape tool performance issues

It's a part of the performance acceptance test.

Use the reshape tool to modify the object and time how long it will take to complete the operation. Follow the screenshots to see how I do it.

Used to be like 13 seconds process from the mouse click until the rendering is completed.

Right now is more like 29 seconds and that's more than twice the time that used to be. I know there are changes in the rendering but it's a massive difference. Let me know if this will be the new baseline time or it's an actual performance issue 

  		Christopher Graye
VB-178287

Viewport Crop Shows Incorrectly in 2022 (Crop isn't Accounting for Walls)

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2021 compared to 2022. The file contains a simple 3D model with a set of Walls around its perimeter, along with an un-cropped viewport.

To reproduce, open the file in each version and update the viewport.

In VW 2022, note that the default crop (which is used when there's no user-generated crop) fails to account for the Walls (see attached screenshots).

This may be related to the T02171 task. 		Christopher Graye
VB-176791

Beta Undo Alert 9

How to reproduce:
1. Load the attached test case: Duplex Building Project ver 5-8.vwx
2. After the loading is completed, zoom out to see the whole scene.
3. Select the fly over tool with the option of "Interactive Origin Mode"
4. Pick an origin on the building.
5. You will get the Beta Undo Alert 9 sometimes 		Christopher Graye

VB-180961

Spotlight Distributor objects no longer document output lengths

In the preview cable tools suite all distributor objects documented the output length for each output connector

the new 2022 version no longer does this, yet the distributor objects OIP still has the display output length option and cable objects still reference output lengths when calculating their needed part length in the cable configuration dialogue 		Kevin Linzey
VB-183699

Spotlight Power Web Interface not updating after deleting cables. Need to reopen file

In the attached file I had circuited the six lights to the dimmer pack.

The web palette was updated and the connections were shown as expected.

I then deleted all the cables.

The web palette did not update as expected.

To test,
# please draw the cables from the distro to the lights to match the images and video attached to this report.
# Notice the updated web interface
# Delete all the cables.
# Notice the lack of updates to the web interface.
# Save, close, and reopen the file.

The only way I've found to refresh the web interface info is to save, close, and then reopen the file.
* Reloading the web palette page does not refresh the display as it deletes everything and is reported in VB-182432

This bug report is a simplified version of VB-182459

I've attached two copies of the VWX file. Ending in b is no cables. Ending c is with cables.

Screen shots and a video are also included. 		Kevin Linzey

I've had it twice now. Vectorworks stops responding but I can still move the cursor. But the Dock will not appear if I mouse to the bottom of the screen and then I eventually stop being able to move the cursor (or it disappears) and then the system drops me at login screen.

VB-176447

Vectorworks crashes by importing specific DWG

Vectorworks crashes when importing the added dwg- file.
Tech support tells it can be because Vectorworks runs out of memory because the DWG is too big. This might be the case indeed, but in that case Vectorworks should give an error and about the operation without a crash.

 

Answer tech support;

"When I load the ciB VO file into autodesk viewer I see many models / plans all over the design layer. It could be that there is too much on 1 design layer over a vast distance and the computers runs out of memory and crashes. My PC and Mac both crashed as they tried to import this file.

Have they asked the Cad user to bind xrefs into the file before sending? Have they asked for the CAD file to be broken into smaller bites? Like less plans per design layer?

Regards,

Rob Nykolaishen
Technical Support Specialist" 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-178503

Migration Manager & Batch Convert Crashing VW2021 SP3.1

* Running Migration Manager in Vectorworks 2021 SP3.1, from 2020 User Folder. 
* Crashes every time. 
* All crashes so far have occurred when converting Vectorworks files created for use by the Interiorcad plugin. 
* The User Folder is ~ 7.5 GB, due to the quantity and size of Interiorcad files. 
* Batch Convert also crashes after handling almost exactly the same number of Vectorworks files. - This makes me suspect a resource management problem (in the software, because the hardware is top-of-the-line: 16 core 3+ GHz CPU, 64 GB RAM, 16 GB VRAM with RTW2080 and very recent graphics card drivers). 

We need to know why Vectorworks is crashing so we can create a solution. 

It would be most helpful to know if it's a Vectorworks bug or a condition of the Interiorcad-Vectorworks files. i.e.
* Too many files, or 
* One or more files are too big, or 
* Files contain data that doesn't convert. 
* File contains illegal characters (etc). 

Crash .dmp files are attached. Currently we are waiting for the user to upload the 2020 User Folder and a Dxdiag. Once done you can access them here: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/aoam0ovhlz18q9g/AAA8gK6sTFJGQDbNasPma4Yda?dl=0 		Konstantin Lalkovski

Vectorworks crashes
If Vectorworks doesn’t crash turn on a Pset_DoorWindowShadingType pset and turn off it
I connect my Windows machine remotely. I was unable to reproduce on Mac.
There isn't created crash log in my user folder.

VB-178773

When creating a PDF with Vectorworks Cloud, Image Prop in the unupdated sheet layer viewport is displayed incorrectly.

When creating a PDF with Vectorworks Cloud, Image Prop in the unupdated sheet layer viewport is displayed incorrectly. Reproduction was confirmed by the following two methods.
-Create a PDF from a vwx file on the Vectorworks Cloud Services Website.
-Open the Publish menu of Vectorworks, select "Store and Process on Vectorworks Cloud" in "Storage and Processing:", and select "PDF" in "Publish to:" to execute.

Reproduction example:
1) Upload the sample files "Viewport_updated.vwx" and "Viewport_not_updated.vwx" to the Vectorworks Cloud Services Website.
2) When opening the two files in Vectorworks, make sure that the only difference is whether the sheet layer viewport is updated or not, and the Image Prop display in the viewport is the same.
3) Create a PDF from each file on the Vectorworks Cloud Services Website.
4) When checking the created PDF, the Image Prop in the viewport is displayed incorrectly in the PDF created from "Viewport_not_updated.vwx".

The reproduction video "12580.mov" is also attached.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov

VB-182458

Shaded Section Viewport Displays All Black or Causes System Crash with Certain Detail Levels

The attached file contains a Section Viewport with Shaded set as its Background Render, that currently uses "Medium" render detail.

When trying to update this viewport, I've twice had my entire system crash on Mac (specs attached).

Others times the viewport just renders completely black, and the black area extends well-outside the viewport's crop (see first attached screenshot).

If I export to VW 2021 and try there, I see the same black viewport and crop issue, but I don't see the system crash.

If I change the Shaded detail to "Low" the viewport works fine.

When I try this on Windows 10 the result is slightly different. I can see the rendered model, but there's still a black area that's shifted way to the left (see second screenshot). 		Christopher Graye
VB-181330

Wall closure at inserts and Wall closure profile offsets failing

Wall closure at inserts settings for either Wall Style or for instance or even for the insert (Window) are not having any effect on the Wall and are not creating the wrapping or the profile. The wrapping and profile are not visible in 2D or 3D. 

When Plug-in Object Options are opened and Wall Closure Profile Offsets are turned on, the Top/Plan view fails - it seems the 2D fills disappear, but the Wall object is still there, the Wall and individual component contours are visible in dashed grey line and Wall is shown in OIP as the selection. In 3D however, the Wall is visible as expected, and the Wall closure at inserts has been applied as per the settings - wrapping and profile are visible in 3D and in 2D in contours. 		Christopher Graye
VB-177845

Vectorworks Cloud Services: Presentation has disappeared

Hello,
How is it possible that a big presentation I have worked on for months is no longer in the VCS Presentations part of the VCS account 'ozcadtraining'?

I have not deleted it, and no one else logs onto that account. The strange thing is that I noticed an old 2 slide show presentation that was for our Spotlight template that I deleted when SP3 came out here, has come back! The presentation that is no longer there was 25 boards and some tours. It was called 'Spotlight Demonstration'.

The presentation was working after SP3 came out as we released a new Spotlight template that had a 3 slide presentation with a link to the bigger demo presentation. We were testing and using and sharing successfully with no problems. I have not touched this since Easter and now it is gone!

There is no way to restore a lost presentation. Nothing in the trash, history or time machine back ups. Of course this might be user error but at the moment I am 100% I did not delete this presentation. Help please!

Thanks,
Peter 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-181346

Redshift doesn't work with non-repeating textures or decals

Original bug from Gunther was about significant visual differences on different platforms but this was really Redshift vs non-Redshift renderings.

 

Instead, his renderings show Redshift not paying attention to non-repeating material tag values.  This means Redshift doesn't show non-repeating image textures or non-repeating decals correctly.

 

We will try to get Maxon to get Redshift to pay attention to these parameters.

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-182666

Vectorworks 2022 crashes while updating the viewport in this user file [210920_HotelModelMT.vwx]

I am able to render the viewport on sheet layer "0.00 GROUND" when using VW 2021. It took about 8 hours.
When using VW 2022, Vectorworks crashes about 2 hours into the rendering. I discovered this crash while investigating a Publish job submitted to the Cloud by a user. The reason why the cloud job fails is because Vectorworks crashes while rendering the viewport.

I am attaching the original user's file, which you can use if you want to try rendering in VW2021. The 2022 file version is saved on the sheet layer where the crash occurs. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-182690

Vectorworks 2022 crasshes while updating the viewport in this user file [BSBH Splash 2.0_Multipurpose Hall-091821 [1].vwx]

Export PDF and Publish jobs fail consistently on the cloud for the attached user file, I believe because Vectorworks is crashing while trying to render the viewport in it.
When trying to render the viewport locally, Vectorworks 2022 crashed about 2-3 hours into the rendering.
I tried rendering on VW 2021 as well, and the rendering progressed for more than 6 hours, (after which I stopped it ). Based on this, I believe this crash is a regression with VW 2022. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-182691

Vectorworks 2022 crashes while updating the viewports in this user file [QVC Truss Structures_render.vwx ]

Steps to reproduce in VW 2022:
- Open the attached test file and switch to Sheet layer "3 Entrance iso"
- Try updating any of the two viewports on it.
- Shortly after the viewport border starts appearing as up-to-date (a few minutes after the update is started), Vectoworks crashes.

With VW2021, I am able to update both viewports without a crash, so I think this is a regression. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-181216

Apple Silicon - M1 - Unable to launch Series B and G versions of Vectorworks

The Apple Silicon Acceptance Test build, Series B and G, launch without issue on my Intel MacBook Pro. However, the same build does not launch on my Mac Mini M1. Series B and G using any recent 27.0.x build on the same Mac Mini M1 works with no issues.

For Series B, it will not accept the serial number and doesn't recognize the dongle is plugged into the computer.

For Series G, Vectorworks just hangs during launch at the splash screen

Series B:
-Download and unzip 607936 Apple Silicon build on a M1 Mac
-Download and unzip the Supplements file for the 607936 build also
-From inside the Supplements zip, go to Protection > Series B and copy the Plug-In Support.vwlibrary file and paste it inside the, Plug-Ins folder within the Vectorworks application folder, overwriting the current file
-Also, from the Supplements zip, copy the, "Vectorworks 2022B.app" and paste into the Vectorworks application folder
-Launch the, "Vectorworks B" application
-With a dongle plugged into the computer, Vectorworks should show you the Dongle ID when prompting you for the serial number and this is currently failing (see attached images)

When simulating a clean install, and launching Vectorworks after the installation is complete, you'll receive the following message, "A Vectorworks dongle could not be found. Make sure that the dongle is connected and that all required drivers have been installed. Vectorworks will not quit." See DongleNotFound.png and Donglenotfoundafterinstall-1.mp4

Series G:
-Download and unzip 607936 Apple Silicon build on a M1 Mac
-Download and unzip the Supplements file for the 607936 build also
-From inside the Supplements zip, go to Protection > Series G and copy the Plug-In Support.vwlibrary file and paste it inside the, Plug-Ins folder within the Vectorworks application folder, overwriting the current file
-Also, from the Supplements zip, copy the, "Vectorworks 2022B.app" and paste into the Vectorworks application folder
-Launch the, "Vectorworks B" application
-Vectorworks will hang at the Splash screen during launch 		Tim Ardoin
VB-183559

Graphical Problems on Mac with iMac and Big Sur and crash

We at ComputerWorks Germany do have some customers complaining about a flickering Vectorworks before crash. Not so much customers to be alarmed, but too many to ignore.
It seems only affect Mac (iMacs) and Mac OS Big Sur (although... one customer reported of Mac OS Catalina).
And it seem to affect Vectorworks 2022 as well as Vectorworks 2021.

We also have reproduced it on two Macs here at ComputerWorks. In subfolder VN you will find a video in which one employee of us recorded a video on s.th. else when this "flickering" happened.
Vectorworks crashes on flickering.

Do you see the same with your customers?

I have attached a folder with three subfolders, each subfolder a different mac.

What to tell the customers? Is this a bug or Mac OS related?
Any info for us?

VB-182537

Reports of crashes switching to Spotlight workspace in Vectorworks 2022 on Windows

We've had reports now from:
adam.chekir@designexpress.eu and another co-worker
lars@capture.se

What we know:
-These were clean installs, no Migration Manager involved
-Appear to be laptops only at the moment?
-Multiple displays are not involved
-Users appear to be up-to-date with OS and video card drivers
- Adam Design Express: If I rename Spotlight.www to Architect.www within the application folder, VW will load the spotlight workspace at launch giving me a way to access to my dedicated workspace.
- Adam Design Express: If I save the palette positions, VW will accept to build a new workspace within my user folder.
- Adam Design Express: If I want to rearrange any palette in my interface VW will crash to desktop

Hardware - Adam Chekir, Design Express
Dell Alienware Area-51M
CPU: Core i9 9900K@3,6GHz - 32Go RAM -
Video Card 2D Intel HD Graphics 630 - Video Card 3D nVidia RTX 2070 (Driver 471.68)
OS Windows 10 Family 20H2 19042,1237
Screen resolution: 1920x1080 native

Hardware - Lars Wernlund
See attached: LarsDxDiag.txt

A few .dmp files from Lars Wernlund are attached (Lars_VectorWorks Crash Dumps.zip), however, I was unsuccessful symbolizing the crashes. The .dmp files seem a lot larger than usual also.

Lars Wernlund recently added:
If I ..
- launch and give VW a chance to load and settle down
- grab the following divider (Resize.png) and drag to the left
- VW crashes instantly as I release the mouse button and it starts adjusting the sizes
- Following this I can start VW again without problems.

We asked Adam Chekir, if he experienced the same, as noted above by Lars:
Yes that’s it.. I issued the same crash with adjusting the size of the tools palette.. You can also see the crash happening when you try to change the size of the main application window by dragging the bottom left corner when it is not full screen.

I also noticed that on a working computer the screen flashes to black at a certain step of the process. On my faulty machine I do not see the black flashing screen. It seems that the crash happens at this moment.

Justin Hutchison

VB-178609

Installing Vectorwokrs fails on specific Mac computer

On a specific Mac computer, the installation of Vectorworks fails. in the beginning on the installation, an error appears and the installation terminates.

- Firewall is disabled
- On another mac on the same network, the installation is no issue

I added a screencapture (video and image), the installation folder from "application support", a screenshot of the mac overview, an SPX report and a list of installed software.

Answer tech support:

"Hello,

The easiest way to check if there is any issues with permissions or security is to make a new user account on the machine and try to install it again. If it works, there is some kind of permission or security issue on the users account. Otherwise, it may be a network related issue which would need to be corrected on the network of the user.

Thank you,

David Rodriguez | Vectorworks Technical Support
Monday to Friday | 9 AM – 5:30 PM EST" 		Tim Ardoin

VB-182914

Vectorworks 2022 SP0 614805 Crashing every time palettes resized

I’ve recently installed Vectorworks 2022 SP0 on Mac and Windows. On Windows only, I've experienced repeated crashes *every time* I try to adjust the margins/width of docked palettes. A customer (also on Windows 10) has reported the same behaviour. (I was adjusting docked tool palettes on the left side, the user was adjusting the width of the docked Object Info Palette on the right side). Her Vectorworks also crashed when we tried to change from Workspace 'Fundamentals ANZ' to 'Landmark ANZ.' I've since spoken to a different customer using 2022 SP0 who has no such issues. 
 
I just experienced another crash: Vectorworks 2022 opened with the main window at a smaller-than-usual size. After double clicking the window header to maximise the window, Vectorworks crashed about 2 seconds later. As this relates to window proportions I expect the cause of these crashes to be the same or related. 
 
I’ve also experienced a crash on Windows just by opening a file, via File > Open… but I suspect on this occasion I just got to this menu command after maximising the window and before it crashed. 
 
*History so far:* 
My first installation of 2022 SP0 I did with antivirus (Windows Defender) turned off. 
After issues I have tried the following remedies:  
* Restarted computer.
* Uninstalled, then reinstalled leaving Windows Defender on. Then restarted. 
* Tried two other workspaces (three total). All crashed once selected. 
* Tried removing existing 2022 User Folder and generating new one. 
* Installed the latest graphics card driver (only one month newer than my existing one). Then restarted. 
* Created a 'New' workspace, quit Vectorworks, removed all the other workspaces from the Program Folder. Still crashed when adjusting or docking palettes. 
* Did a clean installation of the same (latest) graphics card driver. Assigned Vectorworks 2022 to dedicated graphics card. Restarted again. 
* Creating a new, unedited Workspace, then putting it in the Program Folder's Workspace folder and removing the others to constrain Vectorworks 2022 to use it on launch. - No crash like the other workspaces, but when I adjusted the docked tool palette width, it crashed. So seemingly not due to workspace files. 
* Checked permissions of Program Folder and User Folder. Compared to 2021 folders, they all look normal. 

Nothing has worked. I've never encountered anything so absolute in a new release and a fresh installation. 

*I've attached:*
* a fresh Dxdiag
* the InstallerLog.txt
* a screenshot of the Windows Update History and
* a screen recording. - The recording shows how simply adjusting the width of the docked, Basic tool palette crashes Vectorworks and the (possibly related) second issue: Major graphical lag when using 2D tools. - This reinforced my suspicion of the graphics card driver.

Maybe a Windows update is responsible…
 
*Is this a known issue? And are there any known causes? What about a fix?* 		Ian Lane

VB-179080

Performance Degradation in Switching Views 2022 - CSG RecalcBoxAndCube

Open Attached file. Translated from 2021 file from Industry Experts
Switch saved views. See attached image showing the views captured in instrument trace. (also attached)

Two main categories:
1) CSGTreeHandler::RecalcBoundsAndCube (this bug)
2) Shell code (another bug using this attached file)

1) Likely expected with Wall Re-Eng project. Did we expect the hit on bounds recall for walls? Perhaps 2021 used cached composite surfaces to extract bounds/Cubes more efficiently? This SEEMS a major performance penalty - we are not in a wall reset context - we are simply extracting bounds. GSGs in 2021 did not play such a application critical role. Perhaps we need to cache more info to make up for slow CSG? 		Christopher Graye

VB-183426

Main Vectorworks menu nonfunctional

We've had a couple reports on the Vectorworks public forum where the main Vectorworks menu is nonfunctional after launch. Shortcut key operations from those menu work, just not the interface, it does nothing when clicked.

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/87020-apple-macos-12-monterey-compatibility-feedback/&do=findComment&comment=409182

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/87020-apple-macos-12-monterey-compatibility-feedback/&do=findComment&comment=408336

User indicates closing and reopening the laptop's lid, restores functionality.

Josh Peizer found some interaction with Apple's System Preferences Battery settings to introduce the issue.

I was able to duplicate randomly on:
Macbook pro debugging machine (touch bar, newer) 1
Monterey 12.0 Beta 10 (21A5552a):
vnc://pc102247.nemetschek.net/

I was unable to find the magic combination that would reproduce the problem every time. In some cases having the Battery option, "Automatic graphics switching" on and "Low power mode" off, would duplicate the issue. Some times having both options turned on would duplicate the issue. However, if you tried to launch Vectorworks multiple times, it might fail the first two attempts and succeed on the third, as seen in the attached video.

-Try combinations of Battery settings (Automatic graphics switching and Low power mode)
-Restart the computer
-Launch Vectorworks
-Attempt to us the main menu in Vectorworks
-If it doesn't fail, modify your battery settings and repeat the above steps

-----
In working with a user from the public forum having the issue, this was their feedback after suggesting modifications to their Battery settings. As noted above, I had mixed results.

- I turned OFF the "automatic graphics switching" and then the menu is working correctly !!

- I turned ON again the "automatic graphics switching" and then the menu is working correctly !!

- I restarted the machine and with the "automatic graphics switching" still ON, the menu is dead again.

- I turned OFF the "automatic graphics switching", restarted the machine and then the menu is working correctly.

I think I'll leave OFF the "automatic graphics switching" at the moment, until next SP will be released. 		Ian Lane
VB-176297

Marionette: wrapping named (negative) int/real nodes with strange results

Please watch the attached video for the whole story.

Here are some highlights:
a) wrapping a named int node with a negative causes the node to subtract the given value from 65536. If the int node had -1500, afterwards it will have 64036.
b) wrapping several real/int nodes with the same name, the OIP outside the wrapper will show the correct values (minus case a)), but when going inside the wrapper, the values are not correct anymore.

Attached is the file shown in the video. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-179234

„Improper delete call detected“ upon closing document after running Marionette Wrapper

Full error message:
{quote}Improper delete call detected Imminent crash is possible. Object 0x7fcb384ea360 is being deleted when ForEach is referring it.
{quote}
To reproduce (see video):
1) open document „Improper-delete-call.vwx“
2) run Marionette Wrapper
3) close document (select either "Don't save" or "Save" - it doesn't matter)
--> Error message. (see above and screenshot)

{{vs.ResetObject(wsimg)}}

(in line 118) of the last node (sName zu hTextur) before running the wrapper, makes it so the error message does not appear when closing the document.

Hello,
Every time I try to import the enclosed worksheet (Layer Object Count Wsheet) in the file ‘Jayden Sutherland - ASO_FOFO21_v2_v2022’ it crashes 2022.

It’s as if it is calculating the number of objects just on import. When trying to make the worksheet within that file the same thing happens - spinning wheel for 20 mins and I give up. I had to make the worksheet outside of the file but I can't import for it to calculate.

There are 1,021,598 objects in the file and I was hoping the worksheet could quickly identify the culprit layer where the big number of objects are on but it seems too much to calculate in a worksheet.

Using Custom Selection I can the the number of objects immediately so it is surprising it gets stuck when in a worksheet?

Hence this report.

Cheers,
Peter
Karthick Chilaka
VB-178293

Text and worksheet size changes when switching from Mac to Win

See the attached test file and screenshots.
This issue was reported by a user during the Vectorworks Open House event. The user thought the cloud was not producing correct results when he publishes his file to a PDF while his local computer managed to generate the PDF correctly.
I did some testing locally and discovered that this is not actually a Cloud issue, but an issue when the user's test file (created on Mac) is opened and published on Windows. Since the Cloud servers are Windows-based, the issue is observed. So, the issue needs to be fixed in Vectorworks in order for the Cloud to produce the expected results.
The issues observed are:
Text scaling issue on AV0.1
Worksheets scaling on AV1.5c, 1.6, AV1.8 AV4.7

Please compare the attached screenshots form Mac and Win, and notice the difference. The scaling of the worksheets occurs after the worksheets are recalculated.
This is one example, where I annotated the differences. Similar differences are found on the rest of the sheets mentioned above.

!Compare Mac and Win.png|thumbnail! 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-183663

Schematic View doesn’t create witness line and then the Undo is incorrect

1. Open the attached file.
2. Select the Straight Truss in Schematic View object and set Z value.
3. Select and move the LD in schematic view. – Note that the LD remains on the same location. (If the Z of the Straight Truss in Schematic View is 0, moving the LD will create a witness line)
4. Undo.
5. Note that the LD in schematic View is moved away from the truss.
Please watch the attached movie. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-177581

The calculated area of clipped slab components is wrong

When you clip a component of a slab, the calculated area of this component in a worksheet is not adjusted to the clipping. It is sill the total slab area which is shown.

I'm sorry, I was mistaken. it is the other way around. The area of the clipped component is actually correct. It is the other components, which display the clipped area in the worksheet, while they should display the total slab area. 		Christopher Graye

VB-178387

Beta Undo Alert Only Shows for a Split-Second in Some Scenarios

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a simple set of Walls.

To reproduce:

-Select the Walls and run the "Create Roof" command
-Choose the "Sloped LG Metal Struct Insulated Asphalt Shingle" Roof Style and keep everything else at default

Note that "Beta Undo Alert 4" shows, but it only flashes for a brief second before disappearing which makes it easy to miss.

I'm not sure if the same thing happened in VW 2021 since this particular beta alert didn't happen there. Other undo alerts (for example the one reported in VB-178386) will keep the alert on-screen until the user does another operation. Maybe the "Geometry" phase of the progress bar is causing the alert to disappear prematurely? 		Christopher Graye

VB-177156

Slab by fill doesn't work in specific document

When you try to create a slab by fill in the attached document, Vectorworks will tell you there's no closed boundary of walls. Creating a space by fill on the other hand, isn't an issue. If the space tool can find a closed boundary of walls, the slab tool should find this closed boundary as well. Christopher Graye

VB-182088

Wall Framer creates some cells as text, only mnaually editable

In the attached file, I have run the wall framer module and produced a spreadsheet. In cell G311 I added a SUM function to give me a total length of all studs; the function fails. This is because many of the cells are text, not numbers, and cannot have arithmetical operations performed on them. In fact, there appears to be an invisible character in each that prevents their being easily reformatted as dimensions or numbers, as well as a string of spaces after the last digit. The spaces can be removed with Find/Replace. But copying the recalcitrant cells and pasting into a text editor, stripping out all formatting, then copying and pasting back does not fix the invisible character problem. The only solution I have found is to manually add a "=" at the beginning of each string of numbers, hit return, then go back and delete the "=". Very tedious. Christopher Graye
VB-181151

Not sure if this is a VW or Vision issue.

 

Exporting visible to vision and I get the attached results both with ESC and MVR... 		Kevin Linzey
VB-183612

Export to MVR uses a lot of memory and seems unable to hand it back

Hello,
The enclosed huge file is from a user. If you export to MVR and use the first setting (everything) it will take some time because the file is so large but using Activity Monitor it uses about 110GB of memory.

Once the export has finished after about 30 minutes it seems to retain the memory according to Activity Monitor and doesn't hand it back. So I have to quit to set it back to normal.

I might well be making false assumptions but this is what it seems to me. I am prompted to do this VB due to the Forum post:
https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/89465-continuous-memory-occupation-after-the-sections-creation/

Cheers,
Peter 		Kevin Linzey

VB-184058

Spotlight adding truss to a stacked system bug

When a section of truss is added to the top truss line of a truss system consisting of several truss lines hung directly under each other using drops the drop closest to where the new section of truss is added will move.

I have attached a video of the issue, it doesn't seem to matter whether the new section of truss is created by duplicating an existing section or by using the insert truss tool, the behavior is the same, the drop closes to the new section will move.

The correct behavior is that the drop should only move if the user consciously decides to move it.

To recreate

draw 3 duplicate truss line directly under each other and connect them with the insert connection tool using the insert drop mode.

Add a section of truss to the top truss line

the drop to the next truss line down will move as soon as the new truss section has been added 		Kevin Linzey
VB-182822

Spotlight Cable Tools reports spare length in metric inside worksheet report

When creating a report, the cable tool "Spare" field is reporting in Metric. Screenshot says it all. Kevin Linzey

Hi,

Please note that the hoist is still connected to the truss system (so that's fine). 		Kevin Linzey
VB-179686

VB-182154

Spotlight Cable Tools Distributor Insertion Tool breaks when using Automatic Numbering Preferences

When using the automatic numbering preferences dialog box, the choice of a distributor may be changed to either nonexistent or incorrect. Users can easily miss that they are placing completely different though similar symbols during their drawing time than they had chosen.

These are the steps taken and shown in the attached 03:30 minute video.
# Start with a new blank document.
# Using your resource manager, navigate to VW libraries, default, cable tools, and land on the +Distributors US+ file.
** I have also tested using other distributor folders.
# Open the power distro folder and import the first six symbols.
# Navigate back to our drawing and confirm that you now have those six distributor items.
** Please keep your resource manager open but do not select any of the symbols.
# Open the distributor insertion tool.
# Using the tool Resource Selector option, select the first Distributor.
# Click on the automatic numbering preferences button
# Add a checkmark in the use column.
# Place a 1 in the start field. —STOP.—
** Notice the Resource Manager does not have any of the distributors highlighted.
# Click OK. ---STOP—
** Notice that now the last symbol in the RM is highlighted.
** Notice this symbol is NOT the one we chose using the Resource Selector.
** The one we chose is still indicated in the Resource Selector field.
Continue.
# Insert a distributor.
** You should now see an empty box. —STOP—
** Notice the Resource Selector still has our chosen Distributor.
** Notice in the RM that the Sixth (and last) distro symbol is now highlighted.
# Click on the distributor symbol Resource Selector —STOP—
** Notice that even though the Resource Selector field still has the name of our first choice, the sixth distro is now highlighted. It now matches the RM.
# Under the Resource Selector, choose the first distro again.
# Place the distro.
** This should now work. —STOP—
** Notice the sixth distro is still highlighted in the RM.
# Click to place another distro to confirm it is working.
# Change the numbering to reset the number back to 1.
# Place another distro.
** This should result in an empty box again.
** Notice in the RM that the last distro is still highlighted.
# In the RM, double click on the third distro to highlight it.
# Use the Distributor Symbol Resource Selector and activate the same third Distributor.
** Notice that now the same symbol is highlighted in both the RM and the Resource Selector.
# Place two distributors. These should be correct.
# Reset the numbering back to #1
# Place another distro, and this should work again. —STOP—
** Take note that the two symbols are still matching in both the RM and the Resource Selector.
# Using only the Resource Selector, change to the fifth distro. —STOP—
** Notice in the RM that the third distro is still highlighted.
# Place the distro.
** It should have placed the chosen 5th distro.
# Reset the numbering back to #1 via the number preferences button.
# Click to place another distro. —STOP—
** Notice it has placed the distro currently highlighted in the RM and NOT the one chosen via the Resource Selector.
** Notice that the one chosen via the Resource Selector is still called for in the Resource Selector.

This may be related to my prior VB-182089
Telling of how the RM doesn’t trigger the Resource Selector properly. Perhaps the RM is being triggered by the renumber tool?

I also tested this in Windows. The only difference seems to be that the symbols in the RM did NOT change their highlighted status indications.

2022: 613622,

2021: 602791

Mac 11.5.2
Windows 10

 

 

 

 

 

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-181034

Cable: The values in the Cable Configuration dialog are reset when you close with OK the Cable Style dialog

To reproduce:

 

Open the attached test file

Select the cable object from the drawing area

Click on Cable Configuration button in the OIP

Select a part from the Available parts list and move it on the right side

Click OK

Choose Edit Style from the Style drop down in the OIP

Click Ok to close the dialog

Open the Cable Configuration dialog again

Notice that the part that was added is removed 		Kevin Linzey
VB-177784

Extra Gobo Wheel on Lighting Devices in MVR files

This issue seems to only be with MVR files and is on both Mac and Windows.

I included an MVR file and the Vectorworks file that MVR was exported from. 

The snap shot of the Properties Palette shows the PRG Bad Boy, which should only have 2 Gobo Wheels, not 3.  This additional Gobo Wheel has been added to most fixtures in this file, but not all.  

+*{color:#FF0000}UPDATED (4/2):{color}*+ This is not in Build 583796, but I am seeing it in 583886 for Mainline (26.0.9).  Looks like this issue is also in 26.0.3, earliest build I could find was Build 583358 (I am not seeing this in Build 582153)

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-179554

Spotlight trusses become disconnected and sometimes reorientated when changing the trim heights

Using FD-34 trusses from the 2022 beta library whenever the trim height of a connected truss system is changed parts of the truss system get disconnected when the truss system moves to the new trim height. This occurs both when the change trim height of system button is used and if the new trim height value is directly entered into the Z coordinate field in the truss properties.

In the sample file FD-34 2.5m section and FD-34 corner blocks were used to create the system

to reproduce change the trim height either by using the change trim height of system button in the truss object properties or by group selecting and entering a new value directly in the Z coordinate field in the properties.

Either way the truss sections will split and in some cases re-orientate while moving to the new trim height, the blue 'Truss cross' object will then be displayed at the splits 		Kevin Linzey

VB-178098

*Spotlight: Cosmic Global F44300 truss crashes when using the 'Replace Truss' Command and also in the OIP when Selecting System objects

Hello,
In the enclosed file on the truss layer there are some Cosmic Global F44300 Straight 3m trusses.

If you go to Spotlight>Rigging> Replace Truss / Replace Truss type the software crashes.

If you select a stick and in the OIP click 'Select System Objects' the program will vaporise.

I have checked all the symbols in the F44300 file and in a blank file it seems ok when trying the above.
So this must be file related but somehow something has made it corrupt. I can redraw them in another file and copy and paste into this file and it seems to fix it.

Cheers,
Peter 		Kevin Linzey
VB-182274

Spotlight Cable object adapter report bug

If the user sets a cable object to use an adapter in the object properties the adapter doesn't display the same name in a cable report.

In the properties the adapter uses the localised name of the cable connector for each side of the adapter, where as in the report it displays using the universal name of the connectors for each end.

To reproduce

draw a cable object

in the object properties give it a start or end adapter

create a report using the cable object as the criteria and select the parameters cable run id, adapter start and adapter end.

The new report will display the adapters using the back-end universal name for the connector not the localised name like the object properties 		Kevin Linzey

Hey guys,

Please take a look at this behaviour.

Thanks in advance.
Best Regards
Alex 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182225

Spotlight Cable Tools Breakouts inserts symbol with missing information

When I insert a cable tools breakout, the symbol is missing several needed bits of information and functionality.

In 2022, open a blank document.

Using the Insert Distributor tool, Insert a breakout. I used several including a "Schuko Break Out Staggered"

Missing info in the OIP when compared to the same in 2021.
# The name of the breakout is not filled into the name field
# The load info is missing.
# All the fields to assign lengths to breakouts are missing.
# When one clicks on the "Draw output lengths," nothing happens in the drawing.

Please see attached for a side-by-side image of 2021 and 2022.

I've marked this as regression as this worked in 2021. If there's been a process change, we should include a pop-up when one clicks on the "Draw output lengths" to alert the user.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-181062

Spotlight Cable path and cable object editing problem

It is no longer possible to edit more than a single vertex of a cable object with attached data tags or a cable path containing cable objects with data tags.

The issue in both cases is that as soon as a vertex is edited all the connected objects are automatically selected including the tags.
* Cable path containing cable objects. edit 1 vertex and the contained cable objects (and linked data tags) get selected. effectively meaning the user will have to de-select everything and re-select the cable path before they can continue to edit/reshape it.
* Cable object created form a cable style containing data tags, again as soon as the first vertex is edited the connected data tags will be selected preventing the user from continuing to edit/reshape the cable object

in the attached file select any of the cable paths with attached cables or any cable object and try to reshape it

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-177456

Braceworks Underhung system deleting hoist on trim height change

When a truss with two parallel drops from an upper truss is changed by the Change Trim height option it's deleting leading one hoist as well as additional hoist connected to the upper system Kevin Linzey

Spotlight - Kabel Tool - Wrong calculation

Hej Guys

4 Lighting devices are added to this file. These are all connected to the generator with cables via distributors.

Overall with 4KW power. This is also shown to the distributor. From there, however, 2KW are missing in the calculation for the generator. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-179971

T02185: Inserting a data tag cause Undo/Redo to work incorrect

1. Insert a cable.
2. Click on Settings button in OIP.
3. Go to Data Tags pane.
4. Add a data tag and close the dialog with OK.
5. Press Ctrl+Z to undo.
- The data tag disappears.
6. Press Ctrl+Z to undo.
- The cable have to disappear instead a message ‘No undo history’ appear.
7. Press Ctrl+Y to redo.
- A message ‘No undo history appear’. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-176502

Spotlight edit cable part dialogue errors

When using the Edit Cable Part dialogue, accessed from the Manage Cable Parts dialogue there are several errors


The diameter and cross section area fields do not use consistent  (or correct) units
* the diameter field doesn't display any units, should be mm
* the cross section area field displays cm² it should be in mm² (normal international standard)



The second is how the cable diameter is used to calculate the cross section area (and the same going in the other direction).

The formula seems to use the same values no matter how many cores the cable has, which then means that for many cable types the cross section area is not correct

for example a EU standard 2.5mm² socapex typically has an outer diameter of approx 17.8mm (varies a bit between manufacturers) the edit parts

if 2.5 is entered into the cross section area field in the Edit Cable part dialogue you get 17.8 out which is what I would expect

However if I want to update a 16a 3 phase CEE 2.5mm² cable which is a 5 wire cable I don't get the correct results

from the Titanpower, a very popular UK cable supplier

https://www.titanpower.co.uk/2-5mm-ho7-rubber-5-core-16a-3-phase-rubber-cable.html

their standard 16a 3 phase cable has an out cable diameter of 11.8mm and each the wires should have a 2.5mm² cross section

if I put 11.8 into the diameter field I will get a cross section value out of 1.09

 

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-181348

Potential crash in VGM - "vector subscript out of range" for single-vertex polygon

VWPolygon2DObj can be created from a 1-vertex poly (VWPolygon2D) or 1-vertex array (TSTLPoints2DArray).
Test workflow: creating a polygon and consequently adding vertices.

VGM would crash in this "1-vertex" situation.
There are if-checks for array size >2 but not array size >1. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-179911

Cannot set/change some list browser interaction edit types.

Cannot set/change some list browser interaction edit types due to existing list browser code.

The known types that do this are kListBrowserItemInteractionEditText, kListBrowserItemInteractionEditNumerical and kListBrowserItemInteractionNone.

On Windows, see CListBrowserEx::SetItemInteractionType. In some cases, ListBowserGridItem::make_item returns nullptr instead of a control.

There is currently a workaround for two of the above types for the criteria dialog in CListBrowserEx::SetItemInteractionType.

These two criteria dialog issues were fixed by use of a workaround, changelist 602198, implemented in criteria dialog code; VB-179868 and VB-179861. 		Ian Lane
VB-182026

Crash in TMFCDialog::OnListBrowserItemChanged

The if statement uses static_cast instead of dynamic_cast in the assert that fails. Ian Lane
VB-182565

SBE: VWDialogEventArgs::GetListBrowserDropInfo() causes crash

VWDialogEventArgs::GetListBrowserDropInfo() sometimes returns garbage. The calling function expects as result either null or a pointer to a valid SListBrowserDragDropInfo struct, but often neither is the case and accessing returned SListBrowserDragDropInfo* causes a crash.
VWDialogEventArgs::GetListBrowserDropInfo() needs to check if GetEventDataPtr() returns null or a valid SListBrowserDragDropInfo* . Atm it does neither thus returning garbage or pointers to other data structures in some situations.
Ian Lane

VB-183610

Texture image gets moved in list on resource import

Scripters at Design Express are creating a texture resource, and this is having strange behavior when the texture resource is moved between documents.

 

The attached file includes a paint node on the drawing, and a script that creates a texture resource from the paint node.   Texture Test 4 is before the script is run.  Texture test 5 is after the script has been run to create the texture resource.  Texture Test 6 is with the texture applied to a sphere, it is working properly.  Debug list view shows everything fine, and the texture resource can be applied and renders on objects OK.

 

When this texture is imported into a blank document, the image def node seems to be moved to a child of the texture node, rather than a child of the texture bitmap node as it was before.  This breaks the texture so that it doesn't render with the image properly.  Renderings don't show the image and the Edit Texture dialog doesn't show the image, editing the image shader in the Edit Texture dialog shows a VW logo denoting the image is missing.

 

It seems that this bug happens during the resource import somewhere.

 

The script:

hPaint = vs.FActLayer()
hImage = vs.CreateImageFromPaint(hPaint, 'Image That Should Not Exist')

hTexture = vs.CreateTexture()
vs.SetName(hTexture, 'Import Me In Other Document')
hShaderRecord = vs.CreateShaderRecord(hTexture, 1, 41)
hTextureBitmap = vs.CreateTextureBitmapD(hShaderRecord)
vs.SetObjectVariableHandle(hTextureBitmap, 528, hImage)

  		Justin Hutchison

VB-180031

Then place a shape file into a succession of folders so that it is 12 folder deep as per enclosed folder "This will produce error".

This will create the error message "'An unknown error has occurred during this geographic operation". The Details log file is usually the file path.

It seems that once Vectorworks creates this message no matter where the file is, even on the desktop Shape files are no longer able to be imported!

We have:
Uninstalled and deleted the user folder and reinstalled.
Created a new user account with admin permissions
Rebooted in safe mode

The user presented to us with this problem. He is on Big Sur and I on Catalina. I could not repeat the problem on our Big Sur machine or on my one.

However once I got the error message by using the nested folders, I too am no longer able to import shape files even when after I renamed my user folder and the shape file is on my desktop, nor any shape file!

I am now at the same point as the user. I haven't tried getting the error message on SP4 or v2022 because I am hoping you can replicate.

VB-177226

Space : create space from polys gives wrong results with flipped planar polygons

VB-176322

3D model exports create improper texture names.

Exporting a model using textures that have some characters in the filename results in the filename becoming corrupted, so the textures cannot be found by any importers.

For example, the attached MVR uses one of Vectorworks' default textures, filename "Siding Aluminum Double Dutch Lap Blue 5in <Surf Hatch> RT.png"

In the 3DS files, the texture filename is given as "Siding Aluminum Double Dutch Lap Blue 5in <Surf Hatch> RT.png"

In the MVR itself, the texture is "Siding Aluminum Double Dutch Lap Blue 5in %3CSurf Hatch%3E RT.png"

Note that the angle brackets have been replaced by "%3C".

It appears that the texture filename has been URI-encoded when saving it, but this change to the filename was not propagated to the 3DS file(s) that reference it.

This inconsistency means that no MVR loader is able to find the texture, and the cones are left untextured.

Additionally, the 3DS format itself is generally considered to only support DOS 8.3 filenames, so not all 3DS loaders are capable of loading this file.

The same fault appears to occur in all Vectorworks 3D model exports that use separate texture and mesh files, such as 3DS, Collada, FBX (external textures) etc.

Note that Collada and other formats have specific encoding rules for filenames (URIs).
It does appear that the filename is being URI-encoded for Collada, but the encoded version is being used to save instead of the original. This means Collada importers decode the URI and cannot find the texture! 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-177013

TBB: Title Block geometry goes crazy upon editing

See attached screen recording.

For some reason a few objects within this Title Block Border go haywire when I edit multiple sheets using the Title Block Manager.

I've had similar distortion happen at random times in the past; previous occurrences weren't necessarily caused by the Title Block Manager, this is simply the first time I've found reproducible steps.

I have a suspicion that the geometry inside the Layout might somehow set to different planes? (which I don't even understand how or why that would be possible). I'm not sure how to fix it outside of recreating the geometry. Really I want to understand the underlying cause so it can be avoided in the future. 		Nikolay Zhelyazkov

VB-176980

Plant: change OI options switches text to "OK"

The attached video shows the Problem being reproduced

Like its shown in the video, there are a variety of options in the Object Info that if switched on or off it will change the text of the plant to "OK".

Is this normal? I have tried this with SP2 release version and SP3 beta 584554 and got the same result with both. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-182467

VW2021SP4 +Interiorcad F3.2 often slow and crashing a lot

Hi team, 

We need your help with this one. We've tried to apply the standard process of elimination, including a clean installation and User Folder, but the customer has been working with a contractor who is helping them build library files and doing their own troubleshooting throughout this process as well, which has made it impossible for us to definitively narrow down a cause. Because of how convoluted the process has got I'll just keep to the particulars: 
* On two different, but very high-spec Windows desktops, if a cabinet symbol (of the 'Cabinet 3D' variety) is dragged from the Resource Manager into the drawing, Vectorworks crashes. (Using license: G0RFL6). 
* After installing their User Folder into my VW2021SP4 +Interiorcad F4 the same procedure did not produce a crash. Neither did a wide variety of typical actions or plug-in object edits nor high-demand processes. (Later also tried with Interiorcad F3.2 to match theirs, but still no crash). 
* One user (Carl) has used their .vwx files on his personal laptop at home with Vectorworks 2021 SP4 + Interiorcad F3.2 or F4 and cannot incur crashes via this sequence either. (Using license: G0RFL6). 
* The business owner (Brendon Munro) is also having lots of issues on his laptop (including crashing), but for various reasons I've not yet conducted a methodical tech support process for him. Mostly because his small amount of RAM makes his computer an unreliable test vehicle. 

For both desktop PCs I've attached:
* Dxdiags. 
* Reliability History reports, featuring events that have accompanying crash logs. 
* DMP files / Crash logs. The most recent ones (2021-09-14) were induced by the above process. 

I note that the Reliability History cites various 'Fault Modules.' I'm aware that what Windows cites as a fault module is not necessarily the root cause, but it would be great if all possibilities could be considered as to what's causing these crashes. This customer has suffered many issues, some due to user error, some were environmental, some fleeting etc, yet they have expected us to fix all problems, even when/though most of them have been due to things outside our purview and despite that their files and customisations are based on bad practices concerning files and setup. 

So far, as part of this and prior issues, Carl's 'Design 3' computer (DESKTOP-2A89HUE) has had:
* A clean installation of Windows. (According to their IT provider, but I am not confident this was done properly). 
* (Therefore) the graphics card driver should be clean also. It is at least, very recent. 
* Then a clean installation of Vectorworks + Interiorcad (performed by me, following best-practices). 
* Since the above, after these recent issues arose/continued the Carl asserted the User Folder was at one time fully removed (by their contractor), but issues persisted with it removed. After they said this I deleted the usual Vectorworks registry files as prescribed by the Forum article on Resetting Vectorworks Preferences but no improvement. 

I'm starting to wonder if there is a hardware-specific bug at play. Hopefully you can answer this.

Another possibility would be defective hardware (memory or SSD perhaps) but proving this is well beyond our purview or my current skillset. 

We would be very grateful if you could review all the dmp files (for a broad view of issues and causes) but specifically advise about today's crash logs: What's the likely cause. 

In case you want to examine [you can download our copy of their User Folder here|https://www.dropbox.com/s/26fx6373bfw9g6e/Carl%2520Geel%2520-%25202021-09-09%252004.00.08%2520-%25202021.zip?dl=0] and I've included screen recordings of Carl's 'Design 3' (DESKTOP-2A89HUE) and his prior computer 'Design' (DESKTOP-BJESUSO) crashing as described along with the file used at the time, DMP files, the Dxdiag files and Reliability History log of recent crashes. 

Please attribute your findings to the computer concerned because Carl's one (DESKTOP-2A89HUE) is a recent $12,000 acquisition bought specifically to handle Vectorworks + Interiorcad and complex geometry and the customer is naturally pretty frustrated with the number of issues they've had despite their investment. 

Much thanks, 

Jeremy

 

*EDIT:* Since submitting this:
* The user Carl, has reported:
** An increase in the frequency of crashes.
** The number of things that trigger a crash has increased, including just switching from a Sheet Layer to a Design Layer. He said restarting his computer did not prevent these. 
** Graphical anomalies (artefacts duplicating and/or lingering onscreen), similar to:

VB-177632

Marionette networks cannot be successfully wrapped when nodes are named certain ways

We've solved other issues in the past when users name nodes inappropriately by modifying the characters they have entered, however, a new issue has come to my attention when wrapping networks that are named a certain way. Please see the attached video.

Because there is an open input port on the node named ">" (which would name the input port accordingly in the wrapped network), when this network is wrapped, an error is presented. Maybe we should prevent special characters in node names and require alphanumeric names? 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-181331

IFC Landscape: The right workflow to model gutters in Vectorworks (for IFC exports)

A big customer of ours is trying to model a gutter using the hardscape object, changing the IFC entity to IfcPipeSegmentType and setting the PredefinedType to GUTTER.

They do that because modelling the hardscape is pretty easy using the modifiers that already exist in the German version. Only I'm not really sure the hardscape object is the correct *way* to do this.

Online resources about how to correctly model gutters far and few between. Also being an architect doesn't help in the matter of landscape planning.

Appart from possible IFC specification issues, there are currently two issues with the IFC export of such a modified hardscape, for which I can report bugs if you like:
1) setting the export options to "SeparateInstances: True" works for the hardscape object as long as it stays IfcSlab. When changing the entity to IfcPipeSegmentType, a part of the object is not exported to IFC.
2) in contrast to walls, slabs and roofs, you *cannot use component* relevant information to *set conditions* for hardscape objects in the *data manager*. That makes it impossible to steer the export process for these objects. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-181991

Solibri Direct Issues with Symbols

Latest Solibri update has a few issues with symbols:

1) It appears that symbols that were solid modeled are now transparent in Solibri.   For example, there are wall panels with and without windows.  They are both based upon the same wall panel symbol that was solid modeled.  A window was added to the area where a solid subtraction created an opening.  Those nested symbols have a Window that appears correctly (solid) yet the wall panel itself does not (transparent).

2) There appear to be sync issues with nested symbols. The unnested symbols can be selected in one program and highlighted in the other.  This is not the case for the nested symbols.  

3) There also appears to be an issue when moving symbols and them not always syncing correctly in Solibri. This was noticed first by moving a wall panel out of the building envelope.  Solibri reflected the move correctly.  The panel was then moved back into the building envelope but the move was not reflected in Solibri.  The videos attached are another version of this description

These were not an issue in the previous version of Solibri. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-176276

DOM: IFC Export of referenced Viewports

There are more and more Customers which have to solve the requirement, exporting a complete model with several Buildings in an IFC Modell.
At the Moment this is not possible. But I think we need a good Workflow or a solution. The Following I can imagine:
1. Exporting a Document and "add" ton an existing IFC File (maybe be complexe and errors are possible)
2. Or exporting the Target Document to IFC. The Export would look into Viewports and creates correct IFC Strucure for it.
The user can build this Structure in Vectorworks with refered viewports. Also those Viewports can be exported in IFC but the Data and the geometry (if components have different heights) are not exported correctly. This could be rated as ab Bug.

Also really this is also a burning BIM Worklfow-issue which arrives our consultants, trainers and supporters.

A good example (quite simple) attached to this Report. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-177641

IFC Import: takes over an hour in VW, only a few minutes in others

To completely import the attached IFC file in Vectorworks takes over an hour. In other applications it only takes a few minutes:

Solibri: 1 minute
BIMcollab ZOOM: 2 minutes
Archicad 22: 4 minutes
Revit 2021.1.2: 30-40 minutes

Import tests show that it's the IfcSlab and IfcWallStandardCase entities that cause the long processing in Vectorworks.

This file comes from the same customer that has had IFC import issues before:
https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-157710
https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-161264

 

Please take a closer look and see if there's an easy fix - possibly a workaround.

Thank you.

Regards,
Antonio 		Mihail Rizov

VB-182848

Application crashes when attempting to remove a landmark area material IFC entry

Steps:
# Open the attached file: [^Crash on IFC uncheck.vwx]
# Select the landscape area object
# In the OIP, select the data tab
# In the IFC area, check Materials
# When the site model goes out of date, select the site model and in the OIP press Update
# Select the Landscape area again, and in the IFC area, uncheck the materials option
# Click through the dialogs

_Notice that once you Click OK to the prompt saying the entry cannot be deleted, the application crashes_

 

_NOTE:  This action may be needed 1-2 times before the crash occurs.  If you don't get a crash the first time, deselect the landscape area, select it again, and again try to uncheck the option._

VB-181121

Scale Objects: symbol moves place instead of being scaled

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

Important Note: This comes from a Customer with 416 Licenses (KNAPP AG).

The attached DWG Import.vwx was created by importing the attached .dwg file (meters were used).

The attached Symbol.vwx was created by copying the Symbol named Fördertechnik 20061219 to a new empty document. The Symbol was "too long" and that was being caused by two Text objects which I removed to create a more "neat" Symbol.

In the Symbol.vwx, use the command "Scale Objects" for the Symbol. For example X,Y,Z with 0,5.

The Symbol instead of being scaled to half of its size, it will move place. 		Josh Loy
VB-180816

Stacked Dual Dimensions do not show Stacked Fractions

When you have a Stacked Dual Dimensions and have the units set to Feet & Inches or Inches, fractions only show in the standard fraction (first) mode. Fractions set to diagonal stacked or vertically stacked are not displayed.

In the attached drawing the right side inner vertical dimension is set to ASME Dual Stacked and the outer is set to ASME. The left side vertical dimension is a custom dimension style made from the Arch standard dimension. The horizontal dimension closest to the rectangle is set to ASME Dual Stacked. The one farther away is set to ASME SidebySide.

Go to File:Document Settings:Units and go to the Dimension pane.

Set the Fraction Display for Dimensions to the first mode and click the OK button. Note that all four dimensions show the fractional values properly.

Go back to Units and change to either the second or third mode of Fraction Display and click the OK button. Note that the Dual Stacked Dimensions, both the stock ASME and the custom one now show no fraction and appear as if they have been rounded down.

The fraction is just getting dropped. The rectangle has a vertical fraction of 0.2 inches and a vertical fraction of 0.7 inches. Both are dropped and not displayed. The dimension is not rounding to the nearest inch.

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-182577

Chained dimension don't adapt correctly after wall orientation change

Just look at the video. When having "chained" dimensions of a wall, if the user changes the orientation of the wall, then...  Karthick Chilaka
VB-177369

*Vectorworks Crash while using Spotlight Numbering

https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?crashId=6948586

The steps taken to experience this crash are not typical, but a crash they do cause on Mac and Windows

 
# Insert 1 or more Lighting Devices in a drawing
# With devices selected or not selected (doesn't seem to matter), Go to Spotlight Numbering under Spotlight
# Check 1 or more fields in the Field List (*keep Primary Direction set to Manual*)
# Click OK
# Do not click on any Lighting Device
# Go back to Spotlight Number
# Click Cancel in Spotlight Numbering window
# It may take a few seconds, but Vectorworks will crash

 

Note: There were a few instances it took a minute or two before crashing, sometime trying to preform another action or click.  

You will notice the curser still has the Spotlight Number Manual Reticle after canceling, but the red highlight that usually occurs when hovering over a Lighting Device with Manual Spotlight Number is not present. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-177911

Classes visibilities not working in Nomad 'Saved Views'

Saved Views in Nomad don't display correctly. When using Class visibilities to control what content is visible in Saved Views, those settings don't affect what is visible when viewing the 3D Model in Nomad. The entire model remains visible despite the Saved View excluding some classes. (This occurs on both iOS and Android). 

Using Design Layers to control what's visible does work however. 

EDIT: The user has since supplied additional data: 
* They've tried reinstalling Nomad. No better. 
* They have a Samsung Galaxy A50, "up to date running Android 11." 
* He has the additional symptoms of the screen/view going black and then after clicking the 'reset view' button, the model becomes visible once again but is rotated 90º around the Y axis (I  think).  		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-183489

Hidden Line viewport: stacking order of drawn geometry incorrect

In the attached file there are two main elements modeled: a 3D storefront (with thin grey pen) and some 3D scenery units in front of each pilaster (with thick black pen).

When I create a Hidden Line viewport in Front orthographic view, the grey lines from the storefront are drawn with a 2D stacking order in front of the black lines of the scenery. I'm not talking about the physical occlusion - that is drawn correctly, but rather when you look at the end points of the grey linework it is being drawn above the black linework. This is incorrect and looks terrible.

I've not found a way to control this or solve the problem. The storefront is of course behind the scenery in 3D space. I've also selected the 3D storefront and did "Send to Back" but that has no effect. I even tried created a separate Design Layer for the storefront stacked below the scenery, but even that had no effect.

Strangely, if I look at the same front view in the Design Layer it's drawn correctly. The issue seems to only be with the viewport.

How can I solve this? 		Hernán Stamati

VB-183153

Unified View Turns Itself Off

With "Legacy 2D" prefs unchecked, the document somehow turned off Unified View. Even though I knew Legacy 2D was not enabled, I recognized what the issue was, enabled legacy 2D features, and unchecked Turn off unified view. That fixed the issue.

However, after updating to 618132, it happened again (this time with legacy 2D features enabled). I went to Document Prefs, Legacy 2D, and sure enough, Turn off unified view was checked again (seemingly by default). 		Josh Loy
VB-182881

Object Info Palette not authorized for use in Viewer after closing the tab

In the Vectorworks Viewer (2021 and 2022), the user has access to the OIP at first when running the Viewer.  

If they close this palette and then try to re-open it in the Window > Palettes menu, they're informed the palette is "not authorized for this product".

The only solution is to fully uninstall/reinstall the Vectorworks Viewer.

Vectorworks Viewer 2022 also runs into this issue with the Attributes Palette; it's available when first launching the Viewer and you can even change attributes but once you close it, it's gone until you uninstall/reinstall.

I'm unsure if this is by design or not, but the OIP is critical for reviewing contents in the file (without it, the Viewer lacks all the visible date/information) and it's also available at the start (and in previous versions of the Viewer).

Please let me know if there's anything else I can be of any assistance with and have a great day!  :)  		Tim Ardoin

VB-176399

Align Layer Views - Stories

*This is the text from the user's email*

 

I am working on a Working File in VW 2021 SP02 and as I was trying to change the Top Bound settings of a wall, I noticed that I no longer had any of the level types/storeys associated with the design layers (See Image 1 & Image 2 for what it should look like). Note that the (after issue) VW file shows the layers associated with the storeys because I re-associated the storeys before saving the file. This changed the Z value of all the slabs and stairs to match L01, yet all the walls were where they were supposed to be. It also changed the default story elevation value of some but not all story levels to a negative number that made the level align with L01.

 

This happened two days ago. Today, the issue happened again but this time only the X-LEVEL layers were no longer associated to the storeys

*He then wrote back with more info*

I was able to recreate the issue.

This happens when I use the “Align Layer Views” tool. I used it because lines from another layer were showing up on my 2D plan in what looks like the Top View Wireframe for the other layer (not Top/Plan). For which usually clicking on Unified View fixes it but, when it does not, I would click on Align Layer Views. This fixes the projection issue but removes the layer to story association.

 

Is this the expected behaviour? I am under the impression that Align Layer Views should only affect the projection of 3D elements and not the layer settings (as per Image 4, [Align Layer Views|https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2021/eng/index.htm#t=VW2021_Guide%2FViews%2FAligning_layer_views.htm%23CSH_45]). Please clarify.

* There is an overall texture applied that is mapped by default with Surface UV, although when changed to cylindrical it didn't make any difference.

* Added Decal to the texture 1m x 1m with rectangular mask.

* Render in Fast Renderworks to see it.

* Click the Attribute Mapping tool (AMT) and the Decal disappears. There's a message saying 'Stopping Render' and in the render menu it shows Shaded.

* Problem is that there is no Decal texture visible and no reshape box or reshape handles. Even when zoomed out in case it was miles away.

* Clicking on a face to set the origin does nothing.

* Sometimes clicking back on the selection tool will make the extrude lose it's original texture and is becomes grey. Yet the OIP says it is still applied.

VB-178219

Landmark: Editing Plant Styles when using multi views and one view in 3D, explodes the Plant tags

Hello,
In the enclosed file you can see some plants in Top Plan and also in a 3D view as the file is using multi views.

If a plant that exists on the page has it's style edited (all you need to do is open the Plant Style dialogue and close it) then the Plant Tags are exploded from the Plant object, individually turned into a group and placed on top of each other away from the Plant. The leader lines, and tick if used do the same.

If the plants are regenerated the tags return correctly, leaving the exploded objects on the page.

In the enclosed screenshot from the user you will see that the location of the exploded tags according to the OIP is far far away, yet the Tools>Origin>Centre drawing on Internal Origin does not report these numbers.

I have enclosed a test file and a movie as well as the user's original file and some silent movies from him. It is hard to see what he is doing as he has two screens and there's no audio but I include all his stuff in a zipped file.

I checked with Vectorworks, Inc. tech support and no one else is reporting this but we have taken some heat as we couldn't replicate until he discovered it was having a 3D view open in multi views that was the cause.

Cheers,
Peter 		Josh Loy
VB-178926

Hello,
The enclosed '0882SYD Ivanhoe Estate C2_SK_Basefile' file has a problem with the active layer: L-Softscape - Park Level. On that layer there is a problem with the image fills not showing as they have very large numbers in the length fields if you click the little mapping button in the Attribute Palette.
We did discover a corrupt symbol which has been fixed and an errant hardscape many kilometres away that has been deleted.
When trying to copy the layers and objects into a new blank file we used the 'Create New layer' >Choose and navigated to the file. We selected all the layers in the list and clicked the button 'Import Layer Objects'.
There were several warnings about being unable to import layer links (when can that be updated to DLVPs?!).

Once the import had finished note the following:
1. Hundreds of classes prefixed with NNA.
2. Select what appears to be the drawing. Then Edit Invert Selection and note there are 7 viewports kilometres away. These are on design layers so how did they import? Delete them.
3. Go to s front view and do a Edit>Select All. Note that there are objects 6000 kilometres up in the air. Some are viewports, groups and polys. This isn't the case in the original file.

This report is about the layer import process scrambling the original file's objects.

VB-176951

Spotlight: Windows: Instrument Summary - Export to PDF has no text unless in Top Plan and visible

Hello,
We have had several users who for some reason when they Export to PDF a plan that has a Spotlight Instrument Summary (IS) on it, the text in it is not produced.

Today someone informed me that is is solved provided the view is in Top Plan and that the IS is also visible. They state that if in an isometric for example the text doesn't export.
Some users are on v2020 and others v2021.

I enclose a sample file that this happens on. I am unable to verify on Windows as I can't access that OS at the moment.

Cheers,
Peter 		Josh Loy
VB-178922

Publish/Export to PDF is unable to print on some printers

Hello,
In the enclosed file there are 3 sheets to be published to PDF. The resulting PDF is also enclosed.

The PDF was unable to be printed at a professional print shop, and neither on a Canon on the macOS nor a Brother printer on Windows, nor another Brother here in the office on the macOS.

I was able to print on an Epson on the MacOS at my home.

If the user creates a PDF from the Print command on the macOS (save as PDF) then it will print.

If the user copies and pastes the geometry into a new file and exports to PDF then it will print on his system.

Cheers,
Peter

Josh Loy
VB-177214

The macOS: v2020 & v2021 continual problems - fixed with Settings folder being renamed.

Hello,
I had a conversation with [~gmiller] about this hence this report. Everyday in Australia, I am getting macOS users to reset their user Settings folder in order for the program to function normally.

This is independent of the actual macOS. I have users on 10.12+ to 10.15 and 11 with this same issue/fix. The problems can all be different from the program crashing, not launching, to palettes unable to be docked - all kinds of different issues. However renaming the Settings folder in their Vectorworks User folder nearly always fixes the problem. This is not an issue with Windows.

This happens on a daily basis. Gunther suggested I get the user folder and in this report I have the Settings folder. When I swap it with mine and relaunch the program it appears to open but stalls. I have also included the user's crash report. I note she is on 10.15.7 and v2020 SP5 but once she renamed the Settings folder it launched fine.

On the macOS there seems to be something 'flaky'(technical term) about one or more of the files in the Settings folder.

Cheers,
Peter

Ian Lane

VB-183586

Cloud Services Presentations - Link's Text to Display behaves oddly when trying to editing

This issue is demonstrated with narration in the attached video.

The issue is: When a link's "Text to display has a typo and the user tries to edit the typo, either the entire line of "Tech to display" is deleted when trying to just remove one letter, or deleting one word of the line disables/remove the link behaviour.

Also, If the user selects entire link and clicks on the link icon in the formatting bar, the URL is editable but the Text to Display is not available to edit.

The expected behaviour would be:
* If the user selects the entire link on the board, then presses the link icon in the formatting bar, the Text to Display should be available to edit normally as text, and
* If the user is working on the board and places their cursor after a letter that is part of some Text to Display, then presses the delete key, only the one character to the left of the cursor should be deleted (not the entire line of Text to Display), and
* If the user is working on the board and selects some text that is within some existing Text to Display, they may retype that text without the entire line of Text to Display losing its URL and link functionality.

Safari for Mac is being used in the attached video but the issue occurs in Chrome for Mac as well. (I am entering Vectorworks version info because JIRA requires it, but the Vectorworks version is not likely relevant for this issue.) 

Thank you for looking into this :)

 

  		Lyuben Hadzhipopov

VB-180257
