-Activate the Line tool with "Screen Aligned" as the active plane
-Snap to the Extrude's corner as shown and click to begin drawing the line
-Now Tab into the floating data bar and enter any length
-Move the cursor so that the "Object" snap is acquired on the Extrude's top face, then click to finish drawing the line at that angle

Request for investigation- On a customer's Windows PC, VW2021 crashes during Quit of VW2021.

There is a survey request from a customer.
On a customer's Windows PC, VW2021 crashes during Quit of VW2021.

The information in the Problem signature screenshot (Problem signature.png) displayed on the customer's PC is as follows.
Problem signature:
Problem Event Name: APPCRASH
Application Name: Vectorworks2021.exe
Application Version: 26.0.2.0
Application Timestamp: 5fad8b83
Fault Module Name: libcef.dll
Fault Module Version: 84.2.6.0
Fault Module Timestamp: 5f08e1b8
Exception Code: c0000005
Exception Offset: 000000000202164b
OS Version: 10.0.19042.2.0.0.256.48
Locale ID: 1041
Additional Information 1: 5212
Additional Information 2: 5212545fbea1cf55723dce21fd725c08
Additional Information 3: bfa1
Additional Information 4: bfa1b3aa8258554da92abc9b48182d4c

The customer renamed the "ChromiumEF_dlls" folder in C Drive> Program Files> VW2021 where the Fault Module is located, and it no longer crashes, and it seems to be working properly.
Customers in such situations have asked the following two questions.
1) What causes VW2021 to crash during Quit of VW2021 on the customer's PC?
2) What is the purpose of the files in this "Chromium EF_dlls" folder? And what kind of trouble does renaming the folder cause?*
*If this answer is related to confidential information, please let us know. We must not tell our customers anything related to confidential information.

By the way, the customer's PC is a home built computer.
Please refer to the Direct X screenshots "Direct X-System.png", "Direct X-Display 1.png" and "Direct X-Display 2.png" of the customer's PC.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno

VB-183978

Objects with gradient fill, don't appear in published PDFs from VW2021

# Draw a rectangle (or a polygon) in a Design Layer. 
# Apply a gradient fill to it. (The client and I both used his black-through-transparent gradient resource). 
# Create a Sheet Layer Viewport. 
# Publish the Sheet Layer as a PDF using default settings. 
# The gradient object either shows as solid or nothing at all. 

I've done many tests for this issue and confirmed: 
* After pasting the objects from the client file into a new blank document, the issue persists. 
* After exporting the file as v2020 then reopening in VW2021, the issue persists. 
* Opening the client file in VW2022 it publishes fine. 
* After exporting the client fine to 2020, it publishes fine. 
* Executing the above test in VW2022 (no issues) then exporting the file as v2021, then opening in VW2021, the issue persists. 

All tests using the client file in all three versions of Vectorworks, had 'None fill uses Alpha Transparency,' ON.  		Josh Loy
VB-180883

2D class attributes from active class not applied to extrusion

When creating an extrusion from a 2D object that sits in a different class than the active class, the 2D attributes of that class are used instead of those from the active class. This makes the extrusion behave differently than other objects in that class. The textures from the active class are applied whatever the class of the first object is.

This is inconsistent behavior.
See attached screen recording.  		Josh Loy
VB-183822

Random white shapes appearing in 3D view

I'm not sure how best to describe this, really best to be seen in the attached video. There are multiple issues, hard to tell if they are related. The issues to be seen in this video are:
# the solid white arcs over the GP that seem to be related to the seating but are not selectable and remain visible no matter what layers are turned on or off.
# In the Section, you will see white squares behind the seats that behave similarly to the above.
# There are box booms with a series of 3D lights on them. These are not lighting devices, just a plain 3D symbol. You'll see both the "lights" and the side arms are showing up just as 3D white rectangles.

 

This problem has presented itself multiple times. One time it happened after doing the following: 
# In the file turn off all layers but [3D] THEATRE. Note that everything appears just fine.
# Draw a square. Everything still fine.
# Extrude the square. Now all the white shapes have appeared

But when I perform those steps again, it does not occur so I don't yet have a surefire way to force the problem. 		Walid Remaili

When I open the file in Windows I receive this error message. (See Attached)

I have attached a screen recording of the issue as well.

What I am finding odd is I have two files that are essentially the same. The only difference is one has a few more resources in the resource manager than the other. One was made in August and one was made in September. (I have attached both) The one made in August I have no problem opening in Windows VW 2022 but the one from September I get the error message.

it doesn’t make sense that the file from August works but the updated one from September doesn’t. The only differences are a few resources added.

I had someone with a Mac computer test this out using Parallels and they received the same error. However I had someone with a Windows computer try it out and they had no issues. So this makes me think it is something to do with Parallels. 		Rick Berge

imported cropped PDF file disappears when zoomed in

# Import a PDF file of a vector drawing (such as a topographical survey).

VB-181800

Boomerang mode on Mac smart options display spacebar

User called in to explain that they can no longer use the space bar to access boomerang mode

I found that the user disabled "show with spacebar" in Smart options display and this triggered boomerang mode to no longer work.

I tried it out on my Mac running SP4 and sure enough I lost the ability to enter boomerang mode.

Steps I took

Hit Spacebar and see that the pan tool appears

go to VW prefs and disable "show with spacebar" in Smart Options Display

Try using spacebar to enter boomerang mode to get pan tool, it is disabled.

 

This issue does not appear in windows 		Ian Lane
VB-181802

hang on Startup Survey, Mac - solved?

login would hang before survey. solution was to turn on VPN to a US location

 

from my forum post:

_opened b6, logged out, quit VW. ran command successfully in terminal._

_re-started VW, long delay to get to log in window. after entering data, complete hang with white screen of log in window, behind is the VW loading screen and showing "Initializing help system".  survey never appeared.  had to force quit._

_opened VW and am logged in.  Will restart the Mac and retry the process, as, when taking a screw shot, the screen shot app somehow broke: it left a shaded and unshaded portion of my screen and never saved the PNG on my system.  Related?  brb._

_..._

_after restart repeated the steps.  continues to fail:_

_20-30s to get to log in screen, +2 min to exit log in screen, indefinite hang on white screen, initializing help system in the background, no surgery._

_Mac OS 11.5.1 MacBook Air M1_

_..._

_I think I have SOLVED the hang issue... (at least for me)_

_I am not located in the US.  So, for a third test I turned on a VPN to a US location.  The process worked as designed: small wait to login window, after login, small wait until survey, upon completion of survey VW started successfully._ 		Mark Farnan

VB-177752

Loft surface cursor targeting behaviour

As seen in the attached narrated video and observed during a training session with a customer (so, replicated on their computer), the targeting behaviour of the loft surface tool is a bit unpredictable. This resulted in some frustration during the training session, though the trainee persevered.

Basically...
* When NURBS curves are coincident with the extrude they were extracted from, the cursor has difficulty targeting those NURBS curves.
* If the extrude is moved away from the NURBS curves, loft surface cursor targeting works fine.
* If the NURBS curves are selected prior to activating the loft surface tool, loft surface cursor targeting is also fine (but this is an odd workflow to suggest to a user.)

This seems to occur in brand new files so I have not included a sample file.

It would be great to have this cursor behaviour reviewed and if possible corrected to make it more predictable.

Thanks! 		Josh Loy
VB-176333

ConnectCAD: Copy-Paste device breaks device

Steps to reproduce:
# New document ConnectCAD Metric template
# New Device using Sample Device symbol
# Copy the device
# New document ConnectCAD Metric template
# Paste

Device rectangle appears offset (-36, 44) from it's correct position. If you enter the profile group it appears correctly positioned. 		Josh Loy
VB-177072

Updated viewport can't be selected by fill after save.

Open the given file. Note that the viewport can't be selected by fill. Update. The viewport can now be selected. Save and reopen. The viewport can no longer be selected by fill. This is because the selection code is relying on temporary caches for determining selection, and those caches are only generated if the viewport is updated and are not saved with the file. Josh Loy

VB-180631

DMX Recorder launches entirely off screen

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/84232-dmx-recorder-window-doesnt-open/&tab=comments#comment-397882v

I feel like I have seen this before. Booting into safe mode clears the "last known location" and allows it to work for a bit. But, this issue in particular, appears to be not that the window is simply hidden behind another window. Rather, this seems like an issue where the last known location on screen ends up being "off screen" and it becomes impossible to work with the DMX Recorder as a result.

I'm not sure what is required to reproduce this. However, I have a feeling it may be tied to having HighDPI 4K displays. Due to Qt's handling of HighDPI, this issue may be specific to PC. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-179867

SDK IObjUpdateSupport ObjectEventCall::fData is NULL when moving grouped objects to a new layer

Using IObjUpdateSupport to catch object events. Changing an object's layer invokes a before delete and a created event. When the monitored objects are grouped, the data pointer is NULL. e.g.

{code:cpp}
void UpdateSupport::OnLightBeforeDelete( MCObjectHandle hObject, const ObjectState &state ) const {
const ObjectStateData_Delete* deleteData = (const ObjectStateData_Delete*) state.fData;
{code}

If, however, the objects are ungrouped, fData is a valid pointer as expected. 		Rick Berge

In this case I did shift + left arrow to move it a couple millimeters to the left.

You may want to submit this as a Jira.

Regards,

Rob Nykolaishen
Technical Support Specialist" 		Rick Berge

VB-179399

VS Concat() fails under very specific conditions

This anomaly in the Concat() function was first noticed by Julian Carr.

Through extensive testing it has been determined that the Concat() function can fail when the function is expected to return a text block of 1024 bytes in length. That's bytes, not characters.

Since text now follows the UTF-8 convention, characters can have a length of 1 to 3 bytes. If the Concat() function builds a block of text that should return a block 1024 bytes in length through any combination of UTF-8 characters, there is a high probability it will fail. 

The attached VW 2021 file contains two scripts. One script creates the problem condition once and displays the resultant text block in an Alert Dialog with the Byte Length and the Expected Byte Length shown at the bottom.

The other script executes the problem condition 100,000 times and reports the number of times the function passed (showing 0 characters added), and the number times the function failed along with the number of characters that were added to the text block. The typical failure mode is for the Concat() function to add 1 extra character, but quite often it will add from 4 to hundreds of extra characters. I have included two screenshots showing different results.

It is possible to change the conditions of the programs, the number of loops to run, and the characters used to build the text blocks. To modify the scripts, follow the comments in the scripts.

The only place I have seen this failure occur is when a text block should have 1024 characters in the return value of the Concat() function. It is possible for there to be other values of text block sizes that cause problems, but I have not found them.

The problem does not affect VW 2018, but can be observed in VW 2019, VW 2020, and VW 2021. VW 2022 is not yet tested.

Attached, one VW 2021 file containing scripts that demonstrate the problem. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-179039

Active Plane Confusion

Active Plane choice does not hold when Screen Plane Only is chosen. See the attached movie, which references the attached fie. The Active Plane changes when in the Screen Plane Only mode. It can change to Symbol Definition ( a 3D mode in this 3D Symbol ) or to Screen Aligned.

What is 'Screen Aligned'? it is not explained in the Vectorworks Help. The Tape Measure Tool obviously does not measure the component of a distance aligned with the Screen Plane. This can be infuriatingly insidious when using the Move by Points Tool when objects can relocate to difficult to predict locations. They can be off the Screen and might not be immediately obvious when an Undo is convenient. They can then actually be time consuming to decipher and correct at some later point in time.

Thanks a lot for your attention while I still have some hair left. :— ) 		Josh Loy

VB-177877

If Vectorworks Site Protection Server is operating with a mixed version of the license, the lower version of the client will prefer the higher version of the license.

If Vectorworks Site Protection Server is operating with a mixed version of the license, the lower version of the client will prefer the higher version of the license.

Regarding VB-167358, the client program was modified in VW2021, but for customers who are using licenses that include VW2020 and below, this bug will occur every time the license is renewed.
The customer who reported this bug had been resolved with a modified license file, but the recent addition of the VW2021 license caused this bug again.
Therefore, in order to prevent similar troubles, it is necessary to fundamentally fix this bug so that it does not occur even if clients of VW2021 or higher and VW2020 or lower are used together.

I have attached the customer license file, debuglog.txt, reportlog.txt, and license poor status image file.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Sasha Wood
VB-178021

Automatic Plane + complex mesh somewhere in scene causes long hang

Working in 3D... If there happens to be a complex mesh somewhere on the screen (such as realistic 3D figure), and I try to use automatic plane to draw a 2D shape on a surface of some other object, Vectorworks frequently hangs for 5-20 minutes. Presumably it's 'seeing' all the 3D polys of the mesh and trying to process each one individually as a potential automatic plane. Even if I consciously avoid the mesh the hang seems inevitable (either I accidentally moved the mouse across the object's bounding box, or Vectorworks is somehow seeing it anyways). I've had this issue for years and it's a pain the butt. Sometimes it's a figure, or a couch, or a plant on the other side of the room.

This also affects other things with interactive highlighting, such as the Extract and Shell tools.

In the attached screen recording, at approx. 8 seconds in, the cursor turns into the spinning beach ball, though this doesn't show up in the recording. Also in this instance the hang clearly happens when I move the cursor within the bounding box of the mesh, though not directly over the mesh geometry.  		Josh Loy
VB-177858

Asymmetric scale of PDF object fails

Importing a plan PDF to trace often requires scaling for exact size, esp when the PDF is a scan of a traditional paper drawing. Often the scan process does not preserve the X/Y ratio at 1:1

Attempting asymmetric scale of PDF page fails, in that there is no response. If the PDF is cropped, the asymmetric scale applies only to the crop, not the PDF.

"Scale Objects" command works as expected using the "measure "option for any given length on the PDF. But asymmetric scale does not work. 		Josh Loy

VB-177329

Component offsets of indiviual walls are reset if you edit multiple walls at the same time

You can give one component a bottom offset with the button "components" in the OIP. After that you make a selection of multiple walls in the same style, this first wall included. You give for all these walls another component a top offset. You'll see that the first bottom offset is cancelled by this last operation. This is odd, because I didn't touch the settings of that specific wall component. The first bottom offset should stay intact unless the user specifically changes the settings. This is important to prevent mistakes in the BIM model. Christopher Graye
VB-177064

VS BeginGroupN: dangerous, never returns NIL if empty, crashes/hangs PIOs

In Vectorscript the usage of BeginGroupN allows to create an empty group, some sort of init.

This group, though, will never return NIL, as any other non-existing group, and at the same time when used in plug-in objects, will crash/hang VW mercilessly when empty.

This doesn't happen in doc scripts.

Please resolve this condition. In the context of large scripts, such groups can end up being empty and it's not possible to check. This might be one of the most frequent causes of crashes in custom plug-ins.

 

Please open the attached file, it contains instances of a test Pio that creates a locus and
* an empty group using BeginGroupN
* an empty group using BeginGroup

Upon regenerating the Pio, this will show an alert informing you which of these groups are NIL. Please outcomment the code lines involving some common group operations to see VW crash or hang.

  		Vladislav Stanev

VB-176476

Referenced Windows not updating on design layers in WGR file

# Open _PST-B003-XX-XX-DR-A-Sheets.vwx_
# Confirm that the workgroup reference to _PST-B003-XX-XX-M3-A-Model.vwx_ is up to date. Replace the sill schedule if it asks.
# Go to sheet 500 in _PST-B003-XX-XX-DR-A-Sheets.vwx_
# Confirm that the Viewport (500-1) is up to date.
# Note the width of window types M2 and M3 (as attached screenshot)

*Behaviour experienced:*
Window types M2 and M3 are 1135 mm wide.

*Behaviour expected:*
When updating the viewport they should have changed to 1022.5 mm because they've been updated to this in the model file. But weirder still, if you check these resources (in _PST-B003-XX-XX-DR-A-Sheets.vwx_) in the in the RB (i.e. _A-Ss_25_30-M_Type_M2_ and A-_Ss_25_30-M_Type_M3_) you will see that they have actually been updated to the new size: 1022.5. It's just the version of them on design layer "Window Schedule 500" that hasn't updated.

Note that these files were Project Sharing files to begin with. I changed them to standard files to see if that would flush out the problem but it didn't work.

VB-184271

Export / Import 3D Symbol to DWG: result is distorted

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When Exporting to DWG a 3D Symbol, the triangulation lines to preserve fills are displayed with Shaded and with Hidden Line the round shape is lost.

We can see this when importing back to Vectorworks.

Should exist a solution to keep the smooth circular shapes of the objects after the export to dwg is done and the lines of the triangulation should not be displayed with Shaded, plus the face of the objects is shown distorted / ragged.

Solution? Workaround for the Customer, please? Thank you. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-177149

Text styling: VW has no option for "shadow" and "outline" (only Windows)

Just yesterday I had a customer on the line that was complaining about measurement text showing up as styled with outline on the PDF, when the text looks fine in Vectorworks.

I was able to resolve the issue by manually setting a default text style to the text in question, but it was necessary for me to get their Vectorworks file to figure out the issue.

Apparently there are text styling options that are only available on MacOS:
* outline
* shadow

That on its own is not the issue. The problem arises, when a Vectorworks user that works on Windows receives a file from a MacOS user. If a text comes with *outline* styling, it will *show up as* *outline* styling for the Windows user with no way to turn off the style other than to override it with a text style. *Shadow* on the other hand doesn't show up as any special style on Windows, but when printed it *shows up as* *outline*.

There are two issues here:
* the missing style options on Windows (outline at least shows up, why not display the option?)
* the shadow style producing an outline text on Windows (when printed)

_The latter point is especially frustrating for_ _the customer__, because they have to start comparing your PDFs with your viewports to find the faulty text objects._

To reproduce: (see also screenshots)
1) open the attached vwx file on MacOS
2) see how the text really looks like
3) print to see that everything looks right (well, the shadow doesn't look exactly the same)
4) open the file on Windows
5) see that the text does not look loke on MacOS
6) print as PDF to see the issue with the shadow styled text
--> see the differences between 		Karthick Chilaka

6) check if the Marionette object works as it should

6) insert the red symbol into the design layer (scale 1:50)

8) import red symbol from 2nd to 3rd document
9) insert red symbol
--> same as in the 2nd document

VB-181519

Align / Distribute leader lines is not working as expected or consistently

Steps:
# Open the attached file: [^Hardscape.vwx]
# Select all the hardscape objects within the document borders
# Once selected, select Modify > Align > Align/Distribute Leader Lines
# Ensure the top two check marks are checked, and the bottom option is active (Equal distance between shoulder lines
# Along the left or right outside the drawing document border draw a line straight up and down.

_Notice the labels are now stacked one on top of the other.  Doing the same with the callouts makes them not stack on top of one another but they do have heavy overlapping._

 
# With the hardscapes selected, in the OIP set the setting "Tag Approach Angle" to 20
# Again, draw a line straight up and down
# Notice that now the object are spread out equally and the option set in the OIP is removed (because each one is angle is now different)

There seems to be no way to predict what happens when using this meu command.

VB-184323

Replacing the hardscape style of a placed hardscape object moves the style definition in the resource browser

The attached file 'HS Library.vwx' has three hardscape styles (two in folder H_Mulch Paving, and one in folder H_Turf).
Open a new blank Vectorworks file.
With the resource browser pointed to HS Library.vwx Place three hardscape objects in the new blank file by dragging the hardscape style objects from the HS Library (in the resource browser) into the drawing window of the new blank file.

Note that each of the hardscapes placed in the new file have different names. These are the names of the hardscape when the style was created.

Note also that each of the hardscape styles are found in a folder of the same name as in the library file.


Select the second hardscape and using the object info pallet style pull down replace the style with Dark Grey Granite Mulch by clicking in the Choose a style box and selecting the first style offered (in this case it was 'Sod'). and then pressing 'ok' . Note that the Hardscape style 'Sod' has now been moved to a newly created subfolder named "Hardscape Styles". This is unexpected and will cause confusion in the users who will now not find the style definition where they expect it,.

If you do the same thing with the third hardscape but this time choose a hardscape definition other than the one first offered, we still have the same issue with the name and colour and the hardscape definition moving.

When I was reporting Bug VB-184321 I noted that the behaviour was different when I choose the first definition offered (the hardscape didn't move). But I have been unable to reproduce that here with the hardscape definition moving regardless of the style shown. Not sure what the trigger is but I am sure that it shouldn't create a new folder and move the style.

At any rate it always moves when I chose a style other than the first one I am offered and sometimes moves when I take the first one offered. I think that once placed, it should never move unless I move it.

Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-176727

Concatenated string Exit Profile needs to be resolved into one

Using *Site Planning > Massing Model*, a massing model is created on a blank sheet. Then select the model, click on *Use custom roof from profile* in the OIP.

Next, select *Modify > Edit massing model*. An image similar to the screenshot (from the Spanish VW 2021) appears. A square labeled *Exit Profile* (Salir Perfil) appears on the upper right corner of the editable massing model.

*Note:* to replicate the bug, it's necessary to follow the above steps in both the English and the Spanish versions of VW 2021 and compare the Exit Profile/Salir Perfil label.

Several strings containing *Exit* exists without being concatenated: Exit symbol, Exit group, Exit viewport, Exit light, etc. A new string, *Exit profile*, needs to be created to substitute these concatenated strings, Exit + Profile, as this impacts adversely the localized version in Spanish (see screenshot for details). VB-177841

Worksheets wrap text differently between editing view and sheet view

Please see attached file for an example.

This is especially visible on longer entries. Wrap text with Autofit Row Height, appears to fill the entire cell when in editing view, but after exiting back to the Sheet view, there appears to be an extra line of space.

The workaround tends to be to select the cell, set the manual row height minus 11 points to have the entry have the same appearance as other cells without the extra space.

The problem happens if someone edits an entry assuming the wrap will accommodate the changes. Text can be lost if the manual height doesn't get modified properly.

While different fonts cause different amounts of difference, all the common ones seem to exhibit more or less the same thing. I gave you two examples and included the uncommon font for your testing. 

  		Karthick Chilaka

VB-184103

VB-181643

Spotlight Distribute Tool Does Not preserve fixture order

Fixture order is not preserved when utilizing the Spotlight Distribute plugin, as part of Align & Distribute Tool. (Not to be confused with Align/Distribute command under Modify menu)

It is important when working on a lighting plot for events, theatre, television etc.. that the order of the lighting instruments is preserved when making large updates to align fixtures to a position or distribute them evenly. At no point should the order of the fixtures be changed.

Currently, the Distribute tool will change the order of the lighting devices, but only when used in a specific way. I've attached a video detailing this. Note when the tool is used to distribute the devices from LEFT to RIGHT the order of the fixtures is the same. However when the tool is used to distribute from RIGHT to LEFT the order is flipped, and flipped and flipped again. 

This holds true when using the tool from TOP to BOTTOM.

 

Another user has previously reported this issue. [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/85536-a-question-for-spotlight-users-about-the-align-and-distribute-tool/]

 

 

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-182125

Spotlight, Convert to Hanging Position command in Truss OIP failures

The Convert to Hanging Position command in the OIP of a truss object does not behave as expected when compared to the same command in the Spotlight menu.

Scenario number one. Placing separate single lengths of truss to be combined into one hanging position.

Starting with a new blank document.

Failed:
# Place a single length of truss.
# Move away from the first length of truss and place a second length of truss.
# Select both pieces of truss.
** In the OIP, notice that you have two truss objects selected.
# In the OIP, click on the Convert to Hanging Position button at the bottom.
# Follow the steps to create the hanging position.
## Notice that only the most recently drawn length of truss has been converted into a hanging position.

Successful:
Repeat these steps and use the Convert to Hanging Position menu option located under Spotlight/Convert Objects.
Your results should show all items have been converted and included in our desired hanging position.

NOTE: The main process step that is missing between these two sets of steps is the window asking me whether I want to create a hanging position for each selected object, or to create a single hanging position from all selected objects. Therefore, the convert tool is only seeing the last drawn truss when used from the OIP. Even though the OIP says it has more than one object selected.

You can repeat the above steps with as many individual pieces of truss and the OIP version will still only convert the last truss symbol drawn.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Scenario number two. Placing connected lengths of truss into one hanging position.

Successful:
# Select the Truss tool.
# Select a stick of truss.
# Choose the Single Insertion option and insert three connected truss to form one run of truss.
# Select all three truss.
# Convert to Hanging Position via the OIP
# Create a single hanging position from all selected objects.
# Use Geometry.
** This works.

Failed:
# Select the truss tool
# choose the distributed insertion option
# insert two lengths of truss
# insert two more lines of truss.
** This presents us with an alignment issue that I have already submitted a bug for.
Select all these four lengths of truss.
** We have four truss objects selected in the OIP.
# Click on the convert to hanging position button in the OIP.
# Create a single hanging position from all selected objects.
# Click OK.
# Give it a name and OK
# Choose Use geometry.
** Notice only these last drawn lengths of truss were converted into a hanging position.
** As before, the OIP version of the tool is seeing only the last placed item it thinks is an object. Even though it showed multiple objects selected.

Successful:
Repeat the above-failed steps and this time use the spotlight object conversion menu option.
This one works

What the user should expect is if the OIP shows a number of objects are selected, all those objects should be included in the resulting hanging position.

 

Videos of all are attached.
Tested in both Mac and Windows.

 

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-180987

Schematic view fails

 to me anyway.

video shows the process. Screen shot shows what I *expect* to generate 		Kevin Linzey
VB-182709

Spotlight, Converting truss to hanging position moves all lights

In the attached file, selecting the three pieces of the truss on the right and converting them into a single hanging position moves all the lights that were attached away from the hanging position.

These lights should have stayed put and simply attached themselves to the newly created hanging position.

Tested in 2021 and the lights do not get moved. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-181686

Spotlight Schematic views not working as user would expect

In the attached file it is not easily possible to correctly create Schematic views for any of the hanging positions that are created from truss objects that have already been given a roll or hanging angle before being converted to a hanging position.

The only way to create to the correct schematic object is to break the hanging positions (by ungrouping twice), set the truss lines hanging angle to 0 (much harder than it sounds without breaking the truss line and/or disconnecting the attached lights), then running the create schematic views command and lastly having to correctly recreate the original hanging position (with the correct hanging angle and rotation)

This is a huge problem for schematic views, as it is a very common workflow to convert trusses into hanging positions after they are correctly orientated in 3D (given a hanging angle and roll), due to how difficult this is to do after they have been converted into a hanging position (unless great care is taken when creating them they become hybrid object and can't be easily rotated in 3D).

This is one of the most basic workflow scenarios that the schematic view should be capable of supporting.

to test in the attached file

select any of the hanging positions based on trusses that have hanging angles

run the create schematic view command from the spotlightmenu

the Schematic object created from the hanging position will be drawn without compensating for the trusses hanging angle inside the position, ie it will be the exact same geometry as the hanging position already displays not the desired top/plan view of the hanging position's trusses lying flat on the ground.

The test file is a large production with lots of angled hanging positions that are in theory exactly what schematic views are meant to help document. As it stands currently the user (not the designer) is going to loose a significant amount of pre-production hours reworking the file to be able to use schematic views. The amount of time required makes it very unlikely they will bother use schematic view and will just revert to the older rotated design layer view port option that schematic views was mean to replace!

I have tried testing this in both 2021 sp4 and 2022 beta 5, with the same results in both 		Kevin Linzey
VB-176306

Undo after duplicate/copy-paste array of lights break LW data exchange

1) Open attached file

2) Start data exchange with LW

3) Launch the LW and open the XML file

4) Go to VW again and the LWIDs will be imported

5) Select some of the lights and copy-paste them(or ctrl+drag or Edit->Duplicate Array...)

6) In the XML file will be export new lights without LWIDs, but when LW get focus will be assign LWIDs on them

7) Press undo in VW and you will see exporting lights without LWIDs to the XML file. This undo will undo the import from a while ago

8) Press undo again and the duplicated lights will be deleted, but the XML file will have all lights with Action Update(not some with Update and others with Delete Action).

9) Go back to LW and import will not delete lights from LW. This is because LW search lights with the help of LWIDs, but deleted lights has no LWIDs, because previos undo deleted them

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-181074

Duplicate array breaks schematic views

When a user utilises a move by points command and then renames their lighting positions they then get a separate schematic view for each position. This is a great workflow and viewed as correct

 

However, if the user uses 'Duplicate Array' this is not the case. Even after a rename command the schematic view remains linked to the original hanging position. This is incorrect.

 

please see attached file and video 		Kevin Linzey

VB-179516

Slab Drainage doesn't show correct angle value in this file

In the attached file, we have a line on the "TEST" Design Layer with an angle of 0.58°, but the angle for the drainage is currently 1.00%. It should be automatically selected on opening the file.

I'm note entirely sure if this is correct, or how it would calculate the drainage. Please let me know if this is actually off, rounded (Decimal Precision is 0.001 in the document), or if he and I simply don't understand how this value is calculated (which is likely).

Any input would be appreciated, and thank you for your time. Have an awesome day! 		Christopher Graye

VB-179920

Answer Tech support:

"Hi Jeroen,

This is definitely an odd one. I have not been able to determine exactly what is causing this. My guess is that it has something to do with the Materials. If I delete all but just one component in the style, I still have the issue. However, if I change that component to not use a Material and just have a Solid fill, I no longer experience the issue.

Can you please submit this as a bug on JIRA and send me the JIRA number so I can follow?

Thanks,

JOSEPH BLOCK
SENIOR TECHNICAL SUPPORT MANAGER
D: 443.542.0411" 		Christopher Graye
VB-184387

Refresh Issue with Wall Components when Editing Jamb Depth Values at certain Zooms

VB-178980

In [Horizontal Section Viewport], the display of [Line Type] of [Wall's Components] may be changed.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2021(Same as previous versions)
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
In [Horizontal Section Viewport], the display of [Line Type] of [Wall's Components] may be changed.

Please refer to "sample0517 eng.vwx","movie12584.mov".

In the Viewport above, Component-Linetype is displayed
in Solid Line-Dashed Line-Dashed Line-Solid Line.

However, in the [Horizontal Section Viewport] below, it is displayed in the order of Dashed Line-Solid Line-Dashed Line-Solid Line

 

*Remarks*
* When [Navigation Graphics] of [Vectorworks Preferences] is [Good Performance and Compatibility] / [Best Compatibility]
Depending on the [magnification ratio] on the screen, it may be displayed in the order of Solid Line-Solid Line-Dashed Line-Solid Line.

* If I delete Wall's Caps set at both ends of the wall of the sample file with [Split Tool] etc., they will be displayed in the original order.

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Christopher Graye

VB-178188

Floor with image fill: Visibility inconsistancies in OpenGL

If you create a floor:

- When the attributes palette of the original 2D object does not link to class and there's a solid fill: the resulting floor object will be shown filled in OpenGL, also after you changed the floor object's 2D fill to an image

- When you set the attributes palette "by class", and recalculate the previously made floor (for example by moving it) the fill in an open GL view will disappear 		Christopher Graye

VB-178449

Slab with Holes have Incorrect Top/Plan Graphics

The attached VWX file contains 8 identical slabs containing a slab modifier (symbol with a hole cutting object).  Each slab is drawn at various rotations.  Notice most of them have lines and gaps in their Top/Plan graphics.  These lines and gaps also seem to be related to the object location and will change as the object is moved.

This appears to be a regression that happened sometime after VW24.0.6(522773) and before VW25.0.0(505414).

I also still see the problem in VW27.0.0d(595669) although it seems to be less prevalent. 		Christopher Graye
VB-184142

Problems when you update Vectorworks while a license is borrowed

Network licenses: If you update or re-install Vectorworks while a license is borrowed, the borrowed license will be limited to "fundamentals" when you restart Vectorworks next time. There's also no way to return the license, even when there's a stable connection with the server.

 

The most recent Vectorworks version with which I encountered the issue is 2021. I don't know whether the issue is still present in version 2022.

I'm sure I've seen this issue on Mac. I think I remember seeing this issue on Windows, but i'm not sure.

I've never reproduced the issue, since it is not possible for us to reproduce G-series issues at the office. So the assumption about origin of the issue is based on what several users told me. 		Tim Ardoin

VB-184305

Roof Bearing Height / Inset, Fascia, and Soffit Issues

The user (*[willofmaine|https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/profile/7196-willofmaine/]*) is pointing out a few issues with the wall as illustrated in the attached "04-Roof Object Issues.vwx" file and screenshots.  Here are the issues mentioned.
# Bearing Height and Inset:  The roof geometry is not located to the correct position.
*Note 1:*  I believe this issues discussed while making Roof improvements for Vectorworks 2018.  However, I believe the main thing we did was to prevent the geometry from shifting after changing to different Eave Cut options of a Roof object.
*Note 2:* We have to be careful because we don't want to fix the problem and have Roof objects shifting unexpectedly in existing user files.  We would probably need to forward translate files to adjust the Bearing Height so that they remain in place.
# Creating a Roof using a Roof Style results in an odd Inset value and a Bearing Height value different than what was specified in the dialog on insertion.
# There are cases where the Soffit and Fascia seem to be in the wrong location.
*Note:*  The soffit case may be working as designed but needs investigation (and maybe a VE to improve it).  The fascia case does seem to be incorrect. 		Christopher Graye

But the wall feature causes the wall to ignore the loci so the wall fails to draw the area next to the loci. (see "wall feature.png"). 		Christopher Graye
VB-178551

Specific document: Polygon - Bucket tool doesn't function because of "volume"

one of our customers has a specific issue in one of his documents. He cannot use the "inner boundary mode" of the polygon tool. It just doesn't do anything when you try to use it.
In this document, there's a "volume" existing out of 2D planar objects. When you delete these objects, everything works fine again.
If you the objects from the 'volume" in the center of the new document the bucket works. If you paste further away from the origin, then the bucket no longer works.

 

Answer Tech Support:

"Jeroen,

I have been having various differences of behavior in this file. I copied the 3D model out of the file and pasted it into a new file and have attached a video of my experience with it.

If I pasted the objects in the center of the new document the bucket works. If I paste further away from the origin, then the bucket no longer works.

I would submit this file as a bug.

Regards,

Rob Nykolaishen
Technical Support Specialist" 		Christopher Graye

VB-176532

VB-180671

Roof interprets interior walls as exterior walls

When you create a roof based on walls (a closed perimeter of exterior walls) and you associate an interior wall afterwards, the roof object interprets this interior wall as an exterior wall. You can see this, because the roof components which have a stetting to react on wall components also react on interior wall. The roof should just trim the interior walls, not stop its components on this interior walls.
In version 2020 it works correctly, so this is a regression. 		Christopher Graye
VB-178401

Create Roof does not allow default values on first attempt

Steps:
# Clear the user folder for the application
# Create a new file using the Architect (Imperial).sta template
# Draw a simple building (just 4 walls)
# Select AEC > Create Roof...
# Without changing any values, press OK

Notice the user get's an error stating that the Vertical miter is set to the highest possible value. 		Christopher Graye
VB-184395

Roof of dormer windows does not display/adopt texture assigned to roof object

Please see/use attached file to appreciate the problem properly. Basically: 

When a window symbol is placed on a 'Roof' object, the resulting dormer window adopts _and_ displays (renders) the same texture seen/applied to the roof object. 

But when a window symbol is placed on a 'Roof *face*' object, it does not display the texture applied to the roof, despite connecting to the roof in the same way. i.e. The dormer window becomes part of the same object, and gets its own handle to reposition the dormer window on the roof surface etc. Open the attached file. You'll see the difference immediately when you open it. I exported this file back to Vectorworks 2021 and the condition persisted. I then created a completely new test file and objects in 2021 and got the same result, so perhaps this is a bug that's already been submitted.  		Christopher Graye

at this point you should see the contextual menu for the modifiers: Edit Slab Addition Settings or Edit Slab Subtraction Settings. But this doesn't happen. 		Christopher Graye

VB-176845

When some top light symbols are inserted into the roof or roof face, the openings can be misaligned.  

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2021(Same as previous versions)
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
When some top light symbols are inserted into the roof or roof face, the openings can be misaligned.  

When the following symbols are inserted into the roof or roof surface as a top light, the opening can be placed in an incorrect position. 

Vectorworks Libraries>Object Architecture>Skylight the Rooflight Company Conservation Range.vwx>Skylight Conservation Rooflight-CR-9

*Remarks*
When I checked the symbols in the “Skylight the Rooflight Company Conservation Range.vwx” file, only "Skylight Conservation Rooflight-CR-9" was invalid, but there may be other files that are in the same state.
This can be avoided by changing the insertion point of the symbol to be the center of the shape. But I think it needs to be fixed. 
Please refer to "sample12543.vwx”.

# In the isometric view presented, Modify/Edit Group on the roof
# Select the rectangle that is 9' x 14'5"
# From the OIP, reshape it by adding 12" to the 9' dimension
# The rectangle reshapes to be 10'3.611" x 15'8.611", which is clearly wrong

# Go to Top/Plan view
# Reshape the same rectangle from the OIP, again by adding 12" to the 9' dimension

VB-176983

Skylights behave weird on roof face edge

if you place a symbol in a roof face on the edge of the roof face, the behavior of the opening is weird
- If the roof face has a "normal" slope (f.e. 45 degrees), the opening cut is always vertical, no matter the settings you make
- If the roof face has a more "extreme" slope (f.e. 60 degrees), the opening cut isn't created 		Christopher Graye
VB-181321

The value of "Bound Offset" set in Component of the Roof Face is not reflected except for the part under the water (lowest side) of the Roof Face.

The value of "Bound Offset" set in Component of the Roof Face is not reflected except for the part under the water (lowest side) of the Roof Face.
--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
v2021, 2021
Win/Mac
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Steps:

Use the sample file.
[File name] 0726sample.vwx
* Sample files are created with v2020.

1) Open the sample file in v2020 and check that the component named "aa" on the Roof Face is offset by "200" from the roof edge.
(200 values more than the other components)

2) Open the sample file with v2021, select the Roof Face, select "Dissociate All Walls" from "Wall Clipping" of the Object Info Palette, and disconnect the Roof Face and the Walls.

3) In the Object Info Palette, select "Pick Walls to Associate ..." from "Wall Clipping" again.
Click the four walls on the drawing and click the checkmarks on the toolbar to connect the Roof Face and the Walls.

4) Make sure that the value of "Bound Offset" set in the Component of the Roof Face is not reflected except for the part under the water (lowest side) of the Roof Face.

Please refer to "0726sample.vwx","v2020_OK.mov","v2022_NG.mov".

*Remarks*
*Since the same phenomenon occurs in 2019, there is a possibility that the problem that was once improved in v2020 has recurred in v2021.

*At the moment, there is no workaround, and it is possible that the phenomenon occurred during throwback, so we believe that this is a phenomenon that needs to be corrected.


Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Christopher Graye

VB-178254

Splitting and Re-Composing NURBS Curves Results in Overlapping Vertices, Causes Editing Operations to Fail

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a single NURBS Curve.

To reproduce:

-Activate the Fillet tool and try to fillet the corners of the curve

Note that it works fine at this point.

-Now activate the Split tool in Point Split Mode
-Split the object at each corner
-Select the resulting curves and Compose them
-Now try to Fillet again

Note that now it fails.

It looks like this is happening because the split-then-compose process causes overlapping vertices to get created. If you delete those vertices the fillet then works fine.

The same thing happened in past versions. This also happens in 2022. 		Christopher Graye
VB-176236

Connect/Combine Roof Faces is causing the Roof Face to Disappear/Lose All Attributes

It is still technically in the file, you can select it in 2D or if you get right over its edge in 3D. It appears adjusting the texture causes it to reappear. 		Christopher Graye
VB-183225

SBE: VWPolygonOperation::ClipToPoly(p_ret,p_test,p_clip) returns garbage

In one of my plug-ins, I needed to clip the blue polygon (please see attached screenshot) at the left side at a certain x-value.

So I created a clip rectangle (VWPolygon2D) with the requested X coordinate as left edge and set all the other corners of the clip polygon very far away to make sure that the clip polygon does not intersect the blue polygon.

This clip polygon is green on the screenshot.

Unfortunately, the polygon returned by VWPolygonOperation::ClipToPoly(p_ret,p_test,p_clip) contained just one vertex
which is obviously wrong.

Please see attached code fragment to reproduce this bug.

It is even weirder: if I reduce the coordinates of the clip polygon from 1e10 to 1e7 or 1e8 (const k_very_large in code fragment), the correct result is returned.

This is very scary.

As VW is supposed to support mauch larger coordinates

(const extern WorldCoord kMaxLegalWorldCoord = 1.0E100;)

it must not happen that even comparably very small numbers produce garbage. It looks as if VW still uses integers...

I also wonder if similar bugs exist for other geometry functions in the SDK... This does not motivate programmers to use them.

// Code snippet:

void test_clip_poly()
{
cwdebug_scope tcp("test_clip_poly",20);

const double k_very_large = 1e10;

VWPolygon2D p_clip;

double x1 = -0.348;

p_clip.AddVertex(x1,-k_very_large);
p_clip.AddVertex(x1,k_very_large);
p_clip.AddVertex(k_very_large,k_very_large);
p_clip.AddVertex(k_very_large,-k_very_large);

p_clip.SetClosed(true);

VWPolygon2D p_test;

double ymin = 2.431;
double ymax = 2.461;

x1 = 0.476;
double x2 = 0.441;

p_test.AddVertex(-x1,ymin);
p_test.AddVertex(-x2,ymax);
p_test.AddVertex(x2,ymax);
p_test.AddVertex(x1,ymin);
p_test.AddVertex(-x1,ymin);

TSTLPolygons2DArray p_ret;

bool b_poly_op = VWPolygonOperation::ClipToPoly(p_ret,p_test,p_clip);

VWPolygon2DObj clip_obj(p_clip);
VWPolygon2DObj test_obj(p_test);


cwdebug("b_poly_op = %d, p_ret.size() = %d\n",b_poly_op, (int)p_ret.size());
if (p_ret.size () > 0) {
cwdebug("#vertices of result = %d\n",p_ret[0].GetVertexCount());

VWPolygon2DObj res_obj(p_ret[0]);

}



}
Christopher Graye

VB-176519

Incorrect Tab Behavior in Door and Window Settings Dialogs

There are several fields in the Door and Window Settings dialogs that do not behave as expected.  When tabbing into fields, it is expected that the field value highlights allowing the user to type an new value to replace the old one.  However, when tabbing into some fields, the value is not highlighted and the cursor is placed before the value.  This causes entered data to be prepended to the existing value creating errors.

This appears to be a Windows OS problem only.

While there may be others, here's a list of all the problem fields I found:

*Window PIO:*

General Pane:
* Width
* Height

Jamb and Sash Pane:
* Shim Gap
* Masonry Module

Louvers Pane:
* Blade Angle

Transom Pane:
* Sash Offset
* Mullion Depth

Lintel Pane:
* Drop

*Door PIO:*

General Pane:
* Offset in Wall

Configuration: Barn Door Pane:
* Rail Depth

Jamb Pane:
* Depth
* Jamb Extension Width
* Masonry Module

Lights Pane:
* Bar Offset

Transom Pane:
* Mullion Depth
* Bar Offset

Interior Wall Detail Pane:
* Number of Components

Exterior Wall Detail Pane:
* Number of Components 		Christopher Graye

VB-179542

Please open attached file for an example

Objects came from a file where I for some reason had the Window-Main with no fill. (I don't recall exactly while)

I inserted some windows 'Triple Slider' from the library with Standard Naming on

I noticed that they were not filled, so assumed the class Attribute setting needed to be refreshed, so selected the 'All Attributes by Class' from the attributes palette

I then edited the Class, noticed I had it set to no fill, so corrected that and accepted the changes. I then noticed that only the jamb and one of the three sashes filled.

If I toggled an option for the window in the Info Palette (say "create Niche...') to force a reset caused the rest of the sashes to fill in.

In another file, I created an unsettled window from this style, added Lintel, Transom, Muntins, Trim, & Sill. The jamb and the sash filled(including its munitions) along with the sill. The other two sashes (including their units), transom, trim, & lintel did not fill until a forced reset.

The same fill objects respond in reverse if you set the class fill to none 		Christopher Graye

VB-181222

Previous version Window configurations change, when opened, in Vectorworks 2022

The testing approach here is, a red reference object that matches the original geometry lives in the background. When a plug-in is reset, if any of the red reference object appears, something has changed with the original object/plug-in.

-Open test file in Vectorworks 2021
-Go to Tools > Utilities > Reset All Plug-Ins and answer, "Yes"
-You'll notice the Windows remain unchanged from the red reference object in the background
-Open test file in Vectorworks 2022
-Even before the Windows are reset, you can see red lines appearing where the geometry has changed from Vectorworks 2021 for some reason

See attached image and movie

These Window objects go back many versions. This is a smaller subset of the original test file where all other Window examples passed. 		Christopher Graye

VB-184289

To reproduce:

Open the attached test file
There are two window styles:
1) Window Style
- Width parameter is by instance
- Height is by style =1111
2) Window Style-2
- Width parameter is by style = 2222
- Height is by instance
Insert two window objects
Select the objects
Click on the Settings button in the OIP
Choose Window Style from the Style Name drop down
The Height parameter is set by style and its value is 1111
Choose Window Style-2 from the Style Name drop down
The Width parameter is set by style and its value is 2222
The Height is set to by instance and its value isn’t changed
Click OK to close the dialog
Select each of the window objects
Notice that one of the object has parameters set to
Width =2222
Height = 1111
another has
Width =2222
Height = 1810

VB-184310

bad 2D representation of the bracing diagonals represented with "structural members"

I have to draw bracing diagonals.

I used "structural members" objects.

But the 2D representation is bad : 

instead of using the same system of 2D representation as hybrid object which is :
* Above the cut plane : the +part+ of the structural member above the cut plane attributes
* at the cut plane : the +part+ of the structural member at the cut plane attributes
* below the cut plane : the +part+ of the structural member below the cut plane attributes

Vectorworks uses those attributes +to the whole object+ if it is above/at/below which is wrong. 		Christopher Graye

-Now set the SM's pen color to "Color by Class"

VB-184391

Walls Within PIO Behave Differently in Vw 2022 Depending on Position of SetWallCornerHeights() : JBC

Attached is a Vw 2021 file displaying some WinDoor objects in a wall. WinDoor has the ability to indicate when new windows or doors are added to existing walls or when existing openings are removed. It does this by adding zero height walls within the object (patches), that appear on either side of the opening or instead of the opening. In the WinDoor Settings dialogue > Wall Existing tab, you can nominate the length of these patches and also which wall style should be used. 

To ensure that the nominated wall style for the patches has zero height, I use SetWallCornerHeights() to set the nominated wall style height to zero. Here is a typical code snippet:

    MoveTo(x2, 0); MoveTo(x2, 0);
    WallTo(x2 + p__NewOpenRightPatch, 0);
    Flag := SetWallCaps(LNewObj, True, False, False);
    Flag := SetWallStyle(LNewObj, p__NewOpeningWS, 0, 0);
    Flag := *SetWallCornerHeights*(LNewObj, 0, 0, 0, 0);

When you open the file in Vw 2022 and compare it to how it looks in Vw 2021, you will see that not only are the walls not zero height, but the wall style nomination is ignored and the document default wall settings are used - but only on one side of the window. The other side is correct. If I alter the order of the code slightly as follows, then it all works correctly: 

    MoveTo(x2, 0); MoveTo(x2, 0);
    WallTo(x2 + p__NewOpenRightPatch, 0);
    Flag := *SetWallCornerHeights*(LNewObj, 0, 0, 0, 0);
    Flag := SetWallCaps(LNewObj, True, False, False);
    Flag := SetWallStyle(LNewObj, p__NewOpeningWS, 0, 0);

Thanks. 		Christopher Graye
VB-182319

Space : Create Spaces from Walls fails when having a selected polygon (random)

This is a random issue seen in VW 2020, 2021 and 2022.
* Create some rooms with the wall tool.
* Create 1 2D polygon
* select only the polygon
* in AEC->Space panning run the "Create Spaces from Walls" command.

Sometimes it only creates a small space at the origin of the document.  		Christopher Graye

VB-178638

Thanks, Luka 		Christopher Graye
VB-184376

Cannot localize labels in OIP Data pane

* Draw a structural member
* Go to Data tab of the OIP
* Set Data Sheet to Simplified Structural Member
* The labels on the left side are in English in any localized build:
** "Material"
** "Profile Shape"
** "Profile Series"
** "Profile Size"

I found "Profile Shape" in DataSerializer.cpp. After changing it to "Profile Shape2", this is shown in the OIP (see screenshot attached), so it seems the strings are hardcoded. 		Christopher Graye
VB-180379

Truss Properties, changing the Geometry Type to Hinge causes the current truss to disappear.

-This is showing the same issue in 2021, but in version 2021, each Geometry type was separted by tabs, so user will most likely not
picked the wrong geometry by mistake.
-In version 2022 and 2021, if the user decides to change the Geometry from Straight Truss to Hinge Truss, the straight Truss will
disappear. If the user change the Straigt Truss to something other than Hinge, nothing will change. Not sure if this a WAD or not.
-But in version 2022, the tabs for each Geometry are gone, it is replace by a pull down list. So for consistency sake, the straigh truss
should not disappear in for situation like this. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182823

Spotlight Cable Tools Voltage Drop calculations are incorrect

While I don't know the actual result, the average voltage drop for a 12ga wire is approx 4% +/- per 100 feet. The cable is showing only a 0.02% drop.

This happens in all my test files.

Open a new blank document.

Insert a 100' cable.

Check the cable configuration for the drop number.

If this number has to be updated AFTER and sort of power calculations, we should replace the 0.02% with something like "TBD after calculations" 		Kevin Linzey

VB-184259

VB-183181

Truss Circle Auto Connect DIfference

In VW 2021 when connecting circle trusses together the Auto Connect line is in the middle of the truss and corresponds to the direction of the circle that is hovered over.  When hovering to the inside the Auto Connect line arcs to the inside and vice versa with the outside.

In VW2022 the Auto Connect line is now on the edge of the piece of truss and opposite of the side that is being hovered over.  This could be confusing to the user as it is a visual change and a workflow change from previous versions.

Video attached. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-182597

Spotlight Speaker array bumper angle hoist attachemnt bug

If a speaker array is inserted with a bumper angle hoists do not correctly attach to the bumper.

the auto-connect insertion line doesn't react to the bumper angle meaning the hoists   attach to the bumper as if it doesn't have a hanging angle.

to reproduce

insert a speaker array with a bumper angle and the array support set to Flown-motors

set the hanging support drop down in the array properties to two hoists or multiple hoists#

attach 2 or 3 hoists to the bumper

change to a side view of the bumper and look at how the hoists have attached, the front hoist will be at the correct offset from the bumper but the rear hoist will either be inside the bumper geometry (if a negative bumper angle is used) or too far above the bumper geometry (if a positive bumper angle is used)

 

 

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-180730

false calculations in Braceworks when the rigging height of the hoist is greater than the chain length

Vectorwoks accepts to hang a hoist at 25m height even when the chain is only 18m lenght but do not consider the extra weight of the chain. It only takes in account 18m of chain lenght.

 

there should be an error when exceeding the maximum length or the extra length should be calculated. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-182261

Truss with hanging angle loses bounding box if inserted with "Modify truss object color" setting checked

Hi,

I found an issue with the bounding box of truss objects with a hanging that are inserted if the "Modify truss object color" setting is checked in the spotlight preferences.

Such a truss object can be selected and shows its info in the OIP, but it will not show a bounding box when selected if it has a hanging angle other than 0.

There seems to be no way to revert the truss object to a state where it shows a bounding box again. Even if other trusses are inserted with the setting unchecked. These new trusses will work als normal, but the ones in question will not show a bounding box.

I noticed the behaviour in a new 2021 file. The behaviour is the same in 2022. Opening the file in 2022 the problem remains.

VB-176786

Spotlight import GDTF waring dialogue error

When using the Import GDTF command to import multiple files at once the Replace Existing GDTF dialogue is triggering far to often,

I imported the complete GDTF library(429 files) in one go, into the default libraray  GDTF resource file. At the time of import the file contained 12 or so GDTF files, which in theory means the warning dialogue should only display/trigger maximum 12.

Instead It triggered several hundred times!

to recreate

go to the GDTF share website and download the complete library and unzip it into a folder

In Spotlight open the GDTF resource library file

activate the import GDTF command

select all the files

and import

The dialogue will then continuously trigger, pausing the import each time until you select an option

This makes importing large numbers of GDTFs a painfully slow process,

VB-182787

Spotlight Distributor "Draw output lengths" doesn't do what it should.

Similar to VB-182225, the Draw Output Lengths button in the OIP of a Distributor Breakout doesn't function. It should show circles at the specified lengths of the labeled distributors. IE, "Distro Edison Breakout 6ft" should draw a six-foot circle indicating the length of the breakout tails.

VB-183151

Spotlight Truss Inventory Export and Import doesn't work as expected

Importing Truss Inventory files need to recognize a "comma" as the delimiter inside the imported csv file.

In the "Truss inventory" dialog box (found via the "Replace Truss" dialog box), when you use the export button to send the inventory out, the resulting csv file uses semicolons as the delimiter.

Both Excel and MacOS' Numbers import the file fine.

After making edits, when one tries to either "Save As" or "Export" to a csv file, 

Neither MS Excel nor Numbers offer an option to export using the same semicolon and the VW Truss import refuses to recognize the comma as a delimiter. Thus, the "Import" button does not complete its task.

From our help file: https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2022/eng/VW2022_Guide/Braceworks/Managing_truss_inventory.htm?rhhlterm=inventory&rhsearch=inventory

_If desired, inventory changes can be made in an external inventory program or spreadsheet program. Click Export to create a .csv file, make the changes, and then click Import to import the edited .csv file back into Vectorworks._

_When editing the spreadsheet, do not change the name of the symbol. The name must remain intact to re-import the data._

There is a workaround.
Exporting the Excel file with commas.
Opening the file in a text editor and doing a find & replace to change the commas to semicolons, and saving.
VW does work when the semicolons are there.

Either we need to change how VW recognizes the semicolon. Or, we need to add the workaround to the help file.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-182804

Spotlight Bridle configuration STAC chain bug

Whenever a bridle is inserted the bridle tool is automatically adding STAC or choke-chains to all of the bridle legs. Only a single leg should have a STAC or Choke chain added (riggers in the real world tend to only use a STAC or Choke chain on a single leg of a bridle) Kevin Linzey
VB-184308

Cable tool: Automatic Numbering Preferences dialog: The Increment by field is active when the Automatically increment the numbering radio button is not active

Activate the Cable tool
Click on Automatic Numbering Preferences button
Activate an Apply the same numbering to all radio button
Click OK to close the dialog
Open the Automatic Numbering Preferences dialog again
Notice that the Increment by field is active
If you turn on any of the check boxes in the Numbering Options the field will become disabled
Kevin Linzey
VB-177152

Spotlight Cable tools insert distributor before lighting device ID problem

When using the daisy chain mode of the cable tool the 'Insert distributor before each lighting device' option from the select output dialogue doesn't give the inserted splitter type (2fer, 3fer, etc...) distributors an ID. Normal industry practice is that splitters get the same ID as the cable run they are part of.

for example if the cable tool auto numbering is set to to label the cables in the chain A1 then all distributors inserted using this option should also be given the ID of A1

 

To reproduce

insert a breakout and give it an ID

insert 2 or more lighting devices

activate the cable tool

select daisy chain insertion mode and a jumper style cable (same style as the outputs on the breakout)

activate auto numbering and configure it to label all the cables with the same Id value, enter

a value in the start box

start the cable insertion by clicking on the breakout

check the insert distributor object before lighting devices box and select the appropriate distributor symbol  for the type of jumper cable being inserted (a twofer or threefer)

insert the cable chain as normal.

select one of the inserted distributors and the look in the object properties, the ID field is empty


I have attached a short video of this



 

 

 

 

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-183163

Spotlight double clicking on a cable style in the resource manger bug

If you double click on a cable style, in the resource manager,  to activate it to start drawing, it doesn't activate the cable tool instead it activates the NURBS curve tool.

You can start drawing and sometimes it will successfully create a cable object (using the socapex 19 cable style the attached file) but in most cases the drawn cable object will immediately disappear.

I'm not sure if it is intended to be able to double click on the style to activate the cable tool and start drawing with that cable style (like you can with many other Spotlight plug in objects) but doing so definitely shouldn't activate the NURBS tool

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-182723

Spotlight Cable tools no longer push data into the lighting device circuit name field

When using the Distributor or schematic mode of the cable tool to cable lighting devices to a Breakout the lighting device circuit name field is no longer filled out when the lights are cabled.

to reproduce

insert a breakout give it an ID

insert several lights give each a unique channel number

activate the cable tool, select either distributor or schematic insertion mode

configure the auto numbering to use the following settings

'Adds source distributor name before prefix'

'Adds breakout output ID after suffix'

'apply the same numbering to all'

insert the cables as normal

the cable will have the correct cable run ID's

but only the circuit number field of the lighting device will have data pushed to it

the circuit name field will be empty 		Kevin Linzey
VB-177475

ADB F101 GDTF not sending colors when exported to mvr Format

The ADB F101 gdtf when exporting to MVR from VW does not take the color in account.

VB-177153

Spotlight cable tool daisy chain mode insert distributor before lighitng device cable bug

When using the cable tool daisy chain mode to gang multiple lighting together, extra cable objects and splitters are created when the insert distributor before lighting device option is used (from the select output dialogue)

Normally when cabling lights in this fashion in the real world the twofer or threefer distributor object is placed directly above the first light in the chain and the light is plugged directly into it without and extra cable. The chain is then continued to the next light with a cable and a second splitter would only be used if there was a third light in the chain

In contrast we are adding a splitter at the first light, inserting 2 cable to the light (at most one should be inserted) and a third cable runs to the next light in the chain.
At the next light another splitter is always inserted not matter whether there are more lights in the chain or not. If the it is not the last light in the chain then again 2 cable are inserted to connect the splitter to the light and a third to the next light in the chain.

 

This results in a large number of extra cables and splitter that will need to be manually deleted from the file by the user

I have attached a video showing the problem 		Kevin Linzey
VB-178626

Truss Circles Have Different Auto Connect Line

In Vectorworks 2021 when connecting curved truss the auto connect line generates from the center of the truss.  In Vectorworks 2022 when inserting curved truss the auto connect line is generating from the edge of the truss.  This may cause confusion to users who are used to the auto connect generating from the center.

Video attached. 		Kevin Linzey

Seems to be a bug for me.

VB-179041

Spotlight cable tool automatic connection mode pathing problem

When using the new automatic insertion mode of the cable tool to connect 2 devices, the inserted cables do not correctly follow the truss system.

To reproduce

insert a distribution object on the ground, a truss system with U shape configuration (see attached image) a cable path leading to one end of the truss and a breakout distribution object at one end of the truss system.

activate the cable tool

choose the Han16 cable style, single connection mode and turn on the new auto insertion mode toggle

click on the distributor on the ground and then on the breakout.

the newly created cable will enter the cable path, follow it to the truss, follow part of the truss system and then jump of the truss system to go directly to the breakout (see the attached image). The desired behavior is that the cable follows the truss system to the breakout without jumping off.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-183104

Spotlight cable tool doesn't recognise multiple power inputs on devices

When using the cable tool to cable a consumer device with multiple inputs the tool will only allow you to connect to the first input. It doesn't matter which mode of the cable tool is used the tool will always link to the first input and ignore all other inputs on the consumer device.

Effectively this means that any consumer device that requires 2 different types of input is not supported, for example a vl-1100 which requires two power inputs one of which is from an external dimmer.

To reproduce

import a lighting device into an empty file

edit its 2D or 3D component to add any combination of consumer and/or input electrical components with unique names

insert the lighting device

activate the cable tool using any mode

draw 2 cables connecting to the lighting device (ending at the lighting device)

look in the lighting devices power infomation input connection drop-downs, only the first input will document a connection, the second input will always display as empty!

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-176981

Spotlight Cable tools suite distributor object labels not updating correctly when duplicated

If a distributor object, that was inserted with auto numbering on, is duplicated the distributor objects label doesn't correctly update to display the duplicates new ID

The ID field in the properties will correctly display the auto incremented ID but the label will display the ID of the original Distributor 		Kevin Linzey
VB-178152

Spotlight: Export to MVR fails = Your system has run out of application memory

Hello,
If the enclosed file is exported to MVR using the default setting (All objects in the Drawing) then the computer will either shut down or you get a message saying "Your system has run out of application memory".
It get's this message at 134GB of memory used by Vectorworks on a 32GB RAM iMac.

If the option to export 'Visible Objects' is used then it does export. The file itself doesn't seem that big with 168,597 objects hence why I am reporting this.

Perhaps 'Visible Objects' should be the recommended/default option? Maybe a warning dialogue could come up when choosing the option 'All objects in the Drawing'? (Are you really sure you want to do this?!).

Cheers,
Peter 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182124

Spotlight Braceworks extending truss misalignment issues

[~klinzey] [~mstaffel]
I've attached two short videos showing the issues I'm seeing and I've done these tests on both Windows and Mac.

For this test, I have been working with Tomcat and Christie Truss.
# Open a new blank document.
# Open the resource manager and navigate to Tomcat TC-1212 truss.
# Choose a 10-foot stick of truss by double-clicking to activate the truss insertion tool.
# Change the tool to insert a continuous line of truss.
# Place approximately 40 feet of truss.
** Once placed and without deselecting,
# click on the end of the 40 foot run of truss to extend it.
** You should see the Braceworks red line indicating it will snap and attach to the end of the truss run.
# Draw your line out to place another 20 feet of truss.
** You should now have a 60 foot run of truss. Take a close look at the connection point between the 40 foot and added 20 feet. Are they aligned properly?

If it did align properly, please repeat this a few more times. I've had mixed results with more failures than successes.

Repeat in ISO view.

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-182784

Spotlight Auto Number doesn't revert when Undo

If I insert a distributor and have auto numbering set to increment and then Undo, the distributor is removed but the numbering does not revert to the prior incremental number.

In other words, I place a distributor and it gets labeled as A. Then I Undo to remove it. The Auto Number will place a B the next time I insert.

The Undo should both remove the item and should revert the auto number to the prior digit. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182486

Spotlight Cable Tool allowing too many lights to be circuited

In the attached file, using the cabling tool upon the truss that contains seven lights, I am currently allowed to circuit more lights than there are circuits. 

In 2021, I would receive an error notification that any cables beyond the number of circuits that the distributor object had could not be drawn.

The cable tool should simply stop connecting to additional lights once we run out of circuits. Unless we are intentionally two-ferring them. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-183047

Spotlight Cable Tools inserting incorrect cables based on distro circuits

In the attached file I have chosen to insert a Multicable via the Cable Selector. Though I have set this to insert the Multicable, the cable tool is inserting the appropriate cable based upon the Next open circuit in the Distro, regardless of the cable chosen.

In the case of the cable being placed in this example, the originating distro is dictating the cable being placed. The Distro (Breakout) is not being taken into account. 
 
On the one hand, it makes sense that the connector dictates the type of cable being inserted. On the other hand, considering that the originating distributor has three types of cable connectors (cam lock, Edison, & multicable) then the cable tool should defer to the second distributor object which has a single input of a multicable, along with its six Edison outputs.
 
In my example, since I had purposely selected a multicable, I would have thought that the cable tool would seek out and choose the next available multicable output. What is happening now is that the tool was simply choosing the next available circuit regardless of the connector. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-183760

Spotlight Cable Tools repatching a distributor to a new circuit adds addition cable

Patching a distributor to another automatically adds a cable. Yes, I want this.

Choosing to repatch the item to another circuit draws an additional cable. This is not something we want.

We would want the repatch process to check if a cable exists and simply use this same cable. Or, we want the cable to delete itself in favor of the new cable being inserted. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-180967

T02185: Undo doesn’t undo all changes

1. Open the attached file.
2. Select distributor 1.
3. Click on 32a-1(3ph) popup and select Distributor 2.Input.
-A cable is created automatically between both objects.
4. Press CTRL+Z to undo.
5. The cable disappears but in 32a-1(3ph) popup the Distributor 2.Input is selected. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-181719

Truss symbols don't show every composants, when 3D symbols contains groups

Hello,

I've found and resolve an issue with all my circle truss librairies. Maybe this is already documented somewhere, I've got this trouble for a long time before v2022.

When truss symbols contains groups in their 3D, and when you roll them, some of groups disapear on screen.

See my screenshots and file. On the Ø6m circle truss, there is no group inside 3D symbols, and in the Ø8m there are few groups in it.

Similar issue with Truss pickup, I create another tickets for that. 		Kevin Linzey

to reproduce

select the FD-34 6way corner block and try to attach it to the 2.5m section at both ends
