VB-182219

Spotlight Distributor Labels using Auto Numbering Fails with Move by Points tool

When adding a distributor device and then duplicating it using the move by points tool, the automatic numbering works in the OIP, but fails to update the labels.
# Open a new document.
# Select the Distributor Insertion tool.
# Activate Auto Numbering.
# Set the number to 1 and check the use column.
# Select a distributor for insertion.
# Place one distributor
# Activate the Move by Points tool.
# Set it to keep the first copy.
# Set it to make 5 duplicates.
# Click on the distributor and stretch out to the right and place the duplicates.
** Notice they all still have the number 1
# Deselect all.
# Select just the last distributor.
** Notice in the OIP that the ID number reads 6.
# Edit the ID field and the label will update.

I surmise the label is not polling for the updated ID number after the Move by Points tool has placed the duplicates.

Tested in 2021 with the same result.

Video of my work attached. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182089

VB-182796

Spotlight Cable Tools Distributor object and cables do not agree on their positions

In the attached file I have a Distributor assigned to B Truss but part of it hovers over truss section "Cable Bridge 4"

The position field for the Distributor has "B Truss" entered into the position field.

The jumper cables have inserted "Cable Bridge 4" into their position fields.

Thus, the two think they are in different positions.

Only the Distributor has claimed a location. The cable's location field has not been indicated by the cabling operation and is blank.

Both objects have the term "position" and the term "location." Yet, they are not matching these two terms as far as their physical locations in the rigging/lighting system.

Since "Position" is used across the lighting tools and often designates a hanging position, I believe we should have objects use "Position" across the board. The "Location" seems to denote an object's location with a rigging system. A Hanging Position can be part of a rigging system and is at a location. Objects hanging on the hanging position are also at locations within the overall rigging system. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-183013

Spotlight Braceworks: Truss system with loads once roll in OIP is 180º detaches load, flips 180º and moves up in the air.

Hello,
In the enclosed file you can see that there are two simple truss systems with and LED as a load. In the OIP if the roll is made to 180º then the LED screen flips around and goes up in the z.
Spinning truss can be common when designing rigs and this means that the entire system has to then be rebuilt.

Movie enclosed too.

Cheers,
Peter 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182902

Using the Create Similar Object command on a Truss object activates the Truss tool but doesn't switch it to be the same truss type. It instead still uses whatever truss symbol was inserted the last time the Truss tool was used.

This is inconsistent with how Create Similar Object works in other contexts; typically you're able to immediately draw more of the SAME object. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-183269

Spotlight Cable area objects not applying settings to only the selected layer

The only apply to objects on this layer toggle in the cable area objects is not restricting the cable setting of the cable are object to the area objects layer, instead the settings are affecting every cable object no matter which layer the cable object is drawn on.

To reproduce

in an empty file

open the cable preferences dialogue and set the cable set to metric

create a second design layer

on design layer 1

draw a cable area object, activate the only apply to objects on this layer toggle and in its settings to use the imperial cable set

select the second design layer

activate the cable tool and select a schuko cable style,

use single connection mode to draw the cable inside the boundaries of the cable are object,

select the drawn cable and open the cable configuration dialogue, it will not contain any cable parts (because the imperial cable set has none)

VB-184088

Spotlight Power planning web palette doesn't delete connections between devices

If a cable is deleted in the design layer the Power Planning palette doesn't register that the cable has been deleted. The power information connection drop-downs do correctly display that the output or input is no longer connected.
To reproduce

insert a power supply object, a distributor and a couple of lights

cable them together (with the cable tool or by using the drop-downs, makes no difference)

open the power planning web palette and look at the component and device graph views, both will show everything connected

go back to the design layer and delete a couple of the cables

check the power information drop-downs in the OIP they will correctly display that there is no longer anything connected to the inputs/outputs

go back into the web palette and the connections will still be there. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182802

Spotlight powerplanning Adding electrical components to a lighting device turns it into a distributor

If you add multiple electrical components to a lighting device symbol definition it will no longer be classed as a lighting device if you then double click on it to insert direct from the Resource manager

to reproduce

import a lighting device into an empty file

edit its 3D component in the resource manager

add an input, an output and a consumer electrical components

set the input and output components to use the 5 pin xlr connector and patch the pins together 1 to 1

set the consumer to use powercon or schuko for its connector

exit the symbol definition double click on the light to activate the lighting device and try to insert it into a design layer.

instead of it being inserted as a lighting device it will insert as a distributor object.

to successfully insert it as a light you need to manually activate the insert lighting device tool and select it in the tools resource selector.

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-182459

Spotlight Power Web Interface retaining phantom connections after deleting cables

In the attached file I have deleted all the cables in the drawing. I have also purged all unseen items.

I have one hanging position with six lights. The history of this document includes my connecting the two Altman units to the small dimmer pack. I had feeder cable running from the supply to the dimmer pack. I then wanted to start again with the cabling so I deleted all the cables. The web interface retained its visual representation of all the connections until after I restarted Vectorworks.

In the attached video I show that I insert a new power supply and I then add a feeder cable from the supply to the small dimmer pack. The web interface then shows one of the lighting units is connected to one of the Edison connections and its corresponding dimmer. Note, however, there are no Edison jumpers in the drawing. I had deleted them all.

To confirm that there are no other cables, run the cable worksheet report command. It should only list the feeder cable.

Obviously, deleting cable should break their connections and allow users a fresh start. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-180131

Spotlight Power planning Power Patch table needs to be reformated

The power planning patch view needs to be  changed as in its current form it is very confusing and difficult to use

Issues/problems
# Entry's should be based on/grouped by object and not display as unrelated individual rows, for example all of the inputs and outputs related to a Distributor object should be grouped together as part of the distributor
# there is no electrical load data displayed for distributors objects, this data is vital for patching as the user needs to be able to balance the electrical load across the phases to avoid damaging them with an unbalanced load (as little as a 4A difference between the phases can be enough to damage a distributors plug or sockets)

##  columns for L1, L2 and L3 power phases for each distributor object
## the total electrical load for distributor objects also needs to be displayed
# The user needs to be able to filter the power patch table depending on what type of patching he wants to do, below are a couple of examples
## distributor output patching,
### should display what is plugged into each circuit (fuse) of the distributor
### should be able to group output circuits by the output connector
### each circuit should display its load based on the phase column it acts on (L1, L2, L3)
### each distributor should display a total electrical load for each phase and the overall total load
### needs to display what is on each circuit
#### cable run ID
#### consumer ID's
#### type of consumers
## consumer object type patching (lighting device, hoist projector etc...)
### needs to display each consumer of the selected type (lighting device, hoist etc...)
### the Id of the consumer
### what it is (mac viper wash etc...)
### connection data 
#### cable run ID
#### Distributor circuit/output
#### Breakout circuit/output
## breakout/plug box patching
### breakout/Plug-box ID
### Input connection
#### cable run ID
#### Distributor output
### output connections
#### ID of the related consumer object or objects
#### cable run ID
# The user needs an option to control which columns are visible 		Kevin Linzey
VB-183044

Spotlight Cable Tools Labels not updating for duplicate items

In the attached file, I used the Duplicate by Points tools to make duplicates of the Spotlight distributor. The copies did change the ID number but the shown label text did not update. Kevin Linzey

Martin 		Kevin Linzey
VB-182797

Spotlight Cable Tools placed too many two-fers

I used the daisy chain tool to two-fer four lights into two circuits. Four two-fers were inserted plus the four cables.

Two-ferring should look something like this:
# Click on the Distributor
# Then click on your first light.
## a cable should be added between the Distributor and the first light
# Then click on your second light.
## a Two-fer should be added plus a jumper to reach the light.
## Note that a Two-fer often comes with tails in the US, so the jumper might not be needed.
## Note that several lighting units have internal two-fers via an input and output circuit. These would need a jumper but no two-fer.
# Clicking on a third light would start the process again. 
## A new cable to be inserted from the next circuit from the Distributor needs to be run to this third light.
## A two-fer gets inserted at the third light.
# Clicking on the next light attaches a new jumper to the two-fer.

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-176385

Spotlight cable tool daisy chain mode bug

The cable tool daisy chain mode is not  working correctly.

When used each cable in the chain should have the same cable run ID and update the lighting device with the same data, i.e  the circuit name and circuit number fields should be filled.

currently the only the first cable and lighting device in a daisy chain is labeled or receives data, all subsequent cables and devices in the chain have noe cable run ID (cable objects) or circuit data (lighting devices)

 

To reproduce

insert a breakout or plug box distributor and give it an ID

insert several lighting devices

activate the cable tool,

select the appropriate jumper cable to go with the chosen breakout

chose daisy chain mode

turn on auto numbering and configure it to use

prepend source distributor name to prefix

append breakout output  to suffix

and

apply same numbering to all

insert the cable chain from the breakout to lighting devices normally.

only the first cable will have a cable run ID and only the first fixture will have the circuit fields filled in. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-182664

Spotlight Braceworks: Replace Truss in OIP flips truss 180º plus odd things in dialogue

Hello,
This is noticed because we are using tri truss. Attached are two identical files saved in 2021 and 2022. They contain a truss section 3m long that is point down on the page and another imported 1m point down section not on the page.

Once selected go to the Replace Truss button in the OIP. Change the 3m =0 and 1m =3 to replace the 3m single section with 3 x 1m sections. Once replaced note that the truss is no longer hybrid and is now point up.

Also note in the Relace truss dialogue in 2022 it seems to list all the items in the library including however these have not been imported in the file, and note that they seem doubled up and have an 'H' after each one which implies height not length which is what the numbers mean. This is very different to 2021 and odd.

Cheers,
Peter 		Kevin Linzey
VB-182216

Spotlight truss system selection inside schematic view odd behavior

In the attached document:
# Select a stick of truss from the schematic view on the right.
# In the OIP click on select system objects.

Notice the odd behavior in that all the system objects except for the one still highlighted in this schematic view show they are selected.

Expected result was to see all truss in the schematic view to be shown selected. Resulting in the ability to work with the truss in that view.

Second choice would be to have all truss in both views show selected. 

Third choice would be to show only the actual truss on the left show selected. This could require a complete change of view for the user if the original truss is located elsewhere.

Tested in both Mac and Windows.

Checked in 2021. The Schematic View does not offer the choice to select system objects. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-183642

Spotlight Truss doesn't snap to one end after rearranging segments.

Placing a run a truss and then rearranging the truss into different configurations can result in the truss no longer connecting.
# Place a line of six truss. I used 
# Select the middle two and drag away from the line.
# Select the two truss on the left and drag to the right and snap to close the gap.
# Select the two sticks that were dragged away first.
# Try to attach to the left end of the truss run.
# They do not connect.
# Try to attach to the right end of the truss. They might connect.

I used Eurotruss FD44 and Christie Truss type A for my testing.

Save the file you create for another report about undo. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-183643

Spotlight Undoing truss placements gives unexpected results.

In VB-183642

I reported some issues with truss placements. If you tested that bug and saved the file, you can skip the steps outlined below.

On that file, perform UNDO several times. The placements of the truss did not revert from where they came during my testing. They ended up in fairly random locations. The more truss I drew and then undid, the more extreme the results.

Placing a run a truss and then rearranging the truss into different configurations can result in the truss no longer connecting.
# Place a line of six truss. I used 
# Select the middle two and drag away from the line.
# Select the two truss on the left and drag to the right and snap to close the gap.
# Select the two sticks that were dragged away first.
# Try to attach to the left end of the truss run.
# They do not connect.
# Try to attach to the right end of the truss. They might connect.

I used Eurotruss FD44 and Christie Truss type A for my testing. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-177519

Vectorworks Cloud Services: .vcstmp file visible then went away

VB-183120

Edit 3D Symbol with Clip Cube ON turns Clip Cube OFF - bug in Tool Bar

 
# Open attached VWX file
# Select the Symbol version of the extrude (farthest right)
# Activate Clip Cube (Tool Bar or View Menu)
# Edit 3D Component of that Symbol
# Notice the Clip Cube button in the Tool Bar appears active, but the objects outside of the Clip Cube are visible and the Clip Cube is no longer checked in the View Menu. (This is incorrect)
# Click the Clip Cube button while in Edit - notice it is now correctly active
# Click the Clip Cube button again while in Edit - notice it is correctly not active
# Exit Edit
# Notice Clip Cube is active again (not sure if this in another bug since is was turned off in Edit?*)

Note: If this Symbol is made into a Group, this workflow works as expected.  Group and Extrude Edit mode does not turn off the Clip Cube.  An Extrude and a Group have been provided in the file to help test the difference seen.

This same workflow was done in Vectorworks 2022 through 2019 and they all work the same.  Maybe turning the Clip Cube off is WAD for Edit Symbol, but the Tool Bar button should not show active when the Clip Cube is not present.

*An additional difference (possible bug) seen is upon Exit Symbol/Group/Extrude: With the Clip Cube turned OFF in Edit.  A Symbol and Extrude will return with the Clip Cube ON.  A Group will return with the Clip Cube OFF.  Should turning the Clip Cube ON/OFF in Edit mode affect if the Clip Cube is ON/OFF upon Exit?  - Filling an addition bug for this issue, just wanted to note it here since seen in the video.

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-182531

Clip Cube Shows Solid Edit Mode Incorrectly

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2019 compared to VW 2020, since a regression appeared between the two. The file contains a 3D model and has Clip Cube enabled.

To reproduce, in each version, enter the edit mode for the selected Extrude.

In VW 2019, note that the source shape is still within the bounds of the Clip Cube and can be selected.

In VW 2020, note that the source shape is outside of the bounds of the Clip Cube so it can only be selected with Select All.

This also happens in VW 2021 and 2022. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-183771

Creating a layer reference: Dave DSTOP Dialog being registered was not registered. THIS MUST BE CORRECTED!!! - See John W.

Start VW (mainline, debug)

Open attached file [^Target_v2023b215.vwx]

Click Tools/Organization, verify that the *"References"  tab is not active.*

Switch to the "References" tab.

Select "New"

Select the attached file [^Source1_v2023b215.vwx]

The assertion occurs.

void ShellAPI::RegisterDialog(HWND hDialog, HWND hRealParentOverride /*= NULL*/, bool bIsPopover /*= false*/)

Dave DSTOP Dialog being registered (271e96 Vectorworks) has parent (81312 Vectorworks Design Suite 2023 - Target_v2023b215.vwx) but should have parent (1f1688 Organization). This might mean that (81312 Vectorworks Design Suite 2023 - Target_v2023b215.vwx) was not registered. THIS MUST BE CORRECTED!!! - See John W.

It seems it only occurs immediately after starting the  application. 		Dave Donley

VB-184433

Test file is confidential. File owner Luca Missio contact: studio@missio.it

Two hatches, Paver Antika HF and Gravel Drain cause navigational performance issues in the attached test file. The performance was so bad on my 2015 macOS 10.15.x AMD Radeon R9 M370X 2GB computer, it causes a black screen and restarts the computer.

Performance is greatly improved when, "Accelerate graphics" is turned off on the Display tab of the Vectorworks Preferences.

VB-183126

Clip Cube ON/OFF setting when using Edit Symbol/Group/Extrude

If Clip Cube is activated before or while in Edit mode, Exit Symbol/Group/Extrude will result in different out comes:

Symbol & Extrude:
* Before and After Edit Mode, Clip Cube status will not change regardless of it being turned ON or OFF in Edit Mode

Group:
* Upon Exiting Edit, the Clip Cube will be set to the same ON or OFF value as when in Edit Mode, regardless of what it was set to before going into Edit.

This same workflow was done in Vectorworks 2022 through 2019 and they all work the same. 

Should turning the Clip Cube ON/OFF in Edit Mode affect whether the Clip Cube is ON/OFF upon Exit?  I would expect these three Edit Modes to work the same with this feature, but I am not sure which is WAD.  Figured it was worth bringing up.  		Justin Hutchison
VB-180496

Unfold Surfaces produces objects on Screen Plane

Using the Unfold Surfaces command converts 3D objects to 2D screen plane objects.  This is obviously undesirable if the screen plane is being deprecated. Unfolded objects should be on the layer plane. Justin Hutchison

VB-177582

Multi-View - Closing Project Sharing Dialog During Inspection Mode Causes Sheet Graphics Error

Movie and Project file are attached. The file contains a bunch of different object types and has Multi-View enabled, with a sheet layer active in the bottom-right pane.

To reproduce:

-In the top-left pane, select all the objects and modify/check them out
-In the bottom-right pane, open the PS dialog
-In the Objects tab, double-click any item to inspect it
-Click OK to close the PS dialog while in the inspection mode
-Zoom/pan on the sheet

Note that the sheet shows a series of random artifacts at certain zoom levels.

If I inspect the objects from the Commit List dialog (and then close/cancel) I don't see the problem.

If I close the PS dialog without entering the inspection mode I don't see the problem.

The double-click inspection behavior from the PS dialog was added as part of the T02209 task. I don't think this bug is related to that task though, it probably just exposed an existing problem with Multi-View.

I don't see this on Windows 10 so it looks like Mac-only.

Justin Hutchison

VB-182131

Circle of sweeped object no longer smooth after using Subtract Solids command

When applying the subtract solids command to a sweeped objects the edges will no longer be smooth.

Steps to re-create (or just open the test file):
# Draw a rectangle parallel to the xz plane
# Go to Model > Sweep and create a sweep that results in a quarter circle
# Notice that the edges of the circle are all smooth
# Create a second extrude object and move it inside the sweep object
# Open the context menu and execute the command "Subtract Solids..."
# Notice that the edges of the circle are no longer smooth, but angular

This is a bug that occurs for both the SDK function and the context menu command "Subtract Solids". A test file is attached, with both objects before applying the "Subtract solids" command and after. 		Josh Loy

VB-182958

Section Viewport: "Use embedded Design Layer viewport settings for Class Visibilities" ignored for objects passing through the cut plane.

The attached "DLVP Class Vis in Sections v2022.vwx" file contains sheet layer section viewports of a design layer viewport.  The section viewports have the option to "Use embedded Design Layer viewport settings for Class Visibilities" selected.  This option is respected for object beyond the cut plane.  However, it is ignored for object passing through the cut plane.

This regression looks like it happened long ago somewhere between these builds:
VW23.0.6(463953)-SP6: Good
VW24.0.6(522773)-SP6: Bad

 I did not do extensive testing so there may be more recent builds where it worked again.

*NOTE:* Regardless of how old this regression is, this is a very serious problem with no reasonable workarounds. 		Hernán Stamati

VB-180371

T02095-Hardscape and Site Model Texture conflicts

_*R3. "*When hardscapes are configured to modify the site model surface, the action on the site model must produce:_
* _Proposed contours indicative of the finished site model surface, even when the hardscape has components excavating the site model surface;_
* _An accurate cut and fill calculation affected by the total thickness (depth) of the hardscape in slab configuration."_

VB-184279

Hardscape: Does not calculate the Boundary Perimeter correctly.

Currently the Hardscape's Border Perimeter is calculated as the sum of the perimeters of each of the border parts.
Should be the sum of the lengths of the hardscape's object path poly segments (edges) that are visible.

Attached is [^test_file_v2022.vwx] as an illustration of the current behavior:
!image-2021-12-10-19-13-47-203.png|thumbnail! 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-182055

DLVPs not exporting properly to IFC

This file is a simple example of using DLVPs to "copy" floors across multiple stories. This is typically what we recommend to users who are creating multi-story buildings that have identical floors. The file has the second floor modeled and floors 3-6 are DLVPs. I exported to IFC and imported that IFC into a blank Vectorworks file and there are weird objects. There are centerlines of walls that exist well above the wall itself. Each subsequent story has the offset of the centerlines from the walls larger than the story below.

 

Note: Because the 2nd floor was copied, each floor above had to be moved down the height of the 2nd floor from the ground plane. This seems to be an annoying but necessary step for working with DLVPs. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-180480

T02067 - Site Model Freezes Sporadically After Editing Modifier

Note: it's really difficult to pin-down specific steps for this since the results seems to differ every time, but I've seen this freeze several times on Mac when doing various things.

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Site Model and a Planar Pad modifier.

To reproduce:

-Update the Site Model
-Edit the path of the modifier
-Fillet the sides as shown (I did this in two separate steps)
-Update the Site Model again
-Change the sides of the modifier to Fixed Slope instead of Retaining, then update the Site Model again

In the movie the freeze occurs at this point, but I've also seen it happen earlier in the process. If you don't see it at this point, try changing the shape of the modifier (Add Surface or Reshape) and update again and it should eventually freeze.

I haven't been able to duplicate this on Windows so it might be Mac-only. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-184499

VS: PtInPoly fails on poly segments whose type is not corner

The Vectorscript routine vs.PtInPoly, according to the documentation, should accept polygons and polylines, returning if the point is on the poly or not, but
on polygons: works perfectly
on polylines: only works on poly segments whose type is corner

Please open the attached test file and test the scripts.
You will see some polylines with loci placed on one of their segments.
On segments of type Arc, Radius, Cubic and Bezier the routine will always return 0 (false) 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-176884

Worspaces need checks, especially to support Partner Installer

I'm doing some testing for the partner installer, and after removing items, the workspace will not load, causing Vectorworks to hang, then crash on restart.

I don't know yet if the issue is due to a bug with Vectorworks or my workspace script, however, Vectorworks should have a mechanism to check the workspace, detect the error that is preventing Vectorworks from loading, and advise the user that a default workspace will be selected.

The partner installer makes workspace editing via script potentially more common, so greater integrity checks need to be in place. 		Vladislav Stanev

# Open Plant tool and create plant in the document

VB-177346

Component texture overrides class textures

If you have a LA with a component with a texture, this will override the texture class texture bed even if only texture bed is switched on in 3D (so no 3D components are supposed to be visible)

Also, what does actually the 3D polygon setting do? When would you use it? It's not visible in 3D, it only gives a thin line visible when using the b key. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-177018

(Maxon Fix) FBX not exporting filtered textures correctly

Currently when you export an FBX, any Renderworks Textures that are utilizing a "Filter Color" within the image color shader are being exported without the filter color applied. That means when they're imported into another program, those surfaces look white/greyscale (assuming the original image was greyscale which is often the case in such scenarios).

Instead, the exported texture should include the filter color baked into the texture. And if the filter color is set to "Use Object Fill" then multiple textures should be created in the exported FBX, one for each color fill being used by objects with that texture.

 

See the attached screen grabs showing the difference between a model in Vectorworks and the exported FBX (as seen in Blender):

-The yellow siding looks correct because it's using a yellow image with no filter.

-The salmon siding is not correct. It looks white because the FBX export isn't taking into account the filter color for that texture.

-The green and purple surfaces also look white - in this case they're using the same Vectorworks texture as each other, but the exported FBX should create both a green texture and a purple texture.

 

A similar issue was recently solved for Unreal export as part of VB-176642. Exporting the FBX should function very much the same way as the fixed Unreal export functions.

 

FBXs are important in the workflow between art departments and VFX houses on films, and fixing this would be greatly beneficial.

 

(This same issue may apply to other export types as well) 		Justin Hutchison
VB-182160

Braceworks Data Tag: TrussBottomTrim_formated doesn't work

Hello,

If we see the object almost from the top, the object will be moved to the desired position.

If we see the object from a greater angle to the side, the final position is further away from the desired one.

VB-184335

Mirror Tool: Hatch rotates 90 degrees

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

In the attached file is a Rectangle with a Hatch that contains horizontal lines.

When using the Mirror Tool, the hatch rotates 90 degrees and the lines will then be vertical. When using again the Mirror Tool, but this time on the newly created object, the hatch lines will again rotate 90 degrees and go from vertical back to horizontal.

Hatch should not rotate, it should mirror together with the object that is in. 		Josh Loy

VB-183665

Flip Horizontal/Vertical do not work correct in rotated plan

Hi there,

the commands Flip Vertical and Flip Horizontal seem to work not proper in a rotated plan since Vectorworks 2021.

VB-177514

TSectionCreator::Regenerate and other leaks : "Lack of Memory" error when rendering viewports

This week I've gotten the following error message a few times:

"One or more operations were aborted due to lack of memory."

Each time the scenario has been when I've selected two or more sheet layer perspective viewports set to a custom render mode and hit Update, then the error happens a minute or two later. Usually one viewport finishes rendering successfully while the others fail.

All viewports also have Image Effects applied.

It doesn't happen every single time, just after working in the program for a while.

After I click OK on the error message, one viewport turns into a grey box with a black X. Sometimes the error pops up multiple times, seemingly once per viewport, as each one individually fails and turns grey. 

To fix the issue, I restart Vectorworks and re-render the failed viewports, and things work fine for a while.

I've also noticed upon re-starting that the viewports that failed no longer have Image Effects applied.

I've only been working in one file this week so I haven't been able to test if it's a more universal issue or file-specific. Unfortunately it's a model that has an incredibly strict NDA so I can't upload it, but it's also not particularly complex so I'm not sure what's causing the issue. 		Josh Loy

VB-183585

Datatag don't display in sheet layer viewport in hidden line

We have a ongoing project, started in version 2019-2020 and are updated yearly  to 2022,

In the attached file we have some data tags reporting size and class of external panels.

On the sheet layer, there are section viewports. Data tags are only visible when rendering mode is set to shaded, and not in hidden line rendering. Observe that Windowtags are visible in both renderings mode. Data tags are visible when zooming inn and out for a short period of time

To make the text readable in the shaded viewport it is necessary to have a the design layer in a high resolution (300p or more). Text in hidden line are crisp even in low resolution 

My idea was to have stacked viewports with a shaded background for shadows and color information, and a front viewport with crisp text and lines 

  		Josh Loy
VB-178992

ConnectCAD: Drop Points placed using automatic plane do not orient themselves to the plane

Somewhere between a bug and a "nice having". When I use the Drop Point tool to place a drop on a vertical surface  e.g. a wall, I'm using automatic plane to detect the wall. The drop point is located nicely at the click point but it doesn't rotate to be aligned with the current plane.

If that were possible it would be a real timesaver.

For an example see the surround speaker drops in the demo doc (attached). 		Conrad Preen
VB-177550

Interior Elevation Viewport marker placement inconsistency.

Open InteriorElevation.vwx file.


There are two Design Layers - "First floor" with elevation 0mm and "Third floor" with elevation 6000mm.

1. If you create Interior Elevation Viewport marker on the layer with an elevation of 0mm it is in right place.
2. If you create Interior Elevation Viewport marker on the layer with an elevation of 6000mm it moves away.
3. If you select IEM from the "First floor" layer and select "Edit Section Lines..." in the OIP, the section lines are created on z position = 0. You can control their length and depth without problems.
4. If you select IEM from the "Third floor" layer and select "Edit Section Lines..." in the OIP, the section lines are created on z position = -6000; If you try to control their length or depth the z position change to 0 and now they look properly positioned relative to the layer. 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-181610

Editing Vision Preferences while receiving DMX seems to be breaking some Lighting Devices

I noticed this issue when adjusting the new Vision Preference slider while a cue was active in Q Light Controller.  However, this doesn't seem to be a bug with the slider, but one of the Vision Preference settings.  I think Surface Light Quality (based on Video 2 made in 2022 Build 60130 before the slider was added), but I haven't been able to reproducing consistent results.  I am sorry I don't have this issue locked down yet as to which setting is causing this problem.  

{color:#172b4d}*Attached Video:*{color} 
# Shows how initially the cues are working fine, no issues. 
# While leaving a cue on and adjusting Vision Preferences (may take an adjustment or two & must hit Apply), the light goes out.  Some times it is from going Higher to Lower settings and some times Lower to Higher (I haven't been able to figure out the pattern, if there is one). 
# Notice most of the earlier cues we saw are now not working, until you get to some that do....for some reason the color cues always seem to get some fixtures 'back on line' and working again (with the exception of the Source 4 lekos - the first cue). 
# After ending the session with the Q Light Controller console, you will see that some Lighting Devices in the Vision file are still broken (ETC Source 4, Elation Impression, Martin Atomic 3000) and won't turn when selected. 
# Closing the file (without saving) and reopening fixes this issue.

This issue is on both MacOS and Windows

*Experienced a crash when testing 2022 Build 601030 on Windows (similar steps to Video 2), trying to reproduce to get steps and crash report. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182092

Acceptance Test Cue 46 - possible issue in VSN files

This issue was found when running Acceptance Test on Vision 2022 Build 613087 using Vectorworks 2022 Build 613171

The issue is with Cue 46 - the shutters are supposed to come in from the right and left to create a 'strip' shape.  What is being seen, _*in some cases*_, is more of a pie piece shape.  This was an issue back in 26.0.0 Build 549907 (VB-171314)

However, it isn't that simple.  This seems to only be in VSN files, the MVR or ESC files that they originate from look correct.  This is very true on Mac (100% of the time), on Windows it is less consistent (first found on Windows, now I am having trouble recreate it).

I have opened files with this issue in older builds and the problems is there, so it seems to be more at the file level than an issue with the Vision build. (??)

+Incorrect:+

*TestFile_v2022 826.vsn* - _came from MVR file type on Windows_

*TestFile from ESC.vsn* - _came from ESC file on MacOS_

*TestFile_v2022.vsn -* _came from MVR file type on MacOS_

Correct:

*TestFile_v2022 826 from MVR.vsn* & *TestFile_v2022 from ESC.vsn* - _These files are examples of inconsistent result on Windows._ 

*TestFile_v2022 826.esc* & *TestFile_v2022.mvr* - _These files show that from a clean export from Vectorworks Cue 46 looks correct - these look the same on both MacOS & Windows._

I am sorry this is not the most defined bug report.  I am having a hard time seeing what is going on here with such varying results.  I did my best to break it down to the basics.  I thought fresh a set of eyes might help . . . happy to discuss and test further. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-184121

KLS: Existing Tree german version data vis no trunk perimeter

Hi there,

Existing Tree tools offers country customization. For our german version, we do not use the parameter DBH, which is the trunk diameter, instead we do use the trunk perimeter, in german Stammumfang.
In Data Visualization there is only the trunk diameter offered as a parameter but not the trunk perimeter.
In a german version it should be the perimeter. For me it is okay, when both, the diameter and perimeter would be offered. This means for you just to add the trunk perimeter.

See video.

Thanks and regards , Klaus Lüttich 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-183915

VB-178670

Not possible to Import a Shape File located to User Origin

Hi Vectorworks

If you have a file, where allready a user origin exists, it's not possible to import a shape file to these coordinates (if you don't use the georeferencing system in the existing file).

Steps:
1. Open the File "Import Shape" (this file has a user origin)
2. Import the Shape File "Strasse"
3. Compare the coordinates of the objects with the file "Import Shape Result" which is the result of a import without a user origin respectively the user origin was set to match the georeferecing system after the import of the shape file.

 

Best regards, Marc 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-181672

Existing tree tool constantly prompts you to select site model

VB-181183

Stake Object: X,Y Coordinate and Easting and Northing values incorrect in worksheet

Please see the attached file, which:
* Is georeferenced
* Has the coordinate systems united
* Has a series of Stake Objects. 

I have created a worksheet which pulls out the data from the Stake record. This includes Easting and Northing. The file unit of measure is meters, so I would expect the Easting and Northing to be reported in meters. However, I have also included the X Coordinate and Y Coordinate. You will see in the worksheet that the values in the Easting and Northing fields have the decimal point 3 places to the right, compared to the correct values in the X coordinate and Y coordinate.

Is there a reason for this? I am concerned that such a report could lead to wild inaccuracy if the client expects the Easting and Northing values to be correct. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-178181

Irrigation - Pipe Length field returns incorrect value on Pipes with Arcs

There exists a significant error in the return of pipe length in a worksheet with a Pipe Object is drawn with an arc in the segment.

In the sample file you will see an arced Pipe object that has a Perimeter length equal to approximately 37 feet. This is confirmed by drafting an arc object, and seeing that the arc length is the exact same dimension.

In a worksheet, built to pull in Pipe objects and report their Name, Size, and Length, the field =Pipe.Length returns a dimension of over 108 feet...almost 3x the actual length, while the function =PERIM returns the correct dimension/value.

Upon further testing, it appears that this BUG only exists on pipe objects that contain an arc somewhere along the segment length. Straight pipe objects return accurate values with both the =Pipe.Length field and the =PERIM function.

This is obviously a big reporting bug that can have significant impacts in quantity estimates. We need this fixed, but until then, we will only be using the =PERIM function for estimating/returning accurate pipe dimensions in a drawing. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-180424

# Now undo the import action.
# The new design layer is still in the drawing and it has a group with some qPoly objects on it. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-178613

Export DWG: class fill opacity is lost

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

In the attached .vwx test file we have 2 rectangles.

The Red Rectangle has a Fill Opacity set to 50%.

The Blue Rectangle also has a Fill Opacity set to 50% but its using the Class Fill Opacity.

We export the file to DWG and import it back to Vectorworks.

The Red Rectangle retains the 50% Fill Opacity.

The Blue Rectangle loses the 50% Fill Opacity and now has instead 100% just like its Class.

We believe that the Blue Rectangle should also retain its Fill Opacity, even if using Class Fill Opacity. Please take a look at this. Thank you. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-180742

It is a requirement that all projects need to be approved out of Signed DWFx files, so all of our users have this problem. It's a long time problem that has never been solved.   		Vasil Kitanov

VB-181821

KLS: Export DWG using publish so much slower the export command

Customer uses publish for export DWG. The export of the sheet layer in the testfile takes about 2 minutes with export command and 20 minutes using publish command. See video and testfile.

The workaround for the customer is not to use publish but to use export command. When only exporting one dwg this might be good, but if the customer exports a handful of dwg, publish command is required. And then the export could take hours.  		Vasil Kitanov

VB-177223

DWG Export: Detail levels are ignored when exporting 2D viewports

When you export a sheet layer with 2D plan viewports to the modelspace in DWG:

The details levels are ignored. For example: if a 2D viewport is set to a low detail level ans is exported to the modelspace after, in the resulting DWG file the wall components will be still visible. Even the "high" detail elements of 2D symbols will be exported. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-182694

dwg export: if 'Flattened 2D Graphics' is checked the export rotates by 90º but file related

Hello,
The enclosed file originated in v2019 but has been rebuilt in v2022 via layer import. However it still exhibits this strange problem. If the option 'Flattened 2D Graphics' is checked then when reimported or viewed in a viewer the objects have rotated 90º.

I am unable to repeat in a blank file so somehow file related but report nonetheless.

Cheers,
Peter 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-184462

Page-based symbol scale bug after exporting to dwg

The user wants to export to dwg a sheet layer with a single viewport using "Export viewports as 2D graphics in Model space". In a work place there are 2 kind of symbols (world-based and page-based) and he wants to add some symbols (lets say both types) in an Annotation mode.

The export fails to show in proper way page-based symbol in dwg.
The "page-based" symbol used in a workplace scales to the same size as "world-based".
The "page-based" symbol used in an annotation mode in a sheet viewport scales according to the sheet viewport scale, so it is much smaller than other objects.
I prepared a simple file showing this issue with a pdf file export as expected output and dwg (and print screen from dwg viewer) with a result of an export.

From the left - rectangle as reference object, middle - symbols placed in a workplace; right side - symbols placed in an annotation mode. 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-178127

Undesired error when exporting wall with end caps in symbols to DWG

When you export to DWG in the following specific conditions, you get the error "The wall has already an end cap inserted in this wall"

- There's a wall with end caps on both ends inserted in a Mirrored symbol
- You export from a sheet layer viewport with the option "Export viewports as 2D drawings in the model space" checked on.

This Error doesn't seem to have any purpose, because the export result doesn't seem to be affected in any way. But it is very annoying if you publish multiple sheet layers with many of this kind of symbols. You will get an error per exported wall with two end caps in a mirrored symbol, which means a lot of clicking on "OK" 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-177039

Page based symbols on sheet layer scaled when exported to DWG

Steps to reproduce:

1. page-based and world-based symbols placed on sheet layer
2. document settings -> units -> meters
3. export DXF/DWG (export options see screenshot)
4. DWG import to VW or any other DWG Viewer

Result:

page-based symbol scaled on sheet layer

Workaround:



1. page-based and world-based symbols placed on sheet layer
{color:#FF0000}2. document settings -> units -> millimeters{color}
3. export DXF/DWG (export options see screenshot)
4. DWG import to VW or any other DWG Viewer

Result:

page-based symbol shown ok on sheet layer 

Please check if it is a bug.

  		Vasil Kitanov

The drawing is rotated

VB-178006

Hardscape doesn’t display its attributes on a drawing if they are set by class

To reproduce:

# Draw a hardscape
# Choose New class from the Class drop down in the OIP
# Turn on Edit Properties After Creation check box
# Click OK in the Edit Class dialog
# Turn on Use at Creation
# Set Fill style to hatch
# Pen style to Blue
# Click OK
# “Do you want….” message appears
# Click Yes
# You will notice that Attribute palette displays the correct attributes but the hardscape has not changed its settings on a drawing area
# Duplicate the hardscape
# Choose Remove by class settings in the Attribute palette
# You will notice that the hardscape displays its attributes on a drawing
#
Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-176436

Hardscape: inconsistent class control and display. Textures ignored due to underlying issue with original class when originally created.

Hello,

1. If a hardscape is drawn in 'Class A' the hardscape *forever* retains that class even if the entire hardscape is placed into 'Class B' afterwards and all attributes set by that class.

There is no way to purge the document of 'Class A' even if it is not being used anymore. It stays hidden within the Floor part of the 3D slab which you can see once ungrouped.

2. If the 3D component of a Slab is using the <Object Class> for it's attributes, then even though 'Class B' has used at creation set for both 2D and 3D attributes, it seems that even if 'make all attributes by class' is checked in the Slab Component dialogue, some attributes appear set by 'Class A', especially textures.

The Use class for the texture shows the incorrect texture that is not set by the <Object Class>.

The preview of the Slab Component shows the 2D fill for 'Class A' as opposed to what has been set by 'Class B'. Even then, in Top Plan the 2D attributes show incorrectly (white in the example file) rather than what is indicated in the Attributes palette with all Attributes indicating they are set by class.

File and movie enclosed.

Cheers,
Peter
Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-177717

SBE: VWPolygon2D:GetPolygonized() returns strange results

Somehow the polygonized result does nothandle arc segments correctly. Either at the beginning or (as in the sample here) at the end the polygonized polygon contained very long straight segments at the beginning and end although there should be only short ones (arc segments).

This simple sample code

VWPolygon2D p;

p.AddVertex(-1550,0,eVertexType_Corner);
p.AddVertex(-1550.00000, 1086.49908,eVertexType_Arc);
p.AddVertex(-528.64668, 1457.06303,eVertexType_Corner);
p.AddVertex(492.70664, 1827.62699,eVertexType_Arc);
p.AddVertex(1189.39701, 993.89876,eVertexType_Corner);

VWPolygon2D p_polygonized;

p.GetPolygonized(p_polygonized);

returns p_polygonized with a huge gap at the end:

Vertex #

509: � (1175.03372, 1010.83912) (0)
510: � (1179.84843, 1005.21522) (0)
511: � (1184.63623, 999.56839) (0)
512: � (1189.39701, 993.89876) (0)
513: � (-1550.00000, 0.00000) (0)

For convenience I attached a screenshot displaying the positions of the loci.

Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-184329

Landscape area: Pickup / Bucket does not apply all the settings within objectparameters

Landscape Area Pickup mode should pickup all the settings from the selected Landscape Area.
This is not the case when:
you insert a landscape area, add a plant via OIP button Landscape Area Settings... (Convert to Unstyled if necessary) Add Plant to Plant Information.
Then draw a poly-like object. Choose Landscape Area Pickup mode, click on the Landscape Area and then use Bucket mode to apply to poly-like object.

If you check the settings of the 'poly-like object' the added plant is not included.
# insert a landscape area
2. in OIP click on button Landscape Area Settings...
In Landscape Area Settings
(Convert to Unstyled if necessary)
3. add/remove Plant in Plant Information.
4. draw a poly-like object
5. Choose Landscape Area Pickup mode
6. click on the Landscape Area
7. use Bucket mode to apply to poly-like object.

Compare the settings of both Landscape Areas

screencapture: included 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-181930

Marionette: Test List node should be more specific as to failure cause

Currently the node will return only the list length error, and label it as "value", even if both expectations are false.

At the very least, the node should indicate that the failure is the list length instead of blanketing it as the value, since if the list length is incorrect, obviously the expected values will also be incorrect. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

DOM: Marionette Print Debug Issue in this Document

Link to the File:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/7hqypublzgz5z31/Marionette%20does%20not%20work%20r1.vwx?dl=0

1.  The Layer "Marionette Scripte" contains a Hello World Script. After execution there is a group with the text on coordinates 1e99, 1e99. 
2. Delete the Objects by the Text "EP" in the Drawing center
3. Cut and pasteInPlace the Marionette. 
4. Execute again everything will work normally. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-176186

BIMobject - AUTHTEST access times out is a short amount of time

# Open Vectorworks and select the BIMobject tool from the furn/fixture toolset
# Select the browse mode
# Sign in if needed

* _Notice there is a new access request page._
* _This page does not have an option to remember your settings._ 
* _After selecting an object and downloading it you can wait about an hour and attempt to launch the browse again you are taken back to the details page, selecting back and typing in a search you will see the following characteristics..._
** _The predefined filters are now gone_
** _Shortly after selecting search you are taken to the AUTHTEST access request page again_ 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-184385

Acronym in “V.A/Watts” should be VA/W

Several strings in the Circuiting Tool show the acronym VA/W incorrectly as “*V.A./Watts*” in the following plug-in files:

*Circuiting Tool.vst*

*IP Resources.vwr*

 

The V.A. should read VA (volt-amperes) and the VA/W expresses VA vs. W. 

{color:#4c9aff}*Recommendation:*{color} change V.A./Watts to *VA/W* to conform to standard electrical acronyms. 

See screenshots and attachment below for more details.  		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-183691

DWG Export: Redundant text is added to the Model space

To reproduce: Use the attached to the bug report document and export sheet layers as simplified graphics in Model space. Note, that in the created DWG graphics there are more text objects than necessary. Nina Ivanova
VB-176890

Script Editor: color highlighting fails when no scrollbar is present

[~vstanev]

I caught the bug! It's a bit elusive, but once you understand it, it's easy to replicate.

This applies to the script editor either when used for Marionette nodes or when used for plain old script resources.

Steps to reproduce: (see the video)
1) Open a script editor (use the Marionette pass node for ease of use)
2) change the editor size in such way that there is no vertical scrollbar (because the whole script is visible)
3) close the editor
4) open the editor (again, use the Marionette pass node for ease of use)
--> see that the color highlighting does not work for the whole script, but once you type something somewhere see the color highlighting expands to the whole script

Please ignore the user folder bits of the video. I tested the bug with a brand new user folder and it still was reproducible. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-182514

Issue Copying Vectorscript files

I'm no longer able to copy the text in the body of vectorscripts (.vs) saved in Vectorworks. I have tested this in both VW2022 and VW2021. Vladislav Stanev
VB-182996

Data Visualization Pen Thickness Gets Reverted When Line Type is Changed

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few objects with a DV scheme applied.

To reproduce:

-Edit the DV scheme and edit one of the overrides
-Change the Pen Thickness
-Now change the Pen Style

Note that the Pen Thickness reverts to its original value.

It looks like VW is storing a separate thickness value for each type of Pen Style (Solid, Line Type, and Pattern). Other areas of VW store the thickness as an independent variable so this seems like a bug.

The same thing happened in VW 2021. 		Karthick Chilaka

Maybe it is important to mention that "unified view" was turned off during the migration of this document between version 2019 and 2021. The problems came to existence after the migration. 		Josh Loy

-Right-click on the Hyperlink and choose "Edit"
-Now choose "Edit Symbol" and click OK in the alert dialog

Note that, in the symbol edit mode, the Text object isn't selectable.

If I try this on Windows 10, the Text is selectable but its graphics show at a different size than its highlighting.

I don't see this problem with other plugins that use embedded symbols (for example the Data Tag).

In VW 2020 and VW 2021, the problem happens regardless of the Nav Graphics.

In VW 2019, this only happened with "Best Performance" Nav Graphics.

In VW 2018, this worked fine regardless of the Nav Graphics.

This also happens in VW 2022. 		Josh Loy

VB-181635

Stair tool 90 degrees inner corner construction issue.

At the moment user creates a extruded cube to add solids and covers the corner but it makes the stairs to become a solid instead of "stair"

VB-184109

VB-184033

Site Slope Analysis worksheet reports incorrect units

Hello

Please see the attached file. It contains a simple site model, with a vicious slope, and 2 pads. The site model has slope categories enabled. The document units are metres all round (length, area and volume). I have run the standard report Site Slope Analysis, which pulls in the 'Site Model Slope Analysis'.'Projected Area' and 'Site Model Slope Analysis'.'Surface Area' values. 

Despite the file being in metres, and the site model set to display areas and volumes in metres, the worksheet reports these values in millimeters. 

Clearly, we can divide by a million to get metres (or whatever is needed to get to feet), but it would be better if the values in these fields were in the chosen document units for display in the worksheet. Otherwise, someone unaware of this, who doesn't look too closely, could make expensive mistakes.  		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-178018

Smaller Fascia size in rafters can create a notch in the rafter that wasn't present in previous versions

When framing a roof, the rafters with a small fascia height can have an additional notch which wasn't present in Vectorworks 2020.

I've included a couple screenshots and Vectorworks files to help show this. It seems to happen more when using larger rafters (we can see it happen when using 2"x8" rafters, one of the default options in the roof framer). By default my fascia height was about 7", but changing it to 1" or smaller allowed me to see this issue.

This may be intentional, but I'm not entirely certain why this would change from version to version. Please let me know if there's something I'm missing that could cause this.

This was brought up by a user calling in; their name is David Quillin (ddqarch@comcast.net) should we need to reach back out to them.

Any additional information or news on this is appreciated. Thanks for your time, and have a great day! :) 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-180838

Data Tag on Viewports Can't be attached using Single Object Mode

I am actually not certain if this is a Data Tag problem or a Viewport problem.

I have most researched this in VW2021, but I did confirm it also acts the same in VW2022B3.

In the attached file on Design Layer 2 there are two viewport, once from Design Layer 1 (rectangle on right) the other one referenced into the file (octagon on the left).

There are two Data Tag Styles in the file. One displays both the Viewport Source and the Crop Visibility. The other displays only the Crop Visbility.

Open the attached file. Select the Data Tag tool. Set the data tag to either of the Data Tag Styles in the drawing. Select the Select Eligible Objects (third) mode. Both viewports will highlight. Click on either and the data tag will be attached to both as expected.

Delete the Data Tags and switch to the Select Single Object (second) mode. Regardless of the setting for From or To, the Data Tag tool will not find either of the viewports.

The other problem I have noticed is that the Source gets lost from viewports. When I first started the file, I had the referenced file name for the referenced viewport and Current File for the local viewport. At some point I lost both sources. They showed as blank in the Source field of the OIP. Updating the Reference brought the Source of the Referenced Viewport, but I have not figured out how to get the Current file back. 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-184452

Division between components are not always visible

Having a bit of a different one here - Urban planners need to be able to work with building styles, not dependent on the same footprint (so you can't use symbols), so I've created Hardscape Styles for residential/Retail etc. and you can then use these to create building volumes. This is at the early stages of a project where you need to be able to change height and use of large groups quickly. The subpart reporting takes care of the totals (love it!).

This works really well, but it seems like the division between the components is a bit of a hit or miss - sometimes the lines are not there. It seems to be a bit more stable if you create them with the Hardscape tool instead of creating from shapes, but it's the latter that will be the workflow. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-176574

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Open the attached "Testfile 20210125_01" in Vectorworks 2021
# Export the file to IFC 2x3 (IMPORTANT: Turn on "1st Level Space Boundaries")
# Open the exported IFC in Solibri

As you can see you get a Solibri error message during file opening. If you export the same file without "1st Level Space Boundaries" the error does not occur. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-183528

IFC-Export bugs for Stair, Space, Ramp CW

1.) Default IFC 2x3 Mapping for Ramp CW should be as follows:

- IfcStair as Primary

- IfcRampFlight, IfcRailing, IfcSlab as Secundaries

- BaseQuantites Set should be attached to all secondary objects with each mapping visible in the data manager.

For IFC 2x3, the decomposition at export is working correctly with Data Manager default settings, it just doesn’t show in the data manager dialog. Also, the BaseQuantities are being exported and are mapped correctly but don’t show in the data manager default settings dialog.

 

2.) Default IFC 4 Mapping for Ramp CW should be as follows:

- IfcStair as Primary

- IfcRampFlight, IfcRailing, IfcSlab as Secundaries

- Qto_RampFlightBaseQuantities, Qto_SlabBaseQuantities, QtoRailing should be attached to all secondaries with its mappings visible in the data manager.

There are three files attached. One shows screenshots of the data manager as current and as desired. Also attached is one testfile in IFC 2x3 and one in IFC 4. Both include custom data manager settings with the desired settings. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-183529

BaseQuantites and Qto_sets behave unclear on aggregated IFC objects

IFC 2x3:

Vectorworks allows the IFC BaseQuantites Set to be activated in the OIP Data Pane for a selected stair object. Also, Vectorworks allows BaseQuantities to be added to IfcStair and its secondaries (IfcStairFlight, IfcSlab, IfcRailing) in the Data Manager Settings. When exporting a file with such a setting to Solibri via IFC, BaseQuantities Sets do appear for the decomposed secondary objects, not so for the primary object.

I could not find out if this is buildingSMART standard or WAD for other reasons. If so, Vectorworks should not allow the user to add BaseQuantities Sets to Primary Objects in the first place instead of quietly not exporting them despite the custom setting. Also, the behavior should be the same for all objects. For Ramp CW for example, the BaseQuantities Set can be exported to the primary object. I specified it that way because it’s a low hanging fruit to map desirable quantities from the PIO record, thereby enriching the IFC file. I wasn’t aware it could break a rule.

 

IFC 4:

If BaseQuantities should strictly not be part of IFC4 (by buildingSMART standard or for another reason) because they were replaced by the object specific Qto_... Sets, the user should not be able to set them in the OIP or the data manager. But as long as they can be set, like now, they should also be exported according to these settings which is currently not the case. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-176615

IFC Issues - Ares

This is a list of issues Ares has filed in regards to IFC export. I do apologise - I thought I had filed this weeks ago but must not have finished the 'bug creation'.
* No clear way to fill in the Type Name field within Solibri – different results for different IFC objects. IfcWallStandardCase is the only one which is able to differentiate between Name and Type /Type Name
* IfcFurniture Type – no way to add to Type or Type Name field, Had to resort to BuildingElementProxy
* Assigning IFC data to 3D OR 2D/3D symbols displays unpredictable behaviour. I have avoided where possible and combined multiple hardscapes into a solid addition to show as one IFC object. Or, turning symbols into groups to ensure they come through into Solibri leads to a much larger file size.
* Classification only comes through once. Classification 2 or 3 do not come through.
* For most objects, the class (vectorworks class) corresponds with the Layer field in Solibri/IFC.. This is unpredictable depending on the type of object – Symbols / groups the main culprit – assumably because the objects within the groups are on numerous classes? This should pick up the class of the group. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-184348

Data Manager: Online help for VW2022 lists deprecated information about IFC-compatible record formats

{quote}[...] Record formats designated for IFC export should be named with a VwPset_ or ePset_ prefix, or use a name that is defined by a specific Model View Definition (MVD) or documented model Exchange Requirement (ER). [...]
{quote}

VB-176335

IFC 4 Export: Plant information is not exported

VB-183965

conversion of formula in data mapping for column not correct

the formula in the data manager for Material in Vectorworks 2021 is not corectly converted/ translated in Vectorworks 2022

*Vectorworks 2021 formula >>* GETMATERIALINFO(IF([Object.Use Component*] = 'Architectural Only', 1, 2), -1) ELSE IF([Object.Use Component*] = 'Architectural Only','Default', [Object.Struct Type])

Resulting in the name of the material if attached, otherwise 'Default'

*Vectorworks 2022 formula >>* =FIRSTNONEMPTY(COMPONENTMATERIAL(IF(((OBJECTDATA('Universal Value'; 'Column2'; 'Use Component')='Architectural Only')); 1; 2)); IF(((OBJECTDATA('Universal Value'; 'Column2'; 'Use Component')='Architectural Only')); 'Default'; 'Column2'.'Struct Type'))

Resulting in a float/ number  if a material has been attached, otherwise 'Default'

 

Probably other formula's also can be incorrect, but that has to be checked per formula..

 

The issue is derived from another issue in our system, leading to this issue. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-182524

Data Sheet: Popup Default Value overrides the detault value of a different Data Sheet

To reproduce: (see video)

1) open empty file in Vectorworks
2) create a new record format with one or more fields

3) open the data manager and browse to the Wall
4) add both the record format and the record format as a custom pset
5) map the custom pset to the record format
6) add both to the BIM Wall Data Sheet
7) for the record format field source click Edit Field...
8) append something to the name and create a popup list with at least two items (for example item1 and item2).
9) confirm OK, OK, OK
10) create a wall and see that the default value from the data sheet popup shows up on the Data tab

11) open the data manager and browse to the Window
12) add both the record format and the record format as a custom pset
13) map the custom pset to the record format
14) add both to the Window BIM Data Sheet
15) for the record format field source click Edit Field...
16) append something to the name and create a popup list with at least two items (for example item14 and item15).
17) confirm OK, OK, OK
18) create another wall and see that the default value from the new data sheet popup (for the window) shows up on the Data tab for the wall!

When one (window data sheet settings) has nothing to do with the other (wall data sheet settings), there is no reason for them to interact the way they do. This can and does lead to quite some frustration with our customers. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-178388

 The NominalLength,Width, and Height changes in the OIP from inches to mm when you switch to IFC4 when right clicking in the RM and than click cancel and place the symbol on the design layer. The values are shifting up or down when changes to IFC 2x3 to IFC4 in the OIP. See video and images.  Mihail Rizov

VB-184492

Radial Dimension tool: shoulder mode not saving between sessions

95% of the time when I draw Radial Dimensions I want the leader to the right. However the tool isn't saving the last-used mode options between session of Vectorworks, so it's always defaulting to having the leader on the left.

The tool should remember whatever mode was used last even between sessions.

VB-177676

Setting objects to selected via SDK call causes Object Info to toggle off multiple selection

I modified the tool in Tester Module to only run the following on HandleComplete:
{code:java}
void CTool_EventSink::HandleComplete()void CTool_EventSink::HandleComplete(){ gSDK->DeselectAll();
gSDK->ForEachObjectN(allEditable, [](MCObjectHandle  h) { VWObject(h).SetSelected(true);
});
}{code}
Object Info turns off multiple selection, which is unusual. This behavior was observed by another user as well.

This happens on Windows only.

Ignore the selection indicator issues. That is due to the emulator. 		Payne Chang
VB-177983

Straight\Curved Truss: Only part of the truss which attributes are set by class is updated when you edit attributes of the class

To reproduce:

Create a new class
Turn on Edit Properties After Creation check box in the New Class dialog
Turn on Use at Creation check box
Set Fill Style to Red
Pen Style to Blue
Click OK
Activate the created class
Draw a Straight Truss
Edit newly created class
Change Fill Style to Hatch and Pan Style to Pattern
Click OK to close the Edit Class(es) dialog
Only part of the truss is updated
Kevin Linzey
VB-182984

Spotlight Screen tool. third click to place project doesn't see truss

When placing a video screen via the three click method:
# click to place screen upon a truss.
# drag and click to set rotation
# click to place projector on second line of truss

The third click does not see or connect to an existing truss.

to test, place two lines of truss at 20' high and about 20 feet apart.

Place a screen using the above steps.

The third click will align the lens to the location clicked. The third click will not activate the Braceworks red alignment line.

When inserting the projector, it should be placed centered as it would be hung rather than at the lens. The project should also adjust to the height of the truss. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-184136

Landmark: Root Ball volumes are incorrect

Hello,
In the enclosed file and movie you can see that when choosing a particular Root Ball 3D shape there are some preset but customisable sizes in litres.
A litre is divided by 1000 to get the cubic metres. So 100 litres should be 10 cubic metres.

When the root balls are measured and modelled using the Model>Volumetric properties you can see that the Volumes do not reflect what should be the litre volume. So the Root Balls sizes are inaccurate.

Cheers,
Peter 		Chris Baccala
VB-177602

The texture mapping of the Structural Member tool is different between 2020 and 2021 (I suspect it is a bug of 2021).

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
V2020/V2021
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
The texture mapping of the Structural Member tool is different between 2020 and 2021 (I suspect it is a bug of 2021).

Steps:
1.Draw a beam-shaped figure with the Structural Member tool at angles of 0 and 90 degrees, respectively.
(In addition, the pillar shape is also drawn)

(The Timber Shape is easy to understand for the Rectangle_Timber)

2.Assign texture ("Wood Arctiex Pine 03 RT" is easy to understand)

3.In 2020, the texture is mapped along the direction of the material, but 2021 is mapped in a certain direction along the coordinate axes.
Due to the nature of the figure, the 2020 specification is desirable, and the 2021 specification is inappropriate.


Please refer to "sample2020.vwx","sample2021.vwx","movie12560.mov","image12560.png".

 

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Justin Hutchison
VB-176940

  		Payne Chang
VB-177166

*Crash switching to top/plan — random

[https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?crashId=6894507]

Crash report notes: Pure virtual function called 		Payne Chang
VB-176600

DOM: Double esc blocks normal esc

The issue is a kind of hard to explain, because it has to to with interactivity with the Software and can only be reproduced in specific situations.

I would recommend you first watch the attached movie.
How to reproduce:
# Activate the double escape Feature to exit groups and other containers.
# See the Situation (one of many examples) where you use the smart edge feature and make some smart edges
# Start drawing a line and escape smart edge and line to draw a new line
# Do it in a normal speed a user would try it (0.5 sec)
# Vectorworks recognise the first escape as a normal escape and the second escape as a "double" when you do it fast enough. 
# After that Vectorworks has the opinion, that the smart edge and the line are already escaped and dont allow to escape further. So the only solution to get the line from the cursor is, that user change the tool (x) or draw the line.

We often hear from user, that escape does not work reliable. Also my fellows and me have this experience but we never cared about the real behavior and just ignored it (or worked around with changing tool(x) or draw the object and delete). Users just get used to it. But the feeling that behaviour can produces doupts about reliability. Not clear how to fix it.

What seems to technically happens:
1. The first esc is recognized as a normal escape (the funktion do not know, that the key would be twice at this moment )
2. If the second keystroke follows in a small amount of time the double-key feature is executed and not a second single-keystroke
3. It seems that Vectorworks registered two single keystrokes and is of opinion, the tool is already reseted and does nothing after pressing the esc key. think that is a bug.

What maybe could be done in my opinion:
1. Lower the douple click intervall to 0.25 sec. This will not really hurt the double-key function(whish).
2. Allow esc again after a double esc was made (bugfix). 		Payne Chang
VB-178159

Workspaces update

Hi, sometimes workspaces are adjusted in a new SP update. But when the customer has already updated his workspaces, then he has to add the new functionality (tools or commands) manually. When the customer just moved some palettes, then he already has a local version in the userfolder. I can imagine that the customer doesn't update the workspaces anymore during the year.

It would be nice if there was an automatic popup after an update with the question. There's some new functionality in the workspaces. Do you want to add this functionality automatically to your workspaces? 

If yes, then the local workspaces will be added with the new tools and commands. 

  		Hugues Tsafak

VB-182703

LAND - Site Model Contour Labels not centered

The Contour Labels are not centered on the contours. Instead, they are appearing on the lower side of the contours which is poor practice. They should either be in line with the contours or on the higher end of the contours. Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-181563

Monterey macOS 12 - Unable to run Series B or G dongle protection

Essentially the same bug as - VB-181216 though didn't want to assume, since the test is on a completely different operating system.

This same build runs series B and G on Intel, macOS 10.15.7, with no problem. Perhaps a Apple Silicon build issue in general, with modern operating systems (macOS 11 and 12), regardless of M1 or Intel?

For Series B, it will not accept the serial number and doesn't recognize the dongle is plugged into the computer.

For Series G, Vectorworks cannot find the server

Series B:
-Download and unzip 609900 from 27.0.x
-Download and unzip the Supplements file for the 609900 build also
-From inside the Supplements zip, go to Protection > Series B and copy the Plug-In Support.vwlibrary file and paste it inside the, Plug-Ins folder within the Vectorworks application folder, overwriting the current file
-Also, from the Supplements zip, copy the, "Vectorworks 2022B.app" and paste into the Vectorworks application folder
-Launch the, "Vectorworks B" application
-With a dongle plugged into the computer, Vectorworks should show you the Dongle ID when prompting you for the serial number and this is currently failing (see attached images)

Series G:
-Download and unzip 609900 from 27.0.x
-Download and unzip the Supplements file for the 609900 build also
-From inside the Supplements zip, go to Protection > Series G and copy the Plug-In Support.vwlibrary file and paste it inside the, Plug-Ins folder within the Vectorworks application folder, overwriting the current file
-Also, from the Supplements zip, copy the, "Vectorworks 2022B.app" and paste into the Vectorworks application folder
-Launch the, "Vectorworks B" application
-Vectorworks launches and brings up the Login Setting dialog as expected, though cannot find the server (This is different from VB-181216 where you couldn't even launch the application and reach the Login Setting dialog) 		Tim Ardoin

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Polyline and a path-based Plant object.

-Activate the Reshape tool in Change Vertex Mode, with either the "Bezier...", "Cubic...", or "Radius..." modes enabled
-Click on the top-most vertex of both the Polyline and the Plant

VB-183277

T02121 - Design Layer Viewport Fails to Project Screen Objects When Legacy 2D is Disabled, Shows No Plan Fills

The attached "DLVP Display Error.vwx" file contains a DLVP that displays a few other layers, and currently has Legacy 2D disabled.

Note that the DLVP currently doesn't show any fills in plan view, and there's no "Project Screen Objects" option in the OIP.

-Now export the file to VW 2021 and open there

Note that the DLVP doesn't show fills there either, but if you enable the "Project screen objects" OIP option the fills then show.

So it looks like the 2022 DLVP has somehow gotten into a state where it isn't projecting the screen objects, but also isn't showing the OIP option since Legacy 2D is disabled.

I've tried replicating the issue in a new file but haven't had any luck, so I'm not sure what triggered the problem.

This started off as a Project Sharing project, where the main VWXP file had a reference from a regular VWX file that contained site geometry. That's where we originally noticed the problem, so it's possible this has something to do with Project Sharing or referencing. I've attached a .zip containing the PF, my WF, and the ref file. Both the PF and the ref file have had Legacy 2D disabled for the entire project.

The PF was located on the PSS server at: engmacserver/Projects/QA 2022 Project/QA Project_Tiny House_Main.vwxp

The referenced Site file was located on the server at: nemetschekfiles/FileTesting/Individual TestFiles - QA/Mike/2022 QA pod project sharing testing/QA Project_Tiny_House_Site_3.vwx 		Josh Loy

VB-181276

"Done" Disabled When Removing Serial #s

Go top [Tools][Options][Vectorworks Preferences].

Select "Session" in the List Browser.

Click the "Serial  Numbers" button.

Select the Serial Number and click the "Remove" button.

The "Done" button will be disabled, preventing the copy of VW to be deactivated. 		Tim Ardoin

VB-178720

Redshift: Smooth falloff renders as realistic

Sent to Maxon in issues list

 

Only linear is available, not inverse.  With linear you need to provide a limiting bound distance this will not work the same as inverse did.  Maxon may fix this, not sure.

# With the Seating Section Tool active: In the drawing Tool Bar, select a Style from the drop down.
# Then got to Seat Section Tool Preferences in Tool Bar
# In Tool Preference Window, click 'Convert to Unstyled' to the top
# Repeat steps 2 & 3, notice the drawing preview is no longer correct, but clicking OK does correct the seating section.

VB-178885

DOM: Viewport Crop get printed

If there is a crop on a rectangle and the ration between the size of the crop and the size of the rectangle is over a specific value, the shape line of the rectangle is printed around the crop on some printing systems on windows.

The way I can reproduce it here is by printing with the Microsoft xps Document Writer v4. 

You can reproduce it with the attached Vectorworks File. Is is created from scratch with an empty file.

1. Open The file
2. Print the sheet layer on windows 10 with the microsoft Document writer xps
3. I guess some printer previews also would thow the issue. Or Non-PS-Printers of windows generally maybe.

If I convert the rectangles I can see the issue not anymore. So I guess it has also something to do the way Vectorworks handle those rectangle by printing or exporting the pdf and not just a limitation of the printing system.

This issue landing frequently in our support box. Also there is a big thread about this in our user-forum. It seems a small thread in the us- forum. Seems to be related to pulling small frames out of big drawings, which maybe is made more often by some type user groups.

Maybe related reports:

https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-123885https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-123885https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-173003https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-151216https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-166438https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-86040https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-57693


Forum:

[https://www.vectorworksforum.eu/topic/12799-ansichsbereich-rahmen-wird-mitgedruckt/]

[https://www.vectorworksforum.eu/topic/8181-dicker-ansichtsbereich/]

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/56240-can-not-remove-crop-lines-in-viewports/]

-Switch to the Wrapping pane again
