VB-181309

[T02171][UI Review][Mac Only] Wall Closure dialog/Wall Closure at Inserts dialog - Control state and highlight

See attached video. There are two issues:

Issue 1:

When revealing _(1) Angle (2) Diagonal (3) Width (4) Depth_ controls on this dialog for the first time, even though the radio for _(3) Width (4) Depth_ group is not selected, those fields remain editable. These fields will be disabled if you select the radio group, and then deselect the radio group.

Note This issue can be reproduced on the _Wall Closure_ dialog, but NOT on the _Wall Closure at Inserts_ dialog

__________________________

Issue 2:

When an editable field is highlighted, the highlight goes beyond the boundary of the field. This can be produced on both the _Wall Closure_ dialog and the _Wall Closure at Inserts_ dialog. 		Christopher Graye
VB-183668

3D Wall Join clipping height incorrect after Duplicate Array

# Open the attached VWX file
You will see an "exterior" wall with two "interior" walls t-joined to it.
# Switch to a 3D view and turn off the "Wall-Interior" class.
Notice the components of the exterior wall are clipped at the t-joins.
# Turn on the "Wall-Interior" class
# Select all three walls and use Duplicate Array to create duplicates of the walls with the following (or similar) offsets.  Make sure to include a "Z" offset.
The following settings are used in the video:

- Number of Duplicated: 6
Cartesian Offset:
- X: 0"
- Y: 6'0"
- Z: 12"

# In a 3D view and turn off the "Wall-Interior" class.
Notice the components of the exterior wall are no longer clipped at their full heights.

The problem can be corrected by changing any the wall's Height settings in the Object Info palette to update the wall's 3D data.

NOTE:  I was also able to reproduce the issue by flooding these steps:
# Select all three walls and Group them
# In a "Right" 3D view, option drag a copy of the group so that the duplicate is offset from the original's Z location.
# Use the "Duplicate" command to create additional duplicates.
# Turn on the "Wall-Interior" class and you'll see the same issue. 		Christopher Graye
VB-179848

Not sure why slab is black

See the attached test file.

The slab was black at creation and no effort seems to be able to change that.

I'm not sure why that would be.

  		Christopher Graye
VB-183244

Extension Line Dash appearance

VB-183475

Viewport: wall colours not displayed with some render modes

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

In the file is a Section Viewport and a Viewport. In the Section Viewport we can see that keeps the hatch.

In the Viewport happens the following:
- switch from Wireframe to Shaded, hatch is lost without updating. Colours are kept.
- switch back to Wireframe, colours are still kept.
- switch again to Shaded and Update. Colours are lost.
- switch to Hidden Line and Update. No Colours.
- switch to Dashed Hidden Line and Update. No Colours.
- switch to Sketch and Update. Colours are back.
- switch to Unshaded Polygon. Colours are lost.
- switch to Shaded Polygon. No Colours.
- switch to Shaded Polygon no Lines. Empty.
- switch to Wireframe. Colours are back.
The Walls Hatch was never retrieved. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-184086

DOM: Updating 12 Render VP on this Layout

In this Layout I have 12 Renderworks Viewports. If I update 4 Viewports together on my windows Computer (ryzen 16 Core) it renders pretty fast and does the job.

If I Render all together (which customers wants to do > Render it over night), it crashes my Vectorworks. I have 64 GB RAM and 270GB Free SSD Space. I think it crashes the Moment it starts swaping on my Harddisk. I do the same on my macintosh. It is very much slower but it seems not to crash. I did not completed If I add RAM Vectorworks and RAM Cineware together It uses about 80 GB RAM. 

The Customers said he was able to Render Layouts like this in VW 2019 but I not have verified this yet. I think also Cloud Service would not update this layout, also not tried that.

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-183391

Section Viewport: Background Render displays are incorrect

We have two Section Viewports, showing two squares with volume, one inside of the other. The Outside Square has a long deepness and the Inside Square is placed inside of the far end of the Outside Square.

Bottom Section Viewport intersects both Squares, while the Top Section Viewport intersects only the Top Square, being in front of the Inside Square.

Top Section Viewport: Section Viewport is in front of the inner square.
Background Render:
- Shaded: Visible.
- Renderworks: Not Visible.
- Hidden Line: Not Visible.
- Dashed Hidden Line: Visible.
- Unshaded Polygon: Not Visible and inside is light grey.
- Shaded Polygon: Not Visible and inside is dark grey.

Bottom Section Viewport: Section Viewport intersects the innner square.
Background Render:
- Visible in all, but...
...Hidden Line and Dashed Hidden Line look like Shaded.
...Dashed Hidden Line is not dashed.
...Unshaded Polygon is light grey inside.
...Shaded Polygon is dark grey inside.

VB-178873

The master document is "Fox_Studio H_MASTER - TEST.vwx" and the referenced file is "Fox_Studio H_secondary(Overhead-Ribbons-Furniture).vwx".

I've trimmed out all the extra contents in the file, so it should open to the viewport in question and only include the Design Layers. The files were also purged, and my apologies for the larger size.

The users are referencing a 3D document and placing the Design Layer Viewports over top of the contents in their 2D files. I don't think this is the best workflow in this situation, but please let me know if this is just a limitation of their current workflow. It's not something I've ever seen done before, but we should be able to see the 3D geometry in the viewport.

The user in question is Ben Bauer (benjamnn@gmail.com).

Please let me know if there's anything I can do to be of any further assistance with this! Have an awesome day! :) 		Josh Loy

VB-176293

Save and Commit Does Not commit Data to the Project File

# Place attached file in the Vectorworks Cloud Services beta folder and Open (File5.vwx)
# Start Project Sharing  and save file when prompted
# Run command Tools-Origin-Center Drawing on Internal Origin
# Check out all objects when prompted.
# Save and Commit
# Close File
# Open Project File 
# Try to run the command Tools-Origin-Center Drawing on Internal Origin again. It should not do anything because the drawing was already centered on the Internal Origin but it does this operation again. Which means the changes were not commited when doing a save and commit operation.  		Rick Berge
VB-176939

Inconsistent behavior when creating sheet layers

When creating a new sheet layer, this newly created sheet layer will be activated when you did not select 'Edit properties after creation'.

When you do select 'Edit properties after creation', the sheetlayer will not be activated and you'll stay in the active sheet or designlayer.  		Rick Berge

VB-181688

Hardscape: possibly wrong vertical risen polygons in TIN mesh calculations

After the fix for (VB-180809) Hardscape: Hidden arc segment leads to empty border mesh
... another issue becomes visible:

::IntegrateAreaPolygon() could fail to produce risen polygon, or it could have deformed shape.
The reason is that the input polygonized area/border may be not completely inside the TIN mesh. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-177379

Keynotes: Text ignores text alignment functions if the "Auto Fit Bubble Width" is unchecked.

Hello,
In the enclosed file there are some keynotes. They have 'Auto Fit Bubble Width' unchecked with a maximum width set to 5.

Note that the single digit ones are left aligned. Users want to centre them in the bubble. Yet no alignment options whether from within the OIP or from the text menu seem to have any effect on the text once the 'Auto Fit Bubble Width' is unchecked.

The workaround is to select all (if need be) and in the Keynote Prefix field in the OIP click the space bar and enter. That will work for the single digit ones at least.

Cheers,
Peter 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-177038

The textures come from the class and the one facing the viewer if the left hand side. The class has a solid fill 'Use at Creation'.

Yet when the identical viewports are rendered using Renderworks, OpenGL and Hidden Line, only the OpenGL shows it as solid.

The file was created in 2021 but the template originated in v2012. I used a layer import into a virgin 2021 file but that hasn't made any difference. You'll also see that if you return to the layer 'Ground Ex' that the geometry lives on it will render correctly in Renderworks.

VB-182863

Speaker Array using Symbols is unworkable as default preview is Hidden Line and kills any processing

Hello,
When configuring an Array using symbols, the default rendering preview in the 'Array Detail and Configuration' window is in Hidden Line.

Doing anything in this dialogue like adding speakers to the array, changing angles, clicking into any field or changing anything takes up to 30 -40 seconds for something to happen. It is impossible to work.

In the enclosed file there is a Speaker Array using symbols. In the OIP click 'Configure Array' and go to the Array tab. The preview is in wireframe and one can work immediately anywhere in the dialogue. Change the preview to Hidden Line and you will see that doing any work is near impossible due to the extended delay in navigating or processing.

Cheers,
Peter




Josh Loy
VB-179917

Hidden Line Render- inconsistency not showing intersections when Smoothing Angle is 0º for certain Plug in Objects from the Detailing toolset

Hello,
In the enclosed file and movie you will see that there are a load of 'Channels, I Beams, Wide Flanges etc from the Detailing toolset.

Note that when rendered in HL and the Smoothing Angle is at 0 degrees there are no intersections shown. This is not what is expected. In the movie I ungroup one object to get it to an extrude, then use the Push Pull to change it from the Extrude to a Solid.

The Smoothing Angle now has effect and it will need to go to 10º in order to see no intersections, which is what the PIOs show when at 0.

In other words the PIOs are not affected by the Smoothing Angle in a HLR. It's probably always been like this but it is inconsistent.

Cheers,
Peter







Josh Loy

VB-176953

Renderworks becomes unavailable

Hello,
We have recently had two users, one on the macOS v2020 and the other a Windows user on v2021 with this problem. It seems to happen very occasionally with people as noted on the forum.
The problem is that the Renderworks menu is greyed out and if you try and create a new resource from the Resource Manager nothing about Renderworks is listed (see enc screenshot and note no textures render in OpenGL).

We make 3 suggestions and to try after each one to see if it comes back.
1. Run the repair from the Vectorworks Updater.
2. Delete the Maxon folder in their Preferences and also the Renderworks folder from the Vectorworks user folder.
3. Uninstall and then reinstall.

Cheers,
Peter

PS: Platform- Mac but unsure of exact OS 		Justin Hutchison
VB-184027

Spotlight: Undesired re-orientation when placing lighting devices on rigging objects

Hello,
This stems from this forum post:

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/90102-when-i-place-a-light-on-a-hanging-position-why-is-vw-automatically-rotating-the-light/

You can see from my enclosed movies that when placing a lighting device that is +/-90º to the rigging object means that it forcibly re-orientates to be 0º to be perpendicular to the rigging object in my example.

Also when placing a lighting device using the insert instrument tool and rotating the device with the tool, if it is moved along the rigging object a few times, eventually it re-orientates to 0º to be perpendicular to the rigging object. In the first movie that I posted to the forum it happened after 4 moves, the second movie after 5.

The bug is that the lighting device should not change rotation unless actively done so by the user.

There is also a bug regarding the new Spotlight Preference as you can see in the first movie when a device is placed on an angled rigging object and rotated by the instrument insertion tool. The device then ignores the new preference 'Orient loads with rigging objects when placing in 3D'.

Cheers,
Peter

Kevin Linzey

Hello,
In v2020 you can right click a Plant object in the Resource Manager (RM) and the Edit Style dialogue comes up.
In v2021 if you right click a plant in the RM nothing happens. The only way to edit the plant style is to have an instance on the page.

Cheers,
Peter 		Bozhidar Stanchev

If I then enter an angle in the OIP of 46º the result is wrong in the Seating Section. I then undo and use the Focus Angle widget and move that into roughly the correct angle and it gets close say 52º. I can then type in 46º and the seats angle correctly.

VB-182828

PDF when included in a viewport rendered in Hidden Line appears to change stacking order and hides everything else.

Hello,
On sheet 1.01 there is a series of design layers with one that has a PDF. The PDF is a layer plane object.
The PDF is at the bottom of the layer stack and hasn't been over ridden in the viewport. If the viewport is rendered in Hidden Line render (HLR) then the stage disappears. If you uncheck 'Project Screen Objects' you can now see the stage and although the viewport is now dirty you can export to PDF.
Sometimes it would display ok but when exported to PDF, none of the stage would be exported so it was just the base PDF. Sometimes when changing display settings when it's invisible I can occasionally see the objects in wireframe as if it's a VGM issue.

In 2022 once rendered in HLR the stage is not visible at all. If rendered in Shaded mode then the PDF appears. It's as if there's an issue between HLR and the PDF in 2022.

I have checked the file (origin etc) and all seems ok.

Cheers,
Peter

VB-177298

Spotlight: Seating Section- add an aisle and it doubles the number of seats

Peter 		Kevin Linzey
VB-179227

Sheet Layer viewports no longer able to be interactively rescaled when grouped

Hello,
Prior to v2021, if a viewport was grouped, users could interactively rescale the viewport with the Selection tool. In the movie you can see me do this easily in v2020 and then see me unable to do this in v2021. I suggest this is a regression.

This ability is very useful with perspective renders and doing a presentation layout on the page for one or multiple viewports. Instead of laboriously changing the scale numbers in the OIP you can just use the mouse. Users have been able to do this for many versions.

Someone just said to me "even Turbocad can do this" and I was about to rebut them but checked and indeed we can no longer do this, hence this report.

Cheers,
Peter 		Rick Berge

In my ozcadtraining account in the Spotlight Demonstration File Presentation, slide 3 called 'Top perspective' has some pins.
For a while one pin has been to a PDF. The pin has been deleted as has the PDF from the assets for that board.
I have done this several times without any problem when I wanted to upload a more up to date PDF. However when I clicked the + in the bottom row of assets and chose to upload from the cloud (I think but I can't be 100% only 95% sure) the file just keep loading but is stuck. It is only 21.5MB.
I have restarted the machine, from the enclosed movie you can see I can log out and back in but there's no escape it is stuck 'uploading'. I would like it to stop so I can try again to upload the file to the assets and drag the pin onto the page.
Cheers,
Peter 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-179402

Simple Extrude along Path fails

Hello,
In the enclosed file, there is a simple line and circle. If you Model>Extrude along Path and choose the line (or the circle) as the path then it will fail.

If you draw similar objects of a similar size it will work.
If you trace the original objects and run the command it will work.
If you rotate the circle 90º (ie flip it up so it stands vertically not horizontally) it will work.

So it is bizarre that this doesn't.

Cheers,
Peter

Josh Loy
VB-177996

v2020 Spotlight draw beam don't draw correctly if lines up exacxtly in the x or y

Hello,
I realise this won't get a fix but place a lighting device and focus it to a focus point. If they are lined up exactly in the x or y then the draw beam is incorrect. It immediately corrects once you move the Lighting device slightly.

Cheers,
Peter 		Kevin Linzey
VB-179229

Help: Clarity regarding the Surface Array command Array item.

Hello,
On this page about the Model>Surface Array:

https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2021/eng/index.htm#t=VW2021_Guide%2FShapes3%2FCreating_a_surface_array.htm%23CSH_12

Under Array Items it lists: "Symbol instance" as being one.

The point of this report is that *3D only* symbols are able to be used as array items. If a hybrid symbol is chosen, then it will generate an error message with no detail leaving the user non plussed as it plainly states "Symbol instance". What needs clarifying is that it must be a "3D only Symbol instance".

This held me back quite a while until I experimented and discovered the reason why it failed. As the majority of symbols in Vectorworks are hybrid this will frustrate many users.

Cheers,
Peter

PS Unless it's a bug that hybrid symbols can't be Array items?! I didn't check SP4.

Josh Loy

VB-180231

When converiting a flattened horizontal section viewport to a group: the section fill will displace

When converting a flattened horizontal section viewport on a design layer to a group, the section fill will displace. Rick Berge
VB-183262

Wall components disappear when they vary from wall height and wall closure objects are inserted

In the attached file I have four similar walls with windows inserted. In all four cases the window elevation is 6'11 1/2" above the layer elevation

In the left instance (as seen in the isometric view)/bottom instance in plan view, the window has wall closure turned off, and the "stucco/air gap" component has an offset of 6'11"above the wall bottom, hence *below* the window insertion. All behave as expected.

The second instance from left in isometric view /second from bottom in plan only differs from the first in that the "stucco/air gap" component has an offset of 7'0" above the wall bottom, hence *above* the window insertion. All components except for the stone disappear in 3D views but are visible in top/plan.

The third instance from left in isometric view /third from bottom in plan only differs from the second in that in the "Plug-in Object Options", "Use wall closure"  has been selected and and wall closure profiles have been applied. All components except for the stone disappear in 3D views *and* in top/plan.

The fourth instance only differs from the third in that all wall components have heights equal to the wall height, except the stone component bottom is registered to the layer's "ledge" layerless level (even the base component is full wall height). Wall closure is used, and it behaves as expected in 3D and top/plan view.

The upshot is that wall closure does not play nicely with wall components of various heights. 		Christopher Graye
VB-184343

Third party plugin Archireport Doesn't always work with certain files (Windows 10 & 11 only)

IF the plugin is not installed go the menu command:
Help->Install Partner Products...->Bim->Archireport Sync
When the plugin is installed, relaunch vectorworks.

After Vectorworks restart.
-Open the attached file.
-Once the file is open, go the menu command:
-Tools->Partner Products-Archireport->Archireport Sync..
-Choose the Destination Project in the dialog.
-Select One Sheet Layer "Cover Sheet".
-Click on "Send to Archireport" .
-Once you login the web portal and go to documents.
-The PDF output will be empty. This is only happening in windows 10 and 11.

To create a 30 day for the the portal the user has to create an account. https://web.archireport.com/login 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-182890

Vision: Arrow direction is inconsistent after using "Focus Selected Lights Here"

This is not a 'new' issue, just one I never noticed before.  Seeing it in 2021 as well as 2022 and possibly farther back.

 
# Open attached MVR (same results in ESC files as seen in video)
# Select ALL ETC Source4 05deg Lighting Device (in design space)
# Using the Up Arrow Key, test that the Lighting Devices move in the same direction
# With the Lighting Devices still selected, Right Click to use "Focus Selected Lights Here" somewhere on the stage
# Once again, Use the Up Arrow Key to move the Lighting Devices
# Notice how they no longer move in the same direction (now opposite directions)
# Steps 4 & 5 can be repeated to show that each time this function is used different lights respond in opposite directions

 

In the video, I only used the UP Arrow to keep things simple and consistent.  You can see in the start of the video each Lighting Device was reacting the same to the use of the UP Arrow.  After the use of "Focus Selected Lights Here", the Lighting Devices react in opposite directions to the Up Arrow. Use "Focus Selected Lights Here" again and different lights are moving in opposite directions.  It seems like there is a random element that occurs each time that function is used.

(I haven't tested on MacOS _yet_, but my guess is it is the same even though I didn't mark the bug as such) 		Kevin Linzey
VB-184444

Texture Tool support in Vision MVR or ESC Export

I am not sure that Vision is supporting the new Texture Tool in Vectorworks.  However, I noticed some undesired behavior in both ESC and MVR exported from Vectorworks when opened in Vision.  I am also not sure if this issue is a result of the new Texture Tool or Exporting in Vectorworks, or if this needs to be looked at by Vision engineers.

The attached VWX file has a simple box extrude with the texture tool used to apply texture on one or more faces.  The attached MVR and ESC files are from this file.

In the ESC file:  The screen shots maybe not look like it, but the texture files are attached to 2 out the 3 face for the large cube.  The small cube has an additional face with the single face texture.  All the textures are really off in scale and stretched - like switched from Surface US Mapping Type to Plane.

In the MVR file:  The cube with 3 textured faces lost all textures.  The smaller cube with 1 textured face has similar results to the ESC file. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182249

Snapping options need user-definable location. Accessibility issue

This was discussed extensively in the beta forums, so an entry may already exist. [~gmiller], [~stevej] I apologize for officially filing this so late, but I had the impression changes were in store for this, so I was waiting for a new version.

We need the ability to adjust the location of the snapping buttons. I received an eye injury at birth that causes me considerable eye strain when looking down and to the right. Toggling snaps is critical to my workflow, so I also need to frequently glance at this information. 

With the snapping toggles in their current location, using Vectorworks causes me physical discomfort, especially on an external monitor positioned according to ergonomic standards. This makes 2022 unusable for production work for me. Please look into providing positional options for SP0 – this is more than a personal preference, but represents an accessibility issue that could provide a barrier for some users. 		Ian Lane

VB-181082

Localization issue: Graphic Legend

If you edit a Graphic Legend object, you enter in the usual Edit mode (orange frame around the drawing area).

The EXIT button in the upper right corner is controlled by three strings:

"ExitEditGeometryStr0" = "Exit";
"ExitEditGeometryStr1" = "Graphic Legend Cell";
"ExitEditGeometryStr1_Title" = "Graphic Legend Title";
"ExitEditGeometryStr2" = "Layout";

Languages different from English may use a different strings organization.

For Italian, we need to arrange 0 + 2 + 1

The current 0+1+2 strings organization has no meaning.

 

 

  		Ian Lane

VB-183971

KLS: Create Stage very slow with many Renderworks textures

In our german Vectorworks the creation of a stage using at least one texture is very slow when there are many textures in Renderworks - Texures folder.

To reproduce (do it on Mac), rename libraries/Defaults/Event Planning/Stage to libraries/Defaults/Event Planning/Bühne and the file in that folder rename to Bühnen - Texturen.vwx.
Of course rename in Vectorworks.vwr/Strings/210 Folder.vwstring #3 from Stage to Bühne in order Vectorworks can use this renamed default.

Download Entourage and Miscellaneous libraries and Renderworks Libraries with Vectorworks Package Manager. We need tons of textures.
Delete file Flooring Carpet.vwx inside Renderworks - Textures folder.
Very important: In order to see the effect, the texture we select in stage command does only have to exist inside event planning defaults and not inside Renderworks - Textures folder.

Start Vectorworks and refresh libraries.
Draw a rectangle of maybe 5 x 5 Meters.
Invoke Create Stage command.
Set Structure = Legs-Basic and click 3D Options button.
Set Top Color to Custom Texture and select Carpet Low Pile 01 Blue RT.
Again because important: Select a texture which is only inside the event planning defaults and not inside Renderworks - Textures folder.

Click OK and start creation of stage decks. Please notice it is slow.
Imagine how slow it will get, when creating for example 150 stage decks.

I did some additional testing.
This only happens, when there is a german umalut (ä,ö,ü,ß) inside the event planning default folder. In this case it is an "ü" inside Bühne.
Notice, you can select a texture from that "Bühne-folder", so Vectorworks recognizes and accepts the pathname with a german umlaut.
But when the command tries to create the stage decks, then the path that "Bühne-folder" does not seem to be recognized and Vectorworks looks inside the Renderworks - Textures folder in order to find the texture, which of course - because we deleted Flooring Carpet.vwx before - is not there.

Mac and Win do have a different handling of special characters and so the german umlaute. Mac seems to use two characters to create e.g. an "ü" - first an u and then the two point supercripted. When I change the Mac created umlaut to a Win created umalut for testing, then it works too, because Vectorworks seems to find the path then.
Because Mac has its own way of handling special characters this is not a real solution.

I guess, there is a function inside the spotlight tools like stage deck which creates the path to the defaults. It seems, that special characters like german umlaute are not supported. If so, there may be more places, where this occurs.

Gruß Klaus 		Justin Hutchison

is NOT allowed.

VB-184445

3D Symbol with 3D Polygon Mesh not visible if Renderworks active

Attached is a video showing the problem being reproduced.

In the attached .VWX-file we have a 3D-Symbol of a Chair, inside of this 3D-Symbol we have various other 3D-Symbols which are parts of the Chair (seat, legs, back, etc.). Inside of this 3D-Symbols we have a Mesh of 3D polygon in each.

In the video we can see that the top part of the chair (main 3D-Symbol) is not displayed when Renderworks is active, while the bottom part / legs are displayed.

If we zoom in and out, we can see the top part (seat) of the chair being briefly displayed and then disappears again when the zooming ends and the re-rendering is finished.

If we go inside of the main 3D-Symbol, then also inside of one the next layer of 3D-Symbols (eg. seat back) and finally inside of the Mesh where the 3D Polygons are and activate Renderworks, in there the 3D Polygons are displayed. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-177907

Inconsistent behavior with lights attaching to hanging positions

I'm not sure if this is a bug or not, but the behavior feels wrong so I'm including here. Here is what is happening in this video:

I have two lighting pipes which I name Pipe 1 and Pipe 2. I attach lights to Pipe 2, they pick up the position name as expected. I then convert both pipes to a Hanging Position, it suggests to me the name the pipe is already using, all good. 

If I now add lights to Pipe 1, they associate, with the rigging object and pick up the position name, still good. The problem is the lights that were already on Pipe 2. They are still clearly associated with the position because you can see the blue arrows. But they have LOST their position name. And annoyingly, the pipe has now been drawn over lights. 

If this is WAD, it shouldn't be. Whether you add lights before or after converting to a Hanging Position, they should continue to keep, or pick up, the position name of the Hanging Position.  		Kevin Linzey

VB-178024

Truss Visibility Issue in OGL

In the enclosed video I've shown a replication of some Eurotruss FD34 4m sections where it's visible and select-able in wireframe but going into OGL render from any 3-D view causes the truss to become invisible but still select-able. I did try re-importing from the VW stock library a new instance of the FD 34 4 m sections and after using the Replace Truss command there was two 4m choices available one had this issue the other did not, the first one was the default hybrid symbol and rendered correctly, the second which had the visibility issue was an instance in the file that had been rotated at some point. Josh Loy

VB-177230

Possible memory leak. Creating section viewport.

Hell All!

 

Creating a section viewport in the attached file using clip cube crashes the file. Memory usage goes up to a point where machine just crashes with Vectorworks.

 

On a Mac on my side its a little bit better as it just starts to use 70gb memory on Vectorworks 2021 but i still can force quit it. I cant even take screenshots off the users windows machine as the machine completely crashes and the only way to get it back up usually is a force shut down and a complete reboot of the machine. 

 

Please see video attached. 

 

Have two different users experiencing this. Will open two jira's as both cases are quite unique.  		Josh Loy
VB-177842

Unpredictable Jogged Section Extents Beyond Cut Plane

Whenever you have a jogged section viewport, the "Extents Beyond Cut Plane" is presumably based on the distance from the first segment of the Section Line, as indicated by the dashed line widget and blue control handle when reshaping the Section Line - this widget matches the distance in the "Advanced Section Properties" dialog box. In the screen recording this distance is 10'.

However, in the actual Section Viewport, the extents seem to be drawn from the second segment of the Section Line, rather than the first. Furthermore, when using both a foreground render (Hidden Line) and background render (OpenGL), the two modes are drawn with mismatching extents, neither of which are the expected measurement of 10' from the first segment of the Section Line. It's very confusing and makes it impossible to draw jogged sections properly.

VWX file and screen recording attached. 		Josh Loy
VB-180357

Specific symbol: Geomety still visible in viewport, desplte class is set invisible

The added document contains a symbol. This symbol contains grouped geometry. Hen you pout the group within the symbol in a class which is invisible in the section viewport, the geometry within the symbol will still be visible in that viewport, while it should be invisible. Josh Loy
VB-178955

Surface Hatches Fail to Show on Walls in Section Viewport When Textures are Set By-Component

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Wall with a hatched texture applied by-component, along with two Hidden Line viewports (one elevation and one Section).

To reproduce, update the viewports and note that the Surface Hatch fails to show in the SVP.

If you change the wall to use "By Object" texturing and then manually apply the same texture to the Left side, the hatch will show fine.

This is a regression from VW 2021. 		Josh Loy
VB-177023

Section Viewports

I am seeing multiple bugs with Section Viewports and Horizontal Viewports that relate to objects before or above the Cut Plane.

 

*OBJECT DISPLAY BUTTON*

As I understand it, only objects that are directly before/above the Cutting line and *not* *obscured* by anything else will be revealed using the visibility settings of this button. This is not necessarily the case and all objects are revealed when using the hidden line setting (not what I would expect) and hidden using the Hidden Line setting (what I would expect.)

*HIDDEN OBJECT DISPLAY BUTTON*

I understand that objects that are *obscured* by other objects are controlled by the parameters of this function.
Using a Hidden Line setting all obscured objects are revealed as you would expect but sweeps seem to only render in dashed hidden line.

Using Dashed Hidden Line Rendering option also reveals the items, but only in Hidden Line. To achieve a dashed hidden line rendering I need to have Dashed Hidden Line enabled in the OBJECT DISPLAY settings.

There is also variable behavior when an object is contained within a symbol.

I have no idea whether I am misunderstanding the functionality of these before/above cut plane settings as there is virtually nothing written about this in the help files, so forgive me if I have got all this wrong.

Enclosed is a file and also a video explaining the file a bit!

  		Josh Loy
VB-178091

Section Viewport Hidden Line Incorrect with Jogged Section Line

In the attached VWX file, you will see three section viewports created from a jogged section line.  Each viewport has identical settings except for as follows:

*Section 2:* Beyond cut plane is rendered in OpenGL.  No issues are apparent.

*Section 3:* Beyond cut plane is rendered in Hidden Line.
*Notice* the additional line seen on the sloped ceiling in the model.  This line appears to be a seam as if a plane at the location of the first segment of the section line sliced through the entire model.

*Section 4:* Beyond cut plane is rendered in Hidden Line and the Height Range change to Infinite.
*Notice* the beyond graphics appear to be taken from the model as sectioned from a single cutting plane located at the first segment of the section line. 		Josh Loy

VB-177847

VB-176144

Extra lines drawn at extents of Section Viewport

Say you have a long Wall with a couple Door and Window objects in it. Then you create a Section Viewport that looks at just the door, perhaps for an enlarged elevation or something, so you set the Length Range to "Limited by Section Length."

In the resulting viewport, there are vertical wall lines drawn at the left and right extents of the viewport. This is very bad, as it indicates there is geometry there which doesn't actually exist (like the edge of the wall, or a corner or something). See attached example file. It makes the door look like it's in a separate wall (or in my case Hollywood flat). As a workaround I'd add a viewport crop but this is not an ideal solution in certain scenarios.

The Section Viewport should not add these vertical lines in the first place. If a user desired the lines they could always drawn them in Annotations. But otherwise those extra lines can only lead to problems. 		Josh Loy
VB-176556

Delete/replace class doesn't replace it in Section Viewport settings

If I delete a class (such as the default "Section Style" class) and replace it with another existing class (such as my own "2D-Hatch 1mm" class), I would expect any existing Section Viewports that were using the "Section Style" class for cut attributes to now use the "2D-Hatch 1mm" class. However it seems that Section Viewports all switch to using the None class instead.

Screen recording attached. 		Josh Loy
VB-180167

Lines between coplanar wall faces are not being removed

Open the Hidden Line Acceptance test. Navigate to saved view "22: Wall edge intersection line hiding." Render in hidden line. The edges between the faces that should be removed are not. Josh Loy

VB-184411

Site Model inconsistent in identical section viewports

In this file, I was trying to remove the mesh lines from the site model in the section viewports. I tried turning off the classes for contour lines and that didn't work. I also tried overriding the class pens of the site object class and the site component classes and that didn't work. Then I tried copying the viewport and that seemed to work. You can see on this sheet that all eight viewports have the exact same render properties, section properties, and class visibilities and overrides, but two viewports don't show the site mesh lines while the other six do. Each of the lower right viewports in the set is the copy of the original in the upper left. Josh Loy

VB-177813

VW2022 Hangs when converting Horizontal Section Viewport to Polygons

 

-Open test file 

-Create a horizontal section viewport rendered in Hidden line

-Select the HSVP with default parameters. After section is created, set the projection to "Perspective" -  "Normal" from the OIP and update the section.

-Modify> Convert> Convert Copy to Polygons

-Notice you get the "Spinning beach ball" indefinitely and the memory goes up to 15 GB or so, which is higher than the memory usage in VW2021 SP3 with the same above steps.

-Only option here is to force quit the application

 

[Mac Only]

 

Note that performing the menu command 'Convert copy to Lines" works as expected and the above steps don't cause VW2021 Sp3 to hang, so this appears to be a regression. 

Also, this type of test is something I do every version of Vectorworks and its a good gauge that gives me an indication on the performance. 

  		Josh Loy

The Window CW has a built-in shadow that its correctly displayed in the Window CW, but when displaying through the Section Viewport the shadow transparency is lost. 		Josh Loy

VB-182877

Design Layer Surface Hatches Often Fail to Show in 2022

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a simple 3D model.

To reproduce:

-Render in Hidden Line
-Now open the Line Render Options and enable the "Display Surface Hatches" option
-Do a few zoom and flyover operations

Note that, in certain views, the surface hatches will fail to show.

If I try this in 2022 SP0 and SP1 the hatches seem to fail much more often. In SP2 the failure is more sporadic but still happens (the attached video shows SP2).

I don't see this problem in sheet layer viewports.

This is a regression from VW 2021. 		Josh Loy

VB-182291

Stair markers in Horizontal Section viewport are not visible.

Start and end markers are not visible in Horizontal Section viewport on the following occasions:
* *Merge Cross Sections*: all markers, except the end markers for Walk Line as *Polyline* (e.g. in circular stairs), are invisible. End markers are not the correct ones.
* *Separate Cross Sections, Use Attributes of Original Objects*: markers for Walk Line as *Polygon* (e.g. straight stairs) are not visible, except the End markers with option Fit to tread depth. 		Josh Loy
VB-181971

-This minor but worth noting.
-Notice in the video capture.
-Initially it rendered shaded, notice the angle of the texture (class texture).
-Notice the angle of the particular solid, it the object info palette it's at 150 degrees.
-When I switch to hidden line the angle is correct.
-If I change the rotation angle of the texture in shaded mode, the rotation angle will not
be correct in hidden line anymore.

VB-181940

Changing the line weight of hidden objects in hidden line does not appear to take affect

Steps:
# Open the attached file: [^Thanos Lodge v2022.vwx]
# With the viewport selected take note of the color of the stairs (they are purple)
# From the OIP, select the Hidden Object Display button
# Scroll down until you find the purple class (Set-Stairs)
# Take note of the thickness of each line type
# Press OK or cancel
# From the OIP select update

_Notice that once the render finishes, the line thickness has not changed and is no different from the rest of the drawing._ 		Josh Loy

VB-176491

Line type and axonometric viewports don't look decent enough

I received some sample files from an architect from latinamerica. We understand Architects there also provide MEP drawings. It was brought to my attention that line styles, for example lines including text like gas, hot water, etc, when shown in an axonometric viewport, rendered with a hidden line style, the "gas" text looks not presentable.  I wonder if Line type and axonometric viewports do not get along.  I am including a screenshot and a small sample file. I'd recommend looking at the single layer and then look at the viewport on the single sheet. The graphic quality seems to be not acceptable. text is rotated and some hair lines appear in random places. Josh Loy
VB-176315

Inconsistent behavior for Classes and their Attributes in Extrudes

When creating a 2D object in one class and activating another class while creating the extrude, the extrude will sit in the last activated class but will use the attributes of the source object. The attributes pallet uses the class attributes, but it does not.

When changing the class in the OIP, both the source and extrude are forced into the same class.

This issue evokes multiple bugs in section viewports and overruling class attributes in viewports. That's why we consider this to be a High Priority.  		Josh Loy
VB-178236

Section through round wall show sloped sections and inaccuracies

The attached file has four identical section viewports cutting through round walls with windows.  The only difference between the sections is the "3D Conversion Resolution" setting in their Advanced Properties.

Notice the odd sloping components in the sections with a 3D Conversion Resolution of "Low" and "Medium" and noticeable shifting in the ones set to "High" and "Very High". 		Josh Loy

VB-183935

Thick Lines in Section Viewport

We've been looking at this file on the Tech Support side of things for a while now and can't understand why there would be thicker lines around the edges of some doors and windows in this file.  The document has been trimmed down, but hopefully you can see what we're seeing in the attached PDFs and images.

When Line Weight Scale in Advanced Properties is set to 0.1 it seems to get around this.  It also appears correctly on Windows rather than on Mac (but the exports will be the same either way).  It also looks like nudging the doors and windows will fix it, but that's not the best workaround.

This file was sent in by Daniel Staats (dstaats@latadydesign.com) and I've edited it to make it easier to see the issues and download.

VB-177556

3D Text Missing in Viewports using Hidden Line Rendering

3D Text is missing in Viewports using Hidden Line Rendering.

Open the attached file.

Invoke the "Design Layer - Perspective" Saved View.  Hidden Line Rendering works as-expected, including Text visibility.

Invoke the "Sheet Layer - ViewPort" Saved View and, if-necessary, Update the Viewport that will be seen.  Text will be missing.

See related bug:  VB-158567.

This issue is also seen in VW 2020 but all works as-expected in VW 2019. 		Josh Loy
VB-182911

Lighting Accessory Remove Mode: Removal order affecting Lighting Devices that include C Clamps in VW Library

There are some Lighting Devices in our Vectorworks Libraries that come in with C Clamps and are now apart of those Lighting Device as an Accessory.  After a second Accessory is added to the Lighting Device, using the Remove Mode of the Lighting Accessory Tool will remove the C Clamp first.  This removal order is seen on all Lighting Devices and in 2021 - first accessory added is the first to be removed.  This may be WAD, and there may be another reason for this removal order.  However, since this change with C Clamps took place in 2022 I thought it was worth mentioning.
# Insert a Lighting Devices that comes with a C Clamp (ex. any ETC Source 4)
# Attach a Lighting Accessory to the Lighting Device
# Remove the Lighting Accessory Tool in Remove Mode (best seen in ISO view)
# Notice the C Clamp was removed first

There is simple work around by using the Edit Accessory in the OIP, so not critical.

  		Kevin Linzey

result: NIL (Notes: Duplicate is in the original location )

  		Rick Berge

VB-177308

hidden lines

Hi Vectorworks

Hidden lines connect/ merges slabs and walls together but not slabs and columns together.

Best regards, Denis

Christopher Graye
VB-182098

T02171 - Wall: Only upper/lower Wall Hole edges parallel to the ground plane are considered as Top/Bottom Edges

The attached VWX file contains several walls with inserts having various wall hole shapes.

As I understand, the current logic is that upper/lower wall hole edges that have an angle less than 45º from the ground plane should be considered as Top/Bottom and use closure settings from those edges.

Notice the wall holes in the red walls all have edges less than 45º but are using Left or Right edge settings. 		Christopher Graye
VB-182096

T02171 - Wall: Wrong Profile settings used for circular shaped Wall Holes on inside face of Wall

The attached VWX file contains several walls with inserts having various wall hole shapes.

Notice the two circular shaped holes (in the red walls) use the Left Edge Profile settings for the exterior side of wall but use the Right Edge Profile settings for the interior side.  Both the exterior and interior should use the Left Edge settings. 		Christopher Graye

T02171 - Some Round Interior Profile Values causes the Exterior Profile to Show Incorrectly

I've attached a short movie and screen shots that shows this problem.

When the radius is less than 2" for the 'Round' interior profile, then the exterior profile doesn't look right.  		Christopher Graye

With 'Splay' exterior and interior profiles, the wrapping doesn't look right with some diagonal values, mainly higher values.  		Christopher Graye

VB-182917

SBE: Styled PIO is in class "None" despite class is by style and style has different class

Please see attached file. PIO is in class none, despite style symbol and PIO within style symbol are in class "02-Arch..." and SetlClassByStyle(style, tue) is set.

As SetObjectClass blocks assigning a class to a PIO whose class is set by style it can't have been the PIO that caused this inconsistent state. The PIO itself can't even fix it as SetObjectClass prevents any fix. 		Christopher Graye

I tried turning off classes in order to remove the lines, and suddenly a wall appeared in the opening. VB-182532

Wall Texture Offset Changes When Window Height is Changed

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains Walls on different layers that use by-component textures.

To reproduce:

-In the Render tab of the OIP, highlight the "Siding" component and change its Offset H so that it aligns with the lower wall's texture (a 13.4" value aligns them cleanly)
-Now select the in-wall Window and change its height

Note that the texture is no longer aligned.

I don't see this problem in 2021 so it looks like a regression.

This also happens in 2022 SP1 and SP2. 		Christopher Graye

VB-181318

T02208 Seating Section Focus Line - Snap Points for Focus Line differ per mode

When the Seating Section Tool is used in 'Oval Mode' or 'Rectangle Mode', there are no snap points on the Oval or Rectangle to start the Focus Line. 

If an Oval or Rectangle is drawn with the 'Polyline Mode' or 'Create from Shape Mode' converts an Oval or Rectangle, there are snap points at the midpoints and corners.

 

I wasn't sure if this is by design, but felt it was worth noting the difference.  Included a video 		Kevin Linzey
VB-179694

Label Legend Field Containers don't rotate correctly in Schematic Views

Currently, if a Label Legend Field is set to right-reading, then when the lighting device is rotated, the schematic view version shows 2 containers. One is rotated and the other is unrotated.

This problem exists in 2021 SP4 as well.

Enclosed is a file. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-180532

Lighting Pipe line insertion mode no longer allows insertion in 3D

The line insertion mode of the lighting pipe was designed to allow the user to insert pipes into 3D space, applying the desired angle and hanging angle. Vectorworks 2022 changes the tool settings such that pipes now only insert in the layer plane.

This feature was specifically added to meet needs discussed in the NYC Spotlight user group. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-178765

Non-screen plane planar objects in SLVP annotations

This is an issue that's bothered me since the debut of VW2021 but for whatever reason I've never filed a bug about. Another user made this post recently which inspired me to finally file this: [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/83292-annotations-jump-around-on-viewport-annotation-layer/]

 

Often we paste 2D objects from a Design Layer into viewport annotations (like ALL the time). What's happening in 2021 is that 2D objects that are set to Layer Plane upon copying (and likely other non-Screen planes) sometimes behave erratically when pasted into the annotations of a sheet layer viewport. And because you're working on a Sheet Layer, the OIP does not display the "Plane" dropdown, so it's impossible to see that the 2D object is still somehow remembering its plane. Furthermore, it's impossible to fix it in place without the Plane dropdown.

 

Some of the sporadic issues include:

-The object only appearing while zooming and panning, but otherwise being invisible.

-Text objects appearing as grey boxes instead of the actual text.

-The object not moving when the viewport is moved.

-The object moving way off to the side when the viewport is moved.

-The object flipping itself or rotating itself.

-Other graphic glitchiness.

 

This doesn't happen with every single Layer Plane pasted object, but it's happened enough times over the past year I can confirm this is the cause. I deal with it several times per week. At the moment I don't have a file to attach, but next time I encounter the issue I'll try to remember to attach it here before fixing it.

 

Currently the workaround is to cut the offending objects, paste onto a Design Layer or blank document, change their plane to Screen, then return to the viewport and paste again. However, I doubt most users are able to ascertain what causes the issue in the first place.

 

What SHOULD happen: all 2D objects pasted into SL annotations need to behave as Screen Plane objects do. This is what used to happen prior to 2021 - there was never any worry about what plane an object was on before pasting into annotations. 		Rick Berge
VB-176964

Seating section places double rows

In the attached file, you'll find a seating section where multiple (circular) rows are duplicated. When you remove the isle or alter other settings like spacing, the issue can be solved. Splitting the seating section in two parts would help as well, but is not a preferred work-around. 

Check the attached file, (re)move the seating section or isle or change settings. 

This has been send to Tech Support, they requested to create a VB.

 

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-177672

3D Label Legend display issue based on whether reference symbol as attached record

I had some lights who's 3D LL attributes were not displaying properly and I couldn't figure out why or how to fix it. After lots of trial and error, I discovered that the generic S4 symbol I had been using in all my LL layouts (which happened to be my normal S4-36°) seemed to be causing the problem because it had a Light Info Record attached to it. Using the exact same symbol, but having no record attached, the problem was solved. See the attached video and file. The reference symbols in the two different LL are exactly the same except one has an attached record and one does not. Kevin Linzey
VB-177673

Duplicate Label Legend retain Layout Symbol when changed

# Open the attached file (or create a Label Legend in a blank file)
# Go to Spotlight>Label Legend>Label Legend Manager...
# Select '2D' Label Legend and Click 'Duplicate'
# Edit the Legend name
# Select a different symbol/Lighting Device to be used for Layout
# Click OK
# In Label Legend Manager, select duplicated Label Legend and Click 'Edit 2D Layout...'
# Notice there are two symbols present, the original and the newly selected symbol

This issue occurs in both 2D and 3D Layouts.  The issue doesn't happen if the original Label Legend doesn't have the layout edited before duplicated. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-177822

Text Styles used in LL not transferring between scales correctly

I have no idea what is happening here, it's sort of hard to describe, but something seems off.

If I take a light that was in a drawing at 1/2" scale, and paste that light into a new file at 1/4" scale, all the labels seem to display correctly except my unit numbers. In the Text Style, the font should be 14pt. You'll notice when I first look at the LL the place holder "Unit Number" is in two different sizes that changes in the middle of the word, which is very strange. When I select that piece of text, the size is missing, even though it should be getting pulled from the text style. By reapplying the text style, the size does say 14, but visually it remains doubled in size as compared to the rest of the labels.


It seems like all the other label items are reducing their size by 50%, as I assume they are supposed to, when placed in a 1/4" drawing...but the unit number is not. Either I'm doing something wrong, or there is a bug, but something is amiss. As, I believe, all my text styles and LL items are built the same, I'm confused why the Unit Number is behaving any differently. 		Kevin Linzey

Hello all!
Take Seating Section, choose "Rectangle Mode", make your 1. click, after that try to define the size of the planned rectangle (border for the seating layout). There ist no ∆x and ∆y to define the size, same with the Oval Tool. Using the Poly Mode you can define every single line.

VB-183442

Wrong WallAreaNet calculation in Vectorworks 2021 and 2022

Thanks a lot for the discussion about the „WallAreaNet“ issue and your effort to help us. We know that the numbers were wrong already for a pretty long time. The reason why we get more and more complains is just because of the fact that more and more people have to do BIM and have to deliver these kind of numbers.
 
In our opinion we can split that up in three issues:
 
1. We get wrong WallAreaNet in 2021
2. The WallAreaNet has changed in 2022 (better result but do not match the formula description)
3. More function/options for 2023
 
This report is actually only to address issue 1. Issue 2 is probably another bug but gives currently the better result in 2022. But I think it is wrong anyhow :).
 
To reproduce and understand the issue please:
 
1. Watch the attached movie first
 
Issue 1 (would be nice to address this in 2021):
We would like to get the right result for 2021 but honestly, most of our customers are interested in getting the Net/Gross area of the left and right far of the wall/component. But as I mentioned it would be fantastic if you find an easy way to address this in 2021.
 
a.) Open „Testfile 2021“ in Vectorworks 2022
The WallAreaNet should be calculated along the center line. Well, this is actually what this specific formula should do. In that case, the area should be (9.2*4)-4 = 32.8. You do not get a detailed information how the WallNetArea along the center line should be calculated. To keep it simple we think that it just should be the area of the section surface along the center line. Which is (9.2*4)-4 = 32.8. So it depends on the opening size that is on the plane of the section along the center line. 
 
However, we definitely need better numbers that are part of issue 3.
 
Issue 2 (these are changes in 2022. Get better results but anyhow wrong)
As shown in the movie the WallAreaNet calculation is completely different. After file conversion from 2021 to 2022 you get a WallAreaNet value which is the left side of the wall. NOT based on the CENTERLINE anymore. This is actually the better number for the customer but wrong for the formula. In addition „WallAreaGross“ in 2022 is still based on the Centerline. Very confusing. I think this is a bug and should be fixed to as soon as we get some better function options in 2023 :)
 
Issue 3 (planed for Vectorworks 2023)
We realized that the description of the function/options in Vlados Excel Spreadsheet are good but not 100% clear in any case. We try to create some sketches that help you to understand the function/options we would like to see in 2023.
 
 
We hope that Issue 1 can be addressed in an SP for 2021 because some users will finish their projects with that version. I’m not sure if you should fix Issue 2 :). Because currently it gives the better number for the customers. But it is very confusing too because WallAreaGross is calculated differently (along CenterLine). Well, I think you should fix that to avoid confusion and the customer has to use some Object variables to get the numbers of Left/Right edge of the Wall.
 
We know that you expected to get a better description how the "WallAreaNet" should be calculated. But because of the fact the formula is calculating areas along the center line it probable can be kept simple and just give the section area along the center line. However, the plan is to provide sketches for the function/options for 2023 that also contain information how are things calculated if you have a more complex closer profile.
 
 
PS: I'm wondering if the new function/options are also calculated depending of object texture or if it is really based on the "real" geometry. 		Christopher Graye
VB-176665

Convert Hybrid symbol into group: screen objects become 3D

Old as ever, filed in countless flavours. Again:

Exploding a hybrid symbol whose elevation is <> 0 on design layer, turns unexpectedly the screen objects into 3D objects.

This is highly undesirable. If they were screen plane, they have no reason to turn into 3D and it does no good to us, ever, to have them shoot themselves at 0, 0. And we don't want 3D objects floating around.

Please
* select the symbol on drawing and convert to group using cmd + K (this sym instance has elevation <> 0)
* Ungroup until you reach the 2D objects: they are 3D plane
* Make them from 3D plane to screen plane

They shoot themselves at document origin.

If the symbol instance on drawing was at layer plane, they would become layer plane.

Expected: what's screen plane, stays screen plane. 		Rick Berge
VB-178247

Select Similar tool broken in SLVP Annotation

see [^2021-04-22 11-12-51.mp4]

OR
* open [^a5_v2021.vwx]
* double click to enter SLVP's Annotation group
* use Select Similar tool to select all the lines, or text

notice nothing gets selected.  I tried reproducing from scratch and it doesn't happen; could be user error but it seems like select similar should work on this file.  Otherwise a minor alert would be helpful. 		Rick Berge
VB-181273

Additional settings should be shown only when 2D legacy mode is enabled

Task 2121 (deprecate screen plane and non-unified view) changed several settings so that they are now shown only when 2D legacy mode is enabled. Additional settings should be treated the same way.

1) In a unified view, the *Renderworks Background* setting in the Edit Design Layer dialog box is confusing. Show it only in 2D legacy mode.

2) Make the *Set Renderworks Background* command available to Fundamentals users. In 2D legacy mode, apply the command only to the current layer. (Similar to the *Set Lighting Options* command.)

3) In a unified view, the options to *Reset Renderworks background for all layers* and *Reset lighting options for all layers* in the Set Spotlight Rendering Options dialog box are confusing and unnecessary. Show them only in 2D legacy mode. 		Josh Loy
VB-181349

bad user experience with boomerang mode view tools

bug video [^2021-07-28 11-39-22.mp4]
* un-maximize Vectorworks
* use the pan tool - left-click-drag the cursor outside of the window
notice it keeps panning as the mouse leaves the window.  It works this way when you hold space-bar and left-click-drag as well (boomerang pan)
* now middle-click drag to pan (boomerang pan as well) and drag the cursor outside of the window
notice panning stops when the mouse goes out of the window.  This should work like the first scenario.

Also, this problem exists with Ctrl+middle-mouse-drag to flyover.  (using the first mode of the flyover tool and left-click-drag, however, works fine.) 		Josh Loy

VB-178770

VB-179556

Select Similar Tool: cmd+c creates ghost objects

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

Like its shown in the video, do the following steps to reproduce the problem:

Select the group like its shown in the video and go to edit mode.

Activate the Select Similar Tool and select / use the attribute Class in the Tool Preferences.

With the Tool active, select one of the Symbols like its shown in the video. It should be 120 Symbols shown in the OI.

Afterwards press cmd+c (with Mac).
The ghost objects will be created, but won't stay permanently in the drawing.

As a last step, still with the Select Similar Tool active, click again in one of Symbols.
Now the ghost objects will stay permanently inside the group, every time that the Select Similar Tool is active. 		Rick Berge

VB-183522

The screen at the top is standard, and at bottom is retina. I opened VW on the top screen. Moving to the bottom screen, all but the first control point disappears. VB-181861

Symbol Insertion tool randomly switches to third mode

Occasionally when double clicking a Symbol in the Resource Manager to activate the Symbol Insertion tool, the tool will randomly switch to the third mode (Symbol Pick-Up) instead of the first mode which it was previously on (Standard Insertion). This issue has happened intermittently for years.

I'm positive that I'm NOT hitting the "U" keyboard short to cycle through modes. Something else is happening.

I don't know what other circumstances contribute to this bug - I've been trying to figure it out for a while with no luck. So I figured I'd finally file in on JIRA so at least there's an entry for it. 		Rick Berge
VB-179732

CreateCustomObjectN() creates at layer elev but Symbol() creates at Z 0

How to run this test:

Open the bugfile;
Set layer "Design Layer@0" active; run script "CreateCustomObject() Z-test".
Set Layer "Design Layer@12_feet" active; run script again.
Set layer "Design Layer@-12_feet" active; run script again.

Notice that Z insertion values are neither document zero nor layer zero (either of which would have some logic) but rather the Layer Z offset. This means if my layer z is 12' the object gets inserted at document z +24'.


This makes no sense (I almost said "zero sense" :)); CreateCustomObject() should default to local layer zero. Or rather this should be fixed with CreateCustomObjectNew-2().

This is such odd behavior (and so easy to run across) that it seems it could be a regression. But who can say? It's kind of a jaw-dropper. 		Rick Berge
VB-183970

Can't snap to a DL reference VP in a SL VP in the annotations

In the attached files the file 20010 - Model has design layer viewports of the other files.  In the sheet layer that you open the file too, AS 101 Architectural Site Plan, you can't snap to the site in the viewport annotations.  You can after you edit the design layer through the Viewport and then exiting, see video. Josh Loy
VB-181503

KLS: Components has different words for architectural and landscape objects in german

I have a localization bug here with version 2022. In German you would use different words for "Component" for arch. and landscape objects. For wall, slab and roof (roof face) we would use components = Schalen. But for hardscape, landscape area and site model you have to use components = Schichten.

Using the word Schalen for landscape objects sounds funny in german and gives our customers the impression, that we know nothing about landscaping.

I tracked it down to dialog Vectorworks.vwr/Strings/WallSlabRoofDialogs.vwstrings. Please double this dialog for landscape objects or s.th. else.

Meanwhile I try to use Components = Schalen/Schichten (or singular component = Schale/Schicht) in this dialog, which is a workaround, but not a real solution.

We had this problem also in 2021, but there it was only hardscape and we postponed it to 2022. Now we have three objects. So, s.th. must be done here. Thanx. 		Christopher Graye

VB-177225

Splayed Wall Caps dont show correct attributes if changed after insertion of Windows/Doors

Hi Guys, 

A user has reported this issue and I have tested this in house and it would seem it's an issue with the attributes of the wall being set/changed after the insertion of a window or Door. The caps don't update. 

Please see the example file and video of the process and showing the issue. 

If you change the attributes of the class the wall is assigned to, this doesn't come through to the caps. However, if you take the window out the wall and reinsert it takes on the changes. 

Let me know if you need any more information 

Many thanks 

Helen  		Christopher Graye
VB-182887

DataVis wall feature "Use Object 3D Attributes"

When a wall feature is associated with a wall component (instead of <Object> or <None>), it receives a DataVis override as if it were part of the wall component.

However, we currently ignore the "Use Object 3D Attributes", which should break this link in 3D views. Currently we do not have a good way to represent an object that gets different DV overrides in 2D vs 3D. 		Christopher Graye
VB-176582

gSDK->CreateSlab break SDK rules

SDK functions that modify or create drawing objects should never automatically add undo primitives. Christopher Graye

VB-177380

SBE: VWStyleSupport is missing "By Class" member variable

Class VWStyleSupport is missing a parameter for "class is by style/instance". As of VW 2021 there are SDK functions G(S)etClassByStyle, but there is no member function in VWStyleSupport that actually allows to set/get this value. It does not make sense to handle this flag unlike all other style variables of a PIO. This is inconsistent and is likely to cause bugs. See also VB-177366. Christopher Graye

Please see attached file "Sample12649.vwx" and screenshots.

You can see that there are three issues.

In 1) the edge of the wall is distorted.

In 2) some panels are missing.

In 3) a part of wall is protruding from the roof.

VB-183486

.laz Point Cloud file shows as corrupt on VW 2022

I tried another, smaller, .laz file "VA-WV-MD_FEMA_Region3_UTM17_2012_000140.laz" from the same GIS site and VW 2022 imported it correctly.

I have no way of telling if "USGS_LPC_VA_FEMA-NRCS_SouthCentral_2017_D17_17SNB35500250.laz" is truly corrupt or if VW does not understand the file format completely.

The site where I downloaded the files is: [https://www.arcgis.com/home/webmap/viewer.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgismaps.vdem.virginia.gov%2Farcgis%2Frest%2Fservices%2FDownload%2FVirginia_LiDAR_Inventory_Downloads%2FMapServer&source=sd]

VB-183911

Geolocation User Origin placement inconsistency...

If Doc Geo settings > Adjust origin ...to match doc coordinates is NOT selected, a User Origin WILL be placed when Geolocating.
[Note; in this scenario when Geolocation/IO is subsequently adjusted - the User Origin is preserved.]
If Doc Geo settings > Adjust origin ...to match doc coordinates IS selected, a User Origin will NOT be placed when Geolocating.
[Note; in this scenario when Geolocation/IO is subsequently adjusted - a User Origin is still not inserted.]

In the attached file 2022SP2[RC4]-latlongNOTset.vwx, the site was found by placing a GIS Stake object and using Set Geolocation to known values in the OIP. Observe how when Geolocated to the S/W crn of the GeoImage (E:323,000, N:5,814,000) a User Origin IS placed (preserving the map grid). Note also, the Doc Geo Settings are switch on automatically (as one expects).
In the attached file 2022SP2[RC4]-latlongSET.vwx, the doc geo lat/long is defined prior using the same known values as above. Observe how no User Origin is automatically generated. Subsequently, when the geolocation of the same file is adjusted using the Geolocate Tool from the GIS toolset, a User Origin IS NOT placed. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-183363

Zoom / Pan: objects jump position

The file is from 2020 and the problem happens with both 2021 SP4 and 2022 SP1.

When zooming or panning, the objects jump position.

Objects display also changes every time that we move the objects to a different location.

If the objects are copied to a new empty file, the problem will not happen in that new file, hence this seems to be file specific. 		Josh Loy

WorksheetInVPsNotSelectable_v2021.vwx was exported back from 2022 SP2 B3.

VB-178746

Column PIO needs reset after setting Height

This bug is linked to a bug reported by Computerworks.

Column PIO needs reseting or setting its Height field (parametric field names: ОА Height and Struct Height) after changing the Bounds constraints. Resetting the Column PIOs manually updates those fields.

I have attached an example file reduced from the original user's file in the linked bug.

Please see video from the linked bug for more details.   		Christopher Graye

VB-184442

Texture Positioning issue on Export MVR with 3DS backing

The attached VWX file has multiple objects with the same texture applied.  The object's texture  has been scaled, rotated, and offset to be positioned correctly in Vectorworks.  When this file is Exported to MVR with 3DS backing, the offset values seem to be lost. 

Export to ESC does not have this issue.  If the image found in the texture/scene folder for the ESC file (LDI 2021 TEST0) is used in the MVR, the issue will be fixed (that may not be important).

Same results are seen using Vectorworks 2021 and Vectorworks 2022, not issue brought on by a recent change. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-177584

Revit import: all layers import at elevation "0"

In Revit, Design layers don't really exist, but there's a system of "levels" to place object on the right heights. These levels can be viewed in 2D due to a horizontal section view. The levels are imported in Vectorworks as design layers.

The strange thing with the added document is: all imported layers are imported at an elevation of "0", all objects get their correct height by z- heights and bottom offsets. This is a very nontransparent and confusing way to get your document in Vectorworks. I don't have Revit on my computer, so I have to guess how this document is originally build up.

This issue can have 3 different origins:

- The Revit user crated all levels at a height of "0" and adjusted his object manually with a bottom offset and adjusted manually his cut heights to get the right plan view. This is very unlikely, because it is a very confusing way to work in Revit as well. But if this is the case, of course the Revit user himself is to blame and this Jira issue shouldn't exist. (off course, all pronouns can be replaced by the female or any other equivalent)

- This is just how the import is designed to work, levels import as design layers with an elevation of "0", no matter what the height of the levels is in Revit. In this case, this issue should be an Enhancement Request.

-This is a bug (general bug or specific for this document, I can't compare). In this case, this issue is placed right here.

Tech support was not able to answer all of my questions about this issue, That's why i'm not sure yet this is either a bug or this works as designed. you are the last station for me to get some answers.

In the attached video, this issue is explained between 1:00 and 2:05 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-177790

Excel import - different results with different Os settings

I found that the formula +*=IF(B6 > 100;"large";"small")*+ is imported differently on diff. machines.  In one case it is a formula, but in the other, it is the result itself.

I think it depends on Os settings. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-180561

Selecting the color picking in the interactive color properties adds the color to your document

This issue is very minor, but logged because I don't see it being useful in any way.

 

Steps:
# Open a new document
# In the attribute palette select the fill color picker
# Notice there are the document default colors
# Open the Vectorworks preferences dialog
# Select the Interactive tab and select the Interactive Appearance Settings...
# Select a few items in the list with different colors
# Close all the dialogs with either OK or cancel
# Open the fill color selection again

_Notice that the color that was already set has now been added to your list of document colors.  Unless I'm missing something this seems to be doing nothing but adding clutter to an open document._ 		Josh Loy

VB-180224

If the PDF file generated by "Export PDF" is opened with Acrobat Reader DC on Mac and printed, the characters in the print result may be garbled.

If the PDF file generated by "Export PDF" is opened with Acrobat Reader DC on Mac and printed, the characters in the print result may be garbled.
The garbled characters change depending on the combination of fonts and characters and the ON / OFF of the Subset fonts option in the Export PDF dialog.
By the way, the result of opening and printing with "Preview" of macOS or "Acrobat Reader DC" of Windows is not garbled.

Example of font and character combinations that have been confirmed to be garbled:
Font: "Hiragino Kakugo Pro W3" - Characters: "Numbers", "Alphabet", "Hiragana"
Font: "Arial" - Character: "Hiragana"
Printer and app used:
Printer: Canon iR-ADV C5255F
app: Acrobat Reader DC (Continuous Release | Version 2021.005.20048)

Reproduction method:
1) Open the sample file "12596.vwx". Characters exist in the worksheet or in the group where the worksheet is converted by "Convert to Group".
2) Execute File> Export PDF ... from the menu.
3) Export 2 patterns of ON and OFF of Subset fonts option. (Settings other than the Subset fonts option remain the default settings.)
4) Open each of the exported PDF files with Acrobat Reader DC on macOS and print them.
5) As a result of printing, the characters are garbled. And as a result of comparing with the Subset fonts option ON and OFF, the garbled characters are different.
Also check the "Print PDF of Subset fonts_ON.jpeg" and "Print PDF of Subset fonts_ON.jpeg" which are the photographs of the printed matter.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Josh Loy
VB-177030

Interactive Appearance Settings Color Picking Issue

Please watch the attached video to see the issue and how to replicate it. The issue is that if you select a new Interface Element while in the Color dropdown for another Interface Element, the current Interface Element's Color gets applied to the newly selected Interface Element. It may be worth noting that this could be a more generalized issue across Vectorworks if there are other similar interfaces. Josh Loy
VB-178366

Reshape Tool: endpoints are not shown

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When using the Reshape Tool, the endpoints aren't displayed.

If the objects are copied to a new empty document and use the Reshape Tool in that document instead, there the endpoints can be seen and used.

This problem comes from a Customer of ours with 60 Licenses. 		Josh Loy
VB-176578

Ambient Occlusion renders inconsistently

Not sure why, but I'm getting different results on successive renders of the same viewport, and it seems to be the Ambient Occlusion aspect, and only on certain objects. See the attached screenshots. The lower portion of the render is the same in the two images, but the header piece (in green) produces noticeably different shading in one render versus the other. None of the render settings have changed from one render to the next, nor has that geometry.

The one with less AO shading would be considered the 'incorrect' one based on how it usually renders.

I've encountered this issue or something like it periodically since 2021 came out, and perhaps older versions as well? So I don't think it's a fluke in this file, but I'm also not sure the exact scenario that's causing it...

This particular viewport has some Data Vis applied as well, but I've had similar AO irregularities with regular Renderworks renderings too. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-183988

Corrupt light symbols changes rendered VP

Beta tester submitted a file where his viewport  (shown when opening this file) will not render in his set up iso view under any render style other than shaded

VB-182069

Spotlight: Duplicate along path - No Preview for Lighting Devices

Hey guys,

when using the "Duplicate along path..." command it doesn't show the preview whend duplicating Lighting devices.

Please see attached Video.

VB-176772

Invalid colors for the lighting device don't diaplay as white

Place a lighting device and point it at a surface. Enter R-26 in the color field.
Render the light, it should be red.
enter R-123 in the color field and the light still renders red, it should be white.
Any invalid color, or if the color can not be found the color should be considered white.

This is important especially for stacking colors and for dealing with colors that are new.
R1234 should render white
R26+R1234 should render as R26(red) 		Kevin Linzey

In the attached file 2022SP2[RC4]-SnapGrid.vwx, navigate to: Tools > Origin > User Origin, and select 'Set User Origin to match the Geo. co. system'. Observe a UO is placed on the map grid origin and the grid lines change (as expected), but one cannot snap to the new Grid until the file is closed and opened again.  		Josh Loy

VB-184448

- "Accelerate graphics" is checked ON in the Vectorworks preferences
- You create a viewport with this wall visible in it

You will see that the hatch doesn't rotate with the viewport. I consider this behavior incorrect, because:
- When you disable "accelerate graphics" the hatch does show rotated (as it should)
- When you print the or export the sheet layer to PDF, the hatch shows rotated as wall (no matter the graphics setting at that moment) 		Josh Loy

VB-179912

Cannot remove list browser item image after one is set.

Cannot remove list browser item image after one is set. It is only possible replace it. This is an issue in the existing list browser implementation.

This is an issue in the criteria dialog where it would be ideal to be able to remove an image when changing the interaction edit control type for a column item that has an image already set. If this is not possible, it would be useful to have the ability to set a column to the original default settings it had when it was first created.

This criteria dialog issue was fixed by use of a workaround, changelist 602198, implemented in criteria dialog code; VB-179858. 		Ian Lane
