VB-182406

ConnectCAD: Localization issues

Socket R orientation was not localized at all – key = “orient3”, file = “cCADSocketObj.vwstrings”

I noticed that signal types descriptions from connectCAD_Data/SignalTypes.txt were localized. However, the ConnectorTypes.txt descriptions were not localized. The description can be localized I think but if they are localized for signals, they should be localized for connectors too, as both are visible in the UI

The socket symbols in the default content (skt_txt_L, skt_txt_*, skt_con_*) and the terminator symbol should not be localized, since we still do not have a better way to implement this.

Strings like “%02d” should not be localized, as this is a string format that represents a floating point number with a precision of 2 digits. The same goes for “%s”, “%d”, “%f”, etc.

We have some placeholder strings in the localization texts, such as “<NumSys>, <make>, <model>, etc.” (all placed within <>) which are placeholders for replacing and should not be localized. If it is not possible to not localize these and we should use %1, %2 or %s (even though these are meaningless in the string and do not help in understanding the context), let me know so that we can take care of this. 		Ian Lane
VB-182393

The units for perimeter and area are not localized in OIP

 

Draw a rectangle

Notice that the units don’t have square brackets 		Ian Lane

VB-182538

Oval Marker Icon Too Tall For Pulldown Controls on Windows

2. Select Dimensions tab.
3. Click Custom... button.
4. Click New... button.
5. Enter new dimension standard name, e.g. "new".
6. Click OK.
7. Click Edit...

Ian Lane
VB-179015

[UI Review][T02195][Win Only] Texture List Browser should be hidden under certain cases

The Texture List Browser (along with its search field) should be hidden when:
* *An object without texture part* *is selected*. (e.g., a Subdivision, a group, a 3D symbol) Currently we still show the list browser -on both Mac- and Windows when these objects are selected.
* *When the Attribute Mapping Tool is targeting on texture.* On Windows, you still see the list browser while the AMT is targeting on a texture. On Mac it is fine.
* *When no object is selected.* On Windows, the list browser always show regardless of user selection. On Mac it is fine. 		Rick Berge

VB-179006

Hiding and Showing the navigation palette does not remember user selection

Steps:
# In a new document close all the palettes
# Select Window > Palette > Design Layer Palettes
# Repeat the previous step for Classes
# In the Navigation Palette, right click in the tab area
# Select Hide
# Select Window > Palettes > Navigation

_Notice all the palette tabs appear.  This is a disconnect with the term hide.  Using the word hide implies you are hiding it in it's current state.  But I don't see a way to get it back in it's current state._

_An analogy of this term would be if I hide a browser window from my desktop into the task bar, then when I bring it back up, my open pages are gone and I'm met with a homepage instead.  This is what seems to be happening here._

_If this is expected behavior, I would suggest removing the term hide and replacing it with remove._ 		Ian Lane

VB-183718

Vectorworks fails to assign label legends brought in from Lightwright

In Vectorworks, open the attached .vwx file.

Look at Floor Unit#1 (UID 2656.1.1.0.0), it's label legend is "C.F. 12"

Do a "complete export on exit"

Launch Lightwright, connect to the .xml file

Look at Floor Unit #1 in Lightwright, see the Label Legend is "C.F 12".

In Lightwright, edit the Label Legend for that light to "CB Add/Cir". This is the name of an existing label legend in Vectorworks.

In a text editor, open the .xml file and notice that the new label legend has correctly been assigned to the light. Close the .xml file.

Click on Vectorworks, it will process the .xml file, leaving it mostly empty.

Look at Floor Unit #1 in Vectorworks, the label legend still says "C.F. 12". Vectorworks read the .xml file, but it did not assign the incoming label legend.

This is easily reproduced, and is not new to this build. My customer reported it using a released version of VW 2022.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-183648

SDK (and possibly more) GS_GetToolPt2D does not account for user origin in 3D view

In Top/Plan, with a user origin, GS_GetToolPt2D and GS_GetToolPt3D return the same values and ignore the user origin (which agrees with other various getters and insertion methods).

In Top view, GS_GetToolPt2D will shift according to the user origin, while GS_GetToolPt3D behaves as expected.

I believe the behavior of GS_GetToolPt2D is a bug. While only retrieving 3D tool points is an easy workaround, this could easily lead to bugs with tools and PIO insertion. 		Josh Loy
VB-177257

Data visualisation in section viewports with renderworks not working

In a Renderworks rendered section viewport, data visualisation by materials is used to alter wall component textures.

When the section viewport render method is set to OpenGL, the texture alters, when the render method is set to any Renderworks setting, it isn't.

 

Section viewports are used to create elevation views for projects, so this makes this issue important. 		Justin Hutchison

Note that this causes the perspective view to display in an oblique projection, making it really hard to navigate.

The same thing happens in past versions.

VB-176698

Exiting edit group with Text tool active, leaves orange border visible and requires refresh

-Double click the text inside to edit

-You'll notice the orange border is dismissed
-Double click the Group at the bottom to edit
-Double click the text inside to edit
-With the Text tool active, click the orange, "Exit Group" option in the upper-right
-You'll notice the orange border is not dismissed and requires a zoom in/out to refresh the drawing

VB-184498

VS: GetClosestSide fails on poly segments whose type is not corner

The Vectorscript routine vs.GetClosestSide, according to the documentation, should accepts polygons and polylines, test a point, and return the closest poly side, bu
* on polygons: works perfectly
* on polylines: only works on poly segments whose type is corner

Please open the attached test file and test the scripts.
You will see some polylines with loci placed on one of their segments.

On segments of type Arc, Radius, Cubic and Bezier the routine will always return 6-6, which is its -funny- way to tell you it failed. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-183468

Best Performance: Hatches are misaligned in rotated Walls

Hi Vectorworks

Hatches with the property that they rotated in walls are misaligned, if the viewport is rotated. This relates to the problem with the navigation graphics "best performance". If I zoom on the sheet layer, the rotation of the hatches in the walls are correct, also when I export the layer as PDF. It would be nice when the viewport shows the suitable view on the sheet layer. So it would not so confused for some customers.

Thanks for testing.

Best regards, Denis 		Josh Loy
VB-184169

*Hash local mapping length Post-Edit Crash - TMFCPopupDlg::WindowProc

[https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?crashId=7931373]

[https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?category=106286&build=619242-vectorworks-win]

https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?category=106286&build=622317-vectorworks-win

 

Attached are the Customer Crash Logs and .DMPs.

The Customer informed us that after editing the Hatch local mapping length, Vectorworks crashed when clicking back on the drawing.

By giving a size of Zero, got a warning that the size must be bigger than zero, which is WAD. Afterwards has given a size of eg. 0,3m and clicked back on the drawing causing Vectorworks to crash. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-184243

Atribute mapping behaves unusual after changing scale

While using the attribute mapping tool, if you change scale and then try to move your image (texture) it moves with and offset and each time you click and drag the offset becomes bigger. 

If you exit the attribute mapper and then select it again this offset disappears the tool behaves normaly 		Justin Hutchison
VB-183420

gSDK->GetObjectCube returns a cube that includes in it 2D label objects

gSDK->GetObjectCube returns a cube that includes in it the 2D Label, when used on Space PIO. This leads to major issue when using this function to determine the bounds of a Space. 2D Labels should not be included in 3D bounds. Only 3D geometry. Labels can be placed outside the boundary of a Space (as shown in MinMaxPoints2.png). 

For further reference please see attached VW file and screenshots, that show where the Min and Max points for the cubes are relative to the spaces. 		Josh Loy
VB-183509

Polyline Opacity applied to individual segments when assigned a dashed linetype

See attached screenshot and file. The polyline has a dashed linetype applied to it, and the object is set to 50% opacity. However, Vectorworks seems to be applying the opacity to each individual segment of the polyline, rather than the overall object. This leads to the unsightly appearance of dark splotches where the segment points overlap, instead of a uniform 50% value. Josh Loy
VB-177967

Export / Publish PDF shifts PDF on design layer

user has a file with a PDF as the base plan reference of his file on the design layer.  When the user exports to PDF or publishes to PDF the imported PDF base plan shifts.

Rasterizing the PDF stops the shifting. 		Josh Loy

VB-184225

Method which rotates Ovals should be revisited

I found this while working on code cleanup.

Method SpinAsPolyline does not look to be safe. It takes an object of kOvalNode type and converts it to kPolylineNode. This handle is passed by reference and presumably can be used after return.

This method is used only at SpinObjectManUnld for ovals under some conditions.

It would be good if an engineer who has better understanding of the case can look into this.

Maybe this code is obsolete and can be rewritten. 		Josh Loy

VB-184089

KLS: Project Sharing loses. data (older files)

Customer has this misfunction already one year, but until now it was not possible to save one project file with missing data, one workfile with missing and one with complete data.
But those files do have the disadvantage, that the failure already have happened and I have no way to reproduce it.

That's the reason for the report in which is not really a bugrport but asking for help.
Customer is working with 2019. I know, in older version of Vectorworks there have been many undo bugs, which could now in 2022 and also 2021 been corrected.
But customer says that the misfunction is still with 2021 SP3. Okay, maybe the failure came into 2021 when converting those old files? Maybe customer should have revised those files first? But how?

Files HOB-06__VW19_pccad31.vwxw and HOB-06__VW19.vwxp do have missing data. See pink revision cloud for missing dimensions.
File HOB-06__VW19_pccad42.vwxw does have these missing dimensions. But there is no way to these into the project file. It seems, that the project file already have received them but lost somehow. Guess that is the reason that a newly created workfile has 10 MB less size.

The problem disappears if a new project file is created.

Customer says that he has this problem 1-2 per week (project with the most errors). It seems to affect all project of that customer. Maybe something with workflow or hardware?

Project Sharing via SMB. Project file is on a central server (NAS), working files are local on Windows.

I hope you have possibilities to look into files and maybe you habe had customers with similiar problems and could give me some advices.
Tolu Fapohunda

Z_87_Mirroring extrude along path delete the other objects visibility

VB-184130

VS command "AssociateLinearDimension()" does not work.

VS command "AssociateLinearDimension()" does not seem to work.

Why does the script below not associate the created dimensions with the selected symbols and PIOs

(line 33)

The dimension are created and seem to be correct, but when I select a dimensioned object and move it, the associated dimension does not move with it

I have attached a VW 2021 file that contains the script, "Dimension Test", and selected Lighting Devices to dimension.  I get the same results in VW 2022

{Line 1} PROCEDURE AssociateDims;

TYPE
AnObject = STRUCTURE
ObjHdl :HANDLE;
X :REAL;
Y :REAL;
END; \{AnObject}

VAR
ObjArray :ARRAY[1..10] OF AnObject;
Obj :HANDLE;
ObjCount :INTEGER;
Index :INTEGER;

BEGIN
ObjCount := 0;
Obj := FSActLayer;
WHILE Obj <> NIL DO \{Fill ObjArray with selected objects}
     BEGIN
        IF ((GetType(Obj) = 15) | (GetType(Obj) = 86)) THEN
            BEGIN
                ObjCount := ObjCount + 1;
                ObjArray[ObjCount].ObjHdl := Obj;
                GetSymLoc(Obj, ObjArray[ObjCount].X, ObjArray[ObjCount].Y)
              END; \{IF ((GetType(Obj) = 15) |}
        Obj := NextSObj(Obj);
     END; \{WHILE Obj <> NIL}

     FOR Index := 1 TO ObjCount DO \{Place Dimension from X=0 to Object X}
        BEGIN
            LinearDim(0, ObjArray[Index].Y, ObjArray[Index].X, ObjArray[Index].Y, 24, 0, 770, 514, 1);

{line 33}    AssociateLinearDimension(LNewObj, FALSE);
         END; \{FOR Index := 1 TO ObjCount }
END;
RUN(AssociateDims);

  		Rick Berge

VB-180604

Section viewport option unavailable on rotated clip cube

When a clipp cube is rotated, the 'Create Section Viewport' option is not available on the clip cubes top plane. It is available on the other faces of the clip cube. 

Create a clip cube -> make sure it is selected -> right click on the top plane -> Create section viewport is there (see screenshot 'Not rotated')
Rotate the clip cube using the vertices on the z-axis -> right click on the top plane. -> create section viewport is gone. (see screenshot 'rotated')

  		Josh Loy

VB-177886

Resizing grouped Viewports by click and drag & resizing rotated rectangles

In Vectorworks 2020 and older, it was possible to group a single viewports and use the groups vertices to change the size/scaling of the viewport within the group.

VB-176614

Extracted planar polygon does not match 3D parent, rectifies itself if extruded

When a planar 2D object is extracted froma 3D polygon, the resulting 2D object does not coincide perfectly with its parent object.

I have attached a file where the client has imported a Flexijet3D siurvey. He extracts the imported polys to create VWX objects for planning. Very often, the extracted 2D planar objects do not match their parent primitives. Once, this 2D planar object is extruded, the discrepancy rectifies itself.

This is not so much serious as it is irritating because it gives users the impression that VWX is imprecise. It also creates A LOT of support traffic because our clients use digital laser surveying equipment more often these days. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-176935

Landscape Component Material rendering affected when Tile Fill used.

Observe the attached 'LS Component by Material.vwx'
Component 1 of both the Landscape Areas is set by Material.
The Material used on the left uses a Hatch Fill.
The Material used on the right uses a Tile Fill.
Observe - Component 1 using a Material Tile Fill is not rendering solid.
[Note: if the subject Material Fill is changed to a solid and/or a hatch, Component 1 will render correctly (solid). When the Material Fill is subsequently reverted to a Tile Fill, Component 1 may retain the correct visualisation and render solid.] 		Justin Hutchison

VB-183803

wrong Class override

Hello
we received the attached file from a client. Project was made in v2021.
If you open it with 2022 and you updates the Viewports, you may notice that the lines around doors and windows are in magenta. In the original project there is an override to the class "muratura" to render the pen in black. This override is not considered in version 2022 so the pen is rendered with the wrong color.

I attached file v2021. 		Rick Berge

VB-183641

Undoing Texture Mapping Operations Disables Repetition

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a solid with a few per-face textures applied.

To reproduce:

-Select the object and activate the Attribute Mapping tool
-Click on the front face as shown
-In the Render tab of the OIP, change the texture mapping in any way
-Switch back to the 2D Selection tool
-Now Undo the mapping change

Note that this causes the face's "Repeat Vertical" and "Repeat Horizontal" options to become disabled in the OIP, so the texture now only shows one repetition.

The same thing happened in VW 2021. 		Josh Loy
VB-179944

Worsheet recalculate fonction requires viewports to be updated

Hello,
In VWX2022 SP1, when I recalculate a worksheet on a sheet layers, this is force all my viewports to be updated, even tought nothing has changed in those viewports.
This issue is only in 2022 version, not in previous version. 		Rick Berge
VB-183619

Export to PDF: TBB outer sides are cut off

Attached are 3 examples: ISO A1, ISO A2 and ISO A3.

The example Title Border Block has an outer line that is part of the printable area, but its cut off after exporting to PDF.

To reproduce the problem from the scratch do the following:

1. Open a blank new document.

2. Create a new Sheet Layer.

3. Go to File > Page Setup and select "Choose size unavailable in printer setup" and use for example ISO A1.

4. Select the Title Block Border Tool and use the Style provided in the attached files as example, but with US Arch NCS 02 the outer line was also not present in the PDF Export.

5. Make sure to have "Fit to Printable Area" selected or the same ISO as the Page Setup. Result will be the same. Press OK to close the Dialog.

6. After setting the TBB, export to PDF.

Attached are 3 PDF's, showing the results with ISO A1, ISO A2 and ISO A3. 		Josh Loy

VB-183564

Redraw Problem when Removing Texture Overrides within Test File

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

 

-Open test file 

-Select the solid addition and render in Fast Renderworks

-Right click the Face Override texture and select "Add Decal..." from context menu then import an image, etc. 

-Right click the face texture again (Cloth Purple Polyester...) and select "Remove Texture Override"

-Click 'Yes' in the dialog that pops up

-Note the decal is still visible. If you pan or draw a rectangle then the geometry update properly.

Shaded edges render incorrectly when zoomed out

When Lee turns on edges in Shaded mode, they render incorrectly when zoomed out. He says zoomed in look is OK. Added files to bug.



"Note the difference in resolution when zooming. I understand that more lines get closer to each other, but three observations:
# In a VP, with OpenGL and Hidden Line, the lines are much sharper
# In Enscape, the “outlines” can be adjusted by percentage to thicker or thinner – much like SketchUp
# Other VW users don’t seem to have this problem when they share their screen when watching VW Webinars.

 

Here is as much information as I can find. I hope it helps. I have two monitors at the recommended resolution of 1920 X 1080

 

Device name           leeCALISTI_2018

Processor                Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E3-1270 v5 @ Quad Core HT 3.60GHz   3.60 GHz

Installed RAM         32.0 GB

System type            64-bit operating system, x64-based processor

Video Card              NVIDIA Quadro P4000 8GB, 4DP

RAM                        32GB (2X16GB) 2400MHz DDR4 UDIMM Non-ECC

 " 		Justin Hutchison

It should say "Point Cloud" (with a space in between), like many other strings. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-183527

"Remove Texture Override" on Render tab of Object Info Palette fails, requires "bump"

-Open attached test file rendered with Fast Renderworks
-On the Render tab of the Object Info Palette, right click on, "Wood Flooring..." and choose, "Remove Texture Override"
-You'll notice the texture isn't removed from the object
-At the bottom of the Object Info Palette, click the, "Update" button and the texture still isn't removed
-Zoom in/out on the drawing and the texture is removed
-I don't see the same issue when the drawing is rendered with Shaded mode 		Justin Hutchison
VB-183480

Tangent Snap doesn't work inside Extrudes

When editing the profile of an existing Extrude, tangent snaps are non-functional.

First, I'm unable to draw a line starting elsewhere that snaps to the tangent point of an arc/circle.

Second, drawing a line that starts on the end point of an arc seems to let me draw the line tangent to the arc only if I hold the Shift key, but even then it doesn't display the Smart Cursor cue nor the dashed extension line.

Screen recording of these two issues attached.

I noticed this in 2021. Now that I'm also trying it in 2022, I see that the tangent snap button is just disabled entirely when inside Extrudes.

We need to be able to edit the 2D geometry within Extrudes the SAME way we that can outside of extrudes, including having full tangent snaps. 		Josh Loy
VB-183379

texture tool on walls update error

Using the texture tool on a wall - set to object mode.

When I use the first mode and paint a wall with a different texture it shows in the object info as having worked but doesnt change on the drawing.

Doiing something like rotating the texture causes the texture to update but not doing a re-render..

I have set all parts of the wall to 'from overal' 		Christopher Graye
VB-182685

Notification system problems caused by Tools system

Recently we had reports about selection not being properly reflected in OIP.

See VB-180639, VB-180811. Problem appears sometimes, and I was not able to reproduce it.

Sometimes immediately after VW started I saw tools not reacting. For example, I selected the Rectangle tool, but was not able to draw a rectangle until I clicked on a palette and back on the drawing. Maybe related. 

Today I caught such situation and found that reason for notifications being ignored is fSuspendUpdate == true in TNotify::UpdatePendingRequests.

This flag is set in TNotify::NotificationHandler on kNotifyBeginToolMode.

My guess it could have been caused by CL 557761. Maybe some extra begins not followed by ends. 		Josh Loy
VB-183429

All my snap settings are enabled in the snapping, classes, and layer palettes but I can't snap to geometry in referenced viewports in 3D views (Screen Aligned plane) Josh Loy

VB-183395

Wall Components lose their height when moved from 2021 to 2022

I've taken a look at the attached file for a while and haven't been able to figure out what could be happening here.  The attached Vectorworks file works well in 2021, but when it's opened in 2022 the wall components don't follow the wall's height.  Remaking the walls (or using an entirely newly made style) seems to work a bit better, but it would probably be easiest for the user to continue working in 2021 in that case.

This was reported by user Julia Putman, [putmanjulia@gmail.com|mailto:putmanjulia@gmail.com] in case we need to reach out with any updates.

VB-183149

Fine turning renderworks camera doesn't always update in real time.

Steps to duplicate this.
-Open the attached file.
-Notice you have two viewports
-The viewport on the right is created via Renderworks camera and they
have remain associated.
-Double click on the Viewport, on the dialog select the "Camera ".
-While in Camera View, click on "Fine Tune Camera View" in the Object Info
Palette
-Change the "Focal Length" from 15mm to 35mm, notice the view changes.
-Instead of clicking "Ok", click "Cancel" notice the view doesn't revert back
to 15mm, it stays on 35mm. It will revert back to 15 if you click ''Fine Tune Camera Again"


I have attached a video capture for additional information. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-183350

VS documentation does not reflect change to GetPartInstanceName() command

The VS command GetPartInstanceName() was updated in VW 2022 SP1 to correct a spelling error. The current HTML Script Function Reference documentation shipping with the software and the online Developer Script Function Reference do not reflect the change in spelling of the command and both still show "GePartInstanceName()".

See *VB-182161 - New VS function "GePartInstanceName" misspelled* (FIXED)

The documentation should have been updated when the function name spelling was corrected. 		Vladislav Stanev

It is important for the Customers that the exported colors are exactly the same as in Vectorworks. 		Josh Loy

VB-183025

Chain or series quotation

Hello,

Could the orthogonal or diagonal quotations be improved for chain or series quotations?

 


2 possible points of improvement:
- When we have a chain dimension, when we want to quote the height the possibility to put suffix/prefix/note, puts it on all the dimensions so not practical. It should be possible to annotate the chain quotations separately.
- In the same principle why when everything is drawn in 3D, the height of door or window is not automatically set if we want, for example by adding it in the object info palette

thank you 		Rick Berge
VB-182477

Edit Viewport Camera not "Activating" camera automatically

See these threads:

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/44463-camera-activation-via-viewports/]

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/56398-viewport-camera-automatically-activated/]

When editing a RW camera via a viewport, choosing the Edit Camera option takes you to the camera object within the Design Layer context, and selects it, but it does not Activate the camera. Therefore when you make changes to the view and return to the viewport and render it, nothing has changed. I've seen this trip up users (including myself) many many times over the last few years.

You shouldn't have to manually remember to Activate it every single time. The camera should be automatically Activated when choosing Edit Camera, and in the thread Jim Wilson mentioned that this is how it is supposed to work. 		Rick Berge
VB-181204

# Open the attached file.
# Change the "Position name" of the straight truss.
# See that the Soft goods object is added to the selection

Note that this is only happening with the soft goods object. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182964

VGM Stacking on Multiview

Open file attached to VB-179137.
You can remain in Multiview or turn MV off. Sometimes turning MV on/off makes it happen sooner.

Zooming in the Top/Plan layers sometimes shows different stacking orders (objects appear/disappear) compared with final frame, which is correct (see attached movie).

Does not happen on 2021. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-178865

Renderworks image export: the object texture will be applied to components without a texture

When you render a slab with textures set by component:
- In Vectorworks: When a components doesn't have a texture applied, the component is rendered with its 2D fill color (=correct)
- When exporting an image: When a components doesn't have a texture applied, the component is rendered with the object's texture (=incorrect) 		Justin Hutchison

# In the Redshift Options sheet layer, select the bottom right viewport
# From the OIP select update
# Select the viewport directly to the left
# From the OIP select update

_Notice that one viewport shows the color and one does not.  The only difference is the right viewport has a class override to hide textures.  However the render style has render textures unchecked, but still allows to render colors._ 		Justin Hutchison
VB-180855

T02123 - Redshift Render Keeps Processing Long After Render is Complete

The attached file contains a 3D model and two viewports, one rendered in RW and one in Redshift.

To reproduce, update the Redshift viewport.

On my machine the render seems to complete around the 15:00 mark, but the progress bar still shows 0% at that point. The progress bar then keeps going for another 12 minutes or so before finally getting to 100% and showing the render as complete.

The final render looks exactly the same as the render at the 15:00 mark, so I don't think the extra 12 minutes is actually doing anything... 		Justin Hutchison
VB-178778

Specific document: Viewport renders white

One of our customer has an issue with rendering a building. If they render just one story, the result of rendering the viewport is correct. When rendering multiple stories, the rendering becomes empty or white. All stories can render on its own, a combination of stories always fails.

The problem only occurs with Renderworks, other render methods function fine.

Answer Tech support:

"Jeroen,

This file is very difficult to navigate. Once I finally got it into a top plan mode on the design layer, I turned all classes and layers to visible and then fit to objects and I see some 37 large objects 1.2 million by 2.6 million meters away from where the model is.

I suspect these objects / geometry is causing the issue you describe. You may be able to clean this up for them or have them determine what these objects are and either move them or remove them to see if the problem persists.

Even when I remove those items I am still finding objects strewn far from the model.

Regards,

Rob Nykolaishen
Technical Support Specialist"

After deleting these objects, the problem still presisted, so these objects are not the cause of this issue. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-178326

Custom RW texture on wall shifts up with door

user has a custom RW texture to display an existing wall condition.  When door objects are inserted into the wall, the whole texture shifts up.

I found as a work around in this instance was to drop the bottom offset of the wall, that restores the texture. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-178797

Creation of animation in Custom Renderworks hangs at some point

This issue was reported by Tech Support here and reports that the cloud is unable to complete the generation of the animation and that the processing stalls after a few hours of rendering:
https://vectorworks.slack.com/archives/C0EB6GENL/p1620760272053700
I did testing on my local machines and I was unable to generate an animation using High quality and high frame rate using Custom renderworks on neither Windows, nor Mac. At some point Vectorworks just stops making progress. I tried with different Vectorworks builds and I was unable to make this work even with the latest mainline build (VW 2022). I am able to get a movie with All High settings and 1 frame per second. I think the issue occurs when there are a lot more frames to render, which I believe can be a sign of a memory leak?

Please investigate what is the reason why Vectorworks is unable to produce a High quality Renderworks animation at a higher frame rate.
I also received the attached Cinerender error dialog - I believe Cinerender has crashed during one of my rendering attempts. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-177882

Soft shadows and shutters

Place a lighting device

Focus it on something so you can see the beam circle when rendered

set one or more shutters to a value such as 20

The shuttered edge has a hard shadow

right click on the instrument and select Edit Light

check Soft Shadows

Rerender the scene

The shutter shadow no longer shows

VB-176739

create viewport causes creates cut off model view in design layer

there was an old bug, of the model getting cut off in design layer.

I've caught how the bug is created.

steps:

open test file

Menu command/ create viewport

set viewport to any sheet

without updating viewport (this will trigger bug)

return to design layer 1st floor

render in opengl

notice model view is cut

try using the walkthrough tool, and notice model cut away from view

 

this bug can be avoided if after creating viewport - render viewport in any render mode other than OpenGL.

 

history - this file was converted from an older vw file 		Justin Hutchison

bug video [^2021-07-19 17-10-50.mp4]

# In a new document without selecting any buttons or actions, select Vile > Renderworks style > Redshift Exterior Fast
# Take note that at the top there are no recent render styles listed if the renderworks style menu
# Once the render finished, select edit > recent commands > Redshift Exterior Fast
# Once the render finishes navigate to view > Renderworks Style

VB-178324

Vectorworks appears to force video card to high usage when not needed

When testing this I used an application called GPU-Z to track the sensors of the video card.  The readings you will see in the attached video were unique to Vectorworks.  Other applications that forced high usage of the video card allowed the card to return to a more relaxed state.

 

Steps:
# Open the attached file [^Ski_Lodge_OpenGL_Test_2.vwx]
# Once everything is loaded, take note of the current graphics performance
# Create a new render style using redshift
# Uncheck all features in the options tab
# Render in the design layer using the new render style

Notice that once the render finishes, the card continues to be used as if it's still working.  For me (without screen recording) it would jump 1500MH on the GPU clock speed. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-176867

skylight breaks hatch pattern

user reported that his shingle hatch is not appearing in his viewport.

I found that if I removed the skylight from the roof face, the hatch returns in the viewport.  inserting any skylight in this roof face will remove the hatch from being rendered in the viewport.

User is in 2020 but I found this issue is in 2021.in a new blank file, which I have included.

Create roof face, apply roof texture to top of roof. Cut section through roof and see the hatch show up in viewport.  Go back to the design layer and add a skylight and the hatch will not render in the updated viewport 		Justin Hutchison

VB-178107

Render progress does not restart after a render has finished

Steps:
# Open the attached file [^Render Test.vwx]
# With no objects selected, select the zoom to selected objects in the top bar
# In the resource manager double click the render style (redshift render mode)
# Wait for the render to finish and take note of the time
# Scroll in and out with to trigger another render

_Notice the time it took to render, plus the idle time gets added to the start of the new timer. [^2021-04-16 10-50-55.mp4]_

 

_NOTE: I believe this is a change between the last two mainline autobuilds, as I don't recall seeing it in the last autobuild._

 

_NOTE: You can reset the timer by changing to wireframe and back to the render style_ 		Justin Hutchison

VB-179894

Crash updating SLVP--Vectorworks crashed while updating the viewport in the attached file

Steps to reproduce the issue:

2. Click update for the selected viewport.

VB-179772

VGM issues - Some Surfaces Change Colors

see simple problem [^simple.mp4]and bug file problem [^investigation.mp4]
* the problem is that planar objects are brought forward (to address coplanar z-fighting with surfaces) too much for this file.  Changing the offset number too small may introduce z-fighting.  Maybe there could be a SetPref secret or a Shaded Preference to allow user to control the number ?

 

ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION:

There is a Blue Polygon, the orange "Glow Glass" texture of a wall component and the "Glow Glass" texture applied to a 3d Polygon that bleed through when navigating.  For instance, depending on the view:

1) The blue polygon on the site will override the slab that is above the polygon.

2) The "Glow Glass" texture of a wall component which is on the inner face of the wall will appear to be on the outer face of the wall.

3) The "Glow Glass" texture applied to a 3d Polygon is not part of the Slab above it but it will appear to be on the top of the slab.

 

This has been happening for some time in this file.

Thank you. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-181992

T02121 - Convert to Lines/Polygons Places Objects on the Layer Plane Instead of the 3D Plane

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2021 compared to 2022. The file contains a single solid.

To reproduce, in each version:

-Go to a Front/Back/side view
-Select the solid and run the "Convert to Lines" or "Convert to Polys" command using any render mode

In 2021, note that the resulting objects get placed on the Screen plane so that they align with the current view.

In 2022, note that the objects get placed on the Layer plane.

There are existing workflows that require the "Convert to:" objects to be aligned with the original objects in the current 3D view, so ideally these would get placed on the 3D plane that's aligned with the current view (in this case the "Screen Aligned" plane). 		Josh Loy

VB-181946

"Adjust Flipped Text" doc pref vs viewport pref leads to bad results

Let me first say that any time Vectorworks exports a PDF that looks different than what we see in Vectorworks, this is VERY BAD. This leads to errors that aren't caught before distributing documents.

In the case of this bug, it's possible to end up with a PDF that has upside down or backwards text, even though the text looks correct in Vectorworks. This bug has existed for a while and has caused great headache recently.

Here are the steps to reproduce, which can be seen in the attached screen recording:
# Have the Document Preference "Adjust flipped text" turned off.
# Have a Sheet Layer Viewport.
# Have some text in the viewport Annotations, then mirror the text with the Mirror tool. (This bug only affects text in Annotations)
# The text appears correct on the screen.
# Export a PDF. The text is in fact flipped in the exported PDF. This is very bad, and since it's different than Vectorworks, it's very easy to miss this error.

An underlying cause is that viewports have their own "Adjust Flipped Text" preference under Advanced Properties in the OIP, which seems to conflict with the document preference of the same name.*

If a viewport has "Adjust Flipped Text" on, I would assume this supersedes the document preference. Alternatively, an argument could be made that turning off "Adjust Flipped Text" on a Document level should disengage it globally. Either way it needs to be consistent, but right now it's not. Vectorworks displays it one way and exports it another, and this should be fixed.

 

BTW, if I uncheck "Adjust Flipped Text" for the viewport as well, then the text is accurately displayed as upside down or backwards and I can see that it needs to be addressed manually. However, this should not be necessary, as viewports always default with this setting checked, so it's easy to end up with errors.

 

*As an aside, the UX of having these two conflicting settings is confusing, and it's hard to interpret how or what takes precedence. This should probably also be addressed with a VE. Perhaps the Viewport  "Adjust Flipped Text" setting could have the options of On, Off, or Use Document Preference (which should be the new default). 		Josh Loy
VB-182123

error on installer's ReadMe

On the ReadMe of the installer, under System Requirement, I read:
h3. Operating Systems

We strongly recommend using the most current maintenance release of the operating system.

macOS 10.15 (Catalina)

macOS 10.14 (Mojave)

macOS 10.13 (High Sierra)

macOS 10.12 (Sierra)

as I know 10.12 to 10.14 are not supported;

 

under Minimum Hardware Profile

Hard Disk: 10GB free disk space

I have 25 Giga free and the installer refuse to install VW

 

Processor: Intel Core i5 or AMD Ryzen 5, or better

MacOS can run only on Macintosh, thus Intel or ARM "Apple Silicon" processor.

 

Hardware Requirements for Project Sharing Server

System: 

Windows Server 2012

Windows 10 64-bit

macOS 10.15 (Catalina)

macOS 10.14 (Mojave)

macOS 10.13 (High Sierra)

macOS 10.12 (Sierra)

It is true that the 10.14 and previous can be used?

  		Tim Ardoin

VB-180638

Rotation When 2D Plan Rotated

In the attached file...
# Select any of the Lighting Device instances
# Click in the open space following the angle given in "Z Rotation" in the OIP.
# Enter "+90."  (Fixture will rotate as-expected and the rotation value will update.)
# Select the entire "Z Rotation" value and enter "90."  (Again, the fixture will rotate as-expected and the rotation value will update.)

Change the Rotate Plan value to "-90."
# Select any of the Lighting Device instances
# Click in the open space following the angle given in "Z Rotation" in the OIP.
# Enter "+90."  (Fixture will NOT rotate as-expected and the rotation value will become "-180.")
# Select the entire "Z Rotation" value and enter "90."  (The fixture will not rotate at-all and the rotation value will become "0,")

A Video Screen object is also included in the file to show that the issue affects objects other than Lighting Devices. 		Josh Loy

VB-178364

PDF size increases after first export

Hi Guys, 

We have a user reporting inconsistency with PDF sizes and we can replicate this. 

When you first open Vectorworks and the file if you export the sheet (VP01- Footpath 108), it exports as 3.6mb. However if you then go and export again, without changing anything the PDF comes out as 11.1mb. For some reason there is a considerable increase in size with no change to the document. 

Please find attached the users file and also PDF tests. 

If you then close Vectorworks down and relaunch it will export the PDF as 3.6mb and then anything after is 11.1mb again. 

Best Wishes 

Helen 

  		Josh Loy
VB-181131

EPSF Export: transparency is lost

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When exporting to EPSF an object with transparency, the transparency is lost.

When testing with 2020 SP6, it worked correctly and the transparency is saved in the EPSF file created by the export. With 2021 SP4 transparency is not kept in the exported EPSF file. 		Josh Loy
VB-177558

Click-Selection Fails on Symbol Instances After Copy-Paste Between Documents

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few 2D/3D Symbol instances that contain a Floor and a Pillar.

To reproduce:

-Attempt to click-select the symbols

Note that it works fine at this point.

-Now Copy the symbols
-Open a blank file and Paste
-Try to click-select again

Note that now the click-selection fails. It'll stay this way until the symbol's edit mode is entered/exited.

This only seems to happen with these two object types.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Josh Loy
VB-179159

Smart Points - Draw horizontal/vertical extensions checkbox is broken

Smart Points
Draw horizontal/vertical extensions checkbox is broken

Uncheck "Draw horizontal/vertical extensions", and notice those extension lines are still emanating from smart points. Compare with prior versions.
Josh Loy

VB-177991

Bitmaps Can't be Selected in Edge-On Views When Clip Cube is Active

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Bitmap object on a 3D plane.

To reproduce:

-Go to a Front/Back view and try to click-select the Bitmap

Note that it works fine when the Clip Cube is disabled.

-Now activate the Clip Cube
-Try to select the Bitmap again in a Front view

Note that now it can't be click-selected.

I don't see this problem with PDF Page objects.

The same thing happened in past versions. This also happens in 2022. 		Josh Loy

VB-176151

PDF Export: roads displayed on top of trees

1. Open the attached .vwx file

3. Open the result with a PDF reader (Bluebeam, Adobe, etc.)

The roads are displayed on top of the trees. 		Josh Loy
VB-181344

Export PDF: data volume increases with tiles in rotated objects

Hi Vectorworks

By a PDF export with tiles, these are calculated for the bounding area of the object. This is a Problem, when the Objects are rotates. An example: a wall with the length of 100m is rotated with an angle from 45°. Consequently is the area from the bounding box ca. 70m x 70m. In this area are the tile calculates. This has an effect on the data volume.
In the attachments are two exports:
Ohne Titel 12 = 27.6mb (with tile)
Ohne Titel 13 = 11kb (without tile)

I attach also my test file.

Best regards, Denis 		Josh Loy
VB-177304

Greyed out layers not appearing on PDF exports

When I export/publish to PDF, any objects on a layer set to "Gray" visibility doesn't appear at all in the PDF. Josh Loy
VB-179070

Shell Object Disappears After Being Moved

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Shell object placed far from the document origin.

To reproduce:

-Draw a marquee around the Shell to select it (this is needed due to the bug reported in VB-179068)
-Run the Modify/Move/Move command and move it any distance

Note that now the object disappears in static views and is only visible while navigation is active.

This is a regression from 2021. 		Josh Loy

VB-180610

VP Annotations: Erroneous snaps when inside group w/ "Show Other Objects" turned off

Have a sheet layer viewport.

Go into annotations.

Have geometry that's in a group.

Enter group.

Make sure "Show Other Objects While in Edit Modes" quick pref is turned OFF.

The SmartCursor still snaps to the invisible geometry outside of the group. This is inconsistent with how this typically functions elsewhere and is undesirable.

VB-180053

Gridlines disappear in Viewport

User submitted a file where daily random gridlines will vanish from their viewports.

User mentions that they have to select each viewport and toggle the Grid 3D layer invisible and back to grey to get all grids to reappear.  In many cases doing so loses the viewport formatting of the gridline.

In the attached file, we tested this on sheet  A1.04 RCP.  I could see upon opening that sheet layer that only a few gridlines were visible.  I navigated to the GRID 3D to see all the gridlines were visible.  I chose Grid 14 as it was not visible in the viewport and could see that its instance was not set to be visible in that viewport.

Navigated back to sheet layer A1.04 and in the OIP toggled the GRID 3D layer to invisible then back to grey.  All the grids showed up.  Navigated back to the GRID 3D layer and chose grid 14 again and can see its instance is now set to be visible in Viewport A1.04

User will toggle the layer off and on in the viewport and all will work for a while, but when reopening the file a day or two later, the visibility has changed back to missing random gridlines. 		Josh Loy
VB-177022

Hi there,

I have a file from a german customer who has 75 licences of Vectorworks. This customer creates his own columns with solids, auto hydrid, symbols and so on.

In this file one column shows no snapping point and I cannot figure out why. Please have a look.

Kind regards, Klaus Lüttch 		Josh Loy
VB-181881

Walkthrough Tool looses feedback

When using shift and option with the Walkthrough Tool, we used to get feedback on elevation and view angle. This was a really quick and easy way to make sure the view you're looking at is accurate. In 2022 Beta 6 these do not show up. Josh Loy
VB-177855

Deform fails at certain angles (PR 10059658 )

The customer has created an exterior circular stairway with a 27'4" outer radius and 33.34° sweep.  They want to extend the outer railing several feet along the sidewalk as per building code. The extension is shown on the .vwx. It must be extended along a curved path, the same as the curve of the outer handrail of the stairs, which has a 27'4" radius. It would cover a sweep of about 2.51°. They have sent 2 screenshots which may be of help.  The first image shows the path (in red) they would like to bend the extension to. The second picture shows the extension from a front view but it is straight, not bent.

The process of bending using the bend option in the deform tool seem to work for this object when bending at severe angles greater than 45° but not for smaller angles. 		Josh Loy
VB-176479

Maxon: Fill color changes lag by doing two renderings

Blank document, draw a sphere, choose FastRW.  Change fill color.  You will get two renderings one with old color then another with new color.

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-176481

Maxon: Progress renderings show black background

Instead we should apply a pale green (or gradient for perspective projection) that doesn't affect alpha blitting.  Alpha channel should still be 0 for background pixels.

 

Another way to do this would be to blit draw pad background image as if it was an image background. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-177723

Crashing on start up with multiple screens

Vectorworks is crashing on start up.  This issue seems to only be happening on Windows laptops when Vectorworks is starting up on a screen which is plugged into a dock.

This issue seems to be happening after the Windows 10 20H2 update.

The only way around this is to set the laptop screen as the main display in the display settings and let Vectorworks open up on the laptop screen.  Once Vectorworks is open, it behaves as normal.  The user can unplug the dock and plug it back in without issues when Vectorworks is open. 		Ian Lane
VB-180579

Search in the color selection does not appear to work correctly

Steps:
# Open the attached file [^EmptyFilesWithColor.vwx]
# Select the color swatch from the attribute palette
# Notice right above the color swatches is a search bar, type "793" into it

* _Notice there is a 1 at the other side of the search field as if it found a result (there is an L-793 color)_
* _Pressing enter removes all search elements and you cannot search again_
* _The forward and back are not operational_
* _The list is not filtered down to show the results_
* _The search field appears only on the Mac platform_ 		Ian Lane
VB-181739

Texture is incorrect when using a texture right next to the previous within the resource library

Steps:
# Open a new file and create a simple extrude
# Switch to a 3D view and change to the shaded render mode
# Enable the texture tool and select the apply by face mode
# Select the extrude if it's not already selected
# Choose a texture and apply it to any sides you see
# Once all sides are applied, undo all the texture applications
# Deselect the extrude and change the texture of the texture tool
# Go to apply textures on any of the same sides

_Notice the texture gets applied using the previous texture, but in the OIP, it shows as the correct texture._
Note: There may be a condition that only some textures show this issue.  In my testing I used Brick Stnd Running 01 and Brick Stnd Running White. 		Rick Berge

VB-181368

Center Mark for Regular Polygon tool in 2022

In 2021 Center Mark tool is not possible fo regular Polygon tool
However in 2022 it allows to place center mark on regular polygon tool. But object will not highlight when placing or mark is not constrained to object
Not sure which version is having a correct behavior.
If 2022 allows center mark for regular polygon then object need to show red highlighting and also it should constrain to object. 		Rick Berge
VB-180276

Boundary Path Mode Creates Excessive Vertices on Longitudinal Line

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few loci that can be used as snap points to create modifiers (a second file's also attached with the modifiers already created).

To reproduce:

-Activate the Site Modifiers tool in Pathway Path Mode
-Draw an object as shown, using the red locus points to snap to
-Now activate the Reshape tool in Longitudinal Profile Mode

Note that the Longitudinal line only has a few vertices.

-Now activate the Site Modifiers tool in Boundary Path Mode
-Draw another object as shown, using the blue locus points to snap to

Note that now the Longitudinal line has 90+ vertices.

It makes sense that the two would give different results based on the way they work, but ideally there'd be some background code that simplifies the profile line to keep the same basic shape while reducing the number of vertices. Users will most likely need to do some manual tweaking of these lines and that gets really difficult with so many vertices. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-176843

Graphmod 2 performance testing

As requested by Justin and Tim, I did some performance testing on my Mac with a Radeon 560 4GB graphics card.  Between 2021 SP3 build 583640 and 2020 build 583631, I saw a performance hit of about 25% to 30% going to 2022. 

These are the instructions from Justin and Dave:
       - Run the attached “FPS Testing ON” script in VW 2021 and VW 2022 (this shows FPS in the bottom-left and sets the view transition animation to 5 sec)
       - Open the test files in VW 2021 and create some saved views if there aren't any (5 saved views should be enough)
       - Activate a saved view and then Pan slightly
       - Activate the saved view again and estimate the average framerate over the 5 seconds it takes for the view transition to complete
       - Open the same file in VW 2022 and repeat the same steps
       - Record results for both versions in [this spreadsheet|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1clDsAK2G-08L5gn9pocilMSgBZUJM-JgtJiuAgFow-k/edit?usp=sharing]

Files I used are attached. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-181080

Group containing 2D symbol on elevated layer can jump to screen plane during copy

Files attached. If using new versions of VW, need to switch to legacy plane mode.

File contains:
Group with a simple 2D symbol, all on layer plane.

The layer has non-zero elevation - this is very important.

To repro:

Make sure current screen is screen plane.

Select the group and copy. The group and symbol  will jump to the screen plane.
Revert the file to saved, then make the current plane the layer plane.
Now when you select and copy, the group and symbol stay put. 		Rick Berge
VB-178080

clip cube cap edge color ignored in RW SLVP

watch video [^2021-04-15 12-19-50.mp4]

OR
* open [^a.vwx]
* Cap Edge Color to anything other than black
* update the VP

OR
* draw sphere, rendered in Final Quality RW, create SLVP
* select VP, turn on OIP -> Advanced Properties -> Display with Clip Cube 
* Cap Edge Color to anything other than black
* update the VP

notice the VP ignores cap edge color (it just uses black).   The Cap Fill color is respected.   Changing the VP to OpenGL/shaded shows both cap edge and fill correctly. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-181014

Performance issue with Viewports

Video shows everything. 

Viewport takes excessive time to update.  Noticed this in a file I've been using regularly w/o issue on previous builds.  This issue happed in that file and was then reproduced in the file (included) in which all of the previous geometry had been purged to lighten the load.

Issue 1 - Updating the viewport to reflect the new geometry takes way too long.

Issue 1 - Updating the viewport to reflect change in scale locks up Vectorworks and also severely reduces the ability for any other software functionality outside of Vectorworks.   		Rick Berge

VB-180368

Entering Bitmap crop resets Rotated Plan

Be in rotated top/plan.

Double click a Bitmap.

The view switches to the unrotated view. You can type in a new Rotated Plan angle, but you have to do this every single time you enter the crop.

This is undesirable - we should be able to crop the image in the context of the current view without it reverting to unrotated.

  		Josh Loy

VB-180321

Viewport isn't marked as dirty when texture used in class override is deleted/replaced

The attached file has a sphere assigned to a class that uses a texture at creation (brick modular). The VP overrides that texture with another (Blue Silk). 

To see the problem:

Delete/replace the Cloth Blue Silk texture with one of the other textures. The VP does not dirty. However, if you update the VP it will then correctly show the replacement texture. 		Rick Berge
VB-180176

New Snapping Palette and unintended Pan

The enclosed Video describes this.

When trying to change snapping settings using the new palette, while a tool is still active, it is very difficult to keep the drawing area from automatically panning. I guess this is because the cursor hovers outside of the drawing window and the automatic pan is initiated. 

Could this function be disabled when a settings popup is activated from this palette?

Thanks 		Josh Loy

VB-177360

Viewport shows wrong Render Result

Hi Vectorworks

The viewport in the attached file shows a wrong result. After changing something, for example: delete some other sheet layers, rename the viewport or update another viewport the result will be fine.

Best regards, Marc 		Justin Hutchison
VB-177888

Vision crash when rendering still

I was working with a customer on render still/movie issues. The render movie issues seemed like a matter of using valid settings given the show file and hardware.

However, the render still issue seemed reproducible.

While on the call, I was able to load the midsize demo file and reproduce the crash regularly. It appeared based on my tests and feedback from the customer that anytime the Texture Quality used for the Render Still did not match the Texture Quality used for realtime, a crash would occur.

This seemed to occur regardless of whether or not the "<Default>" preset was used or if "<Active Settings>" was used. Note, that when using active settings, you must customize the settings in order to allow the Texture Quality used for realtime / render still to be different.

The customer was on PC and I tested on MacOS.

I'll try to post more information in this ticket shortly. I just wanted to open this so I do not forget. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-177086

Vision - when focus is on the properties panel the user is not able to select keyboard shortcuts for navigation

Steps:
# in a new file select the add an object
# In the filter type drummer
# Select one of the drummers and insert them
# In the properties panel change the Y position to 24 and press Return to submit the changes
# Press the "X" key to change to the selection tool

_Notice that because the user in the properties panel, keyboard shortcuts appears to not take.  In this instance it's an issue as the only way to put the focus back on the viewport is to click which would insert another drummer or ignore the viewport entirely and use the side menu to select the select tool negating the use for the shortcut keys._ 		Kevin Linzey

VB-178531

GraphMod2 - Top/Plan Selection is Slower in 2022

I've attached two movies and a test file (see below link) that show this in VW 2021 compared to 2022. This test is meant to show the performance after all the geometry has been cached, so it includes a few extra steps.

To reproduce, in each version:

-Select the objects on the left in Top/Plan view, then de-select
-Switch to a 3D view and zoom
-Return to Top/Plan view and select the objects again

Note that the selection is noticeably slower in 2022 (about 5 seconds compared to 1-2 seconds in 2021). This is an extreme example with lots of objects so this slowdown isn't quite as noticeable on a smaller scale.

I'm not noticing much of a difference when selecting in 3D views so this might only affect 2D selection.

Link to test file: https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11eb1943aa23c7e489a10aa721e465bf/ 		Justin Hutchison
VB-177280

Sheet Layer Viewports no longer scale when inside group and resized with the Selection tool

# Open the attached VWX file in *VW 2020*
You will see a sheet layer viewport to the top right of the sheet.
# Select the viewport and group it
# With the Selection tool, drag a corner grip of the group to scale the group to a different size (hold shift to constrain to make the result more predictable).
Notice the viewport scales along with the group.
# Open the same file in *VW 2021* and try steps 2 and 3.
Notice the viewport shifts but does not scale along with the group.

Users have come to rely on this method of scaling viewports to allow them to easily create page layouts were specific viewport scale are not necessary.  It allows users to immediately get the viewport to the desired size to the layout.  There are no other ways to get these results quickly and easily. 		Rick Berge

VB-179605

visibility till fill in best performance

Hi Vectorworks

Is the geometry of the tile in an extra class (tile fill) and this class is invisible. The fill isn't no longer visible in an object as fill, when the navigation graphics is on "good performance and compatibility". On best performance the fill is visible until to the pdf export. For the export I need to change the visibility from the class "Tile fill" to visible, to see the tile in the export.
I think the invisible class shouldn't be a problem for export. Because in the end, the geometry is used as an image fill, thus the visibility should not have any influence on it. So primary I think its a problem of the navigation graphics?

I attached you my test file and a movie with my full steps.
Thanks for testing.

VB-177645

Symbol Insertion preview makes OIP not function when typing into a field

When using the symbol insertion tool, typically you can insert a symbol instance, then immediately change things like Rotation and Z height in the OIP while still in the symbol insertion tool, then continue inserting more symbols.

However, I've noticed there's a bug where if your cursor leaves the OIP and hovers over the drawing window, the OIP field you're trying to type into resets itself and a new value cannot be entered.

See the attached video which demonstrates the issue better than I can describe it. It doesn't matter which symbol I use or what file I'm in.

Other tools with previews don't behave this way, it seems to just be Symbol Insertion. 		Ian Lane
VB-179192

Old texture ref causes RefNumber assert while importing Hardscape styles

To reproduce import "Hardscape Paver 4*8 Bweaver" style from the default content. I attached the content file.

You will see "out of range SysName" assert.

This happens because an internal slab has fOldTextureRef != 0 and we have chain of calls:
TextureTableMapSysNames -> SetTextureRefOld -> SetDefaultTextureSpaceOld -> GetBoundsCube - > Reset3DSlab. Please, see attached Call stack.
Reset is using some RefNumbers of the parent slab which have not been matched yet.

As I can say this does not cause user problems, possibly only reverse translate problems, but worth fixing. 		Christopher Graye

I have a user who is experiencing an intermittent hang on startup. It's happening after one of my plug-ins launches a dialog notifying of an expired demo period (it does this as the menu command runs its constructor).

I'm unable to track down what could cause this on my end. I have been unable to reproduce the hang under the same circumstances. I'm wondering if this could be a workspace issue. 		Vladislav Stanev

# Once the asset is created make sure again you give the name area majority space
# Right click the render style and select edit

VB-178883

[Win Only][SOD] SOD triggers without resetting timer

This bug documents a minor time trigger bug of the SOD on Windows that has existed for a while. See attached video for reference.

To reproduce this bug:
# Enable the time trigger for the SOD in the Vectorworks Preferences dialog, set a timer
# Activate a random menu from the menu bar
# Mouse hover on a menu command for a few seconds longer than the set timer
# Quickly move the cursor onto the drawing area

Notice the SOD will be triggered immediately when you stop moving the cursor without resetting timer.  		Ian Lane
VB-178816

Pasting objects into a data tag layout places the object far from the origin

# Set the layer scale to 1/4"
# Insert a data tag in the drawing
# draw an object and copy it
# Edit the data tag layout
# Click near the origin
# Paste

The new object is far from the origin, off the screen.

This also becomes apparent if you edit a data tag, copy an element, edit a second data tag, and paste in place. Unlike symbols, the pasted object is not relative to the Data Tag origin. 		Rick Berge
VB-178687

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2020 compared to 2021. The file contains a page-based 2D Symbol and a few other objects.

To reproduce, in each version:

-Make sure the "Show other objects while in editing modes" preference is enabled
-Enter the 2D Component of the symbol

In VW 2020, note that the edit mode doesn't show the geometry of the symbol instance that's currently being edited.

In VW 2021, note that the edit mode does show the geometry from the instance that's being edited.

The same thing happens going back to SP0. This also happens in VW 2022. 		Josh Loy

VB-178457

Multiple image-based control points stop working over time in standard resolution

I'm not sure how best to provide the information necessary to track this down.

I have a plug-in with multiple image-based control points (

eCursorHandleType_Image). After a while working in Vectorworks, all but one control point stop displaying. I can still grab the control point if I can find it, but it does not display on screen.

Interestingly, if I move the window from my external monitor, which is standard resolution, to my retina laptop screen, the control points instantly appear. I can again see them disappear as I drag the window back to the external monitor.

Changing graphics performance to "Best Compatibility" made no difference. I confirmed that the image specs are the same for all the control point images.

I was not able to identify another plug-in that displaced multiple image-based control points at a time to test.

Restarting Vectorworks immediately resolves the issue.

I did notice this message in the console: 
Error in TXImage::GetImageDataFromImageSpecifier.

I was also able to reproduce this problem in a new blank file with default Truss from the Library. VB-176366

Open GL Rendering Showing Invisible

In the attached and video you can see that the truss symbol when inserted is not rendering in OpenGL.  The 3D portion is visible in wireframe in Top view but when rendered in any render mode becomes invisible.  The symbol is still present because it can be hovered over and the geometry will appear and show in the OIP.  The same thing is occurring when rendering in the 'Edit 3D Component' of the symbol.

Note: Once the file is saved and reopened in Vectorworks the problem is corrected.  Seems to occur when the symbol is first imported from the Resource Manager.  This is occurring with many different symbols but the most reliable recreation is in the Chauvet Trusst product line.  That symbol's location is included in the attached screenshot to that testing can be done.

Video attached. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-177840

Save on Vectorworks Cloud Storage reverts to Local storage if the desktop app is not running

I am logging this bug as a result of the following comment on the Forum:
https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/82048-web-view-not-working-again/&do=findComment&comment=388562

When you run the Export Web View command with the Vectorworks Cloud Services app not running, the Save on dropdown reverts back to Local Storage. If you want to export to VCS, there should be something that tells the user to wait until the Vectorworks Cloud Services app is started and the choice on the menu should be preserved, so they can move forward without having to re-select this option. If the user doesn't pay attention that the choice is reverted to local storage, it may cause an impression that Cloud storage option is not working properly. 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-177974

Error upon trying to export a data visualization

Please see the attached screen dump. One of our users is getting this error upon trying to export a data visualization: “Could not find the template to create the data vizalization resource file.”

The user is running Vectorworks 2021 US English verison on Windows.

I have tested with v2021 on my Mac and I don’t get the error.

Josepth Block has told me that he was unable to replicate the issue. After searching through bugs and previous cases, he found that this issue has come up a few times in the past and was always related to a localization issue with localized versions of Vectorworks. He suggested I could refer to these bug reports when file this report:

VB-163346
VB-168842 		Walid Remaili

I have a student's file where she has created a replica of a briefcase from the movie Inception

2 Isometric views - one in Hidden Line and the other in Final Quality

 

I tried updating/rendering all VP's and after about 45 minutes I clicked back on VW and it crashed

The file is not very large and although there are not a lot of objects in the case, it does not want to finish rendering.

 

Before the student asked me to look at the file she had already converted objects to Generic Solids but she said it was happening before she did that as well

 

I have also tried to render just one of the VP's and I get a render progress bar but after about 10 minutes the progress stays in the same place

 

I do not have a crash log as the program just seems to be rendering but nothing happens so I have to force it to shut down

VB-177739

Autohybrid used in Lighting Devices don't export to PDF

User submitted a file that will not export to PDF correctly.  The sheet layer when opening this file displays all the fixtures as expected.  When exporting to PDF most of the fixtures vanish.

I found if I switched Navigation Graphics to Best Compatibility, the fixture vanish on the sheet layer as well.  I found as a work around to add 2D components to the 3D autohybrid will bring the fixtures back in the export to PDF.

User explained this was never an issue in 2020.  I exported the file back to 2020 and without any editing of the symbols, the PDF exports matching what is visible on the sheet layer viewport. 		Josh Loy
VB-177868

Missing Instruments in Publish

User submitted a VW 2020 file where he publishes to the cloud and sees that instruments are missing.  If he publishes locally, the instruments all show up.  

I opened his file in 2020 and published locally and to the cloud and got the same results has him. 

Opened his file in 2021 and found the instruments are missing in both local and cloud publish

This looks to be similar to VB-177739 where I thought it had to do with autohybrid objects 		Josh Loy
VB-177874

Setting the clip cube via ovClipCube_RotationAngle does not work

Using the object variable to set the design layer clip cube rotation does not work. All other clip cube object variables work as expected. 

Consider the following test code and debugger outputs.

 
{code:java}
Boolean success;
TVariableBlock value;

value = (Real64) (20.5 * kRadiansPerDegree);
Real64 rotationAngle;
value.GetReal64( rotationAngle );
success = gSDK->SetObjectVariable( nullptr, ovClipCube_RotationAngle, value );  

> rotationAngle = (Real64) 0.35841365493408045
> success = (Boolean) 1 '\x01'TVariableBlock outValue;

if (gSDK->GetObjectVariable( nullptr, ovClipCube_RotationAngle, outValue)) outValue.GetReal64(rotationAngle);

> rotationAngle = (Real64) -0.85501496963842938 {code}
Here rotationAngle should match. Instead, the get retrieves the existing angle of the clip cube.
  		Justin Hutchison
VB-177058

Drawing Walls Appears Slower Process in VW2022 compared to VW2021

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

-Launch VW2021 

-Draw walls with the Wall tools rectangular mode

-Note the operation is very fast and the selection highlighting is visible

-Launch VW2022

-Draw walls with the 'Rectangular Mode' 

-Notice as you draw the walls, there is a delay compared to 2021. The more you draw, the delay gets longer. This appears as if the Selection highlighting is trying to catch up after the walls are drawn.

 

 # # # # # # # #

Machine Specs: macOS10.14.6

Processor: Intel Core i5 3.2 GHz \ 16 GB RAM

Graphics card: AMD Radeon R9 M390 2GB
h4.   		Justin Hutchison
VB-176827

Vectorworks is not supporting ME fonts in its interface (layers and classes names)

In the attachment, there is a  dwg imported vis VWX 2017. Open the attached file and look at the Layers' names. It seems that Vectorworks is not able to map correctly the Hebrew fonts. Ian Lane
VB-177601

Erroneous "Layer Plane" as current plane in Orthographic Views

Without getting into any discussion about the poor nomenclature and implementation of planes, there has been an ongoing bug in 2021 which causes the current plane dropdown to say "Layer Plane" when in orthographic views, which should not be possible since the Layer Plane is perpendicular to these views. In orthographic views it should say "Screen Aligned Plane" (and usually does except for when this bug happens). When this bug occurs, 2D Objects are indeed drawn correctly as if the dropdown were set to "Screen Aligned Plane" - it's just that the dropdown erroneously says Layer Plane.

Here are steps to produce this bug:

-Start new file.

-Go to Front view.

-Make sure current plane dropdown is set to Screen Aligned Plane.

-Hit 4, draw Rectangle.

-Hit Cmd+E to Extrude, click OK.

-Hold down control+MMB to flyover in 3D (my settings keep me in orthogonal wireframe). This causes current plane dropdown to say Layer Plane (as expected).

-Go to Front view again. The current plane dropdown still says Layer Plane. This is where it's now wrong. It should again say "Screen Aligned Plane" like it did when you first went to Front view.

 

Video attached. 		Josh Loy
VB-177513

Vectorworks hangs when attempting to create a one second movie at one frame per second

On my machine you can hang vectorworks by selecting the shape and pressing `Create Movie` in the shape OIP, then setting duration to 1 and frames per second to 1. This also causes ram usage to jump, in one instance to over 32gb. Josh Loy

This is causing an issue as in this instance elevation benchmarks need to be placed in on the design layer.  When creating a viewport of this, the text can become unreadable due to how pixilated it becomes (even after increasing the sheet layer DPI)

VB-177290

Symbol insertion preview disappears when holding shift when in Rotated Plan

-Rotate the Plan.

-Activate a symbol to insert.

-Click once for insertion point, then as you're rotating to determine the symbol rotation, hold down Shift to constrain it to your angle snaps. At this point the symbol preview disappears.

-It doesn't disappear when in a non-rotated plan.

 

Screen recording attached. Starting in unrotated plan, I first insert a symbol by double clicking, then by rotating without Shift, then rotating with Shift. Then I do it again in rotated plan to show the bug. 		Josh Loy
VB-177220

VS ValidAngStr() does not accept Compass Bearings E & W as valid angles

In the attached file, run the script "Compass Points" and enter the eight Compass Bearing points into the dialog one at a time and press ENTER. The Message Window will display the result of the function (T/F) and the value of the angle in degrees.

ValidAngStr() does not recognize E and W as valid angle inputs and it returns FALSE and 0° for both. 0° for E is correct, but the function should also return TRUE.

ValidAngStr() recognizes the other six Compass Bearing points and returns the correct angle.

See attached file. 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-180850

StripQuotes function in CriteriaInterpreter differs from one in TCriteraDialog

Not sure if this is intended or not. The two methods differ in how they handle embedded quotes. They act the same for a string with two successive embedded single quotes (xyz''bc) but act differently if string has only a single embedded quote (abc'bc). Also, the one in CriteriaInterpreter uses GetAt (I think that change was made with Unicode task).

I was thinking of consolidating the two functions but then I saw they were slightly different.

I've attached snaps of the two methods with the line that differs highlighted.

I made copies of the functions and wrote some test code to demonstrate, this is what I saw:
orig: xy'z, critInterp: xy'z, critDlg: xyz
orig: ab''c, critInterp: ab'c, critDlg: ab'c 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-181133

Criteria Dialog support-dialog excludes valid criteria node types from being listed.

Criteria Dialog support-dialog excludes valid criteria node types from being listed.

The dialog, TComboDialog, excludes some node types via a logical check from being listed for the criteria categories, Name and Location in the Criteria dialog. See TCriteriaDialog::IsExcludedNodeType. See screenshot.

Dialog code needs to be rewritten to correctly list those object types that are valid for both the Name and Location criteria functions.
# Open the test file.
# RIght click on the row 5 cell header and select "Edit Criteria..." from the context menu.
# In the displayed Criteria dialog, note that in the row 2, 4th column text edit control the name of a tile resource, Tile-1, is entered.
# Click on the 5th column icon to display the Object Criteria dialog.
# NOTE: in the displayed Object Criteria dialog, the tile resources name is not listed even though it is a valid argument for the Name criteria function.
# NOTE: this is not a regression. This has been the existing behavior for many versions. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-178417

Even if you change textures assigned to a class by editing a viewport class,Not reflected in floor objects.

Steps to reproduce.

1) Create a Rectangle.
2) Select the rectangle and select AEC>Floor.
3) Enter 100 for "Height" and "Thickness" in the Create Floor setting dialog.
4) Go to View> Create Viewport.
5) Select "New Sheet Layer" from "Create Layer" and select "OpenGL" from "Rendering".
6) Select "Right Isometric" from "View" and close the Create Viewport dialog with OK.
7) Moved to the created sheet layer. Select "Viewport" and click "Classes" button on OIP.
8) Select the class of the floor object ("None") and click "Edit".
9) Click the Textures tab in the Edit Class(es) dialog.
10) Check on "Texture" and select any texture from the pull-down.
11) Close all dialogs with "OK".
12) Click "Update" of OIP.
13) The selected texture is reflected on the sides of the floor, but not on the top.

* * For floors created by ungrouping slabs, the texture will be reflected on the top surface if the same procedure is followed.

* If you create a viewport on the sheet layer after assigning textures to the floor class in advance in the design layer, the texture will be reflected on the top of the floor.

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A 		Justin Hutchison

VB-177124

Spotlight Distributor tool auto numbering bug

When using the distributor tool to insert a distributor object that has been stored in an active file, turning on auto numbering causes the tool to forget the symbol at insertion, instead a bounding box with label is inserted.

To reproduce

create a new file and import a distributor symbol into the file resources,

activate the distributor tool

in the distributor symbol drop down choose the distributor in the active open file, not from the default library

toggle the auto numbering on

set the auto numbering preferences (making sure to tick the name field)

as soon as you exit configuring the auto numbering the tool loses resets the Distributor symbol drop down in the tool mode bar to 'Select a distributor symbol' and instead of inserting the originally chosen symbol a 2D rectangle is inserted with a label

the rectangle registers as a distributor object in the OIP but losses most of its symbol defined configuration data such as output count, output connectors, etc...

If you instead, re-select the distributor object after configuring the auto numbering the distributor object will correctly insert

I have attached a video showing the issue

 

  		Kevin Linzey

# Try to insert a truss
# Nothing appears, neither an error message - this is because the zNested Records folder and the Truss record are now not created.
