VB-177544

Spotlight Hoist: Measurement label unable to be changed in text size even if done by class unlike ID label.

Hello,
In the enclosed file and movie you will see a Hoist with both and ID label and a Measurement Label.

The ID label's size can be changed simply by going to the Text menu>Size. The Measurement label is unaffected by this. Even if placed into it's own class the label is unaffected by any class settings. This goes against a lot of Vectorworks usual workings, and appears hard coded and unable to be changed by users.

Peter 		Kevin Linzey

VB-176143

Issue when changing Mesh Smoothing to None

There seems to be an issue with Mesh objects, where switching the Mesh Smoothing in the Render tab from "Use Document Preference" to "None" has no effect.  You have to first switch to "Custom Crease Angle" then to "None" for it to take affect.

For example:

• Draw 3D Sphere.
• Modify > Convert > Convert to Mesh.
• The new sphere-like Mesh takes on the Document Preference smoothing (which I have turned on); this is indicated in the Render tab, and the Mesh looks smooth.
• Switch the smoothing dropdown to None. The Mesh still appears smooth. (In fact if you deselect and reselect the object, it's still set to "Use Document Preference.")
• Switch the dropdown to Custom Crease Angle then back to None. Now the Mesh appears with hard edges as expected.

This bug seems to only occur with Mesh objects that've been created by me (as opposed to something imported from SketchUp for example). If I were to import something from SketchUp I can switch the Smoothing setting and it works as expected. However, if I take two imported meshes and combine them by selecting both and doing Convert to Mesh, then the issue occurs since that object is technically a new Mesh created in this document. 

Video attached. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-180524

RBerge vw21DataSize sizeof(WireframeRenderOptionsVW21)

Open the attached file. You will see the assert Justin Hutchison

VB-181278

Render is working while moving a control point in 3D so InfoBar messages are not readable.

In the attached video you can see that if we use the stair reshape tool in wireframe everything is working great. When the user is moving the control point too far away, the warning icon and the red text in info bar are showing, as long as the mouse is out of range.
But in render mode, as soon as the mouse is not moving, the red message in info bar is cleared so user don't have time to read it.
It seems to be related to the render engine saying that render is done.

But while moving a control point like this, the render should "wait" for the change from the user to be finished before rendering again....

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-179769

Windows Check Box Three State Control changes state on mouse down instead of mouse up

The normal Check Box control changes its state when the user presses and releases the mouse while hovering the control. The Check Box Three State control changes its state the the user presses, but its DDX data is updated when the user releases the mouse button *while the control is hovered*. This causes issues when the user presses on the control, moves the cursor away from the control and then releases the mouse.

For example this can be reproduced in the Title Block Border Settings Dialog:
Create a TBB, open the settings dialog from the Shape Pane, open the Drawing Stamp pane; Toggling the check box there should enable/disable the controls below

 

Win only 		Ian Lane
VB-183238

[Mac Only] Floating windows show gray selection highlights instead of blue

This is an issue that appears wherever we are using standard system highlight behaviors for selected-item highlighting in containers like outline views, table views, and selection views.

Normally an active window shows selected item with a blue (or settings-defined) highlight color, and when the window becomes inactive this changes to gray.

Our floating windows are almost never considered active key-windows, so the highlighting of items in table and collection views are always gray. However if you can make a floating window key (e.g. by using an edit field in a floating OIP window) you can see that the highlighting in tables (e.g. texture browser) will change the blue.

This can be seen in the floating Resource Manager window as well.

  		Ian Lane
VB-180713

Lightwright Import Worksheet Does Not Populate with Lighting Devices

When adding lighting devices to a Lightwright file that is actively exchanging data with a Vectorworks file, the Import Worksheet that is created in Vectorworks has no import data.

Please find Video and file 		Kevin Linzey

VB-177969

When importing resources in 2021, folder are being created even the root folder is chosen as destination

VB-183635

"Shaded Polygon" requires a vast amount of memory.

Hi Vectorworks
"Shaded Polygon" requires a vast amount of memory. Try to use Shaded Polygon for any Medium oder Big Sized 3D-Model and you will see, that Vectorworks is getting slow. And it's not really possible to go on with the work fluently after updating a viewport with "Shaded Polygon".

From my point of view this render option with this amount of memory should no longer be a part of Vectorworks. In my opinion, customers who choose this render option will be 100% frustrated.

Best regards, Marc 		Josh Loy

VB-178190

DWG Import: Single DWG import should always bind externaly referenced DWG files.

This is probably an old issue, which I just saw. It is reproducible with the sequence of imports I did:

Import "Import Referenced files" folder from the DWG/DXF Acceptance test files using the batch import operation into the current document. Make sure you use Ignore Referenced files option. Check, that referenced DWG is not imported in the main file.

Now in a blank document import the main file 8th floor plumbing.dwg - the plan will be missing as 8th floor plan.dwg will not be bound automatically.

If I repeat the same procedure, but in the batch import dialog choose to bind the external references, subsequent single import will work correctly. 		Nina Ivanova
VB-178265

DWG Import: Single DWG import options dialog issue with proposed units

This is a sequence related issue and is not new. To reproduce:

Choose Import DXF/DWG and DWF memu and from the opened dialog select to import a folder or multiple files (not one). Destination does not matter. Then choose OK to close the dialog and when the DXF/DWG Import Options dialog opens, check, that the dynamic text for proposed units is set to "<Multiple files with different units>" and corresponding popup for unitless files is empty - this is the correct behavior. Now hit Cancel - batch operation will be canceled and no files will be imported.

Choose to import a single DWG using the Import Single DXF/DWG menu command and select a DWG file to import. In the opened Import Options dialog see that that the dynamic text for proposed units is set to "<Multiple files with different units>" and corresponding popup for unitless files is empty - this is not expected. If the file you have chosen is unitless, then popup should be empty, but you should not see "<Multiple files with different units>". 		Nina Ivanova
VB-180865

Extra files included with the installer

There's quite a lot of oddities in the Windows installer.

- It ships a lot of the "debug" Qt DLLs (*d.dll and everything in QtPlugins/plugins/qmltooling), which makes the download and install a few hundred MB larger than it needs to be.

- There are a lot of MSVC DLLs in the application folders, especially "Vectorworks Cloud Services".

Putting them in the application directory only ensures they will become security problems as Windows Update will not be able to keep them updated.

The installer should simply run the redist installer, as that way Windows Update can apply security fixes.

(It also makes the install go faster, takes up less space on the customer hard drive and also ensures the install actually works for everyone. The new layout of MSVC redists since MSVC 2015 has made it pretty much impossible to figure out which DLLs are required.)

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/85037-vectorworks-2022-2700-604624-sp0-beta-3-now-available-for-download/&tab=comments#comment-398788 		Tim Ardoin

VB-176419

Pathway Hardscapes not closing on closed polyline

To my knowledge, using the 'Pathway' option in Hardscape should result in a closed pathway around a closed polyline.  This is not the case.  However I am seeing this in earlier Service Packs and builds, so perhaps this works as designed or should be a VE?

 

I have included a snap shot, video, and file.  The issue is with both the Hardscape tool set to Pathway as well as 'Create Objects from Shapes' and selecting 'Hardscapes/Pathways'

 

Hardscape Tool:
* Select Hardscape Tool
* In Tool Bar, select 'Pathway Configuration Mode'
* Using any of the listed Polyline modes will get the same results
* Draw a CLOSED Polyline shape - notice the Hardscape Pathway does not completely close.

Create Objects from Shapes:
* Draw a closed Polyline using the Polyline Tool
* With closed Polyline selected, right click and chose 'Create Objects from Shapes'
* In the Object Type dropdown, select 'Hardscape'
* Under 'Configuration', check 'Pathway' (depending on size, set width to reasonable value - doesn't affect issue as far as I can tell)
* After clicking 'Ok' - notice the Hardscape Pathway does not completely close.

  		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-182039

Hardscape: border issues at non-corner segments in this case.

Attached is a file containing a hardscape: [^Incorrect_border_-1.vwx]

The hardscape's path has 2 consecutive corner vertices and 5 consecutive Bezier vertices. The corner segment is hidden (using the Reshape tool's 'Hide or Show Edges' mode) so no border should be created along it. Notice that the border has issues in this case:
!image-2021-08-25-18-00-46-306.png|thumbnail!

It seems to happen because the neighboring segments are Bezier segment. After making (changing the type of) the corner segment's immediate neighboring Bezier vertices be Corner vertices, one of the problems is fixed, the other one remains:
!image-2021-08-25-18-03-40-742.png|thumbnail! 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-176658

Vectorworks tries to call removed obsolete code when started

Steps:
# Download the attached binary to your desktop [^traceApplication]
# Open Finder and navigate to an install of Vectorworks
# Right click the vectorworks.app and select show contents
# Navigate to Contents > MacOS > Vectorworks
# Open Terminal and navigate to your desktop
# Type in
{code:java}
./traceApplication{code}

# Press space and drag the Vectorworks binary to the terminal window
# Press Enter

Notice the following entry in the output:
{code:java}
2021-01-29 12:06:39.078 Vectorworks[20054:868781] Attempt to load executable of a type that cannot be dynamically loaded for CFBundle 0x7fcff744b110 </Applications/Vectorworks 2021/Plug-ins/SketchUpWorker.vwlibrary> (executable, not loaded){code}
 

traceApplication written in go:
{code:go}
package main

import (
"log"
"os"
"os/exec"
)

func main() {
arg := os.Args[1]
command := exec.Command(arg)
command.Stdout = os.Stdout
command.Stderr = os.Stderr
err := command.Start()
if err != nil {
log.Fatal(err)
}
err = command.Wait()
if err != nil {
log.Fatal(err)
}
}{code} 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-176217

Result: The Hardscape will be filled with Line End Markers and this shouldn't happen. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-181229

Marionette Pie Chart: Data Labels are not "Outside" when set as such

The Marionette pie chart offers in its settings the option for the position of Data Labels to be either "Inside" or "Outside" - I assume "of the pie or circle".

What really is outside is the top center point of the text object, which is not what I would expect as a user and it doesn't work out so well either, because the text objects can be hidden beneath a sector of the pie chart. (see screenshot and attached file "Pie-chart-data-labels-outside.vwx")

I believe the "outside" position to be faulty right now and I propose an alternative, which would position the text object outside of its corresponding sector at any time.

For the visual explanation please watch the attached video.

Here's the text explanation:
There are two coordinates to consider:
1) The intersection of the angle bisector with the arc of the sector and adding an offset of 1/8 of the circle diameter. Let's call this point Poutside (Point outside)
2) The position of the text object (usually the center point). Let's call this point Ptext.

The coordinates of Poutside are good, but not the current alignment with Ptext of the text object.

Therefore I propose the following two rules a) to avoid interferences with the pie chart and b) to position the text object really outside:

Rule 1: when Poutside is left of the pie center point, the text object's right edge should be aligned with Poutside. If it's on the right, align the left egde.
Rule 2: when Poutside is above the pie center point, the text object's lower edge should be aligned with Poutside. If it's below, align the upper edge.
Rule 3: when Poutside is at the same x- or y-coordinates, align the text with the corresponding middle point.

This way the text object can never interfere with the pie chart.

  		Konstantin Lalkovski

-When creating a chain extrude, note the redraw issues. The redraw gets corrected with a mouse zoom. 

  		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-183251

OIP not refreshing

Open attached file in VW 2022. Update the viewport and notice the OIP "Update" button changes to "Cancel Update" as it should.

Before the rendering finishes, press "Cancel Update" and DON'T CLICK ANYWHERE ELSE.
Notice the OIP is not refreshed to show the button as "Update" again.

I put breakpoints in the notification handling and they seem to be hit, in particular in

TViewportComparator::AtLeastOneBackgroundRenderingViewport()

where it checks to return FALSE which should remove the "Cancel Update" button. If the breakpoint is HIT, then it seems to work, but if there's no breakpoint, it doesn't.

Scrolling on the OIP or clicking anywhere, EVEN ON OTHER APPLICATIONS (NOT VW) will make Windows refresh the OIP.

This happens with RW and the new non-section backgrounded HL viewports. 		Ian Lane
VB-183589

VB-182816

"Did you know" shortcuts dialog should not appear when user just used the shortcut mentioned

I see this with drag-and-drop of resource textures.

With an extrude in the main window and the Resource Manager open, command-drag or shift-command-drag a resource onto the extrude. A dialog will appear which says "Did you know there are shortcuts for this operation?"

It's kind of silly to ask if the user knows about the shortcut they just used! The dialog should only come up with other methods of invoking the command (e.g. right-clicking and choosing Apply in the Resource Manager).

  		Karthick Chilaka
VB-182706

Mac floating OIP steals main window keystrokes after text field edit

Normally floating panels do not intercept keystrokes, so that all of our keyboard shortcuts work in the main window.

After you edit a value with a text field in a floating OIP, it will become key window and keyboard shortcuts in the main window will no longer work, until you click on the main window.

To reproduce:
# Create a document with a simple shape
# Make the OIP a floating window if it is not already (drag its title bar out of docked position)
# Try some main window keyboard commands, e.g. '4' and 'x' to switch between rectangle and selection tool
# In the OIP, click to edit a text field on the Shape pane (such as shape size), then _click on an empty part of the OIP*_ to apply change and end text-editing

EXPECTED: at this point you can type '4' and 'x' to switch between rectangle and selection tool

ACTUAL: keyboard commands are no longer delivered to the main window so nothing happens when you type those.

*The issue does not occur if you hit return to complete text editing, rather than click on an empty part of the OIP

WORKAROUND: either leave the OIP docked, or learn to always hit return to end editing, or always click on the main window after editing a text field in the floating OIP.

Note that this pertains to some underlying Mac issues with floating panel configuration, key-window status, and NSEvent processing.

Only tested under Big Sur 11.6 in VW2021 and VW2022, so far.

This should also be tested with other panels that can float and have text-edit controls. 		Payne Chang

-Open test file

-Right click slab object and choose 'Edit Slab Style...'

-Click 'Edit slab attributes' button in "Edit Slab Style" dialog

I don't see this issue in macOS10.15, so this looks specific to macOS11.5.2 and Apple M1. This could be an Apple M1 specific bug, so we need to test on Apple Intel to compare. 		Payne Chang

VB-178876

The standard C-clamp in entertainment default content is not a common size

!image-2021-05-18-17-32-34-380.png!

The clamp on the left is from the default content. The next are engineering drawings for Altman (fairly ubiquitous c. 2000), ETC, and a generic aluminum clamp, which is most similar to the one included in the content.

The three actual clamps have fairly similar dimensions from the center of the pipe to the end of the stem. The default clamp, in contrast, is considerably smaller, and doesn't even quite fit around a standard 1-1/2" schedule 40 pipe. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-181718

Attributes by class at the Grade Tool

Hi Vectorworks

A little bug by the definition of the attributes at the grade tool. If I steering the tool by class attributes it works with the assignments. But when I add text style to the class, the assignment for the background color is not changing. It needs first a refresh over the attribute-palette.

VB-183858

Vectorworks incorrectly lists variable font typefaces as all Thin

Many fonts can be installed either as a collection of 'loose' single-typeface files, or as combined collection files.

You can see this for example in the Google Fonts downloads for Josefin Sans and Raleway. The downloads offer two 'Variable' .ttf files to install, or you can instead install multiple .ttf files from the 'static' subfolder.

When you install the static, separate files, Vectorworks lists all of the font faces as you would expect, e.g. Josefin Bold, Josefin Thin, Josefin Medium Italic.

If instead you install the variable .ttf files, Vectorworks lists "Thin" under all of the font faces. That is, Josefin Bold becomes Josefin Thin Bold, Josefin Medium Italic becomes Josefin Thin Medium Italic. The same happens with Raleway when you install the variable font.

This does not occur in other applications, so it must be a Vectorworks issue.

Font URLs:

[https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Josefin+Sans]

[https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Raleway]

  		Ian Lane
VB-183855

Vectorworks font list does not update when new fonts added

Preliminary: get a font that is not installed on the system, e.g. by download from Google Fonts.

Reproduce steps:
# Launch Vectorworks  with a new untitled document.
# Create a Text object with default font, leave selected
# Look at list of available fonts (check both OIP pull-down and main Text menu) - naturally you will not see the font you have downloaded but not yet installed.
# Install the font in the local machine*
# Again check the font list in the main Text menu or in the OIP with the text object selected

EXPECTED: the installed font shows up as available now

ACTUAL: you have to quit and restart Vectorworks for the new font to show up

*On Mac you can do this either using Font Book to preview and install the font, or simply by adding the font to the user ~/Library/Fonts folder.

This is probably also an issue on Windows but only checked on Mac so far. Mac OS has a notification available to detect when available fonts change, so this would be not hard to implement. (Thinking to do it as part of PLAT-119 time permitting).

Note, this is somewhat related to enhancement request VE-91304, though that is specifically about re-scanning for missing fonts during missing-fonts resolution on document open. 		Ian Lane
VB-183856

Vectorworks does not detect when fonts are removed/deactivated at runtime

This bug is the flip side of VB-183855. However it's also got a functional side (bad text-object rendering).

To reproduce on Mac, you need to have some non-standard font installed in your ~/Library/Fonts folder.
# Launch Vectorworks with new untitled document
# Create a text object and set its font to a user-installed font
# Uninstall/deactivate the font being used*
# Create another text object; open the font menu (in OIP or in Text menu)

EXPECTED: the font that has been removed/deactivated is no longer in the fonts list; also, when font removal/deactivation is noticed an alert will be shown if fonts in use in open Vectorworks documents are no longer usable.

ACTUAL: the font removed is still in the list, and you can assign it to the new text object, but it will render incorrectly (see screenshot) as will the text object created at step 2.

(Note however if you save the document and restart vectorworks and re-open it after re-installing/activating the font, the text objects will render correctly).

* On Mac you can uninstall/deactivate using Font Book or by simply dragging the font out of the ~/Library/Fonts folder e.g. to the desktop. 		Ian Lane

VB-178601

The navigation palette scrolls when using keyboard shortcuts to traverse layers

VB-183799

Spotlight: The Lock command doesn't stop Lighting Devices moving when the rigging moves

Hello,
In the enclosed file is a piece of truss on it's own layer and some conventionals on another. When the truss moves the instruments move with it. If users don't want them to move with the rigging for design purposes, then using the Modify>Lock command should prevent that. Indeed the OIP is greyed out as expected but if the rigging movies the instruments still move.

The workaround to disassociate them with the rigging is to set the Pick Radius to 0 in the Spotlight Prefs and select all the lights and use Edit>Cut. If you then use Edit>Paste in Place then they're back in the drawing and moving the truss does not affect the lights.

The Lock command should prevent the Lighting Devices from moving like all other locked objects.

Cheers,
Peter
Kevin Linzey
VB-180497

Select the Speaker Array too.

Click on the white square (which isn't showing/previewing anything) but will open the Resource Selector.

Note that there are 5 weird symbols (presumably supposed to be hidden?) but which are now visible and is confusing for users. They come in once the bumper is placed. Note that they do not show in the Resource Manager.

Peter 		Kevin Linzey
VB-179035

Callouts show no selection handles when edited in the Annotation Group of a viewport

Hello,
In the enclosed file should open on sheet 102. There's a small viewport on the right with some callouts. If you edit the viewport and select a callout note that there are no selection handles for the callout. This makes editing much harder.
The only way around it is to rebuild the file.

Cheers,
Peter 		Josh Loy
VB-177675

Spotlight + Renderworks: rendering of beams for Lighting devices unreliable

Hello,
In the enclosed file there are some focussed lighting devices with a gobo in them. When I closed the file yesterday the beams were rendered. When I opened it today they are not. I have restarted the computer in between sessions.

As you can see in the enclosed movie, using the new Spotlight>Visualisation>Set Spotlight Rendering Options the lit fog is checked. Yet now in Custom Renderworks or FQRW the beams do not render.

If you go to the Visualisation palette and select all the lights and choose 'edit' you can see that lit fog is turned on. If lit fog is turned off here, then if you go to the Set Spotlight Rendering Options command there the lit fog is still on. This should surely be off?

Still the beams don't render.

In the Set Spotlight Rendering Options command, if lit fog is turned off then on again, go back to the Visualisation Palette and edit the lights the lit fog option is rightly back on in the Properties window.

I also note that a Renderworks background is generated each time a new lit fog option is checked. Surely it should use the existing or, rather than adding endless Renderworks backgrounds that will add to the file and make it very messy for the user.

After I made the movie I repeated this and the beams appeared. I then reverted to saved, but the beams also rendered. It's as if the render was stuck in OpenGL (which it might have been). So this is why I label this unreliable as there is no rhyme or reason to why it fails.

Cheers,
Peter

PS Tried to edit and strike through this: "- if not then the user should be able to choose- " but it didn't seem to work. You can of course choose the Renderworks background.
Kevin Linzey
VB-181196

Spotlight Seating Section moves if symbol instances are edited.

Hello,
In the enclosed file there are some Seating Sections. Double click any seating bank to edit that group (Seating Layer). Take note of 1 of the seat's position in relation to the surrounding elements on the drawing. Double click it to edit 2d (or 3d) component. Make no changes and exit that component edit. The Seating Section or seats within the section have shifted position.

In v2021 SP4 [602791 ] this also happens if you just edit the symbol in the RM. However in the movie this doesn't happen in v2022 it seems.


Cheers,
Peter 		Kevin Linzey

VB-182470

Availability of Renderworks Background on the Edit Design Layer dialog

In the manual it says that the Renderworks Background setting is available in the Edit Design Layer dialog if you activate the legacy 2D features. It seems to be also available there if the features were not activated. Does it work as designed? Justin Hutchison
VB-176812

Concatenated strings Exit Bubble Layout need to be resolved into one

Steps:
* Select an existing grid line in the drawing.
* To edit the bubble layout of a grid line style, choose the existing resource in the Resource Manager in the active file. Right-click on the resource and select *Edit* from the context menu to open the *Grid line style* dialog box.
* Click *Edit Bubble Layou*t from either the OIP of a selected grid line or from the *Grid line style* dialog box if editing the style. The bubble layout opens in object editing mode.

The upper right corner shows the _Exit Bubble Layout_ square, which the user can click on after he's done editing the bubble layout. This text, _Exit Bubble Layout_, is made up from two concatenated strings, _Exit_ and _Bubble Layout_. These strings need to be resolved into a single string, _Exit bubble layout_, to avoid negatively impacting the localized versions of Vectorworks. See screenshot below for details. 		Ian Lane
VB-180000

Multiple Wall Move By Points Turns Off Endcaps

An EU submitted this problem via Tech Support. When they would go to move multiple walls by using the move by points tool, the wall caps get set to none. You can go in and change it back, but if you try to move them like that again then the end caps reset to none again. Their file was somewhat cumbersome, but I was able to recreate the issue in a blank file of my own, so I have attached that file. In my file, if you try and move all of the walls using this tool, then the endcaps don't change. If you try and move all of the walls except for the top horizontal wall using that tool, then the endcaps change to none every time. Christopher Graye

If I do several subtractions  on a slab, the one which are totally inside the bounds don’t apply in 3D > see file and screen capture attached. Christopher Graye
VB-181902

T02208 Seating Section Focus Line - Doesn't respond to 'Shift' nor does it have an Angle value in Data Bar

# In a blank Spotlight document, activate the Seating Section Tool
# Use any mode of the tool to create a boundary shape
# When Focus Line reticle appears, make first click to start
# Notice the Focus Line arrow does not respond to holding 'Shift' like the Vectorworks line or insertion tools.
# Notice that the Data Bar has no value for Angle, only X and Y.  So no exact value can be entered at this step.

The angle can be adjusted in the Seating Section Preferences after the fact, so there is a work around. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-179303

Lighting Pipe Ladder object does not use the Default Class set for it in the Settings dialog

Unlike the Lighting Pipe plug-in object, the Lighting Pipe Ladder object does not use the Default Class that is set for it in the Lighting Ladder Settings dialog at the bottom of the Object Information Palette.

These two plug-in items should maintain consistency of behavior when the same functions exist in both objects.

Apologies if I am being premature in reporting this issue. 		Kevin Linzey

This scaled symbol also shifts its origin point

VB-178437

CGSEnhancedComboBox (Win) shows dot only on one item

The dropdown button of the Create Movie dialog only shows the dot when selecting "Shaded". I don't know the meaning of this dot but this doesn't happen on Mac. As a note, Mac shows a check icon on the dropdown on the selected item.

 

Steps for testing with the Create Movie dialog:
# Create polyline
# Go to Model > Create Animation... > Create Walkthrough Path from Selection
# In the OIP select Create Movie

Make sure last parameter is set to TRUE in CreateEnhancedPullDownMenu( dialog, kPopupRendering, 40, TRUE ) of AppSource\Source\Plug-Ins\Shipping\Animation\Animation.vwr\DialogLayout\CreateMovieDialog.vs (this has been changed recently to FALSE). 		Josh Loy
VB-180839

Text: pen style can't change from class to line type

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

How to reproduce the problem:

1. Select the Group in the attached vwx file.

2. Go to the Attributes Palette and try to change the Pen Style from Class Style to Line Type. It will not be possible.

It is possible to change, as example, from Class Style to None and then to Line Type, but never directly from Class Style to Pen Style.

3. Ungroup the objects.
3.1. Select a Line and see that they are all Line Type.
3.2. Select a Text and see that they are Class Style and the ones responsible for this change to not take place.

It is not possible to switch the Text directly from Class Style to Line Type, or a group that has the same text.

Josh Loy
VB-183078

Multiview panes causing slow performance

bug video [^MOVING A SMALL OBJECT.mov][^JUST THE SMALL OBJECT ON ITS OWN.mov]

Josh noticed that Multiview might be the cause from the videos.  Justin noticed SetSels_ is slow for Mesh objects.

====ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION======

To create renderings in VW you must put in furniture. 

The only way to have good furniture is to download them. Sketchup warehouse is one of the very popular options.

But these furniture items end up becoming very big mesh objects in VW. Making it very hard to oparate. 

We now have to separate main file from FF&E to present this crash)/ 		Josh Loy
VB-182084

Steve Johnson dashPercent 0.0 dashPercent 1.0

Attached file has a bunch of problems (parent-less proxies, VB-182024 - crash, etc); this assert during file translation is one of the first that happens.
It looks like we assert that the dash percentage is in range, but never do anything about it if it isn't. The code should probably be pinning it to the valid range.

possibly we can go backward to find origins of this file and how it went wrong. 		Rick Berge

VB-181498

Spotlight Video Screen object position fields problem

The Video Screen object has 2 position fields, one for the projector and one for the screen.

The problem is that the projector doesn't update its position field if it is moved after insertion unless the hide screen option is toggled on in the object properties.

Even if the toggle is used the projector has to be manually moved in a 3D view for the field to update,
* changing the Projector Distance(straight) field will move the projector but the position field will not update.
* using the blue reshape toggle to move the projector will also not update the position field 		Kevin Linzey
VB-177541

Light with both a Point and a Light Point does not work as expected

Created a light where the body is offset from the rotational "yoke"  I added in a Light emitter to have the light come properly from inside the body of the fixture.  when placed and focused, the light comes from the Point and not the Light emitter.  

I know this may be WAD right now, but it would be great if sooner rather than later we could utilize the addition of the light emitter to properly represent lighting fixtures like this one that are out there.

 

Thanks, 		Kevin Linzey

* selection handles are only around the bounding box of visible objects.

VB-182549

Selection method results in differing desplay of Rotation in OIP of Lighting Device Objectss

In the attached file,

1. Select the six lights using the Shift+Click method. Notice the Z-Rotation is blank as we have selected items with mismatching rotations.

Deselect all.

2. Reselect the six lights using a rectangular marque. Now notice the Z-Rotation box shows a 0.00° rotation. This is incorrect.
2A. Try the Marque selection method from both the left and right directions.

If the Z-Rotation was blank in #2, try this... Deselect all.

3. Use Ctrl/Cmd+A to select all. Check the Z-Rotation again.

Though the results are inconsistent depending on the order of selection, repeating the various selection methods result in a random display of the Z-Rotation values. 		Kevin Linzey

To reproduce:

-Open the "Define Legend Source" dialog
-Click the Legend Source menu to expand it, then click the bolded "Custom Source" text in the menu

VB-183814

Hatch preview changed scale after editing

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

1. Create a new blank document.

2. Draw a rectangle with a hatch.

3. Right click the rectangle with the hatch and find it in the Resource-Manager.

4. Right click the hatch in the R-M and choose Edit.

5. Cancel to exit the edit dialog.

Result: The preview of the hatch will change scale.
This does not happen with 2020. 		Josh Loy

FS: Stacking order 2D and 3D wrong

VB-184274

Page-based widget is not tinted when it's diabled on first showing

# Activate the Data Tag tool
# Select any page-based style (currently all default content ones are). "Centerline Marker Line" for example
# Insert one object into the document
# The "Shoulder length" widget is gray like the rest of the disabled widgets. It should either be green as it is when enabled or some muted green to display both its page-based and disabled statuses 		Ian Lane
VB-182674

No warning when lighting instrument beam is blocked by instrument's texture

Followup to VB-176982.

When a texture with the "cast shadow" setting is applied to a lighting instrument and an RW Background is used with "receive shadows" set for lit fog, the beam from the instrument is completely blocked from drawing.

As far as I can tell, this is the intended behavior for this combination of settings, but it's not very intuitive (especially if the texture is applied indirectly through a Data Visualization). At least for me, it took a while to figure out exactly why this was happening. We might want to show some sort of alert in this situation.

I've attached a reduced version of the original bug file for this issue. To reproduce: switch render mode to "Spotlight (veloce)" and turn on the "Luci chiare" Data Visualization. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-183881

Lighting Ladder converted to Hanging Position disconnects all but top Lighting Device in the System

# Create a Lighting Ladder
# Attach Lighting Devices to Lighting Ladder
# Select Lighting Ladder
# Convert to Hanging Position (Note: the top Light Device is the only one with the blue Hang Point)
# Can be verified further by creating a Schematic View for the Lighting Ladder

In the video, I gave the Lighting Ladder a Position Name to show/verify the Lighting Devices were attached before converting to a Hanging Position.  Lighting Ladders don't have 'Select System Objects' in OIP, like Truss, till it is converted into a Hanging Position.  Once converted to a Hanging Position, all but the top Lighting Device lose their Position Name.

If a Lighting Ladder is converted to a Hanging Position before the Lighting Devices are attached, this is not an issue. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-184045

Workspace without Lighting Device tool shows 'double click automatically activate Lighting Device tool' dialog box

# Set to Workspace without Lighting Device tool (Architect, Landmark, Fundamentals)
# In the Resource Manager, double click on a Lighting Device (under: Objects - Ent Lighting Instruments)
# This will populate the tip message seen in the attached image. (If 'Don't show this dialog again' has been checked previously, this won't show)
# Insert Lighting Device in drawing space.
# Note - the OIP say it is a 2D/3D symbol and not a Lighting Device

I wouldn't expect that message to show when in a Workspace that doesn't have the Lighting Device tool, especially since the tool doesn't get activated and the symbol is not inserted as a Lighting Device.

Video is attached.  I checked (and see) this is 2022 SP1, SP2, SP3 and 2021 SP4; probably goes back farther? 		Kevin Linzey
VB-183768

Selecting render modes in a particular order appears to bread the render

Steps:
# Open the attached file: [^SimpleRenderScene.vwx]
# Navigate to the sheet layer and select the viewport
# From the OIP, set the background render to hidden line
# Select the Background render settings button and check the sketch option and press OK
# Set the foreground render mode to dashed hidden line
# Press Update Notice the render does not reflect the changes made, but appears broken
# Change the foreground render mode to none again and press Update
# The viewport renders as expected
# Again, set the foreground render mode to dashed hidden line and press update

_Notice that these settings were the same as step 6 but the render appears to work as expected_ 		Josh Loy

The *Chamfer Edge Preferences* dialog box appears, only that the dialog box's title is truncated because the box is not wide enough. See graphic below for context.

 

{color:#de350b}*Recommendation:*{color} widen the dialog box either manually or by adjusting the corresponding code. 

{color:#4c9aff}*Note:*{color} If dialog box titles get truncated by default because of some dialog box design parameter, this needs to be addressed for translation and localization purposes. 		Josh Loy

VB-176165

Resizing Vectorworks Window Resizes the Contents of the Window

I was working with a very simple drawing (attached) which has 10 lights on it. All I did was copy and paste the lights from another .vwx file, then I did a lot of Data Exchange back and forth with Lightwright, using Duplicate Array.

Late in the process, I resized the Vectorworks drawing window to make room for some other things. To my surprise, the contents of the drawing stretched and compressed in response to the window resizing. I was in standard Top/View 2D, Unified off. I have no idea how this happened. Quitting Vectorworks and launching it again, everything was OK. Screen video is attached. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-183882

Import PICT and Import PICT as Bitmap command produces the same object (Mac Only)

This is on a Mac Only Platform.
In the Import menu command.
You have two Import Commands for PICT images.
File->Import PICT...
File->Import PICT as Bitmap.

The Command "Import PICT..."
will always produce a Bitmap.
The only difference between the two method is a slight difference of the
image file size.

So I'm not sure why we have two commands in Vectorworks.
I have attached a video capture.
Josh Loy

VB-183162

UI: more Mac-only dropdown menu bugs

This is similar to VB-162659, only these are not context menus.

There are still a couple situations, where a dropdown menu will not show up completely even though there is enough space to show it.

For reasons of continuity within the Mac version and across platforms this should be harmonized.

These are the situations where I found this behaviour (even though it's not the same):

1) Resource Manager:
When the RM is at the very top of the screen
and any of the resource types is selected:
* Hatches
* Images
. . .
* Tiles
* Wall Styles

OR

2) Attribute Palette:
When the AP is at the very bottom of the screen
and any of the Attributes is selected:
* Line Thickness (BTW: there is NO hover tooltip compared to the others)
* Line Startpoint Style
* Line Endpoint Style

... the drop down menu is not shown completely but scrollable. 		Ian Lane

VB-183037

bug video (repro from scratch) [^2021-10-07 12-13-13.mp4]

* pan and zoom a few times

VB-182969

Object Highlighting Fails to Update in 2022 When 3D Conversion Resolution is Changed

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2021 compared to 2022. The file contains a curved Extrude object. Both VW versions currently have the 3D Conversion Resolution preference set to "Medium".

To reproduce, in each version:

-Open the VW Preferences and, in the 3D tab, change the 3D Conversion Resolution to "Very High"
-Close the dialog and select the Extrude

In 2021, note that the object highlighting and line geometry update to show the higher resolution as expected.

In 2022, note that the line geometry updates to show the higher resolution, but the object highlighting remains in its original state.

This happens in 2022 SP0, SP1, and SP2. 		Josh Loy

VB-180701

Internet Explorer option, "Display intranet sites in Compatibility View Checkbox" turns off when Vectorworks is launched

A&A brought the following to our attention.

In Internet Explorer > Tools > Compatibility View Settings > turn on, "Display intranet sites in Compatibility View" checkbox and close the dialog
-Launch Vectorworks 2021 or 2022
-After the application has fully launched, revisit, Internet Explorer > Tools > Compatibility View Settings and you'll notice the, "Display intranet sites in Compatibility View" checkbox is now turned off
-I do not see the same result when launching Vectorworks 2019 or 2020
-I tested series E and B, so it doesn't appear related to activation

VB-178921

User claims Tapered Roller Bearings show incorrect Inner Projection values

A user states that the Inner Ring Projection on their Tapered Roller Bearing is incorrect. In the attached Vectorworks file and image, they explain that the Projection should be on the other side of the object.

The Vectorworks file includes a link to a PDF that goes over the math to confirm this; it's on the link below and the page underneath that.

https://www.skf.com/binaries/pub43/Images/0901d1968094ddb3-Rolling-bearings---17000_1-FR_tcm_43-121486.pdf

SECTION 8.1 PAGE 696

I'm not entirely sure if his math is correct in this case, and how this is being calculated in Vectorworks is most likely correct. I just wanted to submit this in the event the user is correct, and it would be good to be able to fix this for future versions.

This was submitted by Francois Laroche (francois.laroche4@videotron.ca), in case we need to reach out to him in the future.

Please keep me posted if I can be of any further assistance with this, and have a great day! :) 		Josh Loy

It‘s added a search field, the texture and map type are next to each other. Scale and Rotation can be adjusted via sliders and Reset default mapping is moved down. VB-182057

Moving stories changes the Active Plane

running thru the stories test, I'm changing the elevation of one of the middle stories while using Front view. Each time I hit OK on a change, the rulers disappear until I re-select Front view. See movie.

*BUG UPDATE*: As Hernan's comment mentions, the actual bug here is that after changing the story elevation and pressing "OK" in the Organization dialog, the active plane is changed from Screen Aligned to Layer Plane. Since the active plane is changed from Screen Aligned to Layer Plane, the ruler behavior is expected (i.e., Works as Designed). 		Rick Berge

VB-178380

Video Camera set angle on insert issue

The Video Camera tool doesn't insert video camera symbols as other symbol insertion tools do, like Lighting Devices.  I included a video that first shows what I would expect from such a tool using the Lighting Device insertion tool.  Then those same steps are taken with the Video Tool.

After the first click for setting placement, the second click should set the angle.  Using three different methods, I was unable to do that correctly.
# Using the Green dashed guidelines.
# Using 'Shift' to hold an angle (Shift seems to break the guidelines)
# Using 'Tab' to set the angle value

There is a work around by setting the angle value in the Object Info Palette after the Video Camera has been placed.

 

Note: After pressing 'Shift' the Green dashed guideline is gone completely.

Video was made in Vectorworks 2021 SP3, but this appears the same in Mainline. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-181378

Request for investigation- When Marquee is selected in the Export Area in the Export Image File menu, it is exported in a slightly wider range than the specified range.

When Marquee is selected in the Export Area in the Export Image File menu, it is exported in a slightly wider range than the specified range.
Would you please investigate whether it is a Vectorworks specification or a Bug?

Reproduction procedure:
1. Since Windows is easier to understand, open the sample file "12623.vwx" on Windows.
2. Start the Export Image File menu, select "Marquee" in the Export Area and click the "Draw Marquee" button.
3. Snap to the Top Left of the Rectangle with the red line in the center of the drawing and click, then snap to Bottom Right and click. This will specify the range along the red frame.
4. Click the Save button to save the image file. Just in case, I also attached the saved file "12623.jpg".
5. Open "12623.jpg" with the "Paint" application to zoom in on the edges of the image.
6. Some of the left, right, top, and bottom edges of the image will be slightly outside the red frame. Please also refer to the screen dump "Reproduced.jpg" that shows the situation.

Also, please refer to "12623.mov" for the operation according to the reproduction procedure.
* There seems to be a difference in the appearance of the image file depending on the OS, display resolution, and zoom of the drawing. The OS of "12623.mov" is Windows 10, and the screen resolution is 1920 x 1080.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Justin Hutchison

VB-181461

Worksheet's Insert Function dialog does not remember last dialog state

When you use the "Insert->Function..." menu in a VW Worksheet, it opens a list browser dialog named "Select Function". The window always opens with the "Functions" choice selected in the "Select from:" popup menu; and the "<All>" choice selected in the second popup menu. Additionally, all of the items in the left column are expanded in the hierarchical display.

1) The entire state of the dialog should be remembered when the dialog is closed and that state should be reapplied for all dialog elements the next time the dialog is reopened.

2) The popup menus should remember which choice the user selected last and reopen the dialog with those choices selected.

3) The hierarchical display in the left column always opens with all categories expanded. The list may be long. If you spend the time to close all of the unwanted categories, they will re-expand the next time the Select Function dialog is opened, which defeats the utility of closing unwanted categories. 

4) Also, it would be quite helpful if there were two extra buttons added to the dialog to Expand and Close all hierarchical categories when they exist. This would greatly improve the navigation of the items in the longer lists.

 

To view the problem:

1) Create a worksheet.

2) Place the cursor in a cell.

3) Go to worksheet menu Insert->Function...

4) The "Select Function" dialog opens. Note the "Functions" choice is always presented in the first popup, and "<All>" is always presented in the second popup, and all hierarchical elements are expanded in the column "Function/Field".

 

See attached screen shot.

 

 

  		Vladislav Stanev
VB-181446

installation failed

Ran the installer from "Vectorworks2022-SP0-609046-SeriesBEG-installer6-osx.dmg" on top of my existing VW2022 install of 2022 SP0-build 606810.  The installation failed after ca. 15%.

Tried running it several times.  It would start at 12% and fail before 20%.  I never got the warning about overwriting the exiting folder in /Applications.  I also tired re-downloading the DMG, but got the same result.

The work around was to drag the while VW 2022 folder from Applications into the Trash and reinstall.  The application successfully installed in this manner. 		Tim Ardoin
VB-181095

Round walls are rendering incorrectly in hidden line

Open the attached file. I am seeing the attached image, which is incorrect. Josh Loy
VB-177755

Vision does not have point/line tools.

The point and line tools were removed in Vision 2022 as they were causing crashes going as far back as Vision 2019. Vision 2018 did not crash but the tools did not function either. Code investigation indicates that the point and line tools stopped working from Vision 4 onward. Their functionality in Vision 2 has not been verified, but they are presumed working.

As this is not a frequently used feature, the priority of this enhancement is quite low. Modeling should be performed in a modeling program. Vision is merely a previz-renderer for VW. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-176553

GraphMod 2 - Objects Fail to Show in OpenGL After Changing Detail Level

Movie and test file are attached.

To reproduce:

-Render in OpenGL
-Now go to the OpenGL Options and change the Detail level

Note that this causes many of the objects to disappear in OpenGL. The result will vary each time you change the view.

I don't see this on OSX 10.15 or on Windows 10 so it might be a 10.14 issue (specs attached).

This might be related to the OpenGL viewport bug reported in VB-176525. 		Justin Hutchison

The result varies every time, but note that several objects usually fail to show.

VB-176723

GraphMod 2 - Highlighting Fails on Some Objects After Undoing Move in Multi-View

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few random objects and has Multi-View enabled.

To reproduce:

-In the right view pane, switch to any 3D view
-In the left view pane, select all the objects and drag them
-Now Undo

Note that now the highlighting fails on several objects in the right pane. A few of the objects will get corrected once you de-select/re-select but others (a Rectangle and an Extrude) won't get corrected until they're edited in some way.

I don't see this on OSX 10.15 or on Windows 10 so it might be a 10.14 issue or an AMD Vega issue (specs attached). 		Justin Hutchison

VB-180595

Migration to 2022: OpenGL keyboard shortcut didn't translate to Shaded

VB-180221

Class pen color fails to apply after ungrouping a plug-in object

In short, after I ungroup a Plug-in Object and change the object's class, the class attributes only apply to some of the objects. See the attached video for a quick overview.

-Create a new class, change the Pen Style color to Red and turn on the, "Use at creation" option
-Draw a line and a rectangle
-Select both objects and in the Object Info Palette, change the class, to the class you created moments ago
-Answer, "Yes" when prompted and the object's pen color will change to Red
-Now insert a Base Cabinet object
-Ungroup the object and answer, "Yes"
-Now You're left with 4 objects, three lines and one rectangle
-Select all four objects
-In the Object Info Palette, change the class, to the class you created earlier and none of the objects take on the Red pen color
-If you had selected the rectangle only and changed the class, the pen color would turn red
-However, it's impossible to change pen color of the three lines, by changing the class in the Object Info Palette

I feel like there's a reason why this fails or is working as expected and I'm unable to remember. 		Rick Berge

VB-178812

Allow object info field to stay highlighted

This has been around a while – I know this was discussed, maybe even on the old mailing list, and had a lot of support.

Many versions ago, when you typed a value in object info and pressed return, the value would remain highlighted, making refining the value easy.

At some point, this behavior changed, and pressing return causes Object Info to stay highlighted. So technically a regression :) 

I believe from the discussion the last time came up, this was due to an update to Object Info, and not implemented by design. 		Ian Lane

VB-179047

Photometers do not appear to be updating/working properly after adjusting light values

VB-178084

Rotation lever is a misnomer on these strings

The following strings below contain an incorrect term, _rotation lever_, which should be rotation axis. Impact on localized versions.

*Current string:* Rotates so that the rotation lever selected aligns with a point on a second object. Drag to define the rotation lever. Release the mouse and snap to a third point; click to end the rotation.

*File where strings reside:* Vectorworks.vwr/Strings/HelpText.vwstrings -2153 (no context provided) 

*Recommendation:* substitute *rotation axis* for _rotation lever_ like this.
{quote}Rotates so that the rotation axis selected aligns with a point on a second object. Drag to define the rotation axis. Release the mouse and snap to a third point; click to end the rotation.
{quote}
See attached screenshot for details. 		Josh Loy

VB-178879

Not sure if this a bug, a request, or working as designed...

VB-178244

[SOD][Win Only] Keyboard Shortcut won't work when a SOD palette is active

This bug documents a minor interaction difference between Mac and Windows that has existed for a while.

On Mac, after users clicking on a tool from a SOD palette (other palette disappear at this point), users are still able to press shortcut key to switch tool. This is currently not possible on Windows.

For example:
# Users trigger the SOD
# Users expand the Standard View SOD
# Users click on a Standard View from the SOD palette (other palette disappear)
# +While the Standard View SOD is still active+, notice now on Mac, users can still press the numeric key to switch standard view. On Windows, this is not possible.

It would be nice to make this possible on Windows to create a consistent experience across platform. 		Ian Lane
VB-178532

Rigging objects need to consistently provide 2D geometry when rotated

When given a roll or hanging angle, Lighting Pipes and Ladders provide correct 2D geometry in top/plan

Straight truss foreshortens the 2D geometry with a hanging angle, so that the overall dimensions are correct, but the ends of the truss and far ladders and lacing are not correctly depicted. The exception is a hanging angle of 90. A roll stretches the object incorrectly.

Truss and Curved Truss just switch to 3D only, such that when the user needs to create a proper groundplan, they either need to convert any angled objects into auto-hybrids or cut up the viewport and apply different render modes to different portions of the ground plan.

The disparate behavior also makes the concept of rigging object harder to grasp for users. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-178015

Extra lines appearing in jogged sections on angled surfaces

I've attached a file with a stripped down set design model to demonstrate a problem I'm having with section viewports. There are some simple dormers (not using any PIOs, just 3D geometry) - they're not aligned on the north and south walls, so I'm using jogged sections for the viewports in order to cut through the middle of the respective windows.

However, this is causing extra horizontal lines to appear on the angled surfaces which are the underside of the dormer ceilings. I've indicated the extra lines with red arrows. These lines happen to be exactly where the initial segment of each jogged section would intersect (which I've indicated with the dashed red line in plan). But these lines should not appear like that. And I can't figure out how to get rid of them. 		Josh Loy

VB-176412

GraphMod 2 - OpenGL Viewports Render Black on First Update

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains an OpenGL viewport.

To reproduce, open the file in GraphMod 2 and, without zooming or panning, update the viewport.

Note that it renders as black.

If you update it a second time, it then renders correctly.

This only seems to happen when the viewport's updated before a redraw is done. So if you open the file and zoom/pan before updating, you won't see the problem.

I don't see this in Mainline so it looks like a GraphMod 2 issue.

I don't see this on Windows 10 so it looks like Mac-only. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-177667

Localization - Two strings must be one

In the Vectorworks.vwr, these two strings should be combined into one. Found in the HelpText.vwstrings file:

*String 1:* The constant radius value for the proposed fillet. 

*String 2:* Must be greater than zero.

*Recommended:* The constant radius value for the proposed fillet must be greater than zero.

 

The above error affects localized versions of these help strings. Please see Vectorworks.vwr/Strings/HelpText.vwstrings and attached graphic below. 		Josh Loy

VB-177808

Vision - UI theme does not update correctly aster suspension

This has been present for a number of years but didn't deem it worth while to bug as the use case seems a little odd.

 

Steps:
# In your mac preferences set the light and dark theme to switch automatically
# At the end of the day start Vision while the application/OS is using the dark theme
# Let the compete sit overnight (Or close the lid if a macbook)
# Wait until the next day and resume your session

_Notice that once you log back in, vision is a mix between light and dark themes.  In addition to this some elements become hard to read making the user be better off closing the application and opening it again in order to refresh the theme_ 		Kevin Linzey
VB-176292

Opacity - Line End Markers

When you lower the opacity of a 2D object with end markers, the opacity is getting applied separately to the three components (the line itself, the end marker 'pen', and the end marker 'fill') which leads to odd results as seen in the attached screenshot. The opacity should apply to the entire object, including the markers, as if it were a single flattened object. Josh Loy

VB-176563

Also note on the polyline that I can't add a dimension at the mid-point of that arc which is annoying.

Lastly, the red error message in the lower right is misleading, since it says "Diametrical dimensions can only be on circles." This is false, since they also work on Arcs and Polylines (when clicking in the right spot). Additionally, this error message says 'diametrical' dimensions even when using radial dimension mode. VB-177946

Mirror and managing focus points is extremely sluggish and I'm constantly waiting on them

I realize this is a dense file with a lot of lights...

but in the video, you'll see that mirroring two brand new focus points across the CL takes  a full 39 seconds. Is that to be expected? While working in this file, I have found doing things such as selecting, deselecting, moving, mirroring, distributing, and aligning focus points all take a long time and really slow down the workflow. In the second video, you'll see just selecting a focus point(s), there is a very noticeable pause while my crosshairs catch up to my cursor. Same issues after moving FPs. Should it be behaving like that? You can turn on other classes labeled Focus Points to play around and see if you experience the same thing. 

This is my first file using Focus points and I've been disappointed in how sluggish they are. Not sure if that is fixable or not. Since using focus points is one of the primary ways of getting conventional focuses into Eos Augmented, I'm sure I'm not the only person who will be using these more. I wish didn't slow down my work so much.  		Kevin Linzey
VB-179304

Worksheet: "=image" causes VW to use a lot of RAM (>40GB) and seems frozen

The worksheet "TAB - FENSTERLISTE" has in its first column "=IMAGE" as a function, even though no image of the windows are shown.

When recalculating this worksheet, VW starts calculating and doesn't stop while the RAM usage gets out of control. Sometimes it rises up to around 24GB and stays there and sometimes it gets much higher. In my current test it's sitting at around 46GB. If I try to access Vectorworks, I only get the beach ball (MacOS). 30 minutes later Vectorworks is still recalculating and the RAM usage doesn't change anymore.

If instead of recalculating the worksheet immediately I delete "=IMAGE" from the function cell, the worksheet recalculates in an instant.

The odd thing though is: there is another worksheet in this document (albeit with a different object list) "TAB - FENSTER" that uses the IMAGE function and it works fine and it also shows the window images. "Fensterliste ALa" is a worksheet in which I recreated "TAB - FENSTERLISTE" a few columns at a time. This new worksheet not only doesn't get stuck when being recalculated, but also shows an image of the windows.

Using 27.0.1 B1 (599272) recalculation takes about 1-2 minutes (and the worksheet still doesn't show any images). I think this still takes too long, but overall in this case a lot better than blocking Vectorworks.

Please take a look at this and see if it's something that could be fixed for SP4 or SP5. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-177306

Symbols and Worksheet Script Performance

From the Customer:

VWX version used: Vectorworks 2021 SP2 R1 (Build 574483) (64-Bit)
OS: Win 10
CPU: Intel Core i7-5930K @ 3.50GHz, 6 cores
RAM: 16GB
GPU: 2x NVIDIA GeForce GTX 980
Hard drive: SSD (system - with 25GB free memory)

File contains 6 construction levels. Construction plane-1 contains 133, construction plane-2 133 and construction plane-3 134 individual 2D symbols (colored squares). Total 400 symbols.
Construction Plane-4, Construction Plane-5 and Construction Plane-6 each contain 5 copies of the same 30 individual 2D symbols. Total 450 symbols. The file also contains a database (dummy record) with 1000 database fields (Int with default 0). The 2D symbols are linked to the database and contain three entries per symbol. (In each case Int 1 instead of 0).

Problem 1:
Selecting the 133 2D symbols in e.g. construction level 1 takes about 10 seconds! (Time until OIP update).
During the selection process, the CPU load increases from 0% to 10% (VWX App) or 1% to 3% (system-wide).
When VWX is in operation, the memory is permanently around 694MB (VWX app) or 6.8GB (system-wide) and does not increase when selected. Other running processes are Google Chrome, MS Excel, MS Notepad, MS Task Manager, other system processes.
Question: Why doesn't VWX make use of the abundant free hardware resources to speed up the selection process? 10 seconds waiting time to select 133 2D symbols while the CPU is at 3% total load is annoying.

Problem 2:
The file contains a script called "KA_Import_WS". This imports a worksheet (dummy record table) that is already in the file from the source file "WS_Source_File_v2021.vwx" and configures the filter lines of the table to the levels specified by the user selected in the GUI. The table is then recalculated. (vs RecalculateWS () - line 103). The script then prepares the table data for transfer to the OS clipboard. The script measures the time of the individual steps of the script execution and shows this after completion of the script (AlrtDialog). The table recalculation process takes a very long time, which is not really surprising due to the size of the table and the number of symbols, but on the one hand the duration of the recalculation varies from 54 seconds to 104 seconds and on the other hand, the free hardware remains of the computer in deep sleep. (Example execution of the script for construction level -1 to -3 // 400 symbols)
Question: Is the spreadsheet process to be speeded up and why does the duration vary? And as with question 1, why doesn't VWX use free hardware to speed up the process?

To configure the script:
Enter the local path to the source file in line 278. (I upload with)

You can ignore the remaining tables and scripts in the file. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-181671

Nudge of worksheet is not smooth

Previous versions worksheets would nudge smoothly, now it is very choppy and very slow. Karthick Chilaka

VB-184439

PIO's in walls are slow and getting recalculated to many times

While profiling our DEWD (Design Express Window Door) tool, some strange things came to our attention.

 

Please have a look at the screencast in attachement, the drawings used in that screencast are also attached. And the monitoring on mac for object A and C has also been added. And also a compiled version of our plug-in. If you need the source code, just let me know.

 

This might be an issue on our side, but we have no idea if or what we did wrong in our plug-in.

Also, we don't see everything that happens in VW, we don't know why several functions in VW are triggered several times and why they do take so long between calls. We don't know if this is something we did wrong in our plug-in, or if this is something in VW.

 

The issues are:
# Why is IProviderShapePane::Active() called 3 times?
# Why does an object (C) that is in a wall that's not directly attached to walls with corner windows in it, causing those corner windows (A+B) to be recalculated?
# Why doesn't point 2 happen in that stripped down file?
# Why does it take so long between a Recalculate() and the next Recalculate() or Active()? 		Christopher Graye
VB-183219

Spotlight: Exporting to MVR uses more memory and takes longer than v2021 with the enclosed file

Hello,
In the enclosed zIp file there are two files, both identical with one exported to v2021.

If you File>Export>Export MVR both versions use up a huge amount of memory. This report is to say that v2022 uses considerably more memory and takes longer to export than v2021 hence this is a regression.

2021 = 58.52GB
2022 = 90.97GB

I have advised the user to swap out the trusses he is using as I suspect they are one element of why it takes 30 mins plus to export but nevertheless there is a difference in memory and time with v2022 compared to v2021.

Snapshots of Activity monitor included.

Cheers,
Peter 		Kevin Linzey
VB-179454

T02185: Cable - Performance issue when you set Adapter Start/End

Slow performance when you set Adapter Start/End values. It takes 1-2 seconds to open the popup and 2-3 seconds after you set a value. Kevin Linzey
VB-181628

Memory leak in DMXProvider introduced with MA3Net

In Vision 2021 SP3, we reworked our DMX Providers to support MA3Net. During this process, a purely virtual class was created without a virtual destructor. This triggered the following warning in clang:
`Delete called on 'DMX::DMXProvider' that is abstract but has non-virtual destructor [clang: -Wdelete-abstract-non-virtual-dtor]`

Essentially, because the purely virtual class had a non-virtual destructor, every call to free memory for any given DMXProvider would not free the appropriate amount of memory causing a leak.

Because this issue was introduced in 260x at CL # 571694, this is a regression. The issue is still present in 270x and mainline. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-184406

Spotlight editing a cable style recalculates the cable parts

If you edit a cable style  all cable objects using that style will  recalculate is parts configuration. It doesn't seem to matter what is edited the cable objects will always recalculate their needed parts.

The only time editing a cable style should force a parts recalculation is if the cable type or connector fields are changed.

It should not recalculate if of the other settings are changed as they have nothing to do with the cable parts used by any cable objects using the style

Ideally even if the connectors and type gets changed there should be some sort of warning dialogue or option to not change the existing part configuration

To reproduce

draw a cable using any style

hit the cable configuration button and had a couple of parts to it

edit the style the cable uses, doesn't matter what is changed

re select the cable object and look in the cable configuration, it will have recalculated the parts from scratch

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-182670

Lightmap performance issues with GDTFs

When investigating the memory leak with GDTFs that was a result of the File Migrator code changes, I stumbled upon a performance issues with GDTFs.

The `m_needs_lightmap_update` boolean should only be set to true when something in the light train has changed and a new lightmap needs to be generated in the LightMaskFactory class. This is because generating new lightmaps is expensive and doing so unnecessarily causes framerate issues in Vision.

GDTFs appear to be setting the `m_needs_lightmap_update` to true every time that `DMXControlledObject::Update` is called. This happens inside of the `GDTFControlledObject::OnBeforeUpdateGdtf` method. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-183738

Web View resource hog

I've exported my model to Web View (Dropbox storage) using the lowest quality settings and no options checked, but when I try to load the link it almost locks my machine up, even if I'm using Chrome web browser. I have an iMac 3.6 Ghz 8-Core i9 with 128 GB RAM.

[https://cloud.vectorworks.net/links/11ec4398a126582a8fde0e8109945acd/]

Is there anything I can do to my model to reduce the Web View export being such a resource hog?

Test file attached. The Saved View I was using for exporting to Web View is "01-Model View" 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-177196

When moving many objects with Move by Points Tool, the move process takes longer than older versions such as VW2020.

A customer has informed us that Vectorworks is slowing down while using the Move by Points Tool.
We have confirmed the following problem compared to VW2020.
I think performance will improve if the following problem is resolved.
Also, I think that the preview function of the new feature of VW2021 depends on the performance of the PC to display many objects, but I think that should be considered separately from this problem.

About the problem of VW2021:
When moving many objects with Move by Points Tool, the move process takes longer than older versions such as VW2020.

Reproducibility procedure:
1) Open the sample file "12546_v2021.vwx". Many objects are in the selected state.
2) Select the Move mode of Move by Points Tool.
3) Click the start point position and move the mouse cursor to the end point position to display a preview of multiple objects. * This preview is a new feature of VW2021
4) Wait for the preview display process to complete. So far, no problems have occurred yet.
5) Clicking at the end point will start the move process, but it will take longer to complete the move process than before VW2020. This is the problem.

Please refer to the video "12546_v2021.mp4" of the problem that occurs in VW2021 and the video "12546_v2020.mp4" that does not occurs the problem in VW2020.
The sample files "12546_v2021.vwx" and "12546_v2020.vwx" used are also attached.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Justin Hutchison

VB-183690

This file has very slow screen redraw times in last four VW versions

The attached VW file has very slow screen redraw times for VW 2019, 2020, & 2022. It fails to open completely in VW 2021, and just hangs before refreshing the screen.

The file is saved in VW 2015 format to allow it to be opened in all newer releases. There are three design layers each with an array of 2D symbols (qty 588). Each layer contains a different symbol name. 

From VW 2019 to the present, it can take from 12 to 40 seconds to switch layers when viewing everything in the design layer. Zooming and scrolling is also affected but not to the same degree as changing layers.

See attached Excel file with times listed in seconds for each operation in each version of VW, except VW 2021, where the file failed to open completely. Typically I'd kill the application after 1-2 minutes of waiting, but I once waited over 7 minutes before aborting.

There were many VW crashes in this exercise, even after rebooting the computer to see if that would stabilize things. It did not. I am attaching three crash logs that occurred during my testing. The last word in each file name shows what I was doing when each crash occurred. VW 2022 crashed twice today while switching layers, but did not generate a crash log either time.

The number of symbols on one layer is small compared to some files I have worked on in the last few years. Symbol counts can easily exceed 3,000 per layer with 5-10 layers being common. 

For this exercise, VW 2017 proved to be the quickest and the most stable. Usually, VW 2019-2021 has been able to edit my designs, but this file has caused all of the recent versions to fail, or crawl so as to be effectively useless. I am not sure if my recent OS upgrade to OS 10.15.6 in July is a contributing factor.

Please note, VW 2015 & 2017 have nearly instantaneous screen redraws for a file of this complexity, and I consider this to be a relatively simple file. This is the screen refresh performance I expect all of the time. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-180900

Selecting a layer with a lot of elements takes a long time

This is not a regression. We have simply improved things such that this is now more evident.

The issue, imo, is that anytime an item is selected we walk all verts and calculate the min/max. This allows us to draw the selection box.

We should try to work towards caching this information so that selections are snappier.

We can probably do something similar to what we did for object transformations. We can simply dirty the min/max cache for selection box and recalculate whenever it is requested and necessary. When not dirty, a request will simply return the cached value. 		Kevin Linzey

This file is responsive on MacOS, extremely sluggish on Windows.

I had just updated the graphics driver as well. The graphics card is an NVidia GTX 950 on the PC. The client has NVidia RTX Quadro. On my Mac, the card is a Radeon Pro with 8GB. I would assume that the GTX 950 should be more than adequate to handle this (mostly 2D) file. Is this assumption wrong? The file only has 32 MB. Josh Loy

VB-183091

Enabling VGM Caching doubles file size and slows down file/computer

In Doc Prefs, checking the box to "Save VGM graphics cache" doubles the file size and slows down working with the file (and the computer in general) while caching graphics. Furthermore, enabling this feature is on by default for all new documents. It should be off by default until it's fixed.

A bit more context: the file size doubling has existed since the tool was introduced in v2021. However, the file/computer slowing down to a crawl is new to v2022. 		Josh Loy

VB-177279

Delay when creating, moving, deleting objects in a document that contains a lot of objects

We realized that there is a delay when creating, moving, deleting objects in a document that contains a lot of objects. In this case a Vectorworks user is affected that switched form AutoCAD to Vectorworks. Creating, Moving or deleting objects can take several seconds. We know the file has a lot of objects but it seems that all objects are always calculated although they are invisible.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Watch the attached movie
# Open "Testfile 20210308_01"
# Move an object
# Delete an object
# Create a new rectangle

The problem occurs on Mac and on Windows . But on Windows it is even slower. We already reported several similar issues.

VB-157268

VB-168056

VB-166974

We compared the speed with AutoCAD and ArchiCAD and there is close to no delay when creating, moving and deleting objects. Therefore we hope that you find a way to optimize the performance too. Our guess is that invisible classes and/or layers are always calculated and this slows down these processes.

 

I log this as high because it is a performance issue and offen our key customers are often affected. 		Josh Loy

VB-178348

Default Hatches Causing Vectorworks to be Very Slow and Leads to Memory Hangs

Please see the example document attached. This is a simplified version of the file that has almost everything cleared from it. In this example document, the sheet layer viewport takes about a minute to update.

If you edit section in place on it, Vectorworks will begin to hang because it starts using over 30GB of RAM (I saw it climb to 50GB before I force quit it).

After some testing, it seems to be linked to a default resource we have in our libraries. These hatches have over 1,000 layers in them. We shouldn’t have resources like this in our default content.

I put together another test document that only had 20 walls and 7 slabs that used the materials that have this hatch applied, and while it wasn’t nearly as bad as this example document, editing section in place caused Vectorworks to use over 10GB of memory. 		Josh Loy

Version of Vectorworks Site Protection used:
RLM software version: v14.1 (build: 3)

Activation key used with macOS: AC1-GW7DJP-JA-BEAF46
macOS used: Big Sur version 11.4

Activation key used with Windows OS: AC1-7LP667-JA-B05AE1
WindowsOS used: Windows 10

Reproduced background:
1) I installed Vectorworks Site Protection and activated it with the Activation Key.
2) With Vectorworks Site Protection running, I also started the SG client and confirmed that I could connect to localhost.
3) Click the Vectorworks Site Protection menu> Uninstall ... to open the Uninstall Vectorworks Site Protection dialog.
4) The option of "Revoke Internet activated licenses" / "Delete license files, logs and settings" was left with the default setting of On, and the Uninstall button was clicked.
5) After uninstalling, when I installed it again on the same PC, the same Activation Key could not be used. When I tried to use it, the following message was displayed. "Activation failed, because the key is being used on another machine. Please revoke it first there and activate again."

By the way, I tried to reproduce this phenomenon using a different activation key, but I could not reproduce it. Therefore, please note that this procedure does not always occur.

In a similar report, VB-181906, it seems that the Bug fix is ​​done in RLM 14.1, but I think that such a problem may still occur.

Please investigate the cause of this problem from the activation key you were using.
Also, I want you to be able to use this activation key again. 		Kamen Kitanov
