VB-181726

Braceworks truss issue with corner with not LEFT at z0

Hello,

To be able to run bracework with tower, made like rigid corner (I know it's not mechanical correct...), I created towers with different Z attach.

If I construct my tower symbol with L truss departure at z0, "Select system object" command works perfectly with the tower and the 4 attached trusses in 4 directions.

If I construct my tower symbol with L truss departure at z6000 by example, "Select system object" command works only with the tower and 3 attached trusses, Right, Top2D, Bottom2D. The Left truss isn't selected by the command.

Maybe for Braceworks it is obligatory to always create L departure at z0 ?

In my case, have the possibilty to have a different z for departure will be great, so base tower will be at z0 instead of z-6000 in this example.

The best solution would be to have adjustable towers in height.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-181325

Spotlight Lighting device circuit name and number bug

Not sure if this one counts as a bug or enhancement request

When connecting a cable object to a lighting device the lighting device only get data pushed into its circuit name and circuit number fields if the cable is directly connected to a distributor object at the other end (and has a cable run ID) first.

This prevents lighting devices from correctly documenting the circuit name and number in a number of common scenarios
* using daisy chain mode- only the first light in the chain will have the circuit name and number.
* single connection mode- often users want to connect cable to lights without using a breakout or distributor.

The correct behavior from the users point of view is that whenever a cable is connected to a lighting device the lighting device documents the connecting in the circuit name and number fields 		Kevin Linzey
VB-183172

IFC to Revit - linking an IFC file to Revit causes Windows to not cut openings in host Wall - Example 1

This came from a UK customer and is part of a larger issue we've seen with at least 4 different customers. It seems to be a recognised Revit issue according to this:

[https://knowledge.autodesk.com/support/revit/troubleshooting/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/Windows-are-not-cutting-their-host-wall-in-a-specific-linked-IFC-file-in-Revit.html]

IFC exported from Vectorworks opens as expected in Solibri and BIMVision, but when linked to Revit is not cutting openings in host Walls. The inserts are there and can be seen if Walls are hidden, but are buried inside them. 

When IFC is imported into Revit, it completely fails.

I'm reporting this here as reference, I've confirmed the issue has been resolved in Revit 2022. Bug can be immediately resolved.

See attached files and images. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-179347

IFC Export: wall features produce new walls in IFC (without wall features)

In the Vectorworks document (wall-with-recess-ifc-export-bug.vwx) (Ifc2x3) you can see a bunch of walls, some of which have a wall feature (recess).

Exactly these walls with a wall feature are somehow duplicated and positioned all together at the very same location, but somewhere outside of the original model, when exporting the model to IFC.

To reproduce (see video):
1) open file wall-with-recess-ifc-export-bug.vwx
2) export IFC
3) import IFC file in Solibri or BIMcollab ZOOM
--> 5 walls are on top of each other
(re-importing the file in Vectorworks will not show these ghost walls)
4) delete some of the walls with a wall feature and repeate 2 and 3
--> the deleted walls will show fewer duplicates
5) now just delete the wall feature from the last walls and repeate 2 and 3
--> the ghost walls will be gone completely 		Mihail Rizov

If as IFC 4 that will not happen. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-177431

IFC: exported file with 1st level Space Bounderies option enabled shows wrong door/window position in Solibri

Space Boundaries for components Door and Window for upper floor space show up with a wrong z offset in Solibri.

Steps to reproduce (see video):
1) open attached vwx file
2) export IFC with "Quantity Take Off" and "1st Level Space Boundaries" enabled
3) import IFC into Solibri and switch the Model Tree to "Component Hierarchy"
4) select the door and window components to see all are positioned correctly
5) select the lower level space
6) select the tab Space Boundaries in the INFO area and click through the components to see that all are positioned correctly
7) repeate 6) with the upper level space selected and see that the door and the window space boundaries have a z offset - as if they were in the lower level.

The video shows this in the German version of VW in 2021 SP 2.1.1, but I tested it using the US version 26.0.2 (580007) and got the same result.

I also tried replacing the German doors and windows with US ones, but those don't show up for "Space Boundaries" tab in Solibri. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-182758

Create Similar Object doesn't change the class settings of the Dimensions

Hi Vectorworks

If you use different classes for dimensions, the function "Create Similar Object" doesn't change the class settings in the document preferences and draw the next dimension in the class of the settings and not in the class of the clicked dimension.

If a user would like to use "Create Similar Object" with dimension she/he must switch off the class option in the document preferences.

Best regards, Marc 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-183739

DOM: Stacked Dual Dimensions

https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-180816

VB-183919

Report: dimension second method creates duplicate criteria

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

If the drawing has Constrained Linear Dimensions using the first, third and / or fourth methods, the Report will have only one "Dimension" Criteria.

If the drawing has also a Constrained Linear Dimension with the second method, then it will be created a duplicated "Dimension" criteria.

The second method in the German Version, we call it "Kettenbemaßung" and we differentiate it from the other methods. In the German Version point of view, we would expect to exist two criteria (one being "Bemaßung" which means Dimension and the other one for the second method being "Kettenbemaßung" which mean Chain Dimension).

Anyhow, if one Criteria for all Dimensions or a different Criteria for the second method, it shouldn't exist two Criteria with the same name. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-183652

Our customers want to know what URLs and port numbers are used for firewall safe lists.

Our customers want to know what URLs and port numbers are used for safe lists of firewalls published on the Forum.
Customers want to set the minimum required URLs and ports in the firewall's safe lists.
For example, if a URL or port is only used to download BIMObjects, customers who do not use BIMObjects will decide that they do not need to be set in the firewall's safe lists.

Forum page:
https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/articles.html/articles/downloading-activating-and-proxy-servers-r82/

The following is an excerpt from the Forum page.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Firewalls:
These URLs should be added to any FireWalls safe lists:

activation.vectorworks.net
connect.vectorworks.net
installer.vectorworks.net
notify.vectorworks.net
release.vectorworks.net
api.bimobject.com
api.vectorworks.net
sso.vectorworks.net

These ports should be open on any filters / routers / firewalls:

Port 80 (UDP and TCP)
Port 75 (UDP and TCP)
Port 475 (UDP and TCP)
Port 1045 (UDP and TCP)
Port 1947 (UDP and TCP)
Port 5053 (UDP and TCP)
Port 5054 (UDP and TCP)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Customers want to know what features these URLs and ports are used in Vectorworks.
Also, if there are any Vectorworks that use URLs or ports other than the above, would you please give me that information as well?

By the way, the information we have so far grasped by asking questions and checking Vectorworks help is about the following three features.

1) Export Web View (3D only)> "Upload To Vectorworks Server" in Export WebView Options
Information source: VB-141404
URL: vgx.vectorworks.net
Port: 80 (TCP)
Port: 443 (TCP)

2) "Update" of Resource Manager
Information source: VB-146509
- For VW libraries
URL: packages.vectorworks.net
Port: 80 (TCP)
- For Subscription libraries
URL: https://api.vectorworks.net
Port: 443 (TCP)

3) Vectorworks Site Protection Server
Information source: Vectorworks Help
- RLM port number
Port: 5053 (UDP)
- Communcates with the browser
Port: 5054 (TCP)
- ISV port number
Port: Random or fixed to any port (UDP)
- Activation
URL: site-activation.vectorworks.net
Port: 80 (TCP)

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Steve Johnson

VB-177144

ILane DSTOP RefNames should not be more than 63 characters yet! Please talk to Ian about this and look at the call stack for how you got here.

This file is filled with lights named "Light Fixt Lightolier Lytespan Style Jack Large Cone Pendant " and is up to "-77" variants.   Dup one, and:

DEBUGSTOP DSTOP(ILane): RefNames should not be more than 63 characters yet!  Please talk to Ian about this and look at the call stack for how you got here.

[~ilane], [~tfapohunda] : this sort of thing keeps cropping up and creating problems. Is it time to change the limit? Or strategy? The code's strategy for it will never work right...it truncates to 63 and calls the uniquing function, which adds a -N and is going to expand it beyond 63 again.

  		Rick Berge

VB-183809

Text style and by class attributes issues

Open the attached file. Notice that the default attributes are all set to by Class.

1) Set the active class to none
2) Create new text object
3) Change its class to Text Class
4) Notice how the text is using Unstyled text style and has its fill not By Class resulting in a mixture of colors taken from the unused text style and from the class
5) Set all attributes of the text to be by class again
6) Notice that the text style is still Unstyled
7) Change the text style to <Class Text Style> or TextStyle-1
8) Notice how the text gets the colors of the text style and sets it fill attributes to be not by class
9) Notice that the pen attribute is set to be By Class and purple but actually the text style pen color is used - red

I think that we have problems with classes using text styles with different fill/pen colors. What should be the correct way for these to behave?

It is important for me to know as using classes with text styles is part of T02268 - ConnectCAD Classes. For example, we would like to set up a text object using a specific class and have all its attributes set to by class. The users will be able to set text styles for this class and we want them to correctly apply. What happens currently is that the text style's fill color overrides the class fill color and sets it not to be by class but the pen color remains by class and uses the class attributes. 		Rick Berge

VB-184148

Vectorworks 2022 Startup fails

A customer starts Vectorworks 2021 successfully while using the proxy.txt file.
When trying to start up 2022, it fails; even when the proxy file is implemented correctly.
It crashes before reaching the SSO Login dialog.

The error message he receives says, ”attempt to reach the login server fails due to communication problems”.
Ports and server addresses you provided are already deposited.

We tried to open sso.vectorworks.net by using the microsoft browser. This works pretty fine when proxy information are stored within the internet settings.
After turning off the Proxy-settings for the browser, sso.vectorworks.net can’t be reached anymore.
Then we checked the VWProxy.txt and the same proxy-information are stored in this text file.

It seems, that Vectorworks isn’t checking the VWProxy.txt when the Login dialog should start.
Therefore the message, the screenshot shows, appears.

Is it possible, that the login dialog is another web-window (chromium?) that doesn’t take a look into the proxy file?
What means, that the login is not able to start up and leads to the error message?
Mark Farnan

VB-176818

Odd file size increase after objects are deleted then saved.

I was deleting items from a 721MB file, SheetLayers, Viewports, Referenced File, a couple layers, record formats, a few textures, and a symbol containing a mesh object. After I saved the file, the file size increased 101MB, to 822MB If I open that file, and execute a saved view, that switches to Top/Plan, and turns on all Layers/Classes, when I save the file, it jumps to 1.2GB. However, if I open the original file at 721MB, with no objects deleted, run the same Top/Plan saved view, save the file, it remains around 722MB with no file increase.

-Download and unzip the following:
\\nemetschek.net\Files\Engineering\QA\FileTesting\JIRA-LargeBugFileDownloads\VB-176818

-Open, "File1.vwx" This is the original file, without deleted objects
-Execute saved view, "Wireframe - Top/Plan - All Layers and Classes"
-Save the file with a different name and verify the file size
-Open, "File2.vwx" This is the file were items were deleted and the size increased 101MB
-Execute saved view, "Wireframe - Top/Plan - All Layers and Classes"
-Save the file with a different name
-Now compare the size of both files and you'll find the second file is over 1GB

In the course of deleting objects from the second file, something has happened, to cause a large increase in file size.

In my testing, I've deleted objects from the first file and it drops down to 300+MB as expected. Once saved view, "Wireframe - Top/Plan - All Layers and Classes" is executed, it's still in the neighborhood of 300+MB. It's just once in awhile, deleting objects from File1.vwx, appears to corrupt the file in some manner and future saves could balloon the file size.


Rick Berge
VB-184480

Activate Design Layer crashes Vectorworks

Windows only.

Ativate the Design Layer Displays and Vectorworks will crash.

With 2021 this does not happen, marking it as regression. 		Rick Berge
VB-182991

Constrained Move Operations Fail Inside Symbol Edit Mode in 2022

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2021 compared to 2022. The file contains a rotated 2D/3D Symbol instance.

To reproduce:

-Open the file in VW 2021
-Edit the 3D Component of the symbol instance
-Select all the objects and drag them upward while holding down the SHIFT key to constrain the movement to the Z-axis.

Note that the movement gets constrained as expected.

-Now open the file in VW 2022 and try the same thing

Note that now the movement fails to get constrained.

This only seems to happen when the symbol instance is rotated. It also seems to depend on which object is clicked-on to initiate the move operation.

This happens in 2022 SP0, SP1, and SP2. 		Rick Berge

VB-183876

Graphics Problem with Wall Geometry after Editing Door Jamb without Moving the Mouse [Mac Only]

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue. This looks like a graphics issue on Mac if you edit something in the OIP and don't move the mouse. Could also be related to M1 systems. 

 

-Open test file

-In the OIP, change the door jamb width to 4" then press Enter key

-Don't move the mouse

-Notice the wall geometry doesn't refresh

-Once you move the mouse, the geometry updates properly

 

I don't see this issue on Windows, so it is Mac only. 

 

Apple M1 Mac mini

macOS Big Sur.  		Josh Loy
VB-184002

Vectorworks 2022 hangs on quit

I notice this occurred when my Shaded rendering couldn't be shut off using the Shaded / Wireframe pulldown. Crashlog attached. Rick Berge
VB-183936

Saved Views don't save and restore render styles

There is no render style RefNumber data in the saved view.  In order to restore the render style you need the render mode (ArtRW or Custom RW) and the RefNumber of the render style resource.  Because this data is missing saved views do not work with render styles.

 

Open the attached file that is saved in Shaded and has a saved view, apply the saved view.  It should be set to the render style but instead it is set to CustomRW.

  		Rick Berge
VB-183948

DOM: Vectorworks Edit Annotations is getting slower 2022

Edit Annotation on this Document takes up to 30 Seconds, where 2019 needs 10-15 Seconds. 
It is Graphic caching, which need more time or more Graphic is cached. At a result from the customer sight, Vectorworks is getting slower. 

in Vectorworks 2019 It takes 18s in 2022 25s 		Rick Berge
VB-183982

On some Windows computers, class visibilities are not observed correctly in viewports

This is a conundrum. I have clients who get back to me in tech support about incorrectly rendered viewports because of wrong class visibilities. If I just press the update button, everything is rendered as expected.
Sending the file back to the customer and updating the viewports on his end will revert the rendering, showing wrong class visibilities in the viewports.

In the attached files, simply update the viewports and see how the class visibilities repair themselves with classes either hidden as expected

In "Test_Klassensichtbarkeiten.vwx" the door of the cabinet should not be visible - classes affected:
*XG-Korpusmöbel-Tür-Bauteil
XG-Korpusmöbel-Tür-Belag Außen
XG-Korpusmöbel-Tür-Belag Innen
XG-Korpusmöbel-Tür-Kante
XG-Korpusmöbel-Tür-Trägermaterial*

these classes are all turned OFF. They render as turned ON.

In "Ohne Titel1-4.vwx", the class *"XG-Bauteil Bearbeitung-Profil"* should render turned OFF. The viewports are showing this class as tuned ON.

This is a v26 file because I cannot test. As soon as I convert to 2022, the issue rectifies itself. Very elusive problem! 		Rick Berge

VB-183847

Inconsistent Behavior When Creating New Story and Editing Level Type with Layer Name.

Watch in the video capture.
This are the steps I'm doing.

1-Creating a new Story with Level Types of Ceiling (with Layer Name of Ceiling) and Top of Slab.
2-Notice when I edit Level Type Ceiling by just changing it's elevation.
3-A new Instance of "Ceiling" is created, but the original is still the one being selected.
4-I edit again, the same check/selected Level Type, again new instance is still being selected.
5-Click "Ok" Edit Story Level dialog and click "Ok" on the New Story dialog.
6-As expected a new Story is created.
7-With the story selected, click on the "Edit Button"
8-In the Edit Story, edit the same Level again. Ceiling by just changing it's elevation.
9-Notice a new instance of Ceiling is created and it's selected by default. This should be
the expected behavior in Step 3 when the story was initially created.


Rick Berge

VB-183770

Assertion because of mismatched types in CListBowserGridItem::SetOriginalValue

The assertion happens beause the original value m_varValue is of type INT and the new value is of type I4.

void CListBowserGridItem::SetOriginalValue(const _variant_t& varValue)
{
if (m_varValueOrig.vt != VT_EMPTY && m_varValueOrig.vt != varValue.vt)
{
ASSERT(FALSE);
return;
} m_varValueOrig = varValue;
}

Steps to reproduce (mainline, Debug version).

Load the attached file Target.vwx It will be converted to VW28

Click Tools/Organization

The assert occurs four times 		Rick Berge
VB-183742

Text: class text style removes color

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

1. Create a new empty document.

2. Create a new class (or use an existing one) and change pen color of the class to red.
2.1. Active "Use at Creation" on the top left corner.

3. Draw some text and see that is of the color that we have chosen.

4. Edit the class in use and activate "Use at Creation" in the Text Style section on the bottom right corner. Choose any Style.

5. Draw again some text and now the text is black. If the Style is changed to un-styled, the red color will be displayed again.

With 2021 this does not happen, hence its a regression.
Rick Berge

See the two videos. Problems:
# "Edit Story Level" always creates a new story level rather than editing the one selected.
# "Edit Story Level", when asked to delete a layer option from a story level, gets confused and checks the wrong story level. This can lead to problems if the user is not paying close attention.

These are longstanding problems with Stories. Fixing them will improve usability. The good news is, these seem to be problems localized in the dialog handler, so hopefully they will be easy to fix. 		Rick Berge
VB-183483

Image Effects: Soft Edges incorrect for holes in crop objects

Notice the soft edges for the oval shaped crop holes are shifted from their correct locations. 		Josh Loy
VB-183482

Image Effects: Soft Edges not soft enough (should be zero opacity at edge)

It is expected that the Image Effects "Soft Edges" feature would fade the edges completely into the background.  However, the only way to get this to happen is to use larger Soft Edge values.  This causes the feature to have a very limited use.  Pixels should have zero opacity at the edge even with smaller Soft Edge values. Josh Loy
VB-183344

File slowness. User comparing VW 2017 with VW 2022.

Hello All,

 

We have a furious user that is comparing 2017 and 2022 performance on a couple of files. Basically If user exports the attached files to 2017 version of Vectorworks they work way better compared to 2022. For 2022 they are using brand new M1 macs with 8gb of Ram and the old machine is around 2gb graphics i7 , 16 gb of ram, ~2016 model Mac computer.

 

Is there anything we can offer them or at least explain why this is happening and wether they can suspect improvements in the future?

 

We are aware about their way of working. We explained that placing objects on different layers and working with visibility will make the file faster as well as 1:1 scale does not help. We pointed out that improving workflows will make it better but the bottom line is that 2017 is handling these files in the state that they are way better compared to 2022.  		Rick Berge

VB-182832

End line marker forcibly linked when set by class

In the attributes palette when you set end line markers, you should be able to unlink them to have different end line markers for each end.

When you set one end to be by class, it forces both ends to be by class even if they are unlinked. 		Rick Berge
VB-182671

creating a styles hardscape does not set correct render data

Steps:
# Open the attached file: [^CreateHardscape.vwx]
# Make sure you are in a 3D view with the render mode set to shaded
# Select the object and right click
# Select Create Objects from Shapes...
# From the Object Type dropdown, select Hardscape
# Check both Show Properties Dialog, and Delete Source Shapes
# Press OK
# In the Properties dialog, select the Hardscape Style dropdown
# Select any hardscape from the _Imperial Hardscape Objects.vwx (I picked Concrete Edging)
# Select the Aligned Surface tab
# Check Enable aligned surface for the 3D slab type
# Align with object on dropdown should be set to Same layer as hardscape
# Check Interpolate surface
# Press OK

_Notice the resulting object is indeed a hardscape object but the 3D view shows only basic which color when it should show textures._

 

_From the OIP, if you select the render tab and change the mode dropdown from By Object to By Component, the textures show up._ 		Rick Berge

Repeatedly, using different builds, placing objects can result in incorrect rotation.  		Josh Loy

VB-180454

DOM: NetWallArea with Window CW PIO

I am not sure, if we do something wrong with the Wall break of the "Window CW" or if there is something wrong with the wall-break-handling of Vectorworks. So I am not sure, where to address this issue.

At the end the NetWallArea in Worksheets and IFC Exports is calculated unexpected (not to say wrong) if we have a wall break created by Window CW. 

In the attached Document there is an example (screenshot right side) with the Wall named "wall-3" which you also can see in the Worksheet. the GrossWallArea is 36.8 which is the middle wall line and is OK. The WallBreak is 2 x 2m (4qm) so NetWallArea should be 32.8. But the NetWallArea in the Worksheet and IFC Export is 34.9. I think it is related to the system, "Window CW" creates the wall break. It would be good to know, how the Wall-Break must be created to get a complete-Wall-Break.  		Vladislav Stanev

VB-182097

Intranet Article #294 needs updated, replacing, "Designer" with "Design Suite"

I'm not sure what Jira project this officially falls under, so I'm submitting under, "Vectorworks Bugs" (VB) for now. Perhaps assign to Jeremy Powell, based on the article author?

Based on Vectorworks 2022 Task Overview T02247, the name, "Designer" is being replaced with, "Design Suite" in and outside of our Vectorworks application.

The following Intranet link, references, "Designer" the product, at the bottom of the article
https://intranet.vectorworks.net/articles.php?action=view&article_id=294

Vectorworks Designer

100 word
For projects that encompass elements of architecture, landscape and entertainment design, Vectorworks Designer software is the ultimate solution. Packing the power of the entire suite of Vectorworks’ products including Architect, Landmark and Spotlight into one robust program, Designer offers digital terrains, plants, lighting, rigging, BIM modeling and rendering tools to help users draft, model and present in a single interface. Additionally, high-quality renderings can be created directly inside files with default textures within thousands of Vectorworks content library objects and our easy-to-use Renderworks features. vectorworks.net/designer
50 word
For projects that encompass elements of architecture, landscape and entertainment design, Vectorworks Designer software is the ultimate solution for professionals who need it all. From digital terrains, plants, lighting and rigging to BIM modeling and rendering tools, Designer enables you to draft, model and present in a single interface. vectorworks.net/designer 		Dave Bowman

VB-181993

Drag-Duplicate Cursor Fails to Show the + Indicator When Duplicating In-Wall Objects

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains two Windows; one placed inside a Wall and one placed outside of the Wall.

To reproduce, click-drag each Window, and hold-down the Option key on Mac (CTL key on Win) to duplicate the instance.

With the Window that's outside of the Wall, note that the cursor shows a + sign to indicate the duplication.

With the Window that's inside the Wall, note that the + sign doesn't show. This makes it difficult to tell if the object will actually be duplicated.

The same thing happens with all in-Wall objects in 3D views. I don't see this problem in plan view.

The same thing happens in past versions.

Josh Loy

VB-181287

AutoTURN Online - Polylines Get Broken-Up When Sent to AutoTURN

Note: this might be related to the bug reported in VB-152939, which was resolved several versions ago. In that bug, creating a simulation from an existing object was failing on certain types of polylines. That bug was fixed, but now I'm seeing failures with other types of polys that previously worked.

I've attached a movie and test file that show this. The file contains three objects; a Polyline that was created with the Polyline tool, a Polygon that was created with the Polygon tool, and a Polyline that was created by filleting a Polygon object.

To reproduce:

-Send the file to AutoTURN Online
-Click the "Generate Path Follow Simulation" button
-Select the Polygon in the middle or the Polyline on the right

Note that the simulation runs the enter length of the object, as expected.

-Now try the same thing with the Polyline on the left

Note that now it only affects a small segment. It looks like this is happening because the poly is getting broken-up into a bunch of segments.

If you look at the movie attached to VB-152939, you can see that this same poly worked fine at some point in VW 2019.

I see the same problem in VW 2020, 2021, and 2022. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-181212

See attached movie comparison with 2021
Place Grid line tool in the drawing
Note that preview will not show the placeholder for Notes
After placing the object, from OIP enter something in Notes field
It will fail to show in the drawing.

I believe the reason in 2021 Grid line tool inserts as style by default. In 2022 it inserts as unstyled. 		Josh Loy

VB-180130

Linked Start/End Markers Become Out-of-Sync After Undo

The attached movie shows this from a blank file.

To reproduce:

-Make sure the Attributes Palette marker controls have the Marker Link Toggle button enabled
-Draw a Line object
-In the Attributes palette, choose any End Marker (which will automatically apply a Start Marker)
-Now Undo once

Note that this only undoes the application of the Start Marker, while the End Marker remains intact. At this point the object is in kind of a contradictory state where the link toggle is still enabled but the Start and End Markers differ

This also happened in past versions so hasn't been marked against the T02155 task. 		Rick Berge

- Use the Set Working Plane Tool and, like shown in the video, pick a side of the 3D Object thast is not the XY.

- After the Working Plane is set, we have the following two results when attempting to draw a rectangle:

If we try to draw the rectangle by mouse clicking on the Rectangle Tool. The set working plane will be lost and the rectangle will be drawn in the XY-Plane.

VB-179074

Hatch fill not render in "Hidden line" if active class has pen attributes set to None

We realized that a hatch fill is not rendered in "Hidden line" if a class is active which has set the line attributes to NONE. Actually the active class should not have an influence on "Hidden" line rendering.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Watch the attached movie
# Open "Testfile 20210525_01"
# Choose "Hidden Line"

As you can see the hatch fill is not rendered 

4. Change the pen attributes of the default class "100 Entwurf Deckweiss" to Solid and black.

5. Render the file again with "Hidden line"

Now, the hatch fill can be rendered correctly.

  		Josh Loy

VB-178962

Clicking on flyover tool should completely switch to top view, redraw should not be required

When there are only 2D objects existed in the drawing clicking on flyover tool will not switch completely to top view. It needs some redraw action from user. This is how it works in previous versions too. Not sure if this should be intended behaviour

For example open the attached file and movie
Switch to top/plan
Click on flyover tool
Note that view shows top but will not completely switch since screen plane rectangles are still shown
Zoom IN/Out now it will switch to top view completely.
If there are any 3D objects exist and clicking on Flyover tool will work as expected. 		Josh Loy
VB-178832

Conversion from 2020 to 2021 results in Data Tags being lost

The files come from one of largest UK customers, who are having issues with Data Tags. They have Data Tags in Project file which is then DLVP referenced into Plot file, then a Section Viewport is placed onto Sheet.

They sent 2020 files through and when I converted to 2021, I noticed Data Tags were not displaying in 2021 on the Sheet. 

I've had a look at the Project file, and noticed that DTs are there in the model, though in Hidden Line view, there is a graphics issue where they display only during zooming in and out, while they are invisible (but selectable) while view is still. They are visible in OpenGL as expected. Changing the viewport to OpenGL however, does not make them appear. The Data Tags are on _OMI_Ref_Unitised Elevation_ class.

This might be related to https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-178828 

Any help or advice is greatly appreciated.

Thanks, Luka 		Josh Loy
VB-178759

Everyone DSTOP GetBooleanComponent not supported for component 20

Run Custom Selection tool in a new blank document, and you get a series of these asserts. The complaint is about fetching values from controls that don't exist on the dialog.

The cause appears to be that we override the context of the criteria (eVSCustomSelVisCriteria, //Used for custom selection and custom visibility menu items) to something else (eVectorScriptCriteria, //Used for VectorScript editor). Custom Selection dialog only has in-sym, in-pio, and in-viewport checkboxes. VS makes it also look for controls like in-subparts and include owner.

The reason appears to be that a context was doing something not quite right, and instead of fixing it we jumped to a different one. It's gotten messier over time as we have a larger number of contexts and the number and nature of the controls has diverged more widely.

c/l 179345, 252401, VB-119533 have some bearing on this 		Rick Berge
VB-178659

Hardscape Pathway with Pavers-Curved Path not working as expected

The offset and the size of the pavers in this configuration doesn't make sense.
Mostly when the pavers are exactly the width of the pathway, then there are always two rows with half the width.

This was reported by Eric 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-178423

SDK VWParametricObj Scaling not working

Put this code into a command.

Place a param obj on origin in the drawing an run code.

Both ways to scale have npo effect on the object.

 

VWParametricObj paramObj ( gSDK->FirstSelectedObject());

static bool testXXX = true; // XXX TODO: remove test
if (testXXX)
{
paramObj.ScaleObject3D( VWPoint3D(), VWPoint3D( 2,2,2));
}
else
{
auto ma = paramObj.GetObjectModelMatrix();
ma.ScaleWithCenter( VWPoint3D(), 2,2,2);

paramObj.SetObjectMatrix( ma);
}

paramObj.ResetObject(); 		Rick Berge

VB-177788

Tiling Acceptance Test for Build 590359 bad test files

The test files compromise the acceptance test of the current state of Vectorworks.

The Vectorworks file from the test is (probably) version 16. Currently, we test v27.

If we test with the original file, the result will be different from the test result with a file created in the current version. Theoretically, the test with the original file may be perfect, but the test with a file from the current version would fail.

That means that the acceptance test does not give us an idea of what we deliver to our customers. 		Josh Loy
VB-177740

Python Script causes crash

Python Script that uses vs.RemoveChoice to remove items from a listbox crashes Vectorworks to Desktop on macOS instead of throwing an exception. Detailed description and the script can be found in Vectorworks Python Scripting Forum: [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/81763-dialogs-modern-crash-on-macos-when-clearing-listbox-and-strange-behaviour/] Problem was due to the scripts attempt to remove an item with an index that does not exist. Vladislav Stanev
VB-177644

Tile prevents export to PDF

Client submitted a file that would stall at 50% when exporting to PDF.  We found that we had to rasterize the PDF for it to go.

I dug deeper into the issue and found that it was related to the tile pattern "Aggregate-1 Image Fill".  As soon as I removed that, the PDF will export within seconds without needing to reasterize

User has a bit of an archaic work flow, but I was able to reproduce it in a new file as well. 		Josh Loy

VB-177580

The attached file set (Working file and Project file are included) contains a bunch of objects on different layers and has Multi-View enabled, with a sheet layer active in one of the panes.

This doesn't happen consistently, but I've seen it twice now where I'll simply open the Working File and the layer scale of the active layer (in this case "Building Shell") will randomly change to 1:1.

I've only seen this happen in VW 2022, but we've had similar problems in the past with Multi-View changing the design layer scale (particularly when sheets are active in other panes), so I doubt this is specific to VW 2022.

I also doubt that this is related to Project Sharing, but so far I've only seen the problem in PS files. 		Josh Loy

VB-176682

VB-176694

Publish: naming scheme problematic for Excel (single files)

I don't know if this is a bug or simply a design glitch.

Upon publishing Excel files from worksheets, using the option "Export Worksheet as separate files", these use the active naming scheme (screenshot 1).

If the naming scheme is based upon Title Block data, the  worksheet will
* just use that naming scheme "as is", stripping extra chars at the end
* not export all worksheets, only 1

Since the Title Block code has nothing to do with a worksheet which is not on-drawing, the naming scheme should skip these codes and use the Worksheet name + whatever applies from the naming scheme (I, like many others, use the date at the end).

We can't have different schemes, since the naming is valid for PDF/DWG export AND excel.

Please export from the attached document and observe the result (screenshot 2). 		Nina Ivanova
VB-176693

Link between plant record and IFC data doesn't work in localized version

The IFC data attatched to a plant are linked with the plant record. It works fine in the US version. In the translated versions, the ifc data isn't displayed correctly, because it looks for English record field names and we can't change the IFC data in the localized versions.

See included movie. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-176605

FileIndex out-of-range in TPEH::GetObjectSubType(). Possibly a frozen object.

I get this in my debug output window a lot when I'm working with stairs with proxies. I've attached a snap of where it's coming from; the FileIndex at that point is -1. To see it happen, put a breakpoint in TParametricExternalsHandler::GetObjectSubType at the very last DMSG, open the attached file, and change the active layer (I usually use Nav palette to change layer). I've attached a snap of debugger stopped there with call stack info.  Rick Berge
VB-176586

Rotate tool issues. Vectorworks 2021, file/object specific.

Hello All,

 

We have received a file where these specific objects that are in the file does not rotate with the rotate tool or mirror tool. Right clicking on the object and using the rotate command from the drop down works but basic tool palette rotate tool moves the object into a quite random location. Might be related with the internal origin.

  		Josh Loy
VB-176273

Saved View: Layer Visibilities is empty

We do not have the OS version required to test this problem and we ask if its possible for someone to test if this can be reproduced. It is required MacOS Sierra (10.12.6 is the Client using).

1. Open the attached .vwx file

2. Go to: Layers Organization > Saved Views > Edit > Layers...

In Layer Visibilities should exist 3 Layers, for the Client and specifically with MacOS Sierra (10.12.6) it appears empty.

Can someone please try to reproduce this? As stated above, we do not have MacOS Sierra.
Apologies and thank you in advance. 		Rick Berge
VB-176397

Facetted Curves

User submitted a file and computer profile where he is complaining curved shapes are appearing facetted.  We tried going through and increasing the settings to smooth out his curves.

This only happens on his computer.  User installed Vectorworks on his wife's computer and opened the file and saw smooth curves.

User sent me the file and I tried it on both Mac and PC and saw smooth curves.  I even opened this on my old 2014 13" MBP with retina and low spec integrated graphics card and I had no issue there.

The only other person able to replicate this facet was Joe Block in Tech support.  He could not determine what setting was causing this.

I have included the file, the spx as well as a screen shot from the the user as well from Joe Block. 		Josh Loy
VB-176498

Section Viewport: Data Visualization not correct displayed

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

The attached file has a Section Viewport with a wall. Which can be seen in two Data Visualization forms. The first, in red "über Schale" and the second in yellow "über Klasse".

In the Section Viewport, if we have the yellow version active, it is correctly displayed.
If we switch to "über Schale" which should be displayed in red, it does not happen so. 		Josh Loy
VB-176390

Switch Layer and Vectorworks freezes

Open the attached file and switch to the Layer Einzeiler.
Vectorworks will freeze.

If we use the Purge Tool before switching Layers, when switching the Layers it will not freeze anymore.

This happens only with Windows. 		Rick Berge
VB-176221

Multi-View - Interactive Move Preview Shows Incorrectly When Snap Points are Acquired

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Extrudes at different elevations.

To reproduce:

-Turn on Multi-View
-In the top-left pane, drag the smaller Extrude and snap to the larger Extrude

Note that the interactive preview shows at the wrong elevation.

The same thing happened in past versions. This also happens in the GraphMod2 branch. 		Josh Loy
VB-176209

Create Animation, Orbit path and Spin Path should have a message dialog when trying to create it in sheet layer.

This is minor but worth noting.

-I'm currently on a sheet layer.
-If I try to create a an animation in sheet layer using "Orbit path" or "Spin Path".
-Notice there is no message dialog that it can't be create because the current layer is a sheet layer not design.
-Vectorworks will behave like the animatin will be created, notice the Object info palette
temporarily change to Animation. 		Josh Loy
